description:
If you're a visitor, please come try a burger, I promise the line goes pretty fast. But don't expect to be able to eat inside the restaurant. 

As a California native, I have semi-regular In N Out cravings. While no, it's not the best burger I've ever had, it's the best burger I've had for this price. Normally I go for the burger, animal style (meaning pickles, grilled onions, and spread, the in n out sauce, kinda like thousand island but better) with fries (animal fries always take FOREVER to get b/c they only have like 2 of the cheese melter machines, so I wouldn't recommend it at this location), and a lemonade (if it's your first time and you like lemonade PLEASE do yourself a favor and try the bright pink lemonade, it's freshly made daily, and and in n out classic). 

However, for those of you who are from around here and are able to, just go to Daly City for your craving, it's a lot less crazy, even if the drive though line gets a little long. 

Note: bathrooms are not inside the store, you'll have to ask one of the servers for a code to go to the bathroom inside the complex. 

Overall, grab a burger, why not? You're in California.
author: Sophie W.

description:
Like many reviewers for this location, I was a tourist and I was so pumped to try it for the first time. I wasn't trying to let this late afternoon line that's out the door on a Monday deter me. Once I'm actually inside, it is best described as organized chaos. The process of ordering was simple, it was the waiting inside and dealing with the crowd was the tough part. It was a 20-30 minute wait to get my order. Don't even think about grabbing a seat inside. It's laughable. Go outside and sit in the outdoor area.

The actual burger, which was a double-double animal style, itself was alright. Pretty, but alright. I do think it's overrated and at first bite, I honestly thought it tasted more like McDonald's. I'd eat it again, but the fries. Oh no. They were just not good. So thin and so puny. They get cold very quickly and they weren't that great. Not sure if getting them animal style would save them. Overall, I'd try it again, but not at this location. Too chaotic for my liking.
author: Augustina G.

description:
In-n-Out is an absolute must for me whenever I'm in the West coast. I don't have any near me, so you understand why this is a thing lol. 

Stopped by this location near Fisherman's wharf very late night, after a long day of hiking and a 3 hour drive back from Yosemite- it was perfect. Double double animal style with animal style fries and a coca-cola, always a pleasure!
author: Stephanie F.

description:
Redemption! My second time trying In-N-Out Burger in the West Coast! I am pleased to say that it is better this time around! I tried it in LA almost two years ago and boy, I was so disappointed. The crowd is pretty crazy here and seating is a challenge. If you're coming with someone, have someone scout for seats (additional seats can be found outside in the back area in front of Krispy Kreme) and have one person to line up. The food does come out fast though! 

We each got the Double-Double Burgers and Animal Style Fries. Patties were good as they were tender and perfectly cooked. Buns were a bit crispy so it added a nice crunch. Animal Style Fries were alright. I was never a fan of the animal style sauce so I can do without it. 

My partner-in-crime really enjoyed his first In-N-Out Burger experience. It is economical and it gets the job done when hunger strikes. At heart, Shake Shack is still better in taste and quality to me even at a higher price point. I strongly still believe that the two are not comparable as they are very different in their own way - chef driven vs. economical.
author: Cynthia D.

description:
Ever since my first in-n-out experience in LA, I've been dying to return to one of my favorite burger joints. After finally returning to the west coast, I knew that I had to pay my respects to in-n-out. Even though the line was out the door, it moves very quickly as the workers are efficient in cycling the crowd through. 

FOOD: My friend ordered a double-double, I ordered a regular cheeseburger with grilled onions, and we shared a vanilla shake and animal fries. It cost less than $20, which I call a steal, not just a deal for all that food. I honestly could've eaten another burger, but was too lazy to get in line. Regardless, the food was delicious and definitely worth it for the price. Grilled onions are almost a must!! 

SERVICE: great. A couple workers rotate around the restaurant and ask if there's anything they can get for you -- more napkins, water, etc. The service really is above and beyond for being a simple fast food joint. 

If you're craving a good burger and are not looking to break the bank, in-n-out is the only way to go!
author: Grace L.

description:
I came here to the SF location because it's basically the only one downtown. As an east coast native, I really wanted to see the difference between In N Out and the east coast chains, like Shake Shack and Five Guys. 

I was definitely satisfied with the high quality of fast food burgers. I got animal fries and an animal burger, and highly recommend it. They both came with onions, cheese, and thousand island sauce, and were delicious. I will say that if I ever visit the west coast again, I would definitely just get normal fries, as the animal style for both fries and burgers is a bit much for one meal. 

-1 star for the insane environment inside this store. It is so chaotic and crazy, and you can basically count on getting shoved a few times. Took us about 25 minutes to finally find seats for two people. Keep a lookout for seating outdoor though - you'll find it much easier to find a place, especially for larger groups.
author: Will W.

description:
**** Review 108 ****

First of all, a lot of people gave me 2 types of review when I asked about this place, either they hate it or love it. 
The first thing you notice when you get there is the line from all the clients, the great thing is that the line moves pretty fast. The staff here is sure nice and very energetic. Now for the food, the burgers are delicious! Great flavor, all the veggies taste fresh, and portions are great. The only downside are the fries. Unfortunately they're thin, and get cold fast. Once they're cold they taste super grease and get clumpy. I definitely will be miss the burgers, and this will be a place I visit for delicious burgers.
author: Luis S.

description:
"A Society gentleman would only go out with you for one reason - to have a good time, a few laughs, and a little vo-dee-oh-doh-doh." - Laverne

I'm definitely not an In-N-Out virgin, Mmk, in fact I'm more an In-N-Out whore lol. Kidding aside, well not really, I've been to a few in the past years, but never to this one (& only?) in San Francisco. So playing tourist today I found myself at Fisherman's Wharf and past that hanger-y stage. So of course Clam Chowder, Fish n Chips immediately came to my mind, but Wham I notice the In-N-Out at the corner of Anchorage Square! Oh yes! Why not!

As I enter I notice one line nearly out the door, but three cashiers ringing up as quickly as humanly possible! Having been to In-N-Out (usually the one in Daly City) I knew I wanted the #1 combo which is a double double burger, fries, and a fountain drink. Another thing I noticed was the combo I wanted was $9 vs. about a dollar less in the suburbs. Who's counting pennies when we're starving, eh? 

So I place my order and surprisingly found a seat in the corner. I mean I can do more than just eat in this little corner, *hint hint* but we'll keep this G-rated;) I also noticed as insanely busy as it was the system they have here is highly efficient, hence why the employees here start at $16.00 per hour, I guess. It's called the balance of living in overpriced San Francisco, but I'm happy for these employees! 

After about 10-minutes of people watching my order is finally ready! Boom! Freshly made and ready to be devoured by this big boy. I always start with a hand full of fries, then a few bites of the burger. Oh baby! Exactly like I remember about In-N-Out! It's fresh, tasty, and relatively cheap in comparison to other burger joints - I'm talking real meat burgers, kiddos. A final gulp of my lemonade and my lunch is complete with a smile on my face! 

All in all, I recommend In-N-Out to anyone into old school burgers. They do it right here! Maybe you won't get the efficiency like I received ($16 per hour at a fast food joint), but it's all about taste and cost. That's a winning formula In-N-Out has down like a poodle on a cardigan! If you know, you know;)

***note: cold fries on my last visit! deduct 1-star***
author: Eric R.

description:
Everyone told me I had to try this California gem and I did within a few days of moving here. 

So first of all, in my opinion, the best way to get your burger is to get it animal style. Actually, the best way to get anything on the menu is probably animal style. If I was a soda drinker I'd probably get that animal style too.

I'm gonna talk about what I don't like first, however; I just want to make it clear that In-N-Out, while good, is not the holy grail of burger places.

So the fries... they're just not good. They're not horrible, but they're not good. I like my fries to be crispy on the outside and soft on the inside, and In-N-Out fries sorta do both in a mediocre way. Now, I'm aware you can get them well done, but trust me, I've had them regular, well done, and animal style, but they're still just meh.

Next, I'm not sure if this is just pertinent to this one chain or not, but there's so much YELLING. The staff call out order numbers, but... there's a microphone. It's a little jarring when I'm deep into enjoying my burger and then I hear an order number being called in the same way my parents used to yell at me.

There is also a wait. Understandable because this location is at the Wharf, so every tourist combined with SF locals will be here. I don't think I've ever seen an hour where there was no lineup. It doesn't take long to get your order in, but waiting for your food takes a while.

All of these shortcomings I can forgive, however, because as soon as I take my first bite into a double double animal style burger, I forget. I forget that I had to wait 30 minutes, I forget that the fries are bad, and I forget that the yelling gives me flashbacks to when I got yelled at for not getting straight-A's. The juiciness of the fresh ground beef smashed patties, the mustard fried buns, the animal sauce... everything on that burger comes together and embraces me, letting me know that flaws are what make someone beautiful. I feel no shame in sometimes not eating for a whole day and then eating 3 double doubles in one sitting.

Maybe this is why I keep going back. It's almost like having an argument with someone you love dearly - once you fight through all the stupid, unimportant stuff, that's when you realize all the reasons you fell for them in the first place.
author: Calvin Z.

description:
Came here on a Monday around noon. For being on fisherman's wharf, it was a lot less crowded than I was expecting. I waited, at most, 10-15 minutes for my food. 

This is a standard in-n-out, nothing very different. I enjoy the burgers here, always get onions! 

I personally think in-n-out fries have never been great, no matter what style. They're a bit too thin and hard for me. However, the crunch of the fresh lettuce in your burger will leave you feeling great.

I am also not a huge fan of the shakes, I think they are quite standard and a bit on the too-sweet side.
author: Christine H.

description:
I'm not usually a fan of fast food, but being that it was my first time in California I knew I had to try this Golden State staple if I had the chance. On our last day in SF my friend and I found ourselves in Fisherman's Wharf around 1 PM and I knew what I had to do.

This location is smack dab in the middle of the most touristy neighborhood of SF (think Times Square in NYC, but Californian edition). I instantly walked in to a mass of people crowded around the ordering counter. This location seemed large but the sheer number of people inside just made it feel tiny. However, I was lucky. Twenty minutes later the line had extended outside and around the block. If I had arrived just a short time later it definitely would've been more than an hour wait.

When it was finally my turn to order I stuck with the single patty cheeseburger, medium fries and drink combo #2 ($8.52). Overall in my opinion it was a pretty decent burger. You could tell that fresh ingredients had been used and nothing seemed too bland or flavorless in terms of the taste. In my opinion though Shake Shack seems better...

The service here was great for what they were dealing with. Easily more than 20 people behind the counter flipping burgers, shuffling fries, and calling out order numbers in almost unbelievable synchronization. The staff here undoubtedly deserves an A+ for their efficiently. 

If you're in SF and have never tried In-N-Out I'd say make the trip (if you have free time) just to cross it off your list. If you know you'll be back in California sometime soon, then maybe go to a location that won't possibly have you waiting over an hour for a $5 burger.
author: Nicholas C.

description:
I've heard so much about this place and it's usually mixed reviews. Either people love it or they hate it. There is really no in between so I had to give it a try myself. 

This In-N-Out is definitely the tourist hot spot and when we got there, the line was almost out of the door. Good thing the line was moving fairly quick. The thing that really caught my eye is how cheap everything on the menu was. Not even in terms of San Francisco prices, but like in general. I couldn't believe that a hamburger was only $3. I can see why some of these orders had 5-6 burgers per tray!

The restaurant I wouldn't say is a small location, but there isn't enough seats considering how busy this location was. The bad thing is that the bathrooms are outside, but the staff is more than willing to give you the code. 

Ended up getting the Double-Double meal with a Vanilla shake and Animal Style fries. The burger was a double patty, but it is possible to get as more patties, but it is just extra. The staff was incredibly fast and the service was quick. The burger itself was juicy and very delicious. It was flavorful, but unfortunately it was really thin. Can't really say much about the shake, it was really thick, but was average at best. The fries were really thin, kind of like McDonald's fries but the sauce really made the difference! 

The experience overall was incredibly pleasant and I'm glad to say I lost my In-N-Out virginity. I would definitely say that it is overhyped for how great and to die for it is, but I thought it was still delicious.
author: Timothy D.

description:
Probably the best burgers I have ever tried... 
Came here with a huge group of people back on 2015. Remember this burgers like it was yesterday.

The spot was PACKED and it took a while for our order to be ready but since we were from NY and had never been here, we were definitely willing to wait... Have to say, the wait was so WORTH it!! 
We ordered from the Secret (not secret at all) menu, I had two double meat and fries.

Just wish they would open one on the East part of the country someday.
author: Wildary C.

description:
This place is sooooo busy! It's in a touristic hot spot so of course it is popular.

I have been many times on the west coast yet never tried the food. So I decided to order fries animal style. I paid $4.50.

Even there were so many customers, ordering went fast and tons of people were waiting for their food, it came out fast - probably because I only ordered the fries.

I would never eat it again. What's the hype?? No flavor at all. I ended up putting ketchup on top of the plastic like cheese and animal sauce as it just tasted like nothing.

Plus: even it is extremely busy, I easily found space to eat at a table outside.
author: Apple S.

description: Typical In-N-Out but very efficient for how popular this location is. The line is usually out the door due to all the tourists who want to try In-N-Out. Anyway, don't expect to get seating inside since its so crowded and you will probably wait for 20+ minutes.
author: Taylor Z.

description:
I recently visited California for the first time in 10 years or so, and the foodie in me was trying to prove a point by visiting In-N-Out just so that I could forever compare it to every burger I have ever. So that's what I did. 

This was the Fisherman's Wharf location in San Francisco so I expected some hustle and bustle as far as traffic inside the restaurant but I got WAY more than that. Luckily we got there a little before the lunch rush so ordering quickly wasn't the issue. But - people were hovering over others & rushing them to finish their lunch, sitting with strangers who were almost done with their food, etc. etc. just to get a SEAT in this place. It was like the Hunger Games of popular food chains. My family and I, after a while, were able to find two separate tables for two, which was fine. But it was surprising (but also not surprising at the same time) that people were being this awkward just to sit themselves in a chair. We waited a while for the food but I understood, these workers were incredibly slammed.

What I will say, is that without the high quality of the burger I had, this would probably be a 3 star review. While I didn't necessarily enjoy the overall "experience" of actually being in an In-N-Out Restaurant that was crawling with tourists, I didn't let that affect my opinion of the food. As a matter of fact, if I were a California citizen, I would be more than happy to consistently visit my much less busy In-N-Out through the drive through. The burger, in the long run, was worth it. I got the Double Double (for the full experience) and REALLY enjoyed it. Much more than I thought I would. The fries are shoestring and not the best I've ever had, but still very good, and the milkshake was yum.

Overall, probably the last time I'll take myself to an In-N-Out in a highly populated area, but if I happen to pass one with less people and a drive thru, I will 100% stop by.
author: Aly D.

description:
This In-N-Out Burger is outstanding. The service was fast and the hamburgers were delicious. I loved the peppers that were served on the side. They really pick up the flavor of the hamburger and the pepper juice taste great on the piping hot french fries. 

The restaurant had an older appearance but was very clean and orderly. There was an employee walking around greeting customers and offering to assist with trash removal. It made for a very pleasant experience. 

They do not have a bathroom but will give you a code for the restrooms outside and around the corner from the restaurant. This restroom was surprisingly sparkling clean and fresh smelling so don't hesitate to ask for the code.
author: Laura G.

description:
In-N-Out was my favorite burger spot when I was in college. Then I became a vegetarian and it lost most of it's luster because my only option was a burger-less burger. They called it a grilled cheese. When you get it animal style (thousand Island dressing, grilled onions, and extra pickles) it's still tasty but not very fulling. My hope is In-N-Out adds a veggie burger to menu.

As far as the fries, it's cool that they make them from potatoes on site. They're fresher and more natural but don't taste as good as the precooked artificial fries at other spots.
author: Dan A.

description: Enjoyed my first time at in-n-out, but definitely should've tempered my expectations. Wait time was reasonable as I had my food in 15 minutes. Got the animal fries and double double with everything on it. The fries itself were cold, sauce was lukewarm if that. I'd equate it to eating your day old cookout fries after a crazy night out in town. The patty itself was flavorful and thin (as people told me). I prefer the bigger thick patties as I find them more juicy but definitely think these crisp patties had tons of flavor and were unique. Overall, I wouldn't come out of my way to get these burgers again much less lug it with me from west to east coast as some Californians I know have done.
author: Emily C.

description:
I don't get it. 

It's clear that this is a popular spot, and as a tourist, I knew (and had been told repeatedly) that I had to try it. It's a cute spot, but since the line up is out the door, you can expect to wait close to 40 minutes...for fast food. 

The price is right- for a burger I spent less than $4, which was nice for my wallet. 

The service was good, as well. Since it was my first time I was unsure of what to get and was a bit overwhelmed because of the line behind me, but staff was helpful in answering my questions.

There was nothing fundamentally wrong with the food. I ordered a burger- just to try the basic. The bun was good, a little toasted but not dry. The meat patty was good as well, albeit a bit thin in proportion to the toppings. I'm pretty sure the onions were cut thicker than the patty, which is my only real complaint about the food.

It seems as though they have a lot of options that aren't listed on the menu, which is a bit disappointing if you aren't local and don't know what you can ask for.

Overall, I'm glad I can say I've tried it, but I'm not sure it was worth the long wait. I would consider trying it again at a less busy time.
author: Samantha M.

description:
I had probably the best experience that I could have considering the amount of traffic inside the dining room. It was probably a 10 minute wait to order. 

My cashier was very thorough and repeated my order back to me for verification. All correct. 

Probably another 10 minutes waiting for my food and scoping out a seat in the previously mentioned packed dining room. 

I did the #1 double-double/fries/medium drink. I'm not from San Francisco so I did "animal style" on both burger and fries. 

Have to say the fries were amazing! As for the burger..... I was shocked when it was less than $5 for a double patty. After I tasted it. It made sense. I couldn't help but get Wendy's vibes. Not like super value menu Wendy's but like Wendy's more "higher end" choices. 

Hailing from NYC, I'm pretty biased to my beloved Shake Shack. The animal fries are much better than the crinkle fries at Shake Shack. But nothing beats a double cheeseburger with Shack Sauce in Madison Square Park. 

Shake Shack over In N Out. Case closed.
author: Derry R.

description:
On my first trip to SanFran , I didn't go to the first place on my Agenda .. which was In- N-out. So this time ... I made sure I did .. was very packed , as expected ... but they have a very efficient system . 
I give my cheeseburger a 6 /10 . The bun was very stale and /or dry , which made it a bit hard to swallow . most Def not a #shakeshack burger .
If you want a delicious burger in #California or #SFO.  Go to #Gotts !..
author: lee r.

description: Pretty much worth all the hype... a very classic burger with archetypal flavors... Their stack method is a no-brainer... although I've usually preferred tomatoes and lettuce on top... also... where are the pickles? I guess it didn't need them.
author: Roy N.

description:
One of the busiest In-n-out's in the Bay given that it's the only location in San Francisco I believe. Tons of tourists and long.... long (did I say long) line's at ALL time's. 

If you have friend's or family from out of state I'd recommend taking them to a surburban In-n-out rather than this location just because there are so many other great dining spots near this location. 

I've become a fan of the "protein style" burgers just because I'd rather want my caloric intake spent on the meat rather than the bread. I always thought this would be terrible but it's actually not that bad. 

Right now this place is hiring as well for those of you looking for work. Starting pay is $16 an hour.
author: Rod M.

description:
This is the first time I had In-N-Out and I really like their burgers but the fries wasn't that good. It tasted cheap and hard. I was told that their fries is the best when it's hot and fresh but by the time I had my order the fries were kind of cold. 

I think their burger is definitely better than Shake Shack and I have yet to their In-N-Out shake.
author: Jenn T.

description: This location is extremely packed since it's in such a tourist area. The line was out the door but they the staff was fast and efficient. It make take awhile to find a seat but eventually you'll get one, there's also seating outdoors. I love these burger they taste home made, straight from your backyard barbecue. The fries are not my favorite. The shakes are delicious. I definitely recommend if you've never been! Some may say it's overhyped but I understand why they are so raved about!
author: Krysten L.

description:
I was so happy to discover an In-n-Out when I was visiting the West Coast.  I've only had it a few times, but I knew I loved those juicy burgers.

We were there right when they opened, and so were about a dozen other people.  We were actually on the way to the airport, so we had our suitcases with us. 

We only had to wait about 15 minutes, and everything came out just as I remembered.  Burgers, fries and shakes. 

Staff was friendly.
author: Kisha M.

description:
Hey you! Do you like In-N-Out? Then you'll like this one! It is exactly what you expect. There are no vegetarian, vegan, or gluten-free options, there are no salads or fancy drinks. You will get a burger, you will get fries, and you will pay a very small sum of money for the privilege, especially given this location's real estate right next to Fisherman's Wharf. Both of the above will be viscerally greasy, but equally delicious.

Don't go in expecting a top-tier gourmet burger, and don't hype your friends up to the point that they're anticipating one, either. As an ex-hater of In-N-Out for this exact reason, you're doing your homies no favors in doing so.

Oh yeah, a few other things. Thanks to its location, it will be absolutely packed at all times of the day. Despite this, your food will be ready quickly, but you will probably have to sit outside in the courtyard in order to eat it.

But dammit, at least you'll be happy.
author: Shawn W.

description:
Being East Coasters, we don't have many opportunities to enjoy some burgers from In-N-Out. We finally traversed back to the West Coast, so of course we made sure to come here! Even at 9PM on a Wednesday night, this place was PACKED. It would have looked like a mad house if it weren't for the skilled coordination of the In-N-Out employees. I think it was so packed because this particular location is by Fisherman's Wharf, so lots of people would be flocking in for some local *chain restaurant* food. 

After 20 minutes from ordering our food, we finally received our two regular/single patty burgers! They were pretty good - fresh vegetables to offset the oiliness of the burger, a savory beef patty, a fluffy bun - what more could a girl ask for? It felt like we had been eating non-stop all day plus I had a lingering stomachache, so I predicted I would only finish about half of it and call it a day. However, the burger was so delicious and easy to eat, I ended up finishing all of it! 

In-N-Out is the epitome of simple and cheap deliciousness. I could see myself coming back to In-N-Out every time I come back to the West Coast.
author: Liselle L.

description: Ate here a few weeks ago while on vacation. The place was extremely packed and you have to wait for seating. However the service was good and we didn't have to wait too long for a seat. The food was amazing, just as expected  i would recommend tourists who have never eaten or rarely eat In n Out to try this location since it's near the main attractions, the boardwalk and Pier 39. All within walking distance to many shops as well. !
author: Abigail C.

description:
Solid In-N-Out near Fisherman's Wharf. It also seems like the only In-N-Out in SF. 

There are definitely not enough seats here and I hate that you have to exit the restaurant to use the bathroom and wash your hands and such. 

Overall, this In-N-Out's food is on par with all the other In-N-Outs I've been to. I applaud them for being able to deal with the crazy amounts of people at all times. Lines can be long, but they move pretty fast. Food comes out slowly (similar to all other In-N-Outs).
author: Carol L.

description:
I don't get the hype. I've heard about this place for years so when we finally were in California in San Francisco for the night, we had to come by. 

This is in fishermans wharf. We came at 9pm on a Friday night. 

It was SLAMMED. It was insane. They have no bathroom so people were literally peeing outside on the building. It was repulsive. It was loud, full of tourists and locals alike. People were in there drunk and screaming like it was new year's eve. 

The food took forever. It took 30 minutes just to find a seat for 2. 

There was spilled food and drinks on the floor. 

Finally, we get the food. Oh, also, there's no variety here. You can get cheese, no cheese or one or two patties. I've never been here before so I guess most people are cool with that? 

And it's expensive for a cheap burger and fries, but that just might be California. 

They have very thin, tasteless fries. They look like steal n shake fries but they don't use seasoning. The burger was pretty good but not worth the price or the environment. It was just a regular burger you'd pick up a a counter place, nothing special. Definitely never doing that again.
author: Annie W.

description:
I can't say a bad thing about this place. Not a single thing. They are all about quality! Every vegetable they use is fresh and crisp. The meat is delicious. When it all comes together with extra spread - it's heavenly.

Since this is the only In-N-Out in the city the line does get pretty long, but I'm willing to wait in it :)

The price you pay for the quality you get is actually insane.

I'm from the East coast originally and I used to like Shake Shack but I have been switched over since the day I took a bite out of my first double double!

Now I live in North Beach and walk to Fisherman's Wharf once a week to get my In-N-Out fix :)
author: Inci A.

description:
This is the closest In-N-Out to Fisherman's Wharf.

Came to SF for a quick 24 hour trip, and since I'm not from the West Coast, I needed to stop in for a quick animal style cheeseburger.

Nothing really special about this particular place. Same as other InNOuts, but super busy. Fisherman's Wharf is a super touristy place and because of that, this place is packed.

Lines went through quickly and the workers did a job churning out everyone's orders. Definitely got my need for that good west coast fast food burger!
author: Daniel Z.

description:
This is by far my favorite fast food place to go to! Is it because we don't have them back home? Is it because of their tasty, fresh burgers? Or the secret animal fries? Maybe it's all three! As I was walking to Pier 39, I just happened to see the in and out sign....I was so excited! It was only 10:30 in the morning, but I couldn't miss this opportunity to grab some food! 

The place had just opened and there were already people in line. Loved that I was not alone in this  burger heaven. I waited in line with anticipation, checking out the restaurant and all the photos on the wall until it was my turn to order. Very proudly I order a cheeseburger with extra onions and animal sauce.  My order was up fast and accurate... I took it to go.... and thoroughly enjoyed every bite as I walked. These burgers are so damn good! I had the perfect amount of onions, sauce and cheese to compliment the fresh burger. 

I love these burgers!
author: Kelly S.

description: Classic burger and fries. I ask for my fries extra crispy and dip in my milkshake. Love animal style fries and burgers as it is creamy and flavorful.
author: Coco D.

description:
Not much to say, you already know...
Ohmygeezus, got here at like1245 AM .... place was PPPAAAACCCKKKKKEDDDD - i was so hammered. Nothing finishes off a drunken all day into the night better than In-IN-Out, food was soo good . God, i love In-IN-Out.
Got my go-to; animal style cheese burger (those f&*kin grilled onions -OMFS) and a milk shake (medium/large is a regular sized milkshake BTW) ... on this night I was in a particular mood and got animal fries.
I LOVE IN N OUT... westside.
author: Steve S.

description: I wish I could've been more impressed with this, but I just was not. This place is all hype. It's cute. The hats are cute. The food is honestly presented nicely, but the patties are thin and dry. They don't have bacon or avocado or anything fun as a topping. The "animal style" fries are just fries topped with cheese sauce, thousand island dressing, and tiny onions and the fries are dry. I feel so negative leaving a review like this, but I'm being as honest and nice as I can be. They are fast and friendly and the food LOOKS great, but it's not.
author: Kimber B.

description:
MY ALL-TIME FAVORITE FAST FOOD CHAIN!! 

Cheap, delicious, and fast. In-N-Out serves your typical American-styled fast food burgers and fries with sodas, shakes, and even hot chocolate with marshmallows to supplement. 

I typically order:
1. Hamburger w/ Grilled Onions
It's simple but amazingly delectable. The edge of the bun is toasted. When you take your first bite into the burger, you'll taste that first crunch.   As you bite into the center, you'll taste a variety of scrumptious flavors like the well-balanced layers of cold iceberg lettuce topped with  refreshing slices of tomato, the well-seasoned, juicy beef patty, and grilled onions for extra flavor. A very simple burger made with so much taste!

2. Well Done French Fries (w/ Grilled Onions & Spread on the side)
This is like the cheaper version of animal-style fries except without the cheese and more crunch with every bite. I personally like this one more because I'd rather have the spread cold and not splattered all over the fries. One tip - order "WELL DONE" fries for extra crisp!

In-N-Out is great because it also has a not-so-secret menu.

Some Tips & Highlights..
1. You can order your burger extra toasted, animal-styled (grilled onions and their famous spread), with double meat, layered (3x3 or 4x4), and even protein style (no bun). You can also order fries well-done or even with cheese or grilled onions. 
2. Ask for spread to dip with your fries or even add it to your burger!

In this particular location, the service is generally really fast. There may be a long wait for your order if it's during busy hours in the day (like lunch or dinner time). Keep in mind that it is by the pier, so it's definitely a very touristy spot and generally very busy. I typically go at night (after 8pm) for free metered parking around Beach St and less crowd.

I love this place so much! It's the only fast food chain where I don't feel like I'm being clogged with oil after every meal. MUST GO!!
author: Michelle L.

description:
Couldn't leave Cali without going to In-N-Out. My first experience with In-N-Out was in Los Vegas and I've been a fan since then. So whenever I'm out West I have to stop. The south doesn't have them. 

I'm not really a burger fan just to throw that out there. Not big on fast food either. So a burger has to be really good for me to actually want it. 

I order the cheeseburger with onions(comes with lettuce, tomato, and pickles), small fry, and small beverage. Their food is always fresh and hot! Also they should win a reward for neatest burgers made. O yea if you've never had their burgers be mindful that they wrap their burgers in paper. My first experiences bit off sole of the paper lol. 
As always there is a line and the restaurant is always packed. Lucky if you get a table. At this location there was outside seating so I enjoyed the weather while demolishing my meal. O and the link lemonade was great!
author: Joiya A.

description:
Food: 4.5/5     Price: 4.5/5      Service: 3.5/5      Ambience: 3.5/5

The Yum: Never go wrong with an innout burger. 

The Yuck: Lines are usually really long here because its the only innout in the area

Crispy bread. Juicy burgers. What can go wrong? I came here for the late night munchies with a couple of my friends and it was pretty crowded. The line goes fairly quick so it wasn't a big deal.  

It was my first time ordering a 4 x 4 and dam it was good. There's going to be a lot of cheese and meat in one bite so if that's not your cup of tea then I don't suggest going higher than a double double. 

The downsides of this innout is that there's not a lot of seating here and there's also no restrooms here.
author: Eric L.

description:
Always good.

Walking distance from our hotel, this was our first destination after we had settled in. Employees were friendly and quick. The quality of their burgers, fries, and shakes were on point. I will always love In-N-Out for their quality ingredients at a great price. Their website has the "Not So Secret Menu" posted. However, there are still items not listed on there. The Neapolitan Shake is awesome. Give it a whirl. Their Sauce and Peppers will add an extra kick to your burgers. They aren't listed on the menu either. Simply ask for it. 

This is one chain I wish would open up in VA.
author: Kimberly J.

description: Burgers are on the smaller size, but are tasty....as are the shakes. Shoestring french fries. Basic limited menu, but its a burger joint. Do one thing, and do it well. And they do that here.
author: Chris H.

description:
Fast, fresh & efficient!  Double-double rankings on the "Double-Double."  

Every-time we get to the west coast, INO is on the list!   First time at this location & it was packed for 2:30.  But in true INO fashion, they washed, cut & fried fresh potatoes as fast as can be ordered ... dozs of patties on the grill!
author: Rob F.

description:
Let's cut to the chase: The burgers are wayyyyyyy better than the experience here.

Pro: As a tourist, it's conveniently located at Fisherman's Wharf. Con: As someone who thinks tourists are crazy annoying, it's inconveniently located at Fisherman's Wharf. It was busy, crowded, and had long waits with other annoying/rude customers.

The staff were nice and trying to do their best, but you could tell it was overwhelming and frustrating at times for them. The dining room could've been a little cleaner though, and the line to order was obstructive. I think they would benefit from having one or two employees dedicated only to the dining area to keep things clean and orderly. 

Tried animal style for the first time! It was good, but I think next time I'll get the original.
author: Kim D.

description: In-N-Out Burger generally can do no wrong. Always delicious, always fresh, always clean. Keep in mind this one is located in a really really touristy area, which means the lines are out the door! Food was great zero complaints ever. First world problems, but their microphone seemed to be messed up so couldn't hear the numbers being called out very well. Also, seemed like the table was wiped with a used cloth, it had a bit of a weird smell after. But really it wasn't a huge deal. Great food is key.
author: Darya K.

description: Too crowded there but the service is fast! 40 peoples ahead of you and it takes only 5 minutes to get your food! However, there is no restroom inside, that sucks :(
author: Anastasia I.

description:
Came here on a Friday around 5 pm and it was crowded! Maybe because it was near a touristy location? The line wasn't that long to order.. just a long wait time to receive the food. 

We were pretty excited to have our first in n out experience. Coming from nyc we always heard there was competition between shake shack and in n out so we wanted to have our own verdict! 

I forgot what burgers we ordered but no room for fries. We also got a strawberry milkshake. The milkshake was too thick and tasted like strawberry ice cream in a cup. Was difficult to drink it with the straw. 

The burgers tasted like a healthy version of any cheap burger fast food joint e.g. McDonald's Burger King Wendy's etc. it was too healthy for my taste. 

But my main question is why do people put shake shack and in n out in the same category?? Shake shack is like fancier fast food. Hands down shake shack wins!
author: Melody C.

description:
Can't beat an In-N-Out burger animal style- sizzling hot beef patty on cold, crisp bed of iceberg lettuce (layers, not just one measly leaf) with 2 slices of tomato, plenty of pickles, and fried onions and special sauce.  The fries themselves are pretty mediocre, but animal style makes those amazing too.  Mmmm...cheesy gooey oniony saucy.

The service is super friendly.  It was raining earlier in the day, so they gave the kids free hot cocoa with marshmallows.  There was no line to order, but it still took about 20 minutes to get our burgers and fries.  It's worth the wait.
author: Alex L.

description:
Super busy location right near the Wharf but I just don't get the hype around this chain. 

To me it's on par with like Sonic, nothing special. 

Be prepared to wait 10-15 minutes for your order because they are understandably very busy. 

I just got a standard double with cheese, not bad but not amazing either. It was about $6.
author: Jim T.

description:
You can never go wrong with a Double Cheeseburger and Animal Fries from In-N-Out. It's seriously the best treat after hanging out around the North Beach Bars. 

Beware that this location can get packed with lots of pre-teen high schoolers, especially if you decide to visit on a Friday or Saturday night. I came on an evening after a high school dance and the place was filled with obnoxious teens who were only ordering 1 burger despite coming in a large group of 10...

Coming here to endure the long lines and crazy pre-teens is definitely worth it though. The Animal Fries are just so heavenly... if only they can add some bacon on top, yum!
author: MyTien P.

description:
Going to In and Out when in California has become more of an obligation than anything else. But it's an obligation I'm willing to be part of. I've never Blown Away by their food, however I will give it to them that their service and efficiency is top-notch. Any and every restaurant could learn something about how well In-N-Out burger restaurants operate.
 The best thing to get, or my favorite thing to get is a double-double with fries animal style. Everything always tastes very clean and fresh, but that also might be the downside to it because I don't eat burgers and fries because it's healthy for me. The animal style always gives it that extra bit of flavor, but sometimes that Thousand Island could be a little on the Tangy side, and the cheese hardens up too quickly. Other than that it's a good spot to stop by and Snap photos just so you can make your friends jealous back home.
author: Nam N.

description:
I am going against the norm here but I am not impressed with their burgers here. This doesn't stop me for stopping by at least once every time I am near one but it's just average to me. 
Service is always good and fast regardless of location (this one is no exception).  I go simple with the cheeseburger meal. I find the burger not to be on par with the East Coasts Five Guys. Their fries are good but not McDonald's quality. Again this is my opinion so don't hate. 
Anytime you stop (any location) in they are mad house busy.
author: Pasquale R.

description: So disappointed my first time at in-n-out, especially since everyone on the East coast hypes it up! The animal fries were cold and the sauce was gloopy. The burger was just oookay.
author: Rachel C.

description: BUSY, BUSY, BUSY. This location is in the heart of tourist central. We stopped in shortly after 1PM and it took us 10 mins to find a place to sit down, but that was okay since our food took about 15-20 minutes. The restaurant was surprisingly clean, for the amount of people being turned. The burger and fries were great. Definitely try your fries animal style (cheese/chili).
author: Steve P.

description: Animal style baby! Super sweet location and friendly staff. Delish as always, also they walked around and handed out stickers. Who doesn't love IN N OUT?
author: Heather B.

description:
Life altering burger customization:
"double tomatoes,
whole grilled onions instead,
add sliced chilies,
+ 1 spread packet." 

How do you In N Out?
author: Geminyna J.

description: This was our first experience and we were surprised with the quality of the burger for the price we paid -- especially since all the ingredients are fresh with no preservatives. The shake was on point as well. I praise them for their quality control but this specific location can get extremely busy.
author: Elly K.

description: We're from Florida, where there are no In-N-Out Burgers. Everyone we talked to insisted we get a burger from the renowned establishment while we were in the SF area. We dropped by this restaurant, by the pier, and got a single cheeseburger. Ordering and picking it up was quick and easy, despite the lobby being packed with hungry patrons. The burger was piled high with sauce, tomato, lettuce, meat, cheese, and onion, atop a tasty toasted bun. With all the toppings, we couldn't taste much of the meat, so next time we'll get a double!
author: Amanda B.

description: There isn't really much more to say about this place than what's already being said: In-N-Out is freaking delicious. I went with my family and it is the first time I have seen my mom finishing 2 burgers and fries by herself. My grandma who normally don't eat very much, had a whole burger and fries as well. They especially loved the animal style special sauce so make sure you ask for it as well! But yeah no burger joint is close enough to challenge In-N-Out yet.
author: Junda P.

description:
I mean, it's In-n-Out people. Is there really much more to say?

It's good! I default to Hamburger (no cheese) Animal Style (grilled onions and special sauce), and animal style fries (share them though, it's a little bit excessive) then a strawberry shake if I'm REALLY feeling it.

Don't forget all the weird things you can get on their "secret menu"--animal style, 2x2, 3x3, 4x4, protein style, monkey style, neopolitan, extra crispy fries, etc. etc. The list goes on. And ask for the special sauce on the side!

Enjoy!
author: Nerissa C.

description: Sorry but this is was the most overrated hamburger place I have ever been to. The fires were horrible and tasted overcooked, the burgers tasted greasy but the milkshake was good.
author: Gen E.

description: After all that hype, and I mean YEARS of hearing about how good these burgers were, I was utterly unimpressed.  This location near Pier 39 gets insane foot traffic.  You are going to wait, but the staff are very skilled and friendly so bear with them.  There is no restroom but there is an outside patio area which you will appreciate because GOOD LUCK scoring a seat inside.  I went with the No. 2 combo because I find double patties too much.  My first thought after my first bite was "I will not remember this." I can't tell you what the burger tasted like because I honestly don't remember.  As blah as blah can get.  The prices are fine, fellow Yelpers, but for THAT long of a wait I expected something better.  Proof positive that sometimes it's just a name and little more.
author: Michelle M.

description:
Not the best in-n-out burger I've been to. Probably because this was the only one around the SF area? I'm really not sure since it's my first time in SF..

Seems like a lot of tourists come here (myself included) but the place was filthy AF. Compared to the ones I've been to in LA, this one was probably dirty because it's the only one around. 

The fries weren't as great as I remembered and the amount of patrons coming in and out really lowered the food quality. We sat outside and let me just say this, cleaning those trash cans were going to be a bitch. The trash was overflowing, the tables outside that I'm assuming they're responsible for hadn't been cleaned, probably all day. Oddly enough the staff was still really friendly and accommodating. Not sure if it's the Jersey girl inside of me cuz if I was behind that counter, I would've cursed someone out lol. 

Anyway, next time I'm back in SF, I'm going to try the food that's more available at Fisherman's Wharf and act less touristy by NOT going to this In-N-Out burger!
author: Tiffany Y.

description: I never though I would be going out of my way to review a fast food establishment but here I am! As a Floridian, I have only heard about in-n-out and have wondering when I would finally have the chance to try the hype for myself. Finally I found myself on a family vacation in California so I obviously had to swing by and try it out (even though I'm vegetarian). My family went a little overboard (I've attached a photo) and tried a few different things on the menu. What impressed me the most was that there was a vegetarian option for a burger that was pretty much a grilled cheese with animal sauce- DELICIOUS. The fries were extra crispy and everything was delicious. The only thing that I could have lived without was the really long line and the rude service we received.
author: Sneha H.

description:
It's going to take 30 minutes minimum to get in and out of this location.  Located in Fisherman's Wharf, this In-N-Out location is ungodly busy even with its large staff.

Given that, In-N-Out does not have a surcharge for this premium location and the price value is pretty unbeatable.  The only In-N-Out in easy access in San Francisco, it's a godsend.  I go here too much.
author: Mark C.

description: Am an avid In-N-Out'er, which is why I was disappointed when I came on a Thursday and it took me over a half hour just to order. I've been to other locations with similar lines that took 1/4 of the time. They need to hire more staff.
author: Ryan S.

description:
This particular In-N-Out location was VERY crowded when I went (Saturday afternoon), but the line moved surprisingly fast. Plus, they were handing out free stickers, which I thought was a nice gesture. We only waited about 10 minutes for our food, and even with the crowd we were able to find a table. 

The burger really is as good as I have heard! The special sauce is what makes it stand out from other burger chains (Shake Shack etc.). I also had a chocolate milkshake, which was absolutely delicious. The only disappointment was the animal style fries. The fries are thin and got soggy fairly quickly. 

Overall, if you're visiting California, you should give In-N-Out a try. For the most part, it lives up to the hype.
author: Katie A.

description:
It's Face-Off time, and I don't mean between John Travolta and Nicholas Cage.  Rather, I mean between In-N-Out Burger and myself.  For years and years now, I have been told by my Californian friends that THIS is the burger to end all burgers (with the fast food realm. Of course) but I'll be quite honest - I like my Midwestern fast food burgers better.  Regardless, I was ready for this face-off.

I ordered the double patty animal style burger, which you won't be able to find on the regular menu (It's on the secret menu), the animal style fries and the strawberry milkshake.  The latter was my favorite part of the meal as it reminded of the strawberry laffy taffy.  Though the infamous secret menu animal style items were noteworthy at a certain level, I felt disgusting after eating them.  That, I'm able to deal with, but the soggy fries and the somewhat bland patty?  Those are two things I cannot deal with.  

The fries, I could tell, were soggy before the sauce was put on them.  As for the burger - it seemed like it was pounded to a pulp and it looked that succulent flavor you'll find at other burger chains like theirs.  I'm, by no means, upset that I came to In-N-Out Burger because it has been something on my bucket list.

A few other things about this location:
1. It is jam-packed.  It is on the Wharf afterall
2. The staff try to be efficient here, but they end up not being efficient at all
3. The prices are pretty fair, and that is something that other similar establishments (like Shake Shack and Five Guys) can't say
4. This location is very close to a tour bus pick up/drop off...so go get a burger while waiting for the bus!!!
author: Lauren K.

description: I'm not a fan of fast food restaurants but I have to say the animal style fries at In-n-out burger is fantastic after a night out with friends. That greasy and cheesy flavor is much needed! I like their burger as well but I'm not a burger person so I don't eat it often. There is usually a huge crowd of you plan to go there. Always busy as Fisherman's wharf is crowded with tourists.
author: Julia J.

description:
My first ever trip to In-N-Out Burger. The question must be answered In-N-Out Burger or Shake Shack. 

This location is crazy crowded. It's a scramble to find empty seats. The wait for your food may take a while as well. 

Being that it was my first time at an In-N-Out Burger, I got the regular burger and some animal fries. The burger was good, but I felt like it was ordinary. Yes, it is better than a Mcdonald's, Burger King, or Wendy's burger, but to me I see nothing special about it. I do think the burger patty could have been thicker. The fries I do enjoy..I mean c'mon on there is melted cheese, grilled onions, and thousand island dressing.

East coast Shake Shack or West coast In N Out Burger...My winner is Shake Shack.
author: Alan L.

description: The Hype is real ! When you hear about In- N -Out burger believe the excitement.Be ready to expect a crowd of people ready to order. Don't worry the ordering process is efficient. I suggest having your friend grab a table while you wait on the food as seating is limited. From the customer service, food and the maintenance team the overall experience was enjoyable. We ordered the cheese burgers and fries with the strawberry milkshake.We ate it all! The food was delicious and if you wanted extra ketchup someone from the staff actually offers you while your eating. Can't get any better than that!
author: Jadea R.

description: If you're down at fisherman's wharf, you HAVE to stop by in n out. It gets really crowded and there's a long line but they work fast. If there's no seats inside I recommend walking down to the water and enjoy the view and your burger!
author: Melissa A.

description: First time trying in and out burger. We found the burgers very tasty and the price very good too! Although my husband found the burger not that filling and he went to get a second burger. Wish we had the well done fries because they were not as crispy as we liked.
author: Cynthia C.

description: IT IS AWESOME! the onion.tomato had just made it taste good! the line is long but everyone were just willing to wait.
author: Clare G.

description:
In-N-Out is good no matter where you go.

This location was busy but delicious nonetheless. Thank god it was close to the bar when we need something to wash the accidental shot of Fernet out of our mouths. 

Life saver as usual.
author: Zoe F.

description: I understand why this location is in the Fisherman's Warf area because there are lots of tourists.  Otherwise it's not really convenient.  They are crazy busy & it's tough competition for seating.  Good when you want a cheap burger fix.  The fries & shakes don't disappoint.
author: Kim S.

description:
Situated in Fisherman's Wharf sits an In-N-Out next to the newly built Krispy Kreme. I came here numerous times in the past, but this is the first time I'm writing a review for this place. Almost every single time I come here, there's always a line and it's pretty crowded inside. If there are no places to sit inside, then venture outside to one of the tables near the back of the store. 

This time, I ordered a Double-Double and a side of regular fries (I usually get the animal fries, but I wasn't feeling up to it that day). Then comes the wait as you congregate near the counter waiting for your number to be called. This more or less takes roughly ten minutes, depending on what you ordered. My Double-Double was pretty good; plenty of meat and flavor, with the cheese and the fresh vegetables a fine accompaniment to the meal. The fries were pretty fresh, and I did regret not getting animal fries (fries drizzled with their infamous animal sauce) instead, since I really just wanted to eat just the fries this time (I had animal fries every other time I came in here and want to change it up for a change, get the animal fries). The only thing that could have made this meal even better was if I just ordered the animal fries, which I'll do next time. 

In the past, I also had the Neapolitan shake (basically chocolate, vanilla and strawberry shakes mixed in one). I highly recommend ordering any burger, the animal fries and the Neapolitan shake for a meal, especially if it's your first time here or even if you're just stopping by California. There is a good reason why people caw about this place as if this was their first-born child; the food here is just that good. Something so simple, yet so satisfying. For less than ten dollars, this is the best fast food that you can get in my opinion.
author: Nelson X.

description:
Can't resist a In-N-Out burger  
So yummy and fresh. This like all the other locations are jamming. So good luck finding a table. We are used to this part so it's part of the whole enjoyment of grabbing a burger straight from your flight!
author: Dominica R.

description:
Coming to California for the first time I knew that I absolutely had to come to In-N-Out Burger for some of the California state's most famous hamburgers - and I was definitely not disappointed.

Smack in the middle of Pier 39 and one of the most touristy areas in San Francisco I was a bit worried if I would get an authentic burger but I can honestly say that I had a delicious cheeseburger for only $3.50. The ingredients were all fresh and the bun was slightly toasted so it was crispy with some great mayo sauce. This place was still packed at 9:30pm at night but there was luckily a couple that just left so I was able to snag a table. And despite the long ass line up (which apparently can be much worse than what I experienced), the food came in a reasonable amount of time - with my grilled onions to boot!

If I lived in California, I could definitely see myself grabbing burgers much more often if I lived near a In-N-Out. Their quality combined with their price makes them super competitive in my books.
author: Justin K.

description: This iconic burger chain at the iconic Fisherman's Wharf is a must-try for anyone visiting San Francisco! The menu is pure simplicity--hamburgers, cheeseburgers, fries, and shakes are all you'll find, but delve into their secret menu (which you can find online) to add many levels of customization! The simple hamburger here is my go-to. The patty is thin, fresh, and perfectly seasoned, while the amazing potato bun is crispy on the outside and soft and chewy on the inside. The lettuce, tomato, and onion add a nice refreshing flavor, and the thousand-island-like spread brings every bite of the burger together! The consistency you'll get at In-N-Out is amazing--the burgers taste exactly like they did many years ago, when I had them while growing up, and they still bring back great memories!
author: David K.

description:
So, for years I have heard the hype.  People being away from In-N-Out and not being able to get to one whining in despair.  Well, this location left me whining in despair too, but not because I wanted more.  This was the worst burger I have ever had.  I'm no burger snob.  I like a good burger and I'll eat a greasy spoon burger.  In either case, they have taste.

This burger was smaller than the lettuce and tomato.  The burger itself had no taste, like no seasoning at all.  The sauce tasted like watery thousand island dressing.  The french fries could have come to the rescue, but instead they were soggy and cold.  Their soft drinks even tasted bad...need to filter the water or clean the lines or something.

I guess if I had to say something nice, I would say the bun was okay and the lettuce was crisp.

Could it have been this location?  I hope so.  I was with 3 other people and we all agreed it was the worst meal we had our entire trip.
author: Shevon R.

description:
So being Canadian we had never eaten at In and Out. But of course we had heard about it and the rave reviews

We got a couple of burgers with drink and fries

The burgers were tasty..delish. One of the better burgers we had in a long time. Fries were just okay

It lived up to its reputation
author: Timmy T.

description:
Place - it is in tuorist place. Always many people in it. Pretty many tables but normally wait for seat. You eat also eat outside tables or on the beach. Hard to park around here and parking fee is expensive. 

Taste - I love protien style. It uses lattues instead of bread. It is more fresh and feel more chewy patty. You can put raw onion or grilled onion. You must eat French fries too. Animal fries is also great or you can ask a pack of animal sauce. 

Service and Price - They are always busy but they are smilling and nice. Price is really reasonable!
author: Da Won L.

description: Yoooooo this place is trash. I'm from the Midwest, we have the likes of steak and shake, portillos, among others. Admittedly I'm not a big steak and shake fan but I'd rather eat that than this. Very sad to find this place is more in line with Mcdonalds and BK than it is with Shake Shack, or Au Cheval. Resounding boo for this place.
author: Abel A.

description: Probably the most popular burger chain in CA, everyone loves it! I personally think the burgers are ok but not as good as people say. I think the reason they like them is because it is a good combination of priceand falvor. Definetely have to try it out though, make sure to order the animal sauce with fries and get a milkshake!
author: Maria O.

description:
Why is this the only In-N-Out in San Francisco? Is this some sort of sick joke? 

Well anyway, it is, and it is in the most touristy area and there may be a line out the door. Whatever. Who cares, it is worth it. As an East Coaster who NEVER gets to eat In-N-Out, it wasn't even an option to skip. 

Burgers are so cheap and like wtf is in them that makes them so good? I don't know, I don't care, I will stand in line. Might as well get Animal Style Fries, too.
author: Jennifer S.

description: Got a cheeseburger with fries and a soda. The fries were dry and not tasty. The burger and soda were great. It took me a while to find a table since this place was very busy. We got there around 3pm on a Tuesday. Be ready to eat outside or take some time to get a table. Good experience otherwise.
author: Jennifer V.

description:
Finally get to try the In n out burger that everyone is talking about. Every so often I would hear people comparing it to shake shack, so now I'm here to try it and see which fast food chain is actually better. I'm actually surprised on how small their menu options are. It's not like McDonald's, burger kings or Wendy's. In n out have just burgers and fries. The menu is rather simple and not to mention the price are hella cheap. It cost less than $2 for a burger. 

I definitely think the burgers at shake shack is better because they use potato bread, good quality beef and green leafy lettuce. No wonder shake shack cost more. The in n out burger has ice berg lettuce and regular McDonald's type of buns, the burger itself was rather dried. But for less than $2 I think it's worth it. I don't mind eating it again. So one point for shake shack and the east coast!!
author: Cindy X.

description:
I feel like I have been on a rant with reviews lately highlighting one thing... overhype. In-n-out is the epitome of this. If I happened along one of these off the interstate of a western US trip, I would be impressed. But as one who rarely makes his way out here and hears about INO a TON, they come up just a little short. They are the epitome of overhype because it isn't that one super annoying guy telling you how great it is. It goes far beyond that and reaching national media.

This was my 2nd visit to INO. My first was in Las Vegas at a very late time after a very long day. So my tastebuds could have been fooled. Or perhaps that location churned out better food because they didn't have a line halfway to Oakland. One way or another, this trip was disappointing to say the least.

Was my double patty and fries bad - not at all. But for being labeled by some as the BEST fast food burger in the country, I beg to differ... at least this location. The meat was slightly over cooked and could have used some seasoning. In the grand scheme of things, this trip to In-N-Out was just A-ok.
author: Will B.

description: Located by the wharf, this In-n-Out attracts many, many tourists. There are a lot of people, but the food is still good and served relatively quickly. Not my favorite location because of the amount of people, but good burgers and fries nevertheless.
author: Alice W.

description: Love this place! Visited the location in Las Vegas approximately a year ago and they never disappoint. Employees are always so friendly and the food is prepared fairly quickly.
author: Ashlee M.

description:
I am a lover of In-N-Out Burger considering you can make your own burger to your own preference. If you are a tourist, local or maybe you travelled from a different state. This is probably the only In-N-Out in SF. But if you are adventurous and want to skip the long lines, just drive on other locations like in Union City down 30 minutes into the SF East Bay Area. 
I visited this branch and it was really busy, I mean the dining area was full of people eating their food, waiting for their food and there was a long line overflowing out of the door. I was crazy busy for a Saturday afternoon at 4:30PM.
If this is your first time - order a double double combo animal style (where the beef patties are cooked with mustard to be more flavorful, delicious burger), also comes with tomatoes, ask for grilled onions, lettuce, a grilled bun. Tell them to cook fries without the salt but slightly well done.
There are fans who come for these burgers, and they are wars battling who are the best burgers in the U.S.A. like Burger Shack, Five Guys, In-N-Out, Shake Shack and many more popping up on respective states. In-N-Out is more of a West Coast burger joint that started in Inglewood located in Southern California.
author: Jade M.

description: I don't care what anyone says about this place I still love this place in day one. I can eat probably 8 of the burgers, don't test me lol.  I love the French fries and I love how the cheese is melting on them patties!  As we all know it's always a little bit of a wait, actually a long wait but it's worth it. For me atleast lol.
author: Jin K.

description: Food was perfect people were nice the burgers tasted like heaven and the little paper hats are a must have. If it's lunch or dinner and you're hungry go to in n out burger. When you walk in the doors and smell the fresh French fries and burgers, 1.Your mouth waters 2. Enjoy the aroma. So if you want a bite to eat and a soda to sip, and French fries to dip in sauce, go to the boss, have the best in the West at in n out burger
author: Kathryn W.

description:
When I was on the west coast, I had the goal of having and In-N-Out burger and that goal was achieved! My friends and I ventured to In-N-Out on a Saturday afternoon and we were shocked at how busy, yet efficient, the place was. The group that I was with had done their homework as there are some non-menu items that were highly suggested online. My friend, who ordered before me, got a double-double, with her onions grilled, and animal style fries. So being original, I ordered the same thing! What shocked me was that there were 40 orders that had to be filled prior to me receiving my order and I only waited less than 10 minutes! When I received my order, I was pumped, and I devoured every last bite rather quickly. The burger were awesome and the cheese/grilled onion covered fries were great! I enjoyed every bite. 

Since it was so busy in the place, our group of 5 had to sit at a table of 4 and one my friends sat on her suitcase. Halfway though our meal, one of the workers came by and offered to grab her a chair, which was nice, however she declined as she was leaving. Next thing you know the same worker came by and gave us In-N-Out bumper stickers and hats because he felt bad that she didn't have a chair. This sort of hospitality is not usually found in other establishments and kudos to both In-N-Out and that worker for being awesome! Check them out!
author: Tom F.

description:
In-N-Out is my fast food chain of choice when I am tired of eating healthy and want to have a cheat meal! I am always looking forward to the weekend of the month where I go and ask for a triple-triple burger, fries and vanilla shake. 

The service here is really fast despite it being in a touristic zone, so if you see some lines do not worry as they will end fast and you will be able to eat your delicious burger sooner than expected. The quality of everything they make is also really good: the vegetables always seem to be fresh, the meat is always cooked perfectly, the fries are out of this world and if you combine them with the shake they are even better.
author: Diego M.

description:
What can be said about this fast food joint that gets it right every time?

As an east coaster I don't get to enjoy this A+ burger often enough but that's ok because when I do it just makes it even more special. 

I hear the internet likes to compare the burgers of In-N-Out, Five Guys and Shake Shack as if they represent the holy trinity. My opinion is they are none alike. All delicious in their own differences.

My order - Double Double animal style with added raw onions and chilies, animal style fries with added chilies, extra chilies on the side, small coke and if I really want to go all out a neapolitan milkshake. (If you could tell I like the chilies)

Fresh, flavorful and filling.
author: Amanda H.

description: Great burger!  The cheese mingled with everything to make a melt in your mixture!!!  My husband and I got a double double combo to split so we could "taste" the West coast burger chain - and we were impressed!  This one was VERY busy!  Took awhile to get food and hard to find a seat.  The fries were great (homemade - peeled and cut in-house). Ketchup and banana peppers are self serve.  No bathroom in restaurant.  Lots of windows to people watch while you eat.
author: Elizabeth S.

description:
Being raised in the South I have had very little exposure to this chain but after they particular visit I can can understand what the whole deal is. Those burgers and fries aren't just delicious- they are beyond any expectation.

Many people already know this but you have to order both the burger and the fries "Animal Style." This $2 addition gives much added flavor and zest to your food. Mmm!

The service was also very good and genuine.
author: Matthew C.

description:
This location is always exceptionally busy, so it's my least favorite location to visit. Parking is a nightmare, and there's no drive-thru. Also, this is the only In-N-Out I've been to that 1) has messed up my order, and 2) doesn't have a bathroom! 

On my most recent visit, it was maybe 8pm, and I needed to pee, badly. The cashier directed me to a public bathroom that was closed. You needed a door code to get in, and she didn't give me one. Were these bathrooms always closed after hours? I don't know. It wasn't that late. I followed more signs to another bathroom, and that one was closed as well! I was getting desperate, so I eventually begged someone at the Marriott to let me use theirs. On top of that whole debacle (which took around 10 minutes), I came back to find that my food wasn't anywhere near ready. That surprised me. It wasn't even that busy, even for this location. My food wasn't ready for another 10 minutes...and when I finally got it, they had messed up my order.

It's In-N-Out, so I can't give it a bad rating, but I've had much better experiences at other locations.
author: Kelsey S.

description:
Same quality as Burger King or McDonald's. what is the hype with this place all about?

And to be fair I was drunk and starving when I ate here, it should have been magnificent
author: Alex H.

description:
I finally got to try In-N-Out burger after years and years of hearing about how great it was. And first, to answer the age old question of In-N-Out vs. Shake Shack, it's going to be Shake Shack for me.

Since my friend and I wanted to try some seafood along Fisherman's Wharf, we decided to share a double double and animal style fries - in order to avoid feeling like greasy bears afterwards. The burger was pretty good, but not great. Maybe it's because I was already subconsciously comparing it to Shake Shack right after I took that first bite. It actually reminded me of a Double Stack from Wendy's. 

I did not like the Animal Style fries. This might be because they got cold really quickly. The cheese was not melted, so that, combined with their special sauce, made the fries kind of chunky. Not very appetizing.

Also, seating here is pretty hard to come by. It would be nice if they implemented a system where you could only have a seat once you get your food, but I really doubt that would happen  , since it's a fast food joint. It takes 2 minutes to put in your order, but 15-20 minutes to actually get your food. They also have seating outside but sit at your own risk, as you will be attacked by pigeons.

I would still go back to In-N-Out and try it again next time I'm in the West Coast. But I probably wouldn't come back to this location.
author: Mel T.

description: For my first experience, I have to say it was a pretty decent burger, it was a nice early lunch but it did not have my mouth weathering for more anytime soon, however I'll eventually comeback for more!
author: Ara H.

description:
Food: Definitely delicious but I do think other In-N-Out's are better just because this is very touristy The food doesn't come out as piping hot as others since they're making so many and doing so many orders at once. I would recommend trying animal style burger or fries at least once. Also asking them to mix the strawberry and vanilla milkshakes makes it taste so good! It's a very thick and sweet milkshake so share with a friend if you don't have a huge sweet tooth. 

Service: There's always a huge amount of people and it's very difficult to get seating. The workers do get the food out fast considering how many people are there.
author: Karen W.

description: This is my 2nd time in CA and 2nd trying here and still disappointed. I'd say it's on a level of Wendy's, hate ke all you want. I have to be honest and havent had anything that blows my mind. Please join me if you agree. They promote fresh alot and I just didn't taste it. Considering some places like Mcdonalds are pushing more upgraded selections, I don't see the point of spending money here. Again, just my experiences. I wish it lived to the hype for me, I really do!
author: Rick H.

description:
LIST of the SECRET MENU!
Many people may already know this, but I think for those visiting out of town this may be something to get excited about. There is a Secret Menu which consists of a variety of things that will make your In-N-Out experience more customized. Below is a list: 

Protein Style (no Bun..semi-healthy version)
Grilled cheese.
The Flying Dutchman -- two patties with cheese melted between them 
Mustard-grilled patty burger. 
Cheese fries. 
Well-done fries.
4x4 burger (4 patties x 4 cheese slices)
3x3 Burger
Animal Style Burger: grilled onions, mustard, and pickles. **Just Order It: This is my favorite and I don't even like onions.
Adding Peppers (for those spicy lovers)
Whole Grilled Onion Burger
Cheese Fries: similar to nachos, but with fries
Neapolitan Shake: Strawberry, Chocolate, and Vanilla 
Grilled Cheese Sandwich (for vegetarians)
Animal Fries: Similar to the burger, but those toppings are laid on the fries 

Hope this helps! :) I was so excited when I heard about this menu years ago because I love In-N-Out so I was looking forward to trying each of these. Order a new one and try something different! Let me know what your favorite one is. My two are the animal style burger and fries. They are so delicious. My mouth is watering as I'm writing this just thinking about it. Enjoy!

I'm a fellow traveler so I appreciate when other people have given me tips/recommendations while in a new city. If this information is helpful, please let me know by hitting the like button. Even if this review helps only one traveler then it's worth it to know I'm contributing towards making someone's experience better, giving to the global community, and paying it forward. Safe Travels!
author: Neo N.

description:
I like how the fries aren't salted and they give you salt on the side to add. This place is crazy busy and long wait! But we were lucky to get seats inside when we came.

I got the pink lemonade and added 3 lemons to make it really good. The burgers here are definitely fresh. Overall a good burger joint that's why it's always so busy!
author: Sally W.

description:
Why did I eat here right after finishing a whole dungeness crab AND bowl of clam chowder at Fisherman's Wharf?  Because I'm from Hawaii where we have no In N Outs.  Because this is the only location in the city and we were already in the area.  Because its been five long and agonizing years since I had my last fix!

ATMOSPHERE:
They're located in Anchorage Square which is a shopping center so there's no drive thru.  Like most In N Outs, the inside is small and the crowds large, so seating was at a premium.  There was no organization at all as far as the ordering and pickup lines went, though the crowd seemed mindful of it all.  It's definitely not a relaxing dining experience as someone is always in your personal bubble space.  I wasn't planning on eating inside but my spouse found a counter seat for us.

FOOD:
Double Double - Being an In N Out amateur, I forgot that you have to ask for GRILLED onions as the ones I got were yucky raw.  Other than picking them out, the burger was good but the patties were a tad salty.  I tried it animal style before but didn't care for it because I like my burgers simple, usually with just mayo.  However, not being a fan of their fries because they lack flavor, I was going to try them animal style but my spouse declined, so I was stuck with boring old fries.  I could've ordered my own but I was full on crab & chowder lol!

SERVICE:
For being as bat ***t crazy as they were, all the workers were calm and collected.  The cashiers were especially friendly and patient.  My simple order took about 30 minutes from ordering to delivery.  

TIP:
Don't bother trying to guess if your order is up next because the numbers were random and not in numerical order.

OVERALL:
It's not the best burger I've ever had, but it's pretty damn good for fast food, and a lot more affordable than their competition.
author: Vince N.

description:
