This is one busy location. Right by Pier 47. I believe it's open very late - if not 24 hours. Corner spot where people hover over you watching as you finish your last fry before they start giving you the stink eye to give up your seat. 

Last night we had a 3x3, mustard fried, fried onions, pickles, lettuce. Pretty superb!  That will be my standard order from now on. Couple that with animal fries and a shake and you are good to go!  Really good burgers. Rivals 5 Guys, Shake Shack and Smashburger.
author: Patrick A.

description: I love burgers and the line was out the door here. I got a double cheeseburger with everything on it, it was very good. It was very juicy all the flavors ran together and they didn't skimp on the lettuce and tomato. The line moves pretty fast so if you see a line don't be afraid to get in it. Same thing with the tables. I was a little disappointed in the fries but the burger made up for it. The service was friendly and fast also. So if you pass by one of these go try it for yourself.
author: Diana M.

description: Okay place for fast food burgers. I ended up going there late on a Monday night as it was the only place I could find that was open past 10 in the area.  Fries were a little soggy and not all the great. Burger was just okay, nothing amazing. Overall, it's okay for fast food.
author: Dakota S.

description: Heard a lot of hype, so we tried it. Burgers were tasty with nice, fresh toppings, but nothing great. Fries had good flavor, but weren't crisp. Shake tasted like a McDonalds shake. Better than BK or McDonalds, but doesn't come close to Five Guys
author: Darren R.

description: When we were inside what we saw a huge human population; there was no free tables to sit. Like everyone else, we were there because simply: it's cheap. You can feel full by only paying 9 dollars or so. Also the quality is awesome, I think, for that cheap price. Double and double is pretty decent for someone to be full. If you have side of fries that would be super satisfying.
author: Zeynep D.

description:
After boasting about the quality of N and Out, a Cali original, to my cousin and his gf from Eerie, PA, their reaction...

Cousin's GF: "I'd have to say Five Guys is better than this"

Cousin: "Damn McDonald's is better than this!"

Also doesn't help waiting for days with all these tourists for a subpar product. Four trays of fries were also left, that could feed a small village,  (although they may have even passed), because of their below average nature. Just plain embarrassing to a CA native. 

N and Out you need to step up your game and stop resting on your laurels. Don't make a lair out of Thomas Keller and other celebrities who have touted this "famed" burger.

Make California great again!
author: Ashley D.

description:
Another place that I've heard hype all about in the west coast. 

Coming from the east coast, I've never had In-N-Out, and I was super excited to try what was purportedly the "finest fast food burger in the west."

In one word, the meal was dry. Not dry in the sense that it was really salty and I was in need of water, but there wasn't enough oil and juice in the meal. The burger patties were borderline McDonald's patties, and the bun was really airy. The vegetables were good though, I have to admit, but that was all for the burger.

As for the fries, it was an absolute disaster. Out of all the fries in fast food, everybody has been acceptable so far, but In-N-Out? I don't know what is a closer description to the fries: veggie fries, or fried cardboard? The insides of the fries are super dry, and the fries have no flavor. But the defining worst part of them is that they are just not fried with enough oil that fries are. I guess it's an attempt to make something unhealthy healthier, but tough luck, In-N-Out.

Overall, another underwhelming experience. Meal was also expensive, as I paid 10$ for the double double meal. I think McDonald's and Burger King are better, considering their options and fries beat this place.
author: Michael Y.

description: Finally tried the highly talked about west coast burger place on my trip to California. Their prices are great for the quality of food provided, definitely beats any fast food burger places like McDonald's or Burger King. However, the fries, not so great. They proved to be a bit hard both times I tried them in different locations. Overall, the burgers are what deserves 4 stars the fries could very well only deserve 1 star. I did have such high hopes so I felt it was a bit overhyped but all in all, affordable prices for a great burger!
author: Ivette T.

description:
I've heard a lot about In-N-Out and finally, a couple days ago on my visit to San Francisco I got to try it for the first time. Whoever's idea it was to put it smack down in the middle of Fisherman's Wharf, give him or her a medal because business is boomin' . It was crowded inside (as expected). I ordered a double-double with regular fries and a coke but also tried their shake and animal fries from the group of friends I was with. The burger was pretty tasty and juicy but I can't say the same for the regular fries. The animal fries however were delicioso. 
In the end, it certainly met my expectations. Would I come back? Yes.
author: David K.

description:
There's never anywhere to sit and eat inside. The picnic tables outside are typically taken or if it's raining, you're screwed. 

Great food but awful place for dining. Wait has gotten ridiculously long.
author: Faldo R.

description: Great food this was my first experience being I'm from the east coast, my lunch was delicious and I'm definitely going back o return on my next trip. On a side note I am Deaf and was very happy to find that my server knew sign language making my order go very smooth. The food was great!
author: Rachel B.

description:
I will literally visit every in n out and write a review for each and every one of them and they will more likely than not always be 5 stars... 10/10 everything - service, food, price.. I LOVE IN N OUT. This is always my go to place when I just want a burger or fries. I think the PC way to name in n out is "healthy fast food." They always make fresh fries, have fresh meat patties and delicious shakes (which are actually like 590 calories? Lol but still worth it!) 

My favorite is an order of animal fries and a hamburger :)
author: Amy L.

description:
Ugh. I'm on the fences with this In N Out. Food and service is always outstanding but the amount of PEOPLE is a little ridiculous. Always expect a full line of tourists of all nationalities. Being in fisherman's wharf this is the mecca of In N Out restaurants. 

The line to order is never too long but the wait can be excessive. My number was #74 and they were serving in the 30's. Ugh! Oh well, gotta fulfill that In N Out craving at all costs!
author: Ralph A.

description: Coming from east coast this is not what expected. Shake n shack, burguer Fi, Five guys are better than this. The fries are terrible.
author: Oscar V.

description:
As a NYer, I spent many a day eating my overpriced Shake Shack burgers, dreaming of a time when I could finally try In-N-Out. I ended up getting the chance a lot sooner than I thought, and unfortunately I was kinda disappointed.

They definitely beat Shake Shack and 5 Guys ONLY in terms of value. The prices are cheap and there are a lot of toppings included, which were all very fresh. The patty was cooked perfectly. I just wish the burger wasn't so dry...not a lot of juice in this burger and the sauce was tasty but seriously lacking... Overall I was still really happy. A good burger is a good burger. I can't say it's better than Shake Shack or 5 Guys because to me they all fill a different craving. 

I would give them 4 stars but the wait at this location is RIDICULOUS. A million tourists + lots of locals = 45 minute wait for 2 burgers. I think they should invest in another location in SF (even though there are other great burger places around) simply to fill the touristy/instagrammer need...
author: Jocelyn M.

description: Wow i know its tourist trap town but burger was dry and fries undercooked. Got takeout so not going back to complain but worse than mcdonalds.
author: Kat M.

description: I would give this 5 stars but the fries stink. Double double was amazing as advertised. Get it animal style! Everyone loves bacon!
author: Karen B.

description: Double double animal style burger was good, and so was the milk shake! I was not a fan of the fries. The line was incredibly long and there was nowhere to sit.
author: Janine T.

description:
I couldn't very well visit San Francisco and not visit In-N-Out, right?

The service was quick, but not as quick as I expected from a fast food joint. I didn't mind waiting because my company was great and we found a table right away (dang, this place was busy!), but if I had been wanting to grab-and-go I may have been frustrated.

The chocolate shake was so thick I almost needed a spoon to eat it, rather than drink it through a straw. But once I got some in my mouth I was very happy - so chocolatey, so creamy. Mmmmm. The burger was great too - full of fresh veggies and the patty was the perfect ratio. I'd gladly order both again.

I wasn't so excited about the fries. Mine were dried out and tasteless - I think they were overcooked? Maybe I got "well-done" fries instead of the regular ones?

If I manage to find another In-N-Out I'm definitely going to try some of the secret menu offerings - Animal Style Fries sound like perfection, and a Neopolitan shake? Yes please.
author: Jodi B.

description: Good burger. Make sure you order cheese fries or animals fries! They are pretty quick when it comes to your food even if there is a long line.
author: Anthony M.

description: Same food as most other in-n-out locations but they were very efficient here. Line was long but went quick.
author: Michelle B.

description: I recently went vegetarian and figured I could get a meatless burger here. I imagined a meatless burger would take half the time to make but boy was I wrong. I waited for my number to be called for more than 20 minutes and still nothing. About 15 numbers after mine were called before I finally asked what could possibly be taking so long. The teenager (seems to be all that works here) at the front was less than helpful, couldn't tell me what the holdup was, and somewhat ignored my frustrated request that he check again. Finally I got my burger. But not before I decided to never come here again.
author: Jessica D.

description:
Best burger in the universe.
Get the animal style on their secret menu.
author: Rokeby V.

description: First time having the famous in-n-out. We had already had lunch but we had to try it so we had as a "snack". The line was out the door but it moved quickly and they are quick putting the orders together I was impressed. We just had an order for their burger and cheese fries. I was pretty impressed didn't expect it to taste as good as it did. Pretty decent fast food!
author: Danisbel C.

description:
In n Out is worth the walking trek for my husband and I, as we will scale the hills of SF to get here, eat, then walk off our burgers back home.

Pros: the cashiers are pretty attentive to my crazy orders/modifications

Cons: the wait.. you will wait for close to 20 minutes for your food to be ready. Also, hovering over families just to snag their tables is frustrating for all.

Nonetheless, we enjoy coming here every now and then just to people watch and enjoy the food and location.
author: Tracy C.

description: We're from the East Coast, so we had to try this place in 12/2017 given it's incredibly loyal following. To each their own, I guess. The line was long, and the burgers were nothing to write home about. I'm not sure what others find so uniquely delicious about these burgers. I've had tastier burgers at Red Robin. The patties were small and not flavorful. The fries were also somewhat soggy. Maybe other locations are better, but In N Out didn't win us over this day. Not that it matters, as they have a loyal following.
author: F S.

description:
Coming here is like a west coast staple, a right of passage!
How I wish we had this place on the east coast! No matter how I try to DIY animal style fries it's just not the same!
Quick service burger joint. I ordered a cheeseburger and animal style fries. French fries with cheese onions & thousand island dressing. You have to eat it with a fork it's so messy but so delicious!
This location is pretty small so finding a seat can be really tough!
author: Phylicia K.

description: I always wonder if there are differences for in-and-out burger from Texas and California. I can say that they were similar and there wasn't a big difference that I noticed. Love the animal-style burgers! This location was very busy, but the staff works very fast .
author: Anke P.

description:
So...a few of my friends told me I apparently "HAD" to try this fast food place, so I went. It sure didn't disappoint! Search up the secret menu and just order off of that.

Burgers: I got it animal style with extra everything (I always get ALL the toppings possible); very fresh and flavorful! 

Fries: animal style is interesting but a bit too heavy, But WOW, you can get them well done, and it tastes really crispy and potatoey! You can SEE them cutting the potatoes in the back using machines...so no frozen McDonald's fries here!

Super long line ups, but then again I went to the Fisherman Wharf location. Worth it!
Also, get a Neapolitan milkshake...it has all three flavors in it! 

I actually ate this I think a total of 3 times in one week...LOL
author: Amelia J.

description: I think the burger looks better than what it taste like. I really feel there are better burger chains out there. I couldn't wait to get to the west Coast and try it. Sadly, I was disappointed. The fries tasted like they were fried twice and the burger tasted like nothing! I wouldn't go here again.
author: Cristely U.

description: I advise everyone to stay away please I am sitting here at 3:50 AM with my whole family having a throw up party.. we are all miserable after that meal destroyed my whole trip It won't stop!! We might have got food poisoning!!! Should've run away when we seen how unclean the kitchen was!! Just to be clear the only reason I gave this place a one star is because i had to.. don't let there long lines for you
author: S H.

description:
We arrived hungry, at Fisherman's Warf in San Francisco and parked within site of the IN-N-OUT Burger. The place was crowded to the door with customers and the food looked and smelled good. We passed on their signature double double and order two of the $7.10 single cheeseburger meals which come with homemade French fries and a fountain drink. The burger was just a plain small Patty the cheese was nothing special, there was plenty of lettuce, tomato and onion topping. The bun is where it got especially disappointing. It was just a plain, dry, Wonderbread bun. Not a pretzel roll, not a ciabatta roll, just a boring stale bread bun that crumbled everywhere it wasn't soggy. 

Very sad. I think I can get better food and value at so many other burger joints.
author: Rich C.

description:
+.5 for service

No trip to California is complete without an In-N-Out Burger stop. It's just something you have to do when you're here, whether you like burgers or not. Unfortunately this is the only In-N-Out in San Francisco, so not surprisingly it's busy from open to close.

I was a bit smarter this time around, since I didn't know about the secret menu the first time when I went to In-N-Out in LA. I went with the double double animal style, in addition to animal style fries. You won't see this listed on the menu in the store, so it is something you have to find online!

There may be a lot of people there at the best of times, but the orders do come out quite efficiently. I only had to wait 10-15 minutes for my order, which is more than what I can ask for given the demand. As for the burger, it's easily one of the best I've ever had. Very cheap too! I also agree that animal style is better than the original; you get a lot more flavour with it too. The fries were also well done, and the animal style coating definitely made the fries tastier too.

Service was excellent in terms of speed, efficiency, and the fact there's always someone walking by to make sure the dining area is kept clean and everyone's satisfied with their meals. It may be the only In-N-Out joint in SF, but it does its job very well in attracting locals and tourists alike.
author: Calvin S.

description: Good, quick food. Not aaaaaaamazing like everyone hypes it up to be, but it's definitely better than a burger from McDonald's or Burger King. Im giving this location 3 starts because the bathroom is located outside in a super sketchy, secluded area completely away from the restaurant that requires a code.
author: Victoria C.

description:
Best thing in one life is having a double&double burger at In-n-out at night, that beef smells very meaty, every bite is satisfying. 
A burger with a cup of coke is necessary. But fries today makes me confused, it looks very great but tasteless.
author: Luoyi H.

description:
Everybody raves about in-n-out burgers so we had to stop there to see what all the fuss was about. The staff at blazing saddles bike rentals (A few blocks away) recommended asking for something from the secret menu - something to do with animals. 

I didn't eat anything but my bf did. My review is more based on the atmosphere - we had to wait about 30 minutes for the food (probably because the burger was from the secret menu) and the place was packed to the brim. Additionally, they do not have a bathroom in the location so you have to go to the nearby subway and ask for a code to the public bathroom.

According to my bf, the food was just okay - nothing spectacular. There are tons of other places to eat in San Fran - if you are visiting we would recommend skipping this place.
author: Camille H.

description: I consider myself a burger connoisseur who is willing to try any and every burger joint. I had never been to In-N-Out but always heard the stories of how remarkable the burger is from there. My first day in San Fran, I decided to hit it up for lunch and was extremely underwhelmed. Is the burger decent? Yes, but nothing to brag home about. Maybe it's the location and other locations less touristy are better, but I think it's a one and done for me with In-N-Out. If you're looking for a burger place in SF, I'd recommend Burger Shack or Super Duper Burgers. Both are much better places, in my opinion.
author: Matthew L.

description:
I refrain from red meat for health reasons but I do have to live a little. When I do, I like to maximize my opportunity. So off we go.

Workers were enthusiastic and welcoming. I ordered the 4x4 (4 patties, 4 cheese slices) and my friend ordered the protein style burger (lettuce replaces the buns).

Fresh buns. Real meat patties. Food is made to order.
Food arrived hot. Food was tasty. Tried the fries animal style (cheese, onions, special sauce) and loved it.

Not necessary for enjoyment, but there is a secret menu. You can Google the various combinations and alterations available.

Praise for this chain on social media is pretty consistent. And it is well-deserved.

In the fast food space, I would say this is as good as it gets.
author: Jaqen H.

description:
I liked it, I'm not a massive burger n fries man, but this was the best 'to go' burger I've had probably anywhere.

Menu is super simple. I liked that, I had a 'double double' and the only decision I had to make was onion or no (none obvs..who has onion in a cheeseburger?) 

Fries were excellent, I mean it's burger and fries so it can't lay claim in my heart to 4/5 stars but it was ::whispers:: better than shake shack.
author: John B.

description:
There's hardly anything bad to say about In-N-Out Burger. This place is legendary. I live on the East Coast, so for me, this is a real treat. If you live somewhere where you can get In-N-Out on a regular basis, you may feel differently. 

There's not much I can write that hasn't already been written about this place. Practically everyone knows about the secret menu. If you don't, Google it. 

This particular location was crowded. I recommend hitting this place during a down time. When we arrived and ordered, we were ticket #86, and they were only calling ticket #19. Yeah, it was that crowded and is really the only reason I didn't give it 5 stars. That many people in one place really does negatively impact your dining experience. 

But outside of that, it was phenomenal as always!
author: Jeremy F.

description: Didn't care for this particular In and Out. Hot, dirty and uncomfortable inside. Flies everywhere and dirty tables. The food was good but didn't have that fresh and robust delicious flavor I've come to expect from the chain.
author: Wally B.

description: Amazing service!!! The line was completely out the door when we arrived and it only took maybe 20 minutes to get our food even though we ordered meals for 5 people. Also had a very sweet server named Dino come outside to check on us and to bring us anything we needed! I've only had good experiences with this location and I plan on coming back.
author: Kyliee E.

description:
I guess this is the reason why I can never lose any weight! I love In & Out! I always get the double double animal style, but after a lot of research I found a new love!

4x4 ANIMAL STYLE WITH GRILLED AND WHOLE ONIONS!!

In & Out Fries, but HOLD the salt, I'm on a diet! Lol!!

Try it before you judge me! I do make a deal with myself though. If I do decide to order a 4x4, I have to burn at least 1000 calories on the stairclimber or run at least 15 miles in the next 24 hours.

Burgers are never dry! So flavorful and moist! Cheese is super cheesy! Maybe because there are 4 slices. And the produce is always fresh! 

I don't usually review chain restaurants or fast food joints, however this place has the nicest staff!! It's always very crowded because this In & Out is located in a tourist area in San Francisco. I'm not sure
how these people stay so positive! I would be throwing meat patties and cheeses everywhere especially in my mouth! Also, they don't judge you when you order a 4x4! They're excellent!
author: Darlene M.

description:
One word: Yes.
Got the dbl dbl and well done fries. Crispy and yet so soft... The burger buns are toasted and the sauce... the price point for In-N-Out makes it even more worth it and should be your GO-TO fast burger joint.
author: Eden W.

description:
This is probably THE busiest one I've been to. It's located on the wharf so it's full of tourists. The line was long when we got there but it moved quickly. The staff was fairly nice, for working under a lot of stress due to the crazy customers, and pretty accommodating. There was no where to sit, let alone stand, while we waited for our food. 
If you're in a pretty big hurry or hate waiting, this isn't the In-N-Out for you. This location would honestly be way better if it was bigger.
author: Rebecca R.

description: The staff was so friendly, they checked on us often and even gave us recommendations on attractions to visit in the area. The burgers were fresh and delicious and the fries were amazing. Would recommend!
author: Ivy M.

description:
As the only In-N-Out in San Francisco, along with being located in the tourist hot spot of Fisherman's Wharf, this place is incredible if you can brave the lines and the wait.

Nothing much to say about the food--if you've had In-N-Out, you know exactly what you're getting. And if you haven't, what have you been doing all your life??

The place isn't large and seating will most certainly be tight. Luckily, there are outdoor tables and even the indoor spaces turn around relatively quickly. Parking can be pretty tough, there is no free street parking within a several block radius. The workers turn orders out at an impressive wait, so even if your number is 30+ what they're currently calling, you shouldn't have to wait more than 15-20 minutes :)
author: Tim X.

description: I love going to In and Out.  because they have really good burgers. I usually get a large burger with tomato, lettuce and fries (I especially requests nothing else). They were always done to perfection, very crispy every time. The midnight is quite easy and everybody keeps you wanting more. They're definitely better than the other fast-food chains in the area. It is quite unfortunate and how expensive it will get here can get however and for that reason only I have one said how often I have been to In and Out. I do recommend that you check them out.
author: Abel K.

description:
I have been away for 8 long years... so of course I am going to eat here every chance I get. Much to my wife's rolling of the eyes, we "ended up by here" a lot during the late night before going to our hotel. Busy location...fun people watching. It was fun to watch the one homeless lad with the little dreads come in, sit down, get chased off, and start all over again.You had to be there... hell, maybe you were because it was always damn crowded.

The Double Double is my protein bomb. Culinary orgasms abound...
author: Captain C. Branagain G.

description: I never thought I'd say I'd see the day that I give In-N-Out Burger just 1 star, but this is that day.  I normally LOVE In-N-Out and it's a must-eat whenever I visit California (Southern California, mainly).  I was excited to try the In-N-Out location in SF when we visited SF in May 2017.  Alas, I was extremely disappointed.  We ordered 2 burgers and fries and were excited to eat it, until we saw the person behind the counter wipe her nose with her fingers and literally TOUCH OUR BURGERS!!!!! EWWWWWWW.  We had already paid for the burgers at that point, and since they are not that expensive, we simply threw them away and went elsewhere to eat.  I was so horrified and disgusted. I've been to In-N-Out since then (most recently in December 2017 when I visited LA for the holidays), but that experience was just awful.  I would never return to this In-N-Out location again.  What a disappointment.  And so disgusting.  Please train your staff to have better hygiene!
author: Pegah Y.

description:
Took a 20-minute Uber from my office just to eat here for lunch. It was so worth it! The line is pretty long but it goes really quick! The workers are nice and patient. We ate outside since there was no seating for a large group indoors. A worker was cleaning outside and asked if we needed anything- more water, ketchup, napkin. I thought that was so nice of him especially since we weren't inside their facility. 

As always, you can never go wrong with In-N-Out :D
author: Annie N.

description: Ordered 2 cheeseburgers with onions. One grilled and one regular. Hot and fresh crispy fries with cheese on top. Delicious! Always the same.
author: Vanessa G.

description:
Worst In N Out I've ever been to. The cashier gave attitude, the place was packed and smelled, all of which would be forgiveable if the food was the quality that I expect from In N Out. Unfortunately my burger was sloppily made and fell apart before my first bite. The normal fries that I got (not animal style) was soggy and luke warm. 

Ugh what an waste of time. We waited over 35 minutes for our food.
author: Ming Y.

description:
This was definitely a surprise to see after we were walking around fisherman's wharf. The place is packed and finding a seat is difficult but not impossible. I mean, most people just eat and leave anyways. It's not a fancy restaurant to sit around and chat.

Burgers aren't really special but the price you pay is spot on. The meat patty is actually thin. You don't get a lot of it. The burger comes with tomatoes,lettuce and some sauce and tastes okay. I am not a fan of their fries. Too think and not as soft as I like. 
However, there are some areas where this is better than most fast food joints. Service is surprisingly good considering how busy they are. And you get hot peppers along with the ketchup if you want. It's just okay for the quality of the food but when you put it alongside other burger places it's more like 4 stars. In any case, if you're hungry and don't want to spend a tiny fortune, this is the place to go!
author: Stanimir C.

description: Arrived from the east coast and one of our first stops was to the In N Out in Fishermans Wharf. The location was crowded but the line moved relatively quickly. A decent amount of indoor seating is available, but fills up quickly with people who haven't even placed an order yet - however, there are outdoor seats around the corner in the square if the weather is nice. The wait for the food was reasonable. We each got a double double and shared animal style fries. The burgers were good and met our expectations. The fries did not. The fries themselves were cold, and the cheese on the fries was cold and hardened by the time they were served to us.  The burger was good, but I've had better fast food meals elsewhere. Nice to try once, but didn't go back our week plus out west.
author: Nick C.

description: Best fast food burger. I got the protein burger from their "secret" menu. It didn't taste processed. It hit the spot for a snack!
author: Angela R.

description:
I love In-N-Out so that's about that. This review is actually for the staff and crew of In-N-Out. I'm still dining at this location alone. The staff are hard working. Working at a fast food restaurant is not easy but definitely hands down to these kids working on a Friday night. Shout out to Joseph and Johan. These two were working so hard. Just loved their hard work so that's why I'm giving them a shout out.

Love this place:)
author: Jennifer B.

description: I've had In-N-Out before like five times and idk why those five times were equal nasty as hell as the first but here they make the food normal it's not a sloppy mess maybe it was me those times or those restaurants stay away from Santa Barbra it'll make you sick I recommend this I-N-Out cause they made up for the other bad times this one specifically is the best in California!!!!! 5 stars for sure!!!!
author: Rolin S.

description: Good. Burger tastes good and fries are still crispy. Location is good but far too popular. Best burger place in San Francisco!
author: Ziyue M.

description:
The burger is amazing! I got a cheeseburger with a lettuce wrap, and animal style fries. Both of them were really good for a fast food chain.

It can't be compared with burger shops, but with fast food restaurants. This is better than pretty much all fast food burgers I've had.

My only problem is the service is a little lacking. I went during a time of low customer volume, but they ran out of forks. The server said he'll get me some, but he never did and I had to ask a second time. The second time also took a while because he decided to have a chat with his co-workers.
author: Alton L.

description: My second time having In-N-Out ever! The animal style double double was delicious. I like that they put it in a little pouch so it doesn't drip everywhere. The fries are good enough to rival McDonalds and the shake is just out of this world. Super busy location, but the line moves fast.
author: Pallabi G.

description: I love in n out but this location is 4/5 it's just always so so rammed... so if you need to get your burger on maybe try another location in the Bay Area... if not possible and willingly to queue for 30/40 minutes... it might be worth it! Great burger with fresh salad and those double fried fries yum...
author: Reg B.

description: It's okay. I got number 3, the burger was good, but the fries weren't even crunchy. They were mushy
author: Maggie C.

description:
Can you say overrated?

Being from the East Coast, I've only heard about this mystical place called In-N-Out, where the burgers are seemingly made by God himself.

No. This place is overrated. Period. It doesn't matter what anyone else says. When I was chewing my Double Double, I closed my eyes and could have sworn I was eating a Burger King burger.

The only people who think In-N-Out is the second coming are people who grew up in this area and is the only burger they've had. One bite of a Bareburger burger, or heck even a Five Guys burger, and you'll forget this place existed.
author: Kevin F.

description: Disappointed by the madhouse touristy place for the wonderful chain I've had otherwise stellar experiences in. I thought it would be worth the wait and chaos.  But the food failed me today.  The fries were not only crinkly like olde, but they were dry and overcooked; the burger did seem correctly put together as I ordered, but not with zip in the flavor.  Maybe I was just drained by the crowd, but not planning to visit this location (or any other chaotic touristy location for In-N-Out) again.
author: Melissa W.

description: Great food and timely service. No bathrooms in this restaurant for some reason, and the demand for seating tables is unorganized. Still, can't best burgers on the waterfront. Shake Shack is going to profit so much once they open up in the Bay area.
author: J L.

description: Solid burger, no complaints. Shakes aren't as good as Shake Shack's (yes, I'm from the east coast), but animal style fries are fun. Try grilled onions instead to change things up!
author: Kevin N.

description:
I would rate In-N-Out two and a half stars.

This burger spot was packed. The cashiers moved really quickly, so there was no line. However, there was a huge group of people waiting for their orders and looking for seating. If the weather is nice, then I'd recommend ordering to go.

We had a cheeseburger with animal style fries. I would not recommend the fries. They were soft and flimsy. The cheeseburger was good compared to a fast food burger from the 90s; nowadays, there are so many burger joints offering higher quality bites with quick service.
author: Joseph T.

description: it's packed in there cause it's near a tourist area but it turns over very fast. don't be scared to get their delicious burgers! then after that go get some non-fast food burgers in the area to compare :)
author: James E.

description:
Greatest letdown in history! Yeah....I said it!

East coasters always hear about the epic, life-changing in&out burger, claimed to put all others to shame. Fans herald the tasty simplicity of the burger as a tribute to days long gone. Really? Were burgers once made from recycled tires?

Entered this frenzied location, bursting with fellow tourists also seemingly eager to settle the debate. The location is too small to be located in Fishermans Wharf, a major San Francisco attraction. Staff were nice and bubbly. Ordered and waited. Found a seat with a cool couple traveling from Canada. (Only option to sit & eat was to share a table. Crowded). 

First thing I noticed were the cheap buns used. Also, the fries looked dry and pale. Didn't panic. All of the voices of praise played in my head. After the 3rd bite, nearly slammed it back on my tray. The burger was nothing. NOTHING. Indetectable seasoning or flavor. Barely juicy. Even the globs of cheese didn't help. And the fries? Cardboard!  No salt. No crisp. No taste. Nothing.

At one point, the couple and I locked eyes and our thoughts beautifully meshed: "This is sh*t".

First time I didn't finish a burger & fries meal. Called up a devotee of the In & Out cult: "Bu...Bu...Animal Style! You had to get Animal Style!" No. The burger & fries should be able to stand on its on without the addition of a clandestine menu option. A rare 2 star review for me. I always try to be constructive. The meal was cheap. There.

I was "in and out" of there for good.
author: Siana C.

description: In and Out has become my new favorite place to grab a burger when I am in a mood for it. The prices are a bit extravagant especially since whatever you add to your order the bill that tends to be more expensive. This is very disappointing as their burgers are really good. Unlike other similar places, In and Out only sells fresh food. However, if you are on a budget and this place is definitely not for you - Taco Bell or Jack in the Box would likely be a better alternative. The only issue I have is that the pricing is a little whack but other than that I can only say great things about this place.
author: Doris L.

description:
You can never go wrong with a burger and fries from in n out! 

There arent many options on the menu, but my go to is always the cheeseburger with pickles and fries. 

This location is almost always busy due to tourists, but what in n out isnt busy? :)
author: Claire W.

description:
Had to get this one way or another on trip of ours in San Fran. Originally we wanted to get it as soon as we landed but then decided it can wait. Instead we got it two hours before our flight takes off. 

In-N-Out is a good burger joint. Menu is very simple. The burgers are good. However are these to die for no. Shake shack or In-N-Out perhaps I'm NYC bias but I love Shack Shack. It's sooo yummy and I love the variation better. The service was great, very friendly staff and helpful folks. 

The animal style fries were yummy and definitely brought a little more flavor to In-N-Out so I will give them that much.

Would I recommend this to my friends? Yes! It's a must-try but you'll be fine if you don't.
author: Yuena L.

description: I was staying in downtown San Francisco on business from New York and given that we don't have it on the East Coast, In-And-Out Burger was on the "to-do" list. I searched for nearby locations and saw that there was one in the Fisherman's Wharf area. I knew how touristy Fisherman's Wharf area was and that this place would be very crowded but decided to go anyway. I went after the workday at about 5:30-6 PM and though the line extended to the door, it moved very fast. We were up to the registers in about 5-10 minutes. We ordered 4 meals (burgers, fries and a drink for about $8-9 per meal) and were immediately given cups for our fountain drinks. There is limited seating there especially given the crowd. The good thing is that eating doesn't take too long so there is a stream of people coming and going. While we were on line to order, we were able to get a seat. We waited for about 15 minutes or so and then our number was called. We navigated through the busy food waiting area and got our food. There is the fountain drink machine there as well as a condiment area with ketchup, mustard, straws and napkins. The burger was good. I would say better than McDonalds and Burger King, but not as good as Shake Shack or Five Guys. I was glad I was able to try it, but I am not sure I would return as there are better options out there. All staff members we encountered were very nice and helpful during our visit, which you don't often find in fast food places.
author: Jason P.

description:
This is probably the busiest fast food place I have been to. Finding it wasn't hard, because it had a massive In-N-Out burger sign with it's iconic red and yellow colours. When we got there, the lineup was OUT THE DOOR. We stood in line for about 15 minutes and another 10-15 minutes to wait for our order. 

Looking at the kitchen, I thought that this was the most efficient fast food restaurant I have ever been to, but yet, we had to wait so long for our order, proving that there are actually A LOT of orders. Seeing the menu, there weren't too many options and they were standard burger options, for instance, hamburger, double burger, triple burger, cheeseburger. There were also drink options such as pop, or milkshakes including vanilla, strawberry or chocolate flavours.

While waiting for our order, there was an employee who walked around to the booths (which were booth with hungry people who stared like wolves at those who were sitting down and ready to jump into the seats when they left) and was handing out condiments and In-N-Out paper hats. 

We got our meal, I personally didn't think the burger was anything special, in addition, it was so big that I couldn't bite into it and the sauce kept spilling all over the place. I think they messed up a little on the milkshake as well because the milkshake was undrinkable due to the amount of ice in it. 

Cool try, cause In-N-Out Burger is only available in San Fran, but I'm not a HUGE fan of it.
author: Kristy N.

description: A decade ago, I'd to come here frequently. The line would almost go round the block! Good thing I came solo! I would usually get a chocolate milkshake to quench my thirst. Is it worth the trip to get over there nowadays? No.
author: Julio B.

description: Bomb food.  Best fast food burger I've ever had. Fries are on point to and the secret menus get you by when you want a twist. Always fresh and available on demand. Staff are quick and get the order right every time.
author: Nickolii Y.

description: This place was so packed it was unreal. The group I arrived with ordered about 15 double doubles and they were ready within 10 minutes. Worth the trip if you're a tourist. Still worth the trip if you're claustrophobic.
author: Will M.

description: Five stars for a fast food spot?  Really? Yes!  This is my favorite fast food burger--and one of my favorites, period!  Always get the double double with the fries animal style.  I recommend wishing the fries were crispier to ask for them "well done"--that always does the trick!   Fresh, fast and delicious!
author: Dan C.

description: This was the first place and first time I had in n out, although that was a couple years ago they were very good and time efficient, the fries weren't over burnt and the burger thoroughly cooked.
author: Veranda H.

description:
Great the first time, okay the second. Seeing the In-N-Out sign the first time was like being a kid in a candy shop. And taking that first bite from a double double was like losing my burger virginity and reaching enlightenment. And then I tried the fries and tarnished my experience. 

Their fries are terrible. Might as well go to BK or McD beforehand to get an order of fries. 

Then I tried the fries well done animal style and still wasn't convinced they were any good to get. 

The regular cheeseburger, one patty with animal sauce doesn't compare to the double double either. 

I just recommend the double double with grilled onions (whole or chopped if you dig it) and a small drink if you're thirsty.
author: Nancy H.

description:
Location sucks because it's so far removed from the rest of sf.

But hey, it's in n out so it's worth the trek right? :p The wait is pretty long but you do what you gotta do. I always order the animal style cheeseburger and fries. I also like getting the neopolitan shake.
author: Alicia L.

description: In Oregon, we don't have In-N-Out Burger, so I was very excited to try it and see what all the hype is about. Disappointed to say that they fell way short of my expectations. The restaurant was so crowded, I barely had room to breath, people were nearly fighting each other over getting a table. There was also food, wrappers, and napkins all over the floors and tables (which I guess I understand because they were very busy). Once we got our food, it was just more disappointment, my burger was practically burnt and the fries were just straight up bad. For as much hype as In-N-Out gets, it should be like heaven on a bun. Talk about overrated
author: Logan L.

description: What's not to like about in and out? It's as quintessential California As It Gets. If it's your first time enjoy it and Splurge for the double double animal style. If you're really hungry try a 4 x 4. Fry's can be hit-or-miss - sometimes raw, sometimes burnt, sometimes a little stale and cold, but once in awhile... Once in every great while they'll be almost as good as McDonald's fries. Almost...
author: Jeff M.

description: Visiting home after spent time in the east coast. I do have mad craving for in and out. This is the king of all fast food burgers in my book. A Double Double with fries always hits the spot for this homesick boy.
author: David Dat T.

description:
If only there were more In-N-Out's in the city..

This location is pretty far and removed from most of SF and right smack in the middle of tourist town at Fishermans Wharf, aka local's hell. Unless you're in North Beach or something, it's pretty inconvenient to make it out here. And then of course, being in tourist central, the wait here is probably 10x the wait at any other In-N-Out location (docking a star for that)

BUT since In-N-Out supply is short in SF, I would still take that wait for one of those delicious burgers. It's honestly not too bad, maybe 5 minutes to order food + 20 minutes waiting for food around lunchtime on a weekday, especially given how long people wait for brunch and food in general in SF. The burgers and fries here are just like any other location. Same cheap price, freshly made and so yummy.

If you're not from California and haven't had In-N-Out before, you MUST try it. Sure, it's fast food so don't expect anything fancy, but trust me, it's good!
author: Jessie L.

description:
Oh - my - gawd. As a Canadian, it was my first time trying In-N-Out and I loved it. 

No frills, not complicated restaurant and menu. The few options they have they do it well. 

I went for the cheeseburger and fries. Both were loaded with flavor, had a great portion size and you couldn't beat the price. 

The staff was surprisingly nice for a fast food joint. Smiley and very pleasant. Our order came in pretty fast as well. 

Special mention to the cleanliness of the place too.
author: Bruno G.

description:
Pros:
-Cheap & tasty!

Cons:
-Lines! 

--
Hamburger
Tasty! The sauce didn't taste that good to me on its own (kind of sweet), but altogether it's a nice bite!
author: Laura D.

description: What happens when you take a great restaurant and put it in the middle of one of the most popular tourist spots?  Super long lines, a long wait, and very limited seating.  I would only recommend this location during non peak eating hours.  And ... homeless people were eating left over food out of the trash cans.  Maybe they should set up a special area you can dump your leftovers for the homeless to munch on.
author: Mike C.

description:
What's a trip to the west coast if one doesn't grab some In-N-Out? I love going to this fast food joint. The food is always fresh and delicious! Pricing is good as well. 

Reason why this place doesn't get 5 stars is the cleanliness. I think it needs to work on it. I realize that restaurants like this get a lot of traffic but it does need to put in more effort.
author: Quynh P.

description:
I orderd one cheese burger. 
It was a little bit solty.
author: Yejee L.

description:
Let me prefix this review by stating that we walked 8km to get to In-N-Out burger and we definitely weren't 'in and out'. It was an unusually hot day in San Fran and we decided, after a workout, we should go and pile on the calories at In-n-Out. This branch is literally at the end of Fisherman's Wharf and it's a fair walk from Pier 39 so don't be fooled like we were.

When we visited this branch was jam packed, there was a queue to order, a queue to get drinks, a queue to get condiments and of course a queue to collect food. If you haven't been before, be prepared to wait and be patient. Eventually we found a seat outside and when our food was ready it was underwhelming. The burger was just OK, the fries were grim and the seating we managed to get was engulfed by angry pigeons as soon as we sat down. 

If I were you I would avoid In-N-Out at Fisherman's Wharf - it's just too busy and you lose whole 'fast food' experience.
author: Stevie M.

description: Good, but not great. Kinda overrated. Reminds of Culver's butter burgers. Fries are kind of steal tasting, it's because they don't blanch their fries.
author: Nathan D.

description:
It's an In-N-Out, so of course, it's solid! However, this location just isn't as good as others. Here's why...

This is a prime tourist area, so it's really convenient for tourists, but it's less convenient for locals. Parking is tough in this area and it's not in an area locals frequent, so I'd say the clientele is definitely mostly tourists which is cool; I'm happy they get to try our famous In-N-Out. In fact, if I'm at this In-N-Out, it's probably because I'm taking an out-of-state/country visitor here. It's a must-eat and a tasty bargain!

As per my suggestion, it's no secret, but order your cheeseburger "animal-style" for extra sauce, pickles, a mustard-grilled patty and grilled onions. I like to order mine with raw onions as well. When I'm being good, I will order mine protein-style, which is wrapped in lettuce instead of buns and I skip the tasty special sauce and just have mustard. Yum! Still tasty!

Despite the food being good, the reason I'm waffling between 3 and 4 stars is because they have very limited seating for how especially crowded it is. It needs an upstairs seating area or some sort of expanded dining area. 

Also, there's no bathroom here. There's a communal bathroom outside that's shared by the businesses in the area and it's nasty! It's always so dirty in there. Come on! How can a restaurant not have bathroom facilities? This is a high-traffic business; they can afford clean toilet facilities.

So, sorry...3 stars it is because the experience here just isn't as good as at other locations. Plus my burger bun was a little burnt on my last visit.
author: Rebecca G.

description:
This is my favourite burger IN THE WORLD. It's fast food and delicious, and very reasonably priced. In fact it's too cheap, I would eat this over a $30 gourmet burger anyday. The lineups tell the story, it's still about a 20 minute wait but there's a reason why everyone comes here. Get the fries animal style (sort of like a Big Mac sauce) 

This location is unique because you can bring your trays outside and sit in their back courtyard for lunch. As well as it's in Fisherman's Wharf so you can walk around and check out the piers after lunch. This is a staple on my west coast trips, must eat multiple times and this time was no different.
author: Kenneth T.

description: As per tradition, most tourists must go to In-N-Out while in California (or some other state that has them).  Because I was a tourist, I, well, had to go because my family believes in the cliché.  Anyway, when I walked inside, the place was PACKED!  I'm not exaggerating.  There's a sign in there that says that there's apparently a maximum 63 capacity, but based on what I saw, there were way more.  I had a hard time getting a table, so some of us had to stand.  Plus, some of the tables looked dirty.  There goes a star.  I got a plain double double with cheese and a side of fries.  Here in Canada, a double double is a coffee, not a burger.  The burger itself was really hot and was very tasty.  It had a nice flavour with a perfect amount of cheese.  The fries were also piping hot.  They were good, but not as good as McDonald's fries.  If you're a tourist, check it out.  It's a very California thing.  If you're a local, go somewhere else unless you really want to go here.
author: Ethan W.

description:
The first thing we did after checking into our hotel at Fisherman's Wharf to walk around to see where we would be eating for the next couple of days.  I was excited to see an In-N-Out Burger so close to our hotel.  It was settled that it would be our first dinner in San Francisco.

The first thing we noticed when we arrived there for dinner was that it was packed!  We were standing in line waiting to order, when I saw a table empty and I was able to grab a little two top.  We didn't know anything about ordering off the menu, so we just got a regular cheeseburger and regular fries.  No animal style for us.

Everything was good.  The burgers were a nice size, hot and juicy, with plenty of cheese.  The fries were pretty standard.  I'm glad that I finally got to try an In-N-Out burger, just so that I can say I had one.  I didn't think they were anything amazing, but they good.
author: Pam G.

description: My first In N Out Burger - this place was great. Super clean. Hamburger toppings were really fresh.
author: Kathy E.

description: Heck yesses! Do I really need to convince you to try it out? They are the best tasting fast-food burgers around! Animal style is the way to go. I wish they had a restaurant in Chicago.
author: Rod C.

description:
Travelling from Canada and having been to Shake Shack in the East coast, trying In-N-Out was the number one thing on my list of to-dos. Majority of my friends said that In-N-Out was better than Shake Shack, plus the Instagram photos I always see makes this place so hard to resist!!

I came on a rainy day and this place was so packed! There wasn't actually a line up to order the food, but the line could go out the door just for the food. I ordered the regular cheeseburger along with their famous animal style fries. I do have to say the food is a lot cheaper than Shake Shack. I waited approximately 20 minutes for my food and was lucky enough to get a seat at the joint.

I first tried the animal style fries so they don't all quickly clump together, and I honestly wasn't a huge fan of it! It's weird because I love the cheese fries at SS, but the cheese sauce here wasn't warm and tasted really processed. I found that there was barely any flavour in it, and the grilled onions didn't help too much. Overall, I felt that it was just chewy and it wasn't my favourite.

I was surprised at how big the burger was considering it's price. I felt that it was a simple cheeseburger that had a nice presentation. Maybe I should've tried something else because I had the Shroom Burger at SS and absolutely loved it. So, I can't really compare the two stores on their basic hamburger.
author: Joy P.

description:
Ok, I finally did it. I had an In-N-Out Burger. After my partner begging me to get to this place, I finally caved and decided to join the hoard of people in the Fishermans Wharf location. Man..... the line was soooo long. Out the door and around the corner. I know that this is a popular tourist destination, but please.... It was a weekday just before 12pm. 

So, when you tell your mates you are going to California, they tell you get to a In-N-Out. Just do it, they say. Your mouth will thank you later, they say. 

The menu is actually quite small here. But, we found out there there are all sorts of secret menu additions to tell the staff to change your order. I really love that idea. It has definitely created a cult following. I was told that you have to order an Hamburger "animal style". This means you will get lettuce, tomato, a mustard cooked beef patty; add pickle, extra spread with grilled onions. I ordered that with fries and an iced tea. 

We had to wait around just over 10 minutes for the burgers. Which is not too bad considering the flock of orders. It's cool to see them processing fresh potatoes through the machine to make super fresh real fries. The taste really reflected that. They were crispy and so much more tasty than other fast food joints. 

The burger itself was a little of a let down though. Although it was one of the freshest fast food burgers I have had, it wasn't at all that special in flavour. Nothing too complicated or gourmet about it. Just a solid burger that aims to please the masses. The patty was flat and not particularly interesting. The bun was like any other fast food joint. 

I would much rather go here than McDonalds or Burger King for sure. But, I think that burgers at pubs or gourmet burger restaurants around SF are a lot more interesting. It was a-ok and I am glad I have crossed it from my list. But, I probably will not return when I go back to SF.
author: Anita D.

description:
One of the most famous burger chain in the USA is IN-N-OUT Burger, no doubt about it. Unfortunately, they are not available on the East coast, so every time I traveled to the West coast, I wanted to go to one of their IN-N-OUT locations, but never worked out... So, when I finally got to go to one, I was super excited!

They don't have enough amount of seating, but people don't really stay long time here, so the turnover is relatively fast. you can find a seat pretty easily with short wait time, but you have to be quick about it.

Overall, I am very glad that I finally got to go to IN-N-OUT Burger, finally! And I enjoyed their food, it was simple but yet good quality and tasty. They are no longer that "quick stop" place, with so much fame and popularity, they are now "IN-N-WAIT-N-OUT."  The service was just average, nothing special there. They don't have bathroom, but there is a public bathroom right outside, where they have more eating spots with tables and chairs (you could sit out there instead, if there is no seat inside IN-N-OUT).  IN-N-OUT is certainly one of those place where you should go try at least once!
author: June S.

description:
America. The land of burgers. Seems like everywhere you go you see the repeating signs; burgers, tacos, pizza, denny's, Walmart, KFC, McDonalds etc etc. So when Anthony Bordain tells you via the TV machine that you MUST have an in 'n' out burger and that it's the quintessential west coast USA thing to eat, you save your belly for it and eat things like smoothie bowls and sushi and the occasional fish taco so that when you do get to in 'n' out you can gorge yourself on the tasty delights.

This is what I did anyway. I was hanging to try in 'n' out all trip and did so on the second to last day in the USA. We were down at Fisherman's Warf in SF after visiting Alcatraz and walked town to the in 'n' out and joined the epic line stretching out the door.

When we got to the counter the cashier was very friendly and asked what we would like. I quickly shot a glance right and then left and leant over and said in hushed tones: "I'd like two cheeseburgers animal style with fries and drinks please" thinking I was doing something awesome and special; as animal style is part of the secret menu which is only available if you know what to order because you have a smart phone and are capable of typing "in 'n' out secret menu" into google.

My partner scoped out the booths and saw that two young ladies were leaving soon and hovered over them waiting to swoop in as I waited for our order. The stars aligned perfectly and she nabbed the table literally one minute before our order was called.

We sat down with our animal style burgers (cooked with mustard, onions and cheese in the beef patty) and started tasting the burgers, but something was missing... ketchup and chilis! One of us went and grabbed those and we dug in again.

Now, the novelty was great; but here's the thing. In my town of Adelaide in Australia a couple of guys went to the USA in the 2010's and obviously saw in 'n' out and other places and brought the concept back to Australia. Good examples of this are Nordburger and Burger Theory. To be honest, I like Nordburger's patties better than in 'n' out's. In 'n' out's were a bit flat. Their buns were great, as was the lettuce and tomato and the pickled chili's were awesome; but I was a little underwhelmed. Also the fries were average, and I know that they make them fresh in store so maybe processed fries are just better tasting even though they are bad for you.

It was very good, but not the epic dining experience I was expecting. I will definitely be back and want to try the double double or normal cheeseburger, but I'm not going to be as excited as I was the first time.
author: Aaron T.

description: Double double was good! But the fries was just so so, we came here about 11:00PM, the line was fast and we didn't wait too long, like the environment here!
author: Sihao Z.

description: We live in Georgia and make a point to stop for at least one In-N-Out Burger whenever visiting the west coast.  The burgers really are fantastic- we always get the same- the double double animal style and it never disappoints!  Our fries were a bit of a let down because we asked for them extra crispy which they were not but honestly the burger was so good we didn't even care- the burger is the star of the show after all.  What made this visit particularly exceptional was the super nice and bubbly young girl who took our order- Diana was the friendliest and most welcoming employee I've ever encountered.  I hope mgmt. at this location knows how special she is- she truly made our visit especially memorable and enjoyable.  Thanks Diana for the great service- you are like a beacon of sunshine!
author: Laura W.

description:
Before I say anything else, let me preface this by saying that I'm from the east coast where in n out is not available. That being said, I have heard the hype surrounding this burger chain. Unfortunately for me, I feel that this particular chain did not live up to the expectations I had. Though the burger was great -- the meat was fresh and the fries were tasty -- I was underwhelmed.

At this particular in n out, the wait time was really quite long. I waited around 15 minutes to order and 15 minutes more before I received my food. My order was actually lost and I had to remind the cashier before I received my food, but I can't hold that against the restaurant as it was extremely crowded. Though the wait time was long, it seemed to be par for the course at fishermans wharf, so the long wait time really isn't a knock against the restaurant. 

What I was kind of disappointed about was the price, Id heard all kinds of stories about in n out's great prices, but I paid $8 for a cheeseburger meal. It wasn't expensive, but it really wasn't the value I was hoping to get. There are also so many different amazing seafood and other food options around that I felt my money could've been better spent elsewhere. 

Overall, I'd give this in n out 3.5 stars, and I would definitely want to go to in n out again, just not this one. The amazing alternatives, higher prices, and slower service at this restaurant make the other options at fishermans wharf better alternatives.
author: Kevin W.

description:
let me preface this review by saying that, generally speaking, i love in-n-out. it's my favorite fast food chain and my favorite burger. now with all that out of the way, here's why this location gets one star from me until something changes:

why on earth in-n-out's corporate people have neither expanded this location nor opened another location somewhere else in san francisco truly befuddles me. the market is here - in fact, having lived in SoCal previously, i can say that this fisherman's wharf location is consistently the busiest in-n-out i've ever been to anywhere, so it's clear the market is here and san francisco wants more. that said, the fact that this location is so perpetually busy is exactly it's problem. while i used to frequent this location regularly, i've since given up on it unless i am really jonesing for an in-n-out burger and have enough energy to deal with the always less-than-stellar experience here. most of the rest of the time, however, i'll just go to a different local chain like super duper burger or burgermeister or even one of mcdonald's newfangled create-your-taste locations as all are of good quality and, while not quite as good as in-n-out, far less of a pain in the ass to deal with than this location is and a much better overall dining experience as a result. the only time i ever see this in-n-out not totally slammed beyond capacity is around midnight. and that's it. finding a seat inside or outside any other time of day is always an endless waiting game, so by the time you actually manage to sit down and eat, your food is half cold. for me it's just not worth it anymore. in-n-out is pound for pound the most profitable fast food chain in the country so there is just zero excuse for in-n-out's corporate hq letting this location continue like this for as long as it has. they can easily afford to open up another location in SF but it seems like they don't care so long as the herd of cattle that perpetually trudges "in-n-out" of this location keeps making them money. well i, for one, am not going to give in-n-out much more of my money until they bother to expand their chain further in SF. going to eat a good burger once in a while doesn't need to be a tedious slog through an over-capacity crowd and an endless wait to just sit down and enjoy the food i just spend 30-45 minutes waiting to get in the first place. PLEASE EXPAND IN-N-OUT IN SAN FRANCISCO. this single location just isn't cutting it anymore. and i'll just support other chains locally until in-n-out cares enough to maintain mine and other locals' business.
author: Lars A.

description:
Finally.  I've got the chance to try out their burgers with all the hype of only in CA.
Waited on line for 20 min with mostly tourists.  Here's the result:  burger is not even half as good as Big Mac, or Whopper.
Fries too bland in other word " sucks"!  There's no way this joint can survive in the east coast.  Now I know why only in CA.
Also, I've noticed there's no blacks eating here.  I should've known that's a hint already!!!
author: Mike W.

description: I love In n Out and the young folks working hard here make orders fulfill quickly and nicely. The cashiers are usually polite, helpful, quick, proactive. They do their best to keep it clean considering the madness. What would help is for the caller to have a microphone so they don't have to yell (for themselves and customers). And let's bus & wipe our own tables so others can quickly sit :)
author: S L.

description: Definitely a quick spot to grab a bite. Me and my husband came to San Francisco on vacation and decided to see what the hype was all about. To be honest the burgers are just like every other burger I've had. Still very good burgers and gotta get the fries animal style definitely a must. The location is great you can walk down Fisherman's Wharf and take in all the beautiful scenery. Parking from what I observed is a bit challenging so I recommend taking a taxi or bus down to the main area it's very touristy.
author: Ty-Lin G.

description:
Stopped by multiple times. Never had my order messed up, whether I'm ordering for myself, for a couple or in a party of 10+. Even when I thought they messed it up, I was just too busy scarfing down the best burger I've ever had (each one better than the last). It may take time, especially during touristy-hours (weekend days are peak) but the workers are fairly efficient and get the food out in a fair amount of time.  

And if you need me to actually rate the damn burgers you need to get the hell off Yelp and drive, sail or fly to your nearest In-N-Out. Seriously, best damn fast food burger I've ever had. Don't forget to Animal Style (cheese/onion galore) the hell out of it! Everything is super fresh - the fries are peeled in store and fried there, the burger buns and toppings are freshly prepared, even the cow tastes like it was sacrificed to my belly the morning of. No matter what time of day it is, you can never regret an In-N-Out burger -- so get the hell to one right now and enjoy!
author: Sameer C.

description: The family was dying to go here, as we don't have this chain in south Florida. It was about 1:30 and the place was jammed packed. There was no line for ordering, but it took about 15 minutes to get your food. Drinks were self serve. All of the tables had hoverers laying dibs to the table when it became empty. It was sunny outside and we found tables outside in the back, amid nice flower planters. Was very glad to get out of the packed crowd waiting inside! My daughter ordered fries "animal style" though I didn't see that on the menu, but they were great. The fries are cut from real potatoes and everything seemed very fresh.
author: Cathy O.

description: I can tell you an in and out and I found out to be here and my hamburger and I told one of the persons that there was a hair first she told me that I can have another hamburger or can I get my money back so she was not in any kind I've been coming to this place a lawyer and this time I didn't like the service and what I found in my hamburger
author: Norma B.

description:
I don't drive much (since I prefer vacation destinations I have to fly to), so I really only encounter In-N-Out when at home in San Francisco.  And since the only location is in Fisherman's Wharf, it's really only when I'm entertaining out of town guests and don't feel like getting gouged at mediocre Seafood/Italian restaurants.  In-N-Out definitely ranks as my favorite fast food burger, but I still prefer Super Duper for a slightly pricier fast casual burger.  So it's a treat when playing tour guide, but I don't necessarily go out of my way for it.

4x4: This is just about the right size for me.  At 1/8 lb a patty, this is like a 1/2 pounder, but swimming in 4 slices of glorious American cheese.  Similar 1/2 pounder burgers at other joints never seem to have the same amount of cheesy goodness.  The veggies are a bit variable though.  Sometimes the tomatoes are ripe and juicy, but other times they are firm and bland.  Iceberg lettuce isn't that exciting and sometimes they put on too much, but removing it is easy enough.  I like asking for a toasted bun to add some texture.

Well Done Fries: The struggle is real.  Regular fries tend to be a bit limp.  Well done fries border on potato sticks.  The lesser of two evils, in my opinion, is the well done option.  Sadly, no competition for McDonald's.
author: Adam B.

description:
Writing again in praise of this establishment! Ordered a ridiculous amount of food for my graduating class and they were very cordial, organized, and efficient! They even hooked it up with hats and stickers for the graduates! 

Special shout out to Marvin and manager Sintia for their help and smiles.
author: Alicia T.

description:
Same ol' great burgers, fries and customer service, but this was definitely the most crowded In-N-Out I've ever been to. The food was great (as always), the restaurant was relatively clean (like all In-N-Outs) and the employees were friendly and very helpful, but the long line and characters in the crowd were a major turnoff. 

At every single In-N-Out I've been to, it was always very orderly, quiet and there were tables/seats readily available. However, at this location, there were numerous local rambunctious teenagers and, of course, plenty of tourists. There were multiple occasions where I saw teenagers asking for water cups and happily filling them up with soda.

Also, although my girlfriend and I got lucky with a table opening up before our food was ready, there was a constant wait for seats/tables for customers. I'm not faulting In-N-Out for all of these issues because their service and food are fantastic, but this is one location I'd probably rather not visit again to get my fill of In-N-Out's deliciousness.
author: Chris E.

description: This is such a disgusting place. This is where tourists experience in n out for the first time, and tables are dirty, floors are dirty. Food was not near expectations at all. Worst in n out I've been up too
author: Daisa N.

description: You might want to go a few times. Even the ketchup tasted better. Amazing food and it doesn't make you feel sick or heavy afterwards. The fries are to die for!!
author: Nada S.

description:
So crowded!!!   The people who work there couldn't have been any nicer and kept things running smoothly with a line that almost went out the door.  
I really don't know how they kept it all together without even a hint of frustration.  We were number #61 and it took at least 15 minutes to get our order but it came up just as ordered: a Double Double with Animal Style fries.
The added cheese, fried onions and Thousand Island dressing on the fries is unnecessary overkill but I did it anyway--so good.
author: Thomas D.

description: I've been to a couple of In-N-Out Burgers in my time so the food was good as usual. One thing that made this place stand out was one of your amazing employees. I'm not sure if any managers check this Yelp page but Diana Ng who was working the cash register was AMAZING! For being such a busy location packed with tourist she had a cheerful disposition Greeting each customer with a welcoming smile, offering onions, and free glasses of water to every customer. When we ordered we had requested our fries to be animal style, it was missed in the business, as soon as I walked back up, Diana came over and offered to add it right to our ticket (we had already been charged for it) but she was ready to help us out right away.
author: Lori-Ann D.

description:
Thanks to Glyna, for handling a very large order provided via text message with ease. She made it seem like a breeze and read it back twice to be sure. 

Gotta love the nice service!
author: Abby S.

description: Ok... we don't have this where I'm from and people always RAVE about it like it's the best burger joint in the history of the world. First of all, come to the PNW and try Burgerville, then tell me how "amazing" In-N-Out is. I will say it's certainly popular with locals and tourists alike - there was constantly a line out the door. We tried In-N-Out 5 years ago and were nowhere near impressed, but we figured we'd give it another chance. This time, I was armed with knowledge of the Not-So-Secret menu - went animal and protein style. They do a pretty decent lettuce wrap, the burger patties were flavorful albeit tiny, but the fries were cold mush. I get that they are fresh, but at least fry them to a crisp and serve them warm!! Prices were good and we had full bellies. Probably not somewhere I'll ever go again, but now I can say I've given them multiple opportunities.
author: Brandi K.

description:
This location is convenient for anyone visiting the Fisherman's Wharf area and looking for In N Out. 

My visit was pleasant and I think their burgers and fries are good fast food. However I also think that In N Out is very over hyped. I have never understood the almost cult status these restaurants have. I give a score of 3 because it is A OK but not anymore.
author: Mike M.

description:
I've been coming here for years starting in 2012 with the Friday Youth Group from the church I attend (Russian Gospel Temple) who frequent this place semi-regularly following sermons. Since then, I've visited the place sporadically from time to time sometimes with my church mates and sometimes with friends, business partners and coworkers. 

Several weeks ago, I was collaborating with a group of professional persons from a former workplace of mine on a project of theirs. They invited me to join them for dinner after the victorious completion of said project. They ordered takeout which we had off-site. I had the milkshake, fries, and double cheeseburger. The food was scrumptous and hearty. 

The subtraction of the 5th star is due to the long lines when one visits in person. I'll definitely be visiting this place again on my next spontaneous group outing and in the area with either casual friends or professional colleagues looking for a hearty simple yet delicious meal after ardous activities.
author: Richard R.

description:
Honestly what's the hype about?!???

I went here for the very first time when I visited San Francisco. I was very excited to try after all the hype. 

I think I've had better fast food. This is mediocre. The fried absolutely suck, they are crispy (more like chips, than actual fries) which I wasn't a huge fan of. I also ordered the double burger and a drink. The burger was okay-- I still think other fast food chain is better. 

Another thing that bothered me is the limited seats. I don't know how it makes sense to have a very busy restaurant in a very busy location with very few tables and chairs. I had to wait till someone left to sit down and my burger was already cold by then and the cheese solidified. 

So, I don't think this is the best fast food but it's also not the worst. Sure, give it a try and see for yourself!
author: Tanzina A.

description: So coming from the East Coast, everyone kept telling me to try In n Out's burgers. We finally had the chance to try it during our walk around Fisherman's Wharf. First off, the line to order went out of the door. Second the line to wait for your order was insane. It's a small location so trying to find seating it like people looking for parking at a mall parking lot during Christmas season! Anywho, I ordered the cheeseburger animal style and my husband ordered it with just a few toppings. In my honest opinion, it was OK. I wasn't blown away by it. It almost reminded me of Shake Shake but a greaser version of Shake Shack. It definitely filled me up, though. I still like Shake Shack better because it's not as greasy. I wasn't a fan of the fries. They were heavy and starchy. I've tried the place once so if I had a choice, I would probably try another burger joint.
author: Christine B.

description:
The only problem is that there aren't at least 4 more around the city. Classic In-N-Out perfection. Quality meat, well prepared, good service.

Only thing is that physical it could use some cleaning up.
author: Ryan B.

description: Really busy in and out lines are long 20 minutes wait otherwise same great food different location just like any other in and out you go to
author: Meishi M.

description: Such a great burger, never disappoints. I order mine protein style and always wonder why other establishments haven't adopted this practice - it's such a win, and the only "fast food" that doesn't make me feel blatantly unhealthy. I do offset that choice with some animal style fries, just because I can't resist how tasty they are. It's always busy but if you lurk long enough you'll always find a table right when you need one, so don't let that discourage you!
author: Ana M.

description: It took over twenty minutes for me to get two cheese burgers and I had to ask twice why it took so long. The burgers aren't anything special and have no flavor. McDonalds is faster, has more flavor, and right down the block.
author: Jonathan G.

description:
Review is based on wait time. Waiting a half hour takes the charm out of In-N "out" -- but the burgers (animal style) are always delicious and the fries well worth the wait. I would definitely recommend doing animal style. You would expect to feel terrible after eating any fast food, but in-N-out seems to really beat other fast food places for that reason. That - plus it's just flat out more delicious than any other fast food! Hearing the other patrons waiting - apparently this In-N-Out location is much slower than any other location. Unfortunately, it's the only one around in this area- so we bucked up and waited, and boy was it worth the wait!

Another tip - for vegetarians - you can order a grilled cheese! They will make it for you.
author: Cate T.

description:
This is probably one of the MOST busiest In-and-Outs I have ever been too, even counting the one on Sunset Boulevard in Los Angeles...because of it's prime location that it is close to the Warf. 

The couple of times that I have decided to come here (because I LOVE In-and-Out), the wait time is generally around 20-30 minutes for my burger. Parking is also hard in this area just because it is super touristy. It is good if you come with someone else that can easily spot a place to sit and isn't afraid to ask the people before they even leave the table because there are SO many people there and there are dozens of other people that are also looking for a spot to sit, which you have to snag first.
