The service is good, like there is little to no wait time to order, it's just that there is a super long wait time to actually get your food, and that it's sometimes hard to find somewhere to eat. 

Some people might think that there is a bathroom in there, but there isn't. However, there is one that isn't too far. If you go south of the In-and-Out (in the little alley way) there is a little plaza, where you can sit down and eat there if there are no seats inside, I've sat here a couple of times and there is a bathroom in the plaza as well.
author: Jean T.

description: The burgers are good, but I don't think I will purposely seek it out, even if one came around east coast. The fries...there's something a bit odd about it.  As if,  it came from powder. I dunno. Too dehydrated? I dunno.
author: Penelope M.

description:
I'm surprised I haven't rated this place after so many visits.

Pros:
It's In-N-Out, the food is usually good
Cons:
-Bathroom requires a code that none of the cashiers seem to remember if they run out of the paper slips. It's also not in the restaurant but outside
-The employees have made my Double Double Animal Style Extra Everything order wrong 9 out of 10 times. It's pretty sad how sometimes the cashiers don't know the extra everything button and/or the burger makers don't know how to make the order.
-Fries aren't the best, don't know why
-Lines are super long because it is a tourist spot
-Parking is a _ _ _ _ _
-Prices are higher than every other In-N-Out's I've been in
-Under employed? Service is REALLY slow
author: Da X.

description:
This may have been one of the most over hyped things I have ever been pushed into doing!  While the food itself was good,  tasty,  filing, etc., it was definitely not God's gift to the planet or the culinary world the way people talk about it.  In fact, it was almost identical to Wendy's.  I wonder how something like this could reach such incredible cult status, when it is no better than any fast food I have had anywhere in the nation.

More importantly,  this location is an absolute zoo!  We had to stalk a table and later had people literally standing next to us waiting for us to finish so they could grab our table.  The place was crazy packed and really not enjoyable at all.   It was easily my least favorite eating experience while we were in San Fran.
author: Mike M.

description:
I love In N Out and this place was packed. So I hear it's the only one in SF. 

Everything was quick and fresh as always. I did want well done fries and the lady looked at me like I was stupid and my fries came soggy actually. 

Everyone was friendly and hustling in the kitchen to make quick orders.
author: David H.

description:
Not much more to add beyond what has been said. I would stay away from the Animal Fries though -- they added unnecessary sogginess to the fries despite everyone recommending them.

As for your burger, besides staying away from the onions I would say look up secret menu stuff cause a lot of it is on point! Here are my favorites:

+ Three by Three (something about three patties makes the burger so much better)
+ Mustard Grilled (put mustard on the patty before it is grilled)

Oh and make sure you get a milkshake (I would lean towards chocolate but vanilla was delicious too).
author: Neechi M.

description: I really wanted to love this place. The French fries were wonderful! Right out of the oil and on my plate.... The hamburger was....a disappointment! I was expecting a nice fat juicy burger. McDonald's burgers are the same size and consistency. The lettuce, onion and tomato were nice...but these ingredients should NOT be thicker than the burger. There are much better fast food burger joints in this city. Go to Unami Burger or Marlowe. On the plus side, they are putting in a Crispy Cream donuts beside the In-and-Out store....
author: Darrin D.

description:
OH GOOD LORD this was so worth the 28 year long wait. I live on the East Coast so, ya know, sadly no In-N-Out Burgers to be found anywhere nearby. On our trip to SF this was one of my only "must visit" spots. It was busy as hell when we went, but the line moved quickly, and there was a bunch of outdoor seating away from the hustle and bustle of the restaurant itself -- much preferred to sitting inside huddled against other folks.

I won't lie, the fries... were nothing special. Not memorable in the slightest, even when ordered animal style. But the burger? Lordy. I hope you like your burgers messy, because IT'S GONNA BE (and it'll blow your mind).
author: Justine J.

description: I was disappointed with the food at this location. My cheeseburger had a pale/hard slice of tomato as well as a pale/hard piece of lettuce. The sauce was also smeared on kind of messily. My order of animal fries came out with the cheese hard and cold, the onions cold, and a disproportionately small amount of sauce on top. I give three stars because the food itself was still kind of tasty and I like In-N-Out too much. This location was also really crowded after lunchtime, but I guess it's a given that In-N-Out is always crowded.
author: Rachel K.

description: You can't go wrong with a double double.   I had been missing in n out.  It was awesome just like I remember it.
author: Charles J.

description: Good food as always but the wait and seating is a nightmare being so close to Fishermans Wharf.
author: Korey M.

description:
The only In-N-Out I've been to with visitors from around the world. On New Year's Day, this place was packed! Depending on when you're there, it may be difficult to find a seat inside, but patrons rotate out as quickly as the staff cranks out orders (which is pretty damn quick). 

Prices are 15-20% higher than your typical In-N-Out, but it's still a fantastic deal if you're looking for a quick bite on the Wharf!
author: Laura B.

description: Why is there even a In-N-Out vs Shake Shack debate? Obviously, Shake Shack is better. It's more like a luxury burger than a standard fast food burger like In-N-Out. Shake Shack has the Shack Stack - with a crisp fried portobello mushroom. It's more accurate to have a In-N-Out vs Whataburger debate - in which case Whataburger would still win hands down. The In-N-Out burger is bland and the cook on the burger itself is sub-par. The fries were good and I'll come back to try the shakes
author: Judy S.

description:
#YAAAASSS

First thing I did after landing, last thing I did before leaving to the airport.  Great food, great price, awesome staff. 

Ordered animal style burger and fries (animal style=secret menu item//bomb sauce).  I also ordered my fries "well" after reading through some Yelp comments, but I think regular fries are the way to go.  Fries done "well" are just cooked longer; this turned my fries more into potato chips.  Worth the try, but I'll be sticking to regular fries from here on out (if I'm lucky enough to get back on the West Coast!).  

Keep an eye out for hot peppers kept by the ketchup area--this adds a nice zing/crunch to ya lunch!  Also, don't forget to ask for extra spread to dip your fries in :)

TLDR: #YAAAASSS ; Animal style; extra spread
author: Michelle M.

description:
All hype. 

Fries and shake were plain bad. Burger was good and worth the price but nothing special. Prefer Shake Shack.
author: Falqsc O.

description:
This place rocks.... Busy, but fairly priced. San Francisco is HIGH priced.
Breakfast at of all places, Dennys was over $40. In-N-Out $20.00.
You choose!
author: Randy N.

description:
After I took my first bite, I looked down at my burger and said "where have you been all my life" 

Make sure your order your burger and fries "animal style" you won't regret it bubs!

With San Francisco being the 420 friendly city that they are, of course I indulged before heading into the restaurant. 

Impressed, being from the east coast, it was the best fast food I've ever had!
author: Jack A.

description:
Well I now understand why In-N-Out is such a big hit in California....we sure do have a ton of In-N-Out in Texas but they do not taste anything like California's chain of them. 

I truly appreciate In-N-Out now. Anyways this location is packed any time of day we walked by the line was out the door to order and the wait of people to get there food was in the fifties.

However, we stuck it out and waited....it was worth it. Since this location is so packed we just ordered our food to go and ran out of there straight to the park down the street and just had lunch there. 

If you chose to opt out of eating in the restaurant and chose to eat outside at the park or next to the water beware of all the birds. They aren't afraid to come and try to steal your food...almost lost my burger once or twice
author: Batul A.

description: In-N-Out... in almost 25 minutes time! About 15 minutes in queue to order and 10 minutes awaiting for it. Otherwise, the beef patties are juicy as Lucy.
author: Pheng L.

description:
When in SF this is the only In-N-Out I know how to get to. Being from Honolulu, we don't have an In-N-Out so this food stop is a requirement when traveling across the Pacific. This particular joint is in the midst of the tourist Mecca of Fisherman's Wharf. 

The most recent visit I got a single cheeseburger and fries animal style. I also shared a Neapolitan shake with the hubby. The shake was very thick. Once it melted a bit I was able to suck it. As for the food, the burgers here are yummy for fast food. The fries here are basic, kind of bland imo. That why I animal style it!
author: Angela R.

description:
Came here with my boyfriend on a Friday night and it was packed!

In addition to our cheeseburgers with grilled onions and an extra toasted bun, we ordered our fries well done and they came out regular. When you're a fan of well done fries - regular does not cut it! First, we were just going to keep the regular fries, but we couldn't.. emphasizing the fact that I love well done fries. I went back to the counter and told them we had ordered Well done. They were nice enough to replace my regular fries and make me some well done ones on the spot. OMG SO GOOD. i love the crispiness of In N Out fries well done =P. 

I also thought it was cool how one of the employees came around to ask us how our meal was and had a tray of the thousand island, ketchup, and napkins in case guests wanted more.
author: Michelle C.

description:
So this was another place that bummed me out when I visited San Francisco. EVERYONE talked about how good In N Out is, so I was super excited to try it. 

As a burger and fries lover, I was let down...a lot. I thought the space was nostalgic and the prices were inexpensive, but I felt like this place was a step up from McDonald's. A lot of hype and that was about it. I'm glad I tried it out, but this is a solid "I will never return place".
author: Dominique C.

description: If you've been to in-n-out, this one is really no different. It's super busy so be prepared to fight for somewhere to sit. Warning: NO BATHROOM!! It's in a grey location however, so it's a great place to stop if you're strolling down the wharf, pier, or ghiradelli square
author: Ashton H.

description: Whenever I'm in the Golden State, I make it a point to hit an In-N-Out Burger and have never been let down. That is, until I made the trip to the Wharf. A quick look at Yelp showed this as the closest In-N-Out to downtown San Francisco. The other great thing, was that, from Union Square, it's convenient to get to this location via cable car. So I made the trip. Maybe I've never noticed it before, but the In-N-Out fries are kind of terrible. They're shriveled and not that tasty. I order the combo to get fries and a drink, but when I went to pick up my order, the guy said I didn't order fries :sad: He asked if I wanted to buy some, and I looked at the line and said no, I'm good. Someone must've seen the disappointment in my eyes, because they brought some fries to my table for me! I really appreciated the customer service focus and humanity of at the Wharf In-N-Out. So, the establishment is on par with all the In-N-Out restaurant's I've been to, with the exception of a shared external restroom, down the alley, with a code. If you've never experienced In-N-Out, this place is worth a stop.
author: Jason F.

description:
I like In-N-Out, and I especially like my Poutine California. Understanding that this is in the middle of a tourist zoo, it can be a bit crowded and the staff can be overwhelmed. But that's not much of an excuse for the cashier giving me dagger eyes and starting the conversation with "...what do you want."

I'd prefer my food, and to either not pay or you to no longer work there.
author: James S.

description: This was my first experience with In-n-out and it was phenomenal. The food was delicious, the prices were incredibly reasonable. My only qualm was the long lines, but I can definitely overlook that. Definitely give this place a try if you're ever in the West Coast.
author: Jenny X.

description:
I passed by In-N-Out Burger while I was visiting San Francisco. Which ever location you visit, the place is always packed like crazy.

That being said, I do believe that this franchise is overrated. First of all, you can't find a shorter menu from what they have lol. Creating a good burger isn't that complex.. You need a good bun, meat looks fresh and good sauce which they clearly have them but nothing mind blowing. Also, I forgot to say that their fries are also freshly cut.

Speaking of buns.. If you don't like bread, they can wrap you burger with lettuce instead ).. Would it make it healthier? it's up to your judgment
author: Massimo G.

description:
This is a great in n out. Really nice location with great views. The turnaround time on orders is pretty quick considering this is an in n out. This location does animal style fries really well, I'm pretty sure they are putting extra cheese on them. 

Burgers are cooked to perfection and the shakes are sublime.
author: Ricky E.

description: A solid burger for an amazing price. The fries are decent, but overall can't complain. Classic 50s shake shop atmosphere, great spot if you need a quick bite to eat!
author: Rishi G.

description: This place is always packed because its the only in n out location in san francisco and its located is a tourist area. The food here is great especially there animals fries which you can't go wrong with. Also, I came here with a few friends and they loved it and there prices are pretty good.
author: Dean A.

description:
Ok call me a tourist. Call me an east coast idiot. But was I impressed by the burger for the price. I just got a cheeseburger as I was saving my tummy for a real meal. Umm delicious!! for 3 bucks?! Seriously wow. I hope there were no mcdonalds around. It felt, looked and tasted like an actually very good quality burger. 

I feel in weighing the scale on fast food restaurants, this place definitely beats out and ranks the best in its class. Maybe mcdonalds in Argentina would be tied for top too..no joke. 

I hear sometimes that east coast has shake shack...but I don't think it's fair to compare as it's a different class of burgers...it's also double the price at least...and the way they make the burger is also different. 

Either way, I was not expecting to be so impressed. No shame to admit I love in n out
author: Shushu C.

description: Love this place..a good cheap eat compared to everywhere else. I got a triple triple and it was fantastic. Good service with a smile as well. I always try to hit this place when visiting the area.
author: Kurt S.

description: Loved this place. As a kid from Chicago, it gave me all the feels of my local portillos hot dog. I enjoyed my cheeseburger and fries in San Francisco, CA. I have definitely had better fries, so next time I will get the loaded fries with the dressing on top.
author: Brendan L.

description: Classic!!! Had to go here-when in Cali. Delicious burger! Long line but worth the wait
author: Mika W.

description:
I came, November 2015, and was not impressed. I've heard natives to California talk about this place like it was the best invention and held it up high like it tasted better than eating cake.... My answer is NO!... I've had quite a few better burgers in the NY. To me it came across as a salad burger, stuff with lettuce and tomatoes with a hint of patty. I wasn't thrilled at all with the packaging and the fries did nothing for me (BLAND to the 15th power) not even with cheese on it made it better. And to top it off the whole line experience made you feel like you were on a conveyor belt, ya move up tell your order or number, pay and step to the side.... no customer service at all - I understand you want to be speedy but damn what about the first timers that have no idea how it works???... The cashier look offended when I asked her a question instead of me just falling into line like the rest of the orders.

I just didn't like it, the lack of options, the lack of ability to customize, and the lack of humans there to greet and make me feel comfortable about them taking my money! And the space was too cramped - I needed to breathe!!! No seating compared to the amount of people that come in. In the words of Kanye West - DO BETTER!!! ..... because I had no desire to return, the thrill was gone the moment I hit the register. 

It had me running in need of a Starbucks cuz they know how to treat people!
author: Elethia M.

description:
The first time I heard of this burger place was during an international scout camping jamboree.  The scouts from California could not stop raving about this place!  Over the next couple of years, my Californian colleagues would just drool over the thought of getting burgers from here.  As a burger lover, I made it my mission to try it the next time that I was in California.  Finally, after 6 long years of waiting, I finally had the opportunity to try out this burger franchise during my business trip to San Francisco!   

The location by the Fisherman's Warf was crowded and I was intimidated by the long line spilling outside, but I was impressed by the speed at which all of the staff worked together to process the orders as quickly as they can.  As I waited in line, the anticipation of trying these famous burgers started building up quickly.  Finally, my order of a double double burger with a side of fries and special sauce was ready.  

My teeth slowly make its decent on the burger, and I am imagining fireworks as I take my first bite the burger.  However, there were no fireworks.  My life did not change with that bite.  In fact, it tasted like a regular burger that I'm used to eating back on the east coast.  Within less than a minute, my years of hopes and dreams of eating a life-changing burger vanished into nothingness.  Hoping to reignite my excitement, I eagerly turn to the fries.  As a fan of crispy foods, I ordered the special well-done fries.  However, quickly realized my mistake as soon as I took a bite into the crispy fries.  Yes, they were crispy.  However, the extra cooking time had also tried out the fries and left it tasting more like paper rather than like flavorful potatoes.  I definitely recommend ordering the normal fries over the well done ones, even if you claim to love crunchy foods.  

Overall, the meal was very filling for the price and I have no complaints about the quality of the food.  I just came here expecting the magic that the Californians were raving about, but finding myself with a normal burger that could be found on the east coast.  Just come here with lower expectations, and you will be pleasantly surprised.
author: Vy N.

description: Too long of a wait!  I love their burgers but it tasted like mine was burnt and the onions on it as well.  I get excited to go there since I'm from the Midwest where they aren't located and was disappointed.
author: S F.

description:
Food: 4.0/5.0
Service: 2.5/5.0
Value: 4.0/5.0
Decor: 2.5/5.0
Overall: 4.0/5.0

It's kind of silly to rate a chain executed with any consistency but... here's another four star In-N-Out location.  This location is tourist central so the line starts to form within 30 minutes of opening.  Street parking during peak hours is more or less impossible, but very much possible off-peak, especially in the evening, on Leavenworth.  Note that this location is a tad bit more expensive than the ones outside the city.
author: Damian W.

description: It's good always busy crunchy fries wish it wasn't the only in n out in the city so great that it's here
author: Ana Maria S.

description:
The veggie burger is not a patty, only leaf
Surprisingly so good, it almost made me queef
In line like cows people stood
For a healthier fast food
And I still had to ask myself, where's the beef?
author: EL H.

description:
Stuck here in tourist gulch, the staff can get a little flat attitudinally from time to time, but don't that stop you from grabbing a burger here.

Been eating this chow since LA in the 80's and it still rocks the casbah...

Enjoy!
author: William M.

description:
I hear people flipping out about In-N-Out, and was excited to know what the hype was all about. Overall, I don't think I got it...

This location is kinda small and seemingly always packed. Be ready to be a vulture, circling "casually" around a table that looks like it might just free up for you. We had to sit outside while it rained, but thankfully a few outdoor tables are covered. I was in search of a bathroom at the end of my meal, which I didn't end up finding... is there no bathroom for paying customers???? #lame. We had to walk a mile back to our hotel, which wasn't fun!

I ordered a cheese burger, fries and a drink. I liked the burger. The patty is  thin, so I get why their double-double is so popular. I'd definitely go double next time. Their sauce on the burger was a nice, sweet addition. The fries, even though super fresh, tasted dry! I wasn't impressed with this style of fry. 

Overall, I'd give it a another whirl, but so far, I'm not one of those people who will be raving about going there.
author: Suzanne B.

description: My first time being to an in-n-out up north and great thing is, nothing's changed! I love the consistency that this restaurant has no matter what location you're at. For this location specifically it was very clean inside and the workers were friendly. Definitely will stop by when I'm up north again!
author: Olivia C.

description:
This In-N-Out Burger location leaves nothing to be desired it's in a great location, it has great service and adequately staff to handle the rush of customers you can get from the crowds on Fisherman's Wharf and some how they manage to keep this place clean.

Double Double - voted best burger by me!

Why can't we have them in Florida?
author: Dave O.

description:
In n out is one of the best fast burger options around. Awesome tasting burgers, the double double with onions is the only option worth getting. Forget about their fries, they're nothing to write home about. Go for a drink and a burger, can't go wrong. 

This location is crazy busy all the time, take it to go and eat around the area or on the tables outside in the back. Don't expect to get a seat easily inside.
author: Quentin L.

description:
I'm born & raised in California.

I'm a real California girl.

Passion for the ocean?  Check.
Accumulated a stellar collection of sea shells & tried selling them in my front yard when I was a kid?  Check.
Drive a convertible?  Check.
Hair colorist keeping me blonde?  Check.
Love a good burger?  Check.

In-N-Out Burger can never be a bad call.
Single or double, cheese, no cheese, animal style, or just regular...
Whichever way you slice it, In-N-Out is a quintessential California burger.

It's really too bad the fries are just okay.  They're not bad, but they're not great, either.  They totally have an inferiority complex over the burger.  As they should.  
McDonald's fries are the best.  If you can get Mickey D's fries to go w this burger, then you'll have a perfect marriage.

The shakes are above average, & a steal at less than 3 bucks a pop.  Props for making them neapolitan style.  The best flavor, imho.

It's always packed in here for a reason.

4 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description: For the first time in my life I experienced In n Out burger. The burger was pretty good- very fresh with lots of fresh veggies. The fries were kind of dry but I appreciate that they are hand made to order. In n Out is definitely a spot to visit if on the west coast.
author: Christine H.

description: Very busy never found a table so we took it to go: the food was gross. Sloppy and inedible. I do not recommend
author: Jennifer R.

description: I was so excited to stand in line for an in and out burger. They are not located in the east coast so I don't get this treat often. Sadly I was so disappointed when I sat down to eat my burger. The burger patty was so thin. I don't recall being this way in the past. All I could taste was the thick bun, onion and tomato, and of course the sauce. Love how all refers to it as their special spread/sauce and the girl behind the counter says it is just thousand island dressing.   So sad this is no longer on my list of must haves when in CA.
author: Susan L.

description:
Everything is cooked fresh and the meat is never frozen. You can easily tell the difference between this burger than say, those from McDonald's or Burger King. 

The buns can only be described as if you were biting into a warm, soft cloud. Everything in the double double burger leaves your mouth swirling with flavor. 

We ordered everything "animal style", which is part of the secret menu so you have to inform them at the counter when you place your order. I have to say that this was a bad decision on our part. We should've just asked for animal style on half of the order because at the end of the meal I felt quite sluggish and too full. 

The fries were delicious and the cheese with tiny bits of onion pieces added a nice touch to it. The chocolate milkshake was also quite good. 

If you look beneath each wrapper there's a tiny bible verse. We had to google them to see what they were. Clever clever idea. Subtle yet powerful.
author: Sarah C.

description:
I love how In-N-Out is consistent everywhere! The food and the long wait times... But that's expected with every In-N-Out and it's worth it!

I got my usual cheeseburger with fries and it was tasty.

The only thing I don't like about this area is that the bathrooms are outside and you have to exit the restaurant.

P.S. it smells.
author: Aj C.

description: It's good. The hype is real. Animal sauce is great. Fairly priced. If you think you can eat two burgers don't do it. I speak from experience. Their deceptive nature makes it so enticing to just get two but you'll set yourself for a nauseating feeling.  The wait is always insane at all of them. It's worth it though. Non West Coast people need to make a pilgrimage to do it at least once in their lives.
author: Thien N.

description:
Well in in out finally did it.  They ruined their fries.  It ain't the same anymore.  It was a slow transition but I finally realized the formula change.  Their fries are dry and tasteless .  That was the main draw for me.
Bring back those fries I grew up with.
author: Mark K.

description: Always delicious! Sometimes it's really crowded but the service is fast. Get the neopolitan shake, it's yummy!
author: Jessica G.

description:
First off- the line was out the door and seats were hard to find, so be prepared during lunch rush. However, even with all that, nothing can stop the urge to get an In-N-Out burger!  


The burgers are great as always, I think what really made this place awesome is Diana! She was at the check out register and even with the long line it the door, she had a great smile! Greeted each customer, asked about our well being, was accurate, efficient but still a welcoming personality! I heard others in line too commenting on how she was great!
author: Justina H.

description:
I ate here at night and came down with a NoroVirus the next morning. I know for sure that the cause was an in n out burger is because that's the only thing I ate the day before.

#stomachFlu #NoroVirus #vomiting #puking
author: Brian G.

description: A lot of hype. Food was cheap but being from the east coast I would take five guys or shake shack over in and out.
author: Chris D.

description:
Having never been to an In-N-Out Burger and hearing "you gotta go there!" a lot I was determined on my trip to SF to finally try the legend. Unfortunately I was very disappointed. They were incredibly busy and filled with tourists giggling about ordering the not so secret animal style. I actually was impressed with how they were able to manage the seemingly 200 people in that place. On that note it did take foreverrrrrrr to get our meal, but with that crowd I can only complain so much.

Onto the food.....not good. I got the double animal style with a side of fries. Burger didn't taste  like anything special. It was a tad too salty and actually reminded me of Wendy's. The lettuce, onion and tomato were fresh which saved it just a little. The fries were really bad; cold and limp.

Now that I have the experience out of the way I'm not sure I'll try again.
author: Allison O.

description:
Same classic In-N-Out goodness, magnified by ten in terms of busyness and craziness in the line. This is the only In-N-Out in SF, so naturally when all the tourists come to SF, they come aflockin' to this place. SO and I stopped by the other day as we were strolling through the Pier 39 area because we were craving that greasiness goodness. We managed to order the food in less than five minutes, but probably waited close to 15-20 min for our food. It's not even an issue of inefficiency on their part--there are just a ridiculous quantity of people there -- e.g. by the time we ordered, there were about 40 orders in front of ours. Crazy.

Same In-N-Out deliciousness though -- we had a cheeseburger animal style and a neopolitan shake. Just as good as it is everywhere. In the off chance that you, dear reader, are actually reading this unsure of what In-N-Out is, definitely try out -- it'll make you feel kind of terrible in a oh god how many calories did I just eat way, but it'll also be oh so delicious.

tldr; only In-N-Out in SF, but god it's good
author: Jasmine X.

description: This place is an authentic landmark, seriously. No other fast food restaurant gets even close to In and Out. I have been wondering for years why other places as McDonalds or Burger King are still so far from In and Out. Anyway, I was at this In and Out location on Friday and had a double cheeseburger. It was fresh, juicy and so tender, as great as always. I also had a large order of fries with it. No need to say much more about this classic but yummy burger that In and Out has taken to the next level. Next week I am supposed to be in this area and I know for sure that I will be coming back.
author: Richard M.

description:
For a high volume In N Out (which is kind of redundant since In N Out is always high volume, but you know what I mean) this place is awesome. The service was super friendly and upbeat despite the lunch rush and the food was prepared quickly and well, but what else should I expect? 

If you plan on eating in, have someone from your party be on lookout for a table, cuz those are a gold mine. People are always hovering around this place waiting to snag a table. Literally a seagull-type situation.
author: Kyle D.

description: This is exactly what you can expect at every other fast food restaurant in the city... a melting pot of languages and cultures paying for overpriced "hamburgers" while pretending they are eating something unique when they say things like "animal style" or "protein style" etc. Either way, it's cheap eats compared to the other places in the area.
author: Edwin R.

description: The place was swamped and very crowded beyond capacity. Despite that it took a surprisingly long time for such a small menu. The burgers were good, the fries were dry and tasteless. We had similar fries at a Carl's Jr in Reno so maybe it's the potatoes they use regionally, or their process. Either way, worst fast food fries ever. Employees were smiling, patient, and friendly.
author: Ron C.

description:
Aiyaya!  In-N-Out is busy at every location I've been to but this one is on the extremest of what is called busy!  Tourist, and I mean tour bus filled with tourist are dropped off here to eat their famous greasy burgers and fries.  The lines to order go out the door!  If you want to sit down, you'll need to be aggressive and persistent.  You literally have to stand and hover next to a table that 'appears' to be finishing up to grab a seat.  That doesn't guaranteed a seat when your order is up.  You may want form a strategy with your group and hover over several tables to ensure you get to SIT!  Yea.  That is how busy it is here.

It was a non-busy afternoon at work.  So, several co-workers and I took the plunge to maneuver around the mass of tourist to get here.  It took over 20 minutes to walk over.  Through-out the walk from Pier 17 to past Pier 39 was filled with part-gossip and part-work related conversation.  I tried to keep a steady heart rate from breathing hard through the power walk and talk.  It was a good calorie killer to our high calorie intake awaiting us.  After finally arriving, the cluster of people turned us off and we deemed NEVER to return again.  But once we were situated in a seat and starting gnawing on our double double animal style burgers and extra crispy fries, we asked each other, when are we coming back?!

Every time I eat at In-N-Out, it always rekindles my love affair with burgers.  They make it exactly the same at every location.  Dripping greasy meat patties slathered with their secret sauce and grilled onions.  My gosh, it was heaven on a bun that makes you hum a loud hmmm hmmm with each bite.  Tourist can sometimes be scary because one can come up to your while your humming and ask you to come get them in line when your done eating at your table.  Was I going to let her know?  Maybe.  Did I do it?  No.  If you want a table, you gotta earn it and wait like other hovering strategist.  And that is how you play the game.
author: Jenny T.

description:
In-n-out is one of the must-tries for tourists. This one is conveniently located at one of the most touristy places of NorCal. This In-n-out is no different from the rest of the chains though, meaning the hamburgers and fries taste the same and the employees are the same friendly people. It's a cheap and fast option if you're not looking to spend much on food in SF.
The only bad part is, because it's in such a touristy area, seating can be difficult to find. There is outdoor seating, but there's also lots of homeless loitering around outside (they're pretty harmless, but just a heads up).
author: Tabitha H.

description: I love you guys!! It would be great to see you guys switch to more biodegradable materials, like plant-based plastics or other compostable materials. It would be so awesome to see you guys leading the charge
author: Meg G.

description:
If your idea of good food is McDonald's then yes, maybe you deserve In & Out.
I don't care about the waiting.
I don't care about the variety.
I don't care if the guys behind the counter were smiling (it's a wonder to me that some do).

I just wanted to try a good burger as a friend from California suggested.

The burger: 
The bun was wet. The bacon was tougher than chips. The cheese was.. Was it there? You must look really hard to find  and buy something so tasteless. The Patties, you could eat them if you forgot that they were supposed to be burgers.

The fries :
Honestly I have tasted worse. I don't want to exaggerate. Tasted like they were fried in a mix of canola oil and water but did not create suspicions of strange chemistry.

Last but not least, the Coke.
what can go wrong with a Coke? Following the whole spirit of the  joint, the Coke had 30% of the taste it was supposed to have. It was like a bottle left open for 4 hours with 35% water added. I tried it without ice and it was the same.

I am still fighting with my California raised friend who insists that this is a good fast-food.

Could I have just gone on a very-very-very bad day?
author: Antony T.

description: They cook all the burgers well done now. What's the point? They taste like cardboard...flavorless...bye Felicia!
author: Paula W.

description:
We live on the East Coast where there are plenty of burger joints.  Everyone says that In-N-Out 
Burger is a place to go.  If you want to try them, DO NO GO HERE.  We stood in line for 10 minutes to wait an additional 30-40 minutes for the order to be processed.  The fries were soggy, the burgers were no better than any I've had anywhere else, mine was dry and not worth eating.  Definitely not worth the wait.  Maybe they are better in other areas, but skip this place.
author: Maureen C.

description:
Pretty popular place to eat, the waiting line is HUGE. Either come here prepared to wait or don't come here at all. Other than the long line, everything was as expected.
I have been to many other in-n-outs and, of all of them, this one has been the worst. While it is not that bad, it just doesn't live up to the standard that I hold for in-n-outs. The food is average, but the service and the lines are terrible.
There are plenty of other amazing options around this area, so unless you're really craving some in-n-out, I would recommend going somewhere else.
author: Derek N.

description:
Animal. Style. Fries.

Don't question it and just ask for it.

You're welcome, tourists.
author: Allen G.

description:
You know what, if you live on the West Coast and you hate In-N-Out, you have issues. I'm anxiously planning my next trip somewhere I don't know to the West Coast already and will go extremes to get my burgers. This, all coming from someone on a strict diet.

I couldn't possibly leave San Francisco without having to try the infamous In-N-Out. It's a shame that I've been to the West Coast quite a number of times and have never tried it. It sure is on the top of my list the next time I go there. I was surprised that this was the only In-N-Out location in San Francisco but didn't stop me from going to Fisherman Wharf's twice. Because it is the only location in the city, it is relatively busy. 

Got a cheeseburger and fries and I was surprised by how cheap it was. As soon as I indulged in and was consciously eating, I biting onto my last piece. .....Where did the time go? I reallllly wanted another one but I was also in a "hurry" to get back Downtown to try Sushirrito before it was closing--this all on my last day in San Francisco. Totally regretted that. The burgers, no doubt, live up to the hype and the toasted bun was divine. Must've been the sauce. The fries, on the other hand, were soggy and not crispy. The one thing I truly regret not getting was ANIMAL STYLE on everything since I had not known about the so-called "out secret menu."

If anyone wants to be burger buddies, we can totally exchange Shake Shack for In-N-Out burgers. Serious inquiries only.
author: Sharon T.

description:
I didn't want to really write this review because it will bring back my memories of how this was the first ever In-N-Out I experienced and who knows when the next time will be.

So before even going there, I didn't know I had to go study their secret menu.   I had to read up on Wikipedia on what's on their secret menu, my friend told me to order a double double animal style with animal fries.......wha???? O_o. I read what animal style was..ok sounds good.  I read what animal fries was.....uh, sounds a bit much so I'll pass.....I ended up getting a single burger animal style with cheese fries...pretty good.  Tasted like a Big Mac but betttttteerrr!!!!  

While eating I saw people eating animal fries and I'm like, eh it doesn't look that bad....


My next visit to In-N-Out, I ordered what my friend suggested and OMG, why did I not listen to him in the first place, the animal fries were delicious and not too overwhelming with the sauce. (My mouth is seriously salivating while writing this review). My friend who ordered regular fries ended up eating all my fries and leaving his there...dammit!!


I can't wait for the day I can return to order a double double animal style with animal fries....


Oh and by the way, their pink lemonade was awesome....loved the free refills.
author: Ming T.

description: I love this In and Out. This restaurant is humongous and they are always packed, but they make your food really quick and it taste amazing still. I usually get to go there because the seats are always full.
author: Irene Z.

description:
I have to start by saying that I love In-N-Out and am ALWAYS excited knowing that I will have a chance to try it on a trip. This particular location was an MASSIVE disappointment. 

The food was decent but not as good as I remember elsewhere and the prices are more expensive at this location than any other In-N-Out I've ever been to but those weren't the reason I am giving it a 1 star. The reason for the low rating is because of the workers they have here.

I hate to be mean but I can't help but think they scraped from the very bottom of the barrel for 90% of the employees at this place. It's run by a bunch of young unprofessional kids that have absolutely no clue what they're doing. From a guy who just looks out to space when he takes your order and speaks to you like you're an idiot to the girls who are standing around gossiping while a line of 15+ people wait, wondering why one of them can't just open a second register. Here's the best part, the guy who seems like he was in charge would only jump on a second register if it was a good looking young girl...and when it was a guy next he would say " sorry I gotta take care of this" and walk away. HE DID THAT TWICE LMAO! 

There was a couple in front of me talking about how they'd get their own orders so the girl went first and of course that *GUY IN CHARGE* noticed and opened the 2nd register and started flirting with her like crazy and she had a very uncomfortable look on here face while her boyfriend was laughing  awkwardly. Once he took her order he asked where she was from and where she worked and she hit him with a " don't worry about it" and the *GUY IN CHARGE* got all upset and told the boyfriend that he was "sorry" and had to "take care of this" and walked away leaving the boyfriend confused and an ever-growing line of now 20 out the door waiting with only ONE FRIGGIN CASH REGISTER OPEN!

Love the animal style burgers and enjoyed them here but all in all this location is an absolute mess.
author: Kenny O.

description: Hell yeah! I know the Beasties have always said they"Fly fat burger when their out West" but for me it's all about In-N-Out!! Food is always served hot, freshly prepared and taste like a million bucks (for fast food). Clean space, service with a smile and great overall experience.
author: Nombre O.

description:
I've been to different locations and must say has different standards.  Place is kinda small  not really for big groups visiting Fishermans Wharf.  

I got the double double no onions or # 1. The fries was cold and not crispy which didnt met my expectation.   Burger patty was kinda small or it was just the bun.
author: Roland C.

description:
NYer here and I think this is okay. The price is def. more affordable than Shake Shack but I felt like the taste was a glorified McDonalds..I tried the Double Cheeseburger. BUT. If I had to choose between the two obv In-and-Out. Also best to note that this place was way over packed. 

Literally people would shadow you as you eat because they wanted your seat when you leave..
author: Wendy Z.

description: While visiting the West Coast I had to try the obligatory In-N-Out Burger. In-N-Out is definitely higher quality than your run of the mill fast food burger and worth a try. With that being said, do not go to this location during peak hours. It was crazy here on a Saturday afternoon and the entire restaurant was filled with people waiting.
author: Nicole B.

description:
At first glance you will think "This will take forever!" But the line moves quickly and once you order it only takes a few minutes to get your food. There is limited seating inside, but pleanty of seating out in the courtyard behind. If you feel like a short walk you can take your food to the beach! The food is the same great American burger and fries that In-and-Out always delivers.

If you come with small kids I recommend getting them to cut the burgers in half. Also, they have lots of stickers! Sticker puzzles and sticker sheets!

Also, as an extra bonus this is a tourist destination, so it is an international experience!
author: Jacob F.

description: Have heard great things about this place! Always wanted to go and try it out. My sister & I went and the service was good but the place itself was very packed! The line went pretty fast for how many people were in it. Once we got our food and we looked for a place to sit, there were no seats! We looked all over for a table and so were plenty of other people, but we couldn't find anything. The food was great! The cheeseburger I got was awesome, the fries could've been improved. The only negative about this place was the seating, getting more seats and tables for the guests would help improve a lot!
author: Ashleigh M.

description: Such a tasty burger! The people at this location work hard to serve food fast and are friendly. Diana is the best!
author: Laura B.

description: Great spot and very crowded in this very popular area of Fisherman's Warf. We actually left a high-end restaurant after drinking a good bottle of wine and had taken a limo to this restaurant for a classic chain restaurant burger along with their hand-cut fries & thick shakes. Love their burgers!
author: Andrew C.

description: Ate at In-N-Out while we were on vacation and it looked like a long wait, but they got us into the counter, and we ordered our food pretty quickly. Just be ready for a decent to long wait for your food; as well as, very limited seating and a very busy, packed area inside the restaurant. It will most likely be hard to find seating inside the restaurant.  We finally got our food and the burger was almost bland, but it was cooked and was okay. The fries were also not to perfection, they were just okay. The fries were a little dry with not much flavor, but I ate them and they were something to eat.
author: Dilan C.

description: They got Mario slinging burgers and fries! Just a bunch of chillers making some fire food!
author: Sam I.

description:
With over 1k reviews for this particular In-N-Out one would think that the reviews would speak for themselves. I'm also usually a fan of most In-N-Outs because of the consistency of the service and final product, hence why you won't see me review every In-N-Outs I've visited. This particular In-N-Out stands out and not in a good way.

It's already bad enough as it is that this is the only In-N-Out in SF proper smack dab in the middle of Tourist Alley in Fishherman's Wharf. Normally that alone is a reason to avoid the place, but the No1DP gets a free pass as he fondly remembers this chain (my first recommendation to him days before we started dating) serving one of the most memorable burgers he's eaten. It's also one of the only three In-N-Outs in the US that doesn't have a drive-thru, which is counter to what In-N-Out stands for ("do you want to eat this in your car") but that also gets a free pass as there's already enough cars in the area as is. 

The large Coke spill greeting us as we entered and the time it took for a staff member to clean it was the least of our issues. 

Our #2 combos with fries cooked well left much to be desired. The burger patty was dry and devoid of ketchup and animal style sauce. The lettuce and tomatoes were not fresh. What bothered me most of all was that even though I knew the wait would be longer for the fries to cook, the fries were not consistently crispy. In the neighborhood In-N-Outs closest to where I've lived I can always count on consistently crispy fries. Even though I'm usually able to finish a burger and fries as a meal it says something when I leave half my food uneaten and the No1DP barely touched his food.

No1DP notes that since we're in a touristy area, the staff doesn't have to care as much as they don't have to worry so much about attracting repeat customers. Just stick to eating clam chowder on bread bowls; though it's very touristy at least the food quality in even the most "subpar" restaurant is better than this sorry excuse of a burger. If you insist on wanting a burger, take the F line to Super Duper Burgers - a few dollars more for a higher quality product.
author: Isabella B.

description: typically in n out joint however, the location is by the pier and can be quite busy. I'd personally avoid the wait and hassle and eat it at home wile enjoying the seafood spots near by for my hunger cravings.
author: Lisa S.

description:
I'm a huge fan of Shake Shack, so I had to try In-N-Out on my visit to SF to see how it stacked up. The burgers are completely different, but still very tasty. My regular cheeseburger was simple, but the vegetables were crisp and super fresh, and the entire thing was well-balanced. It tasted like a much fresher version of the kind of cheeseburger you grew up getting at your local burger shack. The burger was pretty cheap (around $2 if I recall), but also pretty small. You definitely need to get sides as well, for which I chose the animal-style fries. These were much pricier than the burger but boy were they decadent. The fries themselves were nothing to write home about (my boyfriend actually had to go back in and get salt for his regular fries since they were unsalted), but covered in sauce, American cheese, and mounds of grilled onions, they were wonderful. I just wish they had been warmer. By the time I got to eat them after waiting about 5 minutes for my boyfriend's food, they were pretty cold and much less appetizing. My boyfriend also got a chocolate milkshake and it was super creamy and delicious.

The place itself was mobbed when we went in around lunch, but the employees were like a well-oiled machine, and we only ended up waiting about 15 minutes for our food. There isn't that much seating inside, but outside there is a nice little courtyard. Overall, I would go to In-N-Out again if I'm on the west coast, but maybe not go out of my way for it.
author: Katie H.

description: This location works like a well oiled machine. As a burger lover from Europe i had to cross this one off my list. Unfortunately, it didn't meet my expectations. Incomparable to the real burger places in the city like Rove's Kitchen and Monks Kettle. Still, an ok burger for an ok price.
author: Tim B.

description:
Satisfaction you can only get by an in-store appearance!

We stopped in after a fifteen minute convo of how to get the tastiness delivered (hard to find In-n-Out on any delivery site in SF, and it was too late to call a Task Rabbit).

The lengths we went to get the food should say it all.  Satisfying burgers that are a California classic.  The fries leave something to be desired.  I'm a big fan of a hamburger, animal style.  Friends got the cheeseburger and were equally satisfied.  

Stop in if you're wandering around the wharf or grab a Lyft if need be.
author: Beth V.

description: Totally not worth the overrated burger. Waited over 35 mins for ONE burger. It's not even a gourmet burger joint. Take your money and your precious time somewhere else.
author: William K.

description:
Of course while on the west coast In -N - Out Burger is what you MUST eat!!!

i love burgers and had never had any in-n-out burgers, so this was my first time.

There was a bit of a long wait, but it is a touristy area and a tourist attraction if you will...

My burger was pretty good, I would definitely like to try some other options from there, but it's definitely not something I would ever crave or go really out of my way for.  There are a ton of good burger places back here on the East coast, when I have a craving, it's for one of them.
author: Danielle B.

description: I would have given a negative star if I could. This review is not for in and out burgers overall but for THIS particular one. I knew the reputation of in and out burgers and had it before so I know it can do better than this. We ordered double double and animal style fries. Turns out the fries were soft (like they cooked it yesterday and reheated in a microwave) and the meat was stale and taste like it's cooked yesterday and been sitting in the fridge and reheated. Such a disappointment!! Probably it was because this is a touristic spot and they are really busy, but this is perhaps one of the WORST burgers and fries I've ever had. There needs to be some standard in how they handle and serve food so the quality can be consistent. If you are in cali as a tourist and want to try this chain, do avoid this particularly one as all cost!
author: Fay C.

description:
I used to swear by animal style. For everything. My burger, my fries, my second burger...

Now that I'm getting older and my metabolism is constantly threatening to punish me for my glutton ways ... I now swear by protein style.

Wait time is not equivalent to national fast-food joints, but since it's Cali and not New York, I feel obligated to chill out and wait patiently for my number to be called.
author: Teresa L.

description:
Five stars for this location's ability to deliver In-N-Out consistency and quality, in spite of a crush of tourist business that was over 70 orders deep at 6 pm tonight. If you are from a place where In-N-Out is not available, in the US or abroad, do not fail to try these fresh, affordable and delicious round sandwiches.

Years ago when they first opened there were some quality control hiccups, but those are long solved. I have a somewhat esoteric special order and they nailed it once again: cheeseburger with double onions, mustard instead of sauce and pickles, and a side of well-done fries.
author: Otis M.

description:
In n out is one of the top priority to try when In the west coast. Despite the time of the day it is always packed with customers which shows their popularity. I had got the number 2 combo which consisted a double , fries and a soda. It was pretty long for the wait to get to the front and also a long wait to receive the food. Finding a seat indoors can be hard since it's always packed. For the price I can see what the hype is all about but in flavor it is ok. Since this is the only in n out in the area abd in a tourist hotspot I don't blame it for being stuffed.
Employees are friendly too. They maintained their cheerful smiles while taking orders.
author: Bei T.

description:
Disappointed, but my overall experience here was fine. The extremely friendly service made up for the meh food. 

I'm not sure if it's just this location or my taste buds are now spoiled by much better quality burgers and fries from other places, but I remembering loving In-N-Out when I first had it three years ago in LA. We ordered two burgers, animal fries and a strawberry milkshake and everything was just okay. Overhyped in my opinion, unfortunately I don't think I'll be willingly coming back.
author: Claudia C.

description:
4X4 all day 
Animal frys extra spread 
And 10 of the green pepper things. 
On point 
Get the water cup 
Pink lemonade filled
author: Europe N.

description:
Great In-n-Out location in the Wharf. Busy as hell due to being a tourist hot spot and I'll give you a free Cheeseburger next time we'll meet if you manage to find a seat. 

Otherwise, order as takeout and look for a spot near the water. Deal with the occasional crazy person and the persistent birds, but you'll enjoy your burger.

And, go animal style if possible.

Deal.
author: Sebastian F.

description:
Great locale but right in the middle of the touristy part of the FW.  Don't try finding a place to eat - just order and go.  It is so crowded man.

But, like all I-N-O locales, the food was B-D-C, that's BombDotCom for all you newbies to the WWW.  That's world wide web to all you golden oldies.

Peace
author: Craig E.

description: I've heard so much about in and out. So much hype and I finally got to try it out and I don't feel like it's out of this world. It's a good burger not going to lie but it's just like any other. And I most definitely did not enjoy the fries. In my opinion, if I'm going to eat bad than its going down all the way. Would I eat in n out again? Yea, sure but I won't be a regular.
author: Giovanna H.

description:
I love In-n-Out, except for this location. It not about the long wait times, that is to be expected. Every other location is consistently delicious. The Fishermans Wharf location is not. The buns are not fresh here.  I know it seems like a small detail, but it ruins the whole burger. 

Go to any other location. I'm sorry if you are visiting and this is your only chance to try In-n-Out. Go to the Millbrae location near San Francisco International Airport or Daly City.
author: Jeff H.

description:
I've been hearing about this deliciousness all my life without having the opportunity to try it, Damn you East Coast. So when I spent two weeks in Cali, of course I had to try it, multiple times actually. 

Best fast food burger around. Better than Five Guys, better than any of burger I've been served within 5 minutes. Do you research before and peep the hidden menu. I didn't choose the animal style life, it chose me...
author: Andrew Q.

description: I have no clue why this chain is hyped up the way it is. Fries were disgusting and burger had more onions on it than beef.
author: Sarah S.

description:
Had to try it ..... it was good but I wasn't BLOWN away by anything. Wasn't as jaw dropping as was told but I would eat here again.

There is seating outside and there isn't a restroom which is bizarre coming from the East coast.

Fighting for restrooms is the most annoying thing in the world in CA.
author: Funtime P.

description: Lines move fast. Simple menu. Lots of teens. Great fast cheap food on fisherman's wharf
author: Kris B.

description: Recommended by an ardent tour guide, I skeptically waded through the throng to place my order. (It was such a revelation that I had to seek another location closer to home but fell half a continent short.) My first impression was that the bun was distinctive for its fresh taste and yet stoutly held together while absorbing burger juice. The patty itself was equally fresh and, in combination with a magical sauce, just wonderful. It's incredible that In/Out can mass produce such a delicious product! Wish I'd tried the fries to see if they were in the same class, but the real regret was not being able to add applewood-smoked bacon and give artisanal burgers a run for their money!
author: Bruce B.

description: So packed. But the burger is worth trying. The animal style fries not so much. The fries tasted weird. They didnt even taste like fries and the cheese was glued on. The actual burger was alright. Nothing special but pretty. Quality is still much better than any other fast food place.
author: Prima Z.

description: Why 5 stars?  Because it was fabulous!  It was PACKED but we still got served quickly.  I had the double double animal style with fries animal style. Yeah, that's how I roll!
author: Jim K.

description:
We heard it was THE place to get a burger in California.  We read the good Yelp reviews.  We tried it and it are still not sure what all the fuss is about.  Yes, it's cheap and it's popular but these two things do not make it good.  The atmosphere at this location was chaotic (typical of Fisherman's Wharf), the staff was polite, and the service was pretty quick considering they were so busy but the food just wasn't impressive, or even memorable.

It's still better than McDonald's but only worth a second try if it was the only place open late at night and we were starving.
author: Tina P.

description: Well oiled machine here for how insanely busy this location seems to be. Only downside really was it was not very clean. Typically there is someone at In-N-Out walking around keeping things clean and the day we went there was not anyone doing that. The line moved very quickly and we got our food pretty fast. All in all, another great In-N-Out location!
author: Lauren E.

description:
I was so excited to eat here form my own opinion as to whether it is better than shake shack or not. I was highly disappointed that I wasted one of my few meals in San Francisco on In-N-Out. 

In-N-Out or McDonalds would be a better comparison. The fries are definitely much better at McDonalds. I did not have the animal style sauce since it isn't listed on their menu, but the meat itself is not good so the sauce wouldn't make this a better quality burger. Yes, shake shack's burgers are more expensive than In-N-Out, but they make up for it in quality. 

I didn't have the animal style sauce, but it should be on the menu/offered by the cashier if the sauce is the only thing they are known for.
author: Swati S.

description: I had an order 1 value meal: burger, fries and soda in the late morning.  I normally like the taste of burger n fries but this time it didn't taste like hamburger n fries....both items had same odors n taste. The only thing I can think of is the detergent use to wash the cooking ware, grills, frig., freezer odor, etc...I couldn't finish my food cause I felt like throwing up...
author: Ms R.

description:
I'm from Canada, and when I came down, I was told by everyone who's been to California that I had to try In N Out. So I came down and got a Cheeseburger with fries and a Neapolitan Shake. In the end, it was just over hyped completely. 

The shake was good. Not amazing, but solid. The burger was ok, that's it. The beef seemed good quality for the price, but nothing else was particularly special. Barely better than a McDonald's honestly. The fries were cold, stale, and overly salted. 

When I go back to Canada I'm not going to join the droves of people recommending it, I probably won't say anything. In the end it just left no impression at all.
author: Keegan P.

description: Even writing this review is hard because I do not have In-n- out to eat in front of me right now. You cannot go wrong with in-n-out. I always go with a sloppy yet delicious double double animal protein style (skip the bun to save room for the fries and milkshake! ) This place is super crowded around lunch due to its location but its worth every second. NO BATHROOMS AT THIS LOCATION Tables are scarce so scope one out when you walk in. Also a young woman named Diana worked there cleaning the tables and offering to take peoples garbage- she was so kind and polite and lovely.
author: Erin L.

description: It was good place and clean . I order the animal style and was testy . Friendly customer service and fastest service . It was very clean restroom . I like it and recommended to go there and have fun with delicious Berger ...
author: Amir H A.

description: One of my fav burger place!!! The animal fries and burgers are just awesome!!! You can try the shakes they have chocolate and vanilla, my fav is vanilla as the chocolate too sweet for me.
author: Jocelin L.

description: Complete crap does not live up to the hype and do go if you like crap food. Five guys is way better.
author: Davis B.

description: The food is really good! Cheap and fresh! We would eat here again. There are quite a few homeless people around the area though
author: Sadie B.

description: Ya know that whole, "woooooow" thing y'all do when some idiot calls you out on some shit you don't know how to respond to? Ya that's me guy. I live around the corner. Why? Who the fuck knows, I love seals and views of Alcatraz I guess. Yeah NYE, had some friends over from out of town. Offered to go get In & Out because you know those east coast weirdos love a hyphie gimmick... And so I chugged along with orders in hand. While I'm in line a group of youths proceeded to gather and cut line as I called them out the security came and told me to leave when I did absolutely nothing wrong. Cops are here now arresting the security guy as he thought it was a good idea to put his hands on me and the restaurant is closing early. Get it together you morons. I'm going to eat at Denny's. At least the have a grand slam ayyeeeeee
author: Louis G.

description:
Burgers were fantastic (Double Double Animal Style). Definitely bar none probably one of, if not, thee best fast food burgers I've had. Burger was extremely fresh, bun was divine, and getting it animal style is a must. The fries were ok but nothing to write home about. Great that they are fresh cut but by the time I got to my table they were barely warm and borderline pasty. I would go back in a heartbeart for a burger and a shake, hold the fries. Definitely worth a visit!

Love the bible verses on the packaging.
author: Georgianna J.

description:
Delicious fresh burgers, just "meh" fries. If In-N-Out was next to a Five Guys in my town I'd go to Five Guys 75% of the time as I like their fries better and they offer many more toppings, BUT In-N-Out knows how to make a classic, fresh burger. After chowing down on my Double-Double I wanted another!

Service at this location was fine and it's always crowded, so if you want to eat in make sure to grab a table as fast as you can else you'll be standing around. Repeat, make sure to GRAB a table as FAST as you can!
author: Mitch K.

description: Well not much to say here- this is a popular fast food hamburger joint on the west coast and I ordered just a cheeseburger with fries. The burger was very good and the fries are so so. Apparently everyone and their mother goes to this place at any time of the day or night so there is always a long line. Other than waiting 20 mins for a fast food hamburger and fries- the food was good and was what I expected from all the hype I've heard.
author: Danielle M.

description: This place is awesome. I saw people waiting in line way before it even opened haha. I'm from the East coast so everyone on this side is super spoiled. I've been to many other locations in the past, but I like how this particular one has a strong ordering system and everything is clean. We ordered around noon so I did expect a long wait. Our order of 2 2x2 animal style grilled burgers with onions and animal style fries came out perfectly. This location stays true to all of the flavors. I noticed each employee knew their roles. You see people cooking, sweeping the floors, refilling napkins, shouting out order numbers. No doubt this is a high traffic location, but don't be alarmed with the lines out the door. You'll get your delicious meal in no time. My tip is if your here with a party split up in 3. 1 group orders, another check for seats inside and another check outside.
author: Khoi N.

description: Terrible fries. Beef is great though. Food is fresh. Go for an animal style burger. Skip their hella salty cheese though. That's it.
author: Danielle O.

description: Animal style is the way to go! Double burger served animal style with a side of fries animal style and a milkshake will satisfy your California cravings! It's a traditional fast food but the food is super fresh and the location of this in n out is good to take a long walk on the boardwalk after being so stuffed
author: Stephanie C.

description: I go to many locations,same order every time. This location struggles to get it right when others nail it every time. I root for them, not hard. Double meat, protein style, extra lettuce, no spread, w onion, ... amazing what shows up. Meat and veggies guys, come on!
author: Ed J.

description: I'm from NYC so I go crazy seeing people post up pictures of In N Out! So when me and my boyfriend went to SF we had to check it out! The menu looked super old school and simple. I guess animal style was off the menu, but we made sure to animal style everything, and had one of their milk shakes! It was super cheap and cost us less than $15! The server was a sweetheart! I asked him for one of those hats (while my bf was laughing at me) and he gave me two of them! I felt super cool with those hats and I've always wanted one! He also gave me packs of their sauce to bring back to NYC hehehe ! This place was definitely worth the experience, and I'm not a huge burger fan either. It was totally worth all these years of waiting. It tasted way fresher and cleaner than MickeyDs. Their fries were a bit soggy, but the sauce made it 10x better!
author: Mandy F.

description:
Being an In-N-Out novice I couldn't resist coming to this In-N-Out in the lively Fisherman's Wharf.

I arrived to a mass of people at the registers, I couldn't tell it was a line at first seeing how disorganized it was but after finding that it was i worriedly stood in the back. It extended outside the joint! When I finally placed my order after 20 minutes I noticed that all the employees were stressed out to the max, dashing from corner to corner behind the counter and passing out orders like madmen. I had to wait an additional 30 minutes for my order. Even with how crowded the place was I expected it to be swifter than 50 minutes to get your food. 

My double-double burger and fries with animal style arrived. The animal style sauce felt more like a load of fat rather than a flavorful add-on. The fries were also cooked as if I asked for well done fries (extra crisp and hard) although I hadn't.

The burger was ok. It seemed there was too much cheese which bothered me, making the burger unexpectedly greasy. The buns were also soggy adding to the mess. And the patties were slippery. If this is really what foreigners flock to the USA for, they are coming for a terrible reason.

TL;DR:

Pros:
-Hard-working staff
-Located in the popular Fisherman's Wharf
-Easily noticeable 

Cons:
-Long time to get your food
-Long lines
-Burger was definitely below my expectations
-Overrated animal style sauce
-Well done fries when I didn't ask for them

Final Verdict: 2.7 STARS (Rounded to three stars)
author: Edmund Z.

description:
I'm from socal and I know In-N-Out pretty well. Normally I'll go in and order a number 1 and enjoy my meal in a decent environment. At this In-N-Out, I waited in line for about 15 minutes to order (eh I'm used to it already). While I was in line, a lot of people in the restaurant were being loud and obnoxious. When I finally got my burger, I took a bite and the it tasted way worse than a normal burger from any socal In-N-Out. I'm sorry for those who have had their first burgers here because the "real" ones are way better.

TL;DR the burgers here are subpar to other locations and the crowd is rougher.
author: Crisanto N.

description:
*East Coast friends: "Double Double, Animal Style" is the code.
*Must Try: Animal Style Fries.
*Vanilla Shake is made with 100% real ice cream, and perfect for the warm weather.
*my meal was rudely interrupted by an aggressive hobo who stumbled in, sat next to me, and then grabbed the rest of my fries...
author: Amy C.

description:
I got number one double double with fried and medium drink tasted so yummy. The only thing is that I think my burger wasn't that double double I think it was smaller than I thought, that kind of bothered me but again never mind. It could happen even if it happened. So one more thing, Leslie the cashier had a beautiful smile and liked it so kind. Also there is always a line even on Monday night wasn't terrible but still. Good job in n out

UPDATE: I think I was wrong about the double double burger and it was ok :)
author: Majid D.

description: Ordered a double double animal style and they give me a double double with a whole onion in it... gave it back to them and the girl says this is what I ordered.. which I DID NOT!!! SERIOUSLY RUDE CUSTOMER SERVICE.
author: Trang T.

description: Don't believe the hype.  It's a very thin patty hamburger from a fast food restaurant, the fries aren't that great either, don't even ask about the chocolate shake.  The taste of the burgers is comparable with Wendy's, so you're not missing anything if you pass on in-n-out burger.
author: Philip L.

description:
I hope that one day San Francisco can acquire another In N Out that's not in the most touristy part of the city, but until then, we will have to wade through the masses for our delicious burgers. 

Google all their secret shit they got, aint nobody got time to tell you on yelp!
author: Angela L.

description: A long line in a Sat evening! Animal fries is OK but the burger is awesome. Milkshake is a bit too sweet for me
author: Yikai L.

description:
Just can't help yourself - especially when in the California, ya just have to go find yourself one of these in-n-out joints.  Milkshake, fries, burgers....   It's good when you eat it.  The lines are usually very long...  But it goes relatively fast enough.... 

The food is good... But I wonder if it's really that good and worth all the trouble...

But then again...  We still make those trips to in-n-out.  I like it enough to go, again and again with whomever wants to go.
author: Arry Y.

description: Good burgers but what's with those atrocious wafer-thin fries!? Tip: ask for the animal style cooking on your burger.
author: Sadia H.

description:
To hear people talk about this place, you'd think they'd serve the greatest burger on the planet. I was really disappointed both in the burger AND the fries. Both were very bland, with little to no flavor. Especially the fries. 

The only redeeming factor was how unbelievably fast the service was, even with a line that wrapped around the building.
author: Andi B.

description: I don't get this chain and the related hoopla. Stopped by on a very quiet Sunday morning, ordered a double double at 1112 and they called my number 14 minutes later. Burger was OK, but to be sure Five Guys puts out a much better tasting product.
author: Art M.

description:
In N Out.  Need one say more?

I've been told that this is one of the few In N Outs that doesn't meet their cookie cutter layouts.  As you can see in the pics, this one definitely doesn't have a rectangular footprint.

The burgers are so beautiful-looking, you almost feel bad eating them.  I must say that this is one of the very few fast food places I can think of where the food actually looks like the pictures on the website!  There's a certain level of care that you simply don't find too often.

One trick about this location - there's no Wi-Fi, but a signal can be picked up from a medical clinic nearby.  Muwahaha.

I really wish this chain has locations outside California.  Sigh.
author: Edward L.

description: Great fresh burgers daily!! Some of the best fries and always fast and efficient. Highly recommend
author: Christine L.

description:
I love In N Out Burger, the Double Double is my favorite burger, and I even dream about In N Out sometimes. However, the Fisherman's Wharf In N Out is by far the worst location. It's dirty, often filled with homeless people, and is stupid crowded.  The drink machines are nasty, with sticky soda spilled everywhere, caused by homeless people on their 20th refill, and the burgers seem a bit off compared to other In N Outs, but perhaps it was just the hobo stench.  I understand that San Francisco has a homeless problem, and I feel sorry for them, but eating a Double Double in a homeless shelter is really unappetizing.

5+ stars for all other In N Out locations. I've been to In N Outs all over California, and even in Nevada, and all other In N Outs are awesome, but this one is just plain nasty.

Pro Tip: If the weather is nice, get it to go, and eat at the Bleachers at Aquatic Park.
author: Allen T.

description:
Thought we would try it since we have never eaten at one before and we have heard about it 
Very hard to find a seat for starters you basically have to hover over someone until a seat comes open 
Probably one of the most affordable places to eat on the wharf but you sometimes get what you pay for
Very thin patty that is swallowed by all the other stuff
author: Annie H.

description:
I had to go and try it just to say I tried it..

So on a casual Saturday near Fisherman's Wharf, I waited in a long line to order a cheeseburger and fries with a cheese cup.. After eating it was I like- eh, whatever... 

I for sure am not really a fast food junkie. I stopped eating McDs since 2004 and have only been to Burger King like 4x..

Overall I was not impressed by the quality in the food!

Only thing I got out of it is the ability to say- "I've been to an In-n-Out Burger place"
author: Halisa V.

description: Awful. Worse than McDonald's. the fries were not even crispy. And the burger is a skinny disk. Unbelievably disappointing. Go to mcdonalds and save yourself four bucks and the calories.
author: Alicia L.

description:
This place is the main reason why I like to stay at the Marriott, you can just go downstairs and walk right into In and Out. After work, nothing beats In and Out's hamburger, fries and drink combo (number 2). The employees never fail to ask, "How was your day?" Quite a stark contrast from the interactions you'll have at other fast food places. I also like the references to Scripture, like John 3:16 which you'll find underneath your cup or Proverbs 24:16, located under your French fry basket. The lines are always lengthy but you can sip on your diet coke while you wait for your number to be called out. 

You'll need to go out for a 10 mile run after this meal so I'd like to refer to Isaiah 40:31 -

but those who hope in the Lord
will renew their strength. 
They will soar on wings like eagles; 
they will run and not grow weary,
they will walk and not be faint.
author: Gerry T.

description:
Okay--it's a chain and it's fast food but when you're from Texas and then the east coast--this chain was non existent in my life until this trip to San Fransisco. The hubby and I found it totally by accident. 

We ordered the double cheese burger combo. The wait was a little long but totally worth it. The burger actually reminded me of my texas favorite "whataburger" which made me love it even more. The fries were terrible. Dry. Old. Yuck. 

But we will totally go back again. And visit the Times Square of San Fran.
author: Nando R.

description:
I absolutely LOVE this place! Be prepared to wait in line for a long time and possibly not get seating, but hey, that just adds to the festive atmosphere. I love going here to eat after a long day walking around San Fran. Not a fan of animal style (get regular the first time you go there), but the burgers are pretty decent and the milkshakes are the bomb dot com. Try dipping your french fries in the milkshakes, they're so incredibly thick and creamy. 

Tip: if you are just getting a milkshake, they will bring it out to you as soon as you order. You won't have to wait in the back of the line of people who have already ordered (but you will obviously have to wait in the line of people waiting to order).
author: Annie Y.

description:
Coming from the east coast, I have never had the opportunity to try In-N-Out Burger up until now. From what I know, my impression as that it was going to be beyond fantastic, so i was very excited. When we came to this venue, the line was long, but we waited eagerly. I ordered a Double Double with fries and chocolate shake.
