It was very packed, but we managed to get a table and waited around 10 minutes for the food. The fries were a bit soggy, they didn't seem to be fresh or maybe under done. The burger was okay, but i didn't see anything special about it.. I've definitely had better burgers around the same price, but in In-N-Out's defense, they those places were craft burger spots not fast food. However, the shake, was delicious. It was very thick and creamy, would highly recommend getting on if you go to In-N-Out. 

On the other hand, the place was very packed and not clean. Reminded me of any fast food place, just another McDonalds vibe.. They could use some more people cleaning the venue and taking orders to simmer down the lines.

In summary, would come back, but wouldn't go out of my way.
author: Steven P.

description:
In-N-Out is excellent. Very cheap and high quality, especially for fast food.

I already had two dinners and just shared a sundae at the nearby Ghirardelli Chocolate Shop, and my wife really wanted to go to In-N-Out since we were on vacation from New York and she knew she wouldn't get another chance to have it for years. Even though I was so full already that I was huffing, I couldn't resist getting a Double Double Animal Style. You haven't experienced In-N-Out until you've ordered this beauty off the secret menu.

I would probably add a fifth star if the fries were a little better (I highly suggest ordering them well-done, another gem from the secret menu).

Check out the rest of the secret menu here for some excellent ideas on some good stuff you can try at any In-N-Out:
http://aht.seriouseats.com/archives/2011/03/the-in-n-out-survival-guide-we-ate-every-single-item-on-the-secret-menu.html
author: Mike C.

description:
This In-N-Out is regrettably located in Fisherman's Wharf AND the sole location in the area. It will be busy and parking will suck. That said, we were able to get our food to go. I dropped off my husband and parked several blocks over until he texted. The quality of food was the usual In-N-Out standards. They filled our order exactly to our specifications and gave us extra napkins. 

I observed that the area didn't feel too safe at that late hour so if you are solo, keep your wits about you and pay attention. I saw several folks drunkenly walking around, waving their iPhones, purses dangling. I wasn't being reactionary, just trusting what I witnessed.
author: Kristine H.

description:
I love In-N-Out. It's my favorite fast food burger place hands down. They're usually pretty consistent, but for some reason, this place was lacking a little bit. We were coming back from grabbing drinks across the Golden Gate Bridge in Sausalito and wanted some grub before turning in for the night. It was dinner time, but I'm pretty sure this location is almost always crowded. The line wasn't too bad, though, and we were able to get our order within 15-20 minutes. We snagged a seat (you have to be like a circling vulture in order to get a seat in this place!) and chowed down.

The thing I love about these burgers is that they always look so perfect. The bun is fluffy, the patty is juicy, and the lettuce/tomato/onion/spread combination is laid out perfectly. However, in this burger, the lettuce/tomato/onion/spread combination was kind of sad looking. The taste was decent, but not one of the best ones I've had. A little disappointing. I realize this is probably one of the most touristy In-N-Out locations you will find in NorCal, but keep up your standards In-N-Out!
author: Leana L.

description:
Two stars for In-N-Out?  Really? For THIS particular In-N-Out location, YES! Go here only if:

1) You are dying for In-N-Out.
2) On foot...this is basically a walk up location. 
3) Don't mind the homeless bums sitting down next to you asking for some of your French fries. 

Being from Oregon and staying nearby, we were ecstatic to see In-N-Out just a couple blocks from our hotel. We are huge In-N-Out fans, so we quickly added it to our must eat places while staying in SF the next few days. 

Crowded In-N-Outs are always something to contend with, especially during peak mealtimes, so we weren't overly dismayed by the long line to order or the filled tables.  Usually, if you don't have too many people lolly gagging over their meal, the tables always turn fast enough for you to snag one before your number is called.  

Not so with our recent trip. Some people were just sitting there....and sitting there....reading, visiting, playing on their mobile devices....it was the first time EVER that our food was ready and no table was available.  Standing there holding our tray filled with two burgers & two baskets of hot fries, we waited and waited and waited....nibbling on a fry or two every couple of minutes. 

When a table finally opened up, this precocious little 12 year old, who was obviously delegated by her parents to score a table while they ordered, tried to sneak in ahead of us. A hard stare from both my wife & I as I held up our tray of food did the trick as she bowed her head and skulked away.  

Now, I'm not deducting points for that. Crowds are no fault of In-N-Out. But what I am docking them for is lack of management "protection" for their patrons from the intrusion of multiple street bums!

While waiting for that table, we witnessed several filthy, smelly, disgusting and down right revolting bums...who had not showered in who knows how long....enter the premises and attempt to mooch off diners.  Literally sitting down at an open chair next to a family of three and beg for fries. Or ask, mid bite on a burger, "Are you going to finish that?"

When one kind hearted soul relented and said he'd give this one particular cretin some fries, the lout started to reach for them right off his tray and was told, "No, I'll put some in a napkin for you."

I may be sounding a bit harsh for those less fortunate, but there are boundaries that must be taken. Pan handling and begging are particularly distasteful to me no matter what the circumstances. But when I'm in a restaurant and I'm a paying customer, I expect some sort of protection from this establishment from behavior such as this.  

Several employees witnessed it and behaved like it was the day to day norm. Additionally, the bums would come in with an empty cup, after obviously discarded in the trash, and proceed to get a "free re-fill" at the soda fountain. Pushing and shoving paying customers out of their way.  

To be brutally honest, if we hadn't have already ordered AND if we weren't dying for In-N-Out AND if we weren't pressed for time to get to our next engagement, we'd have just left.  In hind sight, I wish we had. The whole experience was rather nauseating and I place direct blame on lack of management to deal with the problem.

We won't be coming back to THIS In-N-Out and hope that anyone reading this review considers this information helpful if you are in the least bit worried about your dining environment.
author: Keith A.

description: Great burgers and service. Always fresh. Highly recommend to friends and family in the  area
author: Monica H.

description: Worst in n out I've ever been too. The fries were not fresh and the burger was super salted.
author: Andrew D.

description: Very popular place I just realized. I was told that this burger joints only available in California. The burgers are just so so, but alsoI think still can't compete with Mc Donald or Burger King.
author: Suria N.

description: This is my FAVORITE In-N-Out EVER!!! The staff is so professional and prompt. The food is as good as it gets. I frequently visit on my way back from work. Seating can be a challenge, but I prefer the drive through anyways.
author: Carolyn P.

description:
Crowded during the lunch hour in the center of a tourist destination, of course, but the burger is worth the wait.

The Flying Dutchman is always an option when being on a budget for the same juicy In-N-Out goodness without any vegetables on top.  I bring my own whole grain buns and ask for fresh Spread packets to put on top and bottom of the Dutchman stack for easy munching at a lower price..
author: Arthur Y.

description:
In-n-out is truly one of my favorite spots to go to in California. The second I step off the airplane it's all I can think about. Their expertly crafted mouth watering hamburgers are enough to make anyone go crazy. Whilst on a short vacation I went twice and regret not going a third time. If I had a genie in a bottle I would use one wish to bring in and out burger to the east coast. 

If you go here be sure to get your fries animal style. As if the food couldn't get any tastier, animal style gives you a thousand island style creamy dressing with grilled onions which is nothing short of heavenly.   

As I sit on my couch in Miami I suddenly got struck with sharp hunger pangs and envy of the California population that get to frequent this establishment. Enjoy locals...enjoy.
author: Lindsay B.

description:
It's great they have an In-N-Out in the city but be prepared for inflated prices. I still love their grilled cheese (it's not on the menu vegetarians- just ask for it) but I found the fries to be a little stale-like and still prefer the Milbrae location on the way to the airport. 

3.5 stars because they still have the grilled cheese for vegetarians! Who knew a "burger" without a patty could be so good?
author: Ninette C.

description:
You can't say you've been to the west without stopping at an In-N-Out! It might have a fast food vibe but you'll definitely get great service with friendly people and fresh burgers and fries! You can even see them make the fries in the back. Though the atmosphere is still similar to a fast food joint, I'm never disappointed with the quality and efficiency for the price that you're paying. However, be prepared to wait in line for a while. On weekends, its so packed that there's usually only standing room.

They also have a secret menu that you can read about online. I usually get a double double (sometimes protein style) with grilled onions. My only concern is that I wish their fries were slightly larger since they're quite thin. They still taste great well done though!
author: Mike E.

description: Oh my...where do I start. If I was rating experience only this place would have a deficit. The line was crazy long, there was no where to sit, people were taking up seats who had outside food, the place was not clean....the list goes on. No one warned me it would be 60 degrees in the summer in San Fran; me and the hubby sat outside (had no choice) and it was cold cold cold...there were pigeons surrounding us...eek. But this is why this place is popular...it is inexpensive, especially for CA prices and the burgers are good! Hence my three star score. In n' out is best if you're in and out and take your food home. Lol
author: Arlene G.

description:
Why 3 stars?  Because this was my worst In-N-Out experience yet.

   ---   ---   ---

Ugh, I hate that this happened.

I had a picture perfect vision of In-N-Out.  I was practically one of their spokesmen.  The main appeal to me about In-N-Out is that I despise fast food, but In-N-Out never made me feel like I had just eaten fast food.  

You know when you go to McDonald's and then afterward it feels like you just ate parts of a used tire that was infested with small animals known to attack the lining of your stomach?  Yeah, I'm convinced that's what a Big Mac is.  The secret sauce is egg batter left over from 8-46 day old Egg McMuffin's, I'm convinced.  46 days old is the threshold, 47 days would be lethal.  Skeptical?  Read a book, would ya?

In-N-Out has the exact opposite effect on me.  After eating a double-double animal style burger with animal style fries and a milk shake...I normally feel like I can go play a some full-court basketball.  It won't help my broke shot, but I don't feel weighed down and bloated the way that normal food makes you feel.

Unfortunately, the location at Fisherman's Wharf humanized In-N-Out for me.  It made me realize that In-N-Out is human and capable of mistakes.  The result of this meal was very McDonaldsian.  I wonder if they ran out of secret sauce and had to borrow some from the Golden Arches.  Instead of the desire to play basketball afterward, I wanted to go play a game of "pass out because my body is rejecting its latest input."

I will visit In-N-Out again next time I am in California, but probably not at Fisherman's Wharf.
author: Brett N.

description: Worse in n out of all time. I live nearby and always come back because I love the food, but this is a disgraceful staff compared to in n out standards.
author: Warren N.

description:
While I do love the brand, this store has the most insane waiting time of all the Stores I've visited so far. Why? It's located directly on Fishermans Wharf and thus always crawling with tourists. 20-30 minutes of waiting is absolutely normal here - I'd honestly stay away from here, if I weren't addicted to their amazing burgers! 

Apart from the wait, the burgers are as tasty as always & the staff is super friendly even when the place is bursting with tourists. If you've never had one of their burgers, you need to try this... you can thank me later!
author: Mike D.

description:
Am I crazy? I almost gave a 4th star, just because of the novelty....but I had to keep it real. 

I got my burger and fries animal style, trying to keep it as crazy as possible since I had never been to In-N-Out and everyone who's anyone has told me you have to get animal style. So I did. I think it was good on the burger, but on the fries I think it was a little overkill. Maybe there was just too much animalization on the fries, cuz as I ate it, it kinda grew on me but at the same time I could not eat all of it. But then again, I only ate half of my burger too but that was because I was saving room to immediately go get a fish sandwich at the pier!

All in all, I didn't think that the quality was amazing or that the taste was SO different that I just had do have more. But it was cool to try, and if I knew of any other hidden menu options other than animal style I would totally go for it. Who doesn't wanna be in on a secret?!
author: Britt C.

description:
Since there is no In-N-Out in my hometown, it's a must have when in California. This location is true to the brand, but extremely busy since it's on Fisherman's Warf. The staff is well prepared for the crowds and you order and get your food within about 10-15 minutes. The place was packed with people and it was difficult to find a table to sit down and eat at.  The staff was great about wiping the tables down after each group would leave a table.

The cheeseburger and hand cut fries were delicious and I love that you can get chili peppers on the side.  V
Even though you can order from the secret menu, I prefer the classic burger and fries. It was good down to the last bite.
author: Katrina D.

description: Classic In n Out burgers! Drive thru always have long queues. But totally worth the wait. I think it's so because its next to a theater.
author: Rushd I.

description: Be prepared to wait a LONG time for your food even at weird hours like 3pm. The ordering time didn't take too long, but it was the time spent waiting for the food that was shameful. If you want fast food, go to Chipotle a couple doors down. They never seemed to have long lines and no seats like this In n Out. Be ready to also grab the first seat you see, because the next one to open up won't be any time soon. 4 stars simply because it's the only In N Out near the area.
author: Christine C.

description:
It's not my favorite In-N-Out in the bay, but as the only one in SF proper, it more than does the job. For awhile I wasn't so hot on recommending this location to first timers to what might be America's favorite fast food chain, but when beggers can't be choosers, this is certainly a better option than not having it at all.

Contrary to popular belief, my subtraction for the star is not due to it's touristy. Most In-N-Outs in major metropolitan cities of California will almost always been flooded with people, be it animal style craving locals or double double curious visitors. It's the fact I've always found the service here to be minimal, just enough to take an order and hand out the food without the usual smiles and occasional winks. They're curt, perhaps because it's Fisherman's Wharf to begin with and because they have no nearby In-N-Out options to relieve the pressure. And without a drive-thru, it's almost always ungodly crowded here, even during bad weather.

But that sad, this place still cranks out pretty solid fast food quality In-N-Out is known for. The burger fixins taste fresh, the fries are rarely overcooked, and the secret menu options are alive and well. Despite the service attitude, I have yet to really encounter any mishaps on their part.

And thankfully, they're open till 1-1:30AM. With San Fran already shutting down at 2AM as a city, this makes for a decent late night eats option.
author: Jando S.

description:
3.5

Great location right in the heart of the touristy Fisherman's Wharf! Finding a table could be very challenging as this place seems to be packed all the time. Burgers were decent but fries were no bueno.
author: Nin A.

description:
This is heaven on earth I promise. You will surely be satisfied after enjoying a nice meal here. The simplicity of this burger joint makes the service a bit more rapid than usual. You can choose from numbers 1, 2, and 3 simple as pie! Although there may be a long line it is definitely worth the wait. I would recommend trying "animal style" which is supposedly a secret recipe but many enjoy this because of the grilled onions. Everything taste so fresh and you can even go watch them chop up your fresh potatoes! Its such a yummy place and you have to try it soon!

The location is rather small and you have to fight for a seat. But it doesn't matter when you're holding gold in your hands. Enjoy the nice weather and go eat at the park or something! Hope no one litters! Have an awesome time eating your burger and fries, and don't forget to try the shakes!!!
author: Renata M.

description: Love It!. In-N-Out has been a subject of fascination for a while now, but after a intensively scouring the nation for the best burgers, my tastes have become more selective, and I have a better understanding of why people love it so much. Even the simplest single patty burger just has that right amount of griddled char and flavor. The buns are so nicely toasted, and it is just as close to perfect as I can get. I'd like to say the same about the fries, but next trip, I'll try to order some "well-done".
author: J E L.

description:
It's a fast food burger and fries. Nothing special.
I do have to say that they get 3 stars and not one because they a very open and creative with orders (search online for secret menu) and because the lady who served me was very friendly.
author: Natan G.

description: Lived up to the hype! In 2015 the double doubles were great. In 2016 the triple triples were amazing. Looking forward to 2017's 4x4's! You can barely get near the place they are so busy. The staff have it down to a science to make sure everyone gets their orders. Plan on getting there when they open or taking your food to go. The 2nd time in 2016 I literally ate it while walking around, I couldn't wait to get there and it was as good as I remembered! Will be a treat to enjoy each time we return!
author: Heather H.

description:
Cheap, good, fat. What else? :)

So many people talk to me about it that I had to try it! So I did and the double-double is my new favorite junk food!
author: Brice D.

description:
I wish we could give half stars. I would def give a two and half stars. But In n Out is just a burger place like McDonalds. If you know about Five Guys then Five Guys win. The burger is just you're regular mass produced burger and bread. The only thing that makes it different is there "Animal style". 
Animal style is seriously just like ketchup, mayo, and relish all mixed in and grilled chopped onions on top. All the burgers come with the sauce, animal style is just extra sauce slapped on with the onions. The fries could come with it and you could put cheese on it. 
This place doesn't even have bacon. Honestly, I love bacon. What burger place doesn't have bacon. I don't get it. 
It's too overrated and mass produced if you ask me. Plus the inside is red and yellow just like Mcdonalds. The fries taste like them too. It's ehhh
author: Ale G.

description: Wha can I say, this place is simply amazing; fast, tasty, great customer service and very affordable. I'm an In-N-Out Junkie!!
author: Cesar L.

description: This place was amazing! First time coming from NY and it was honestly life changing. Considering moving across the country just for this burger joint.
author: Brian H.

description: This will probably be my only fast food review but it's In-n-Out and if you don't already know, it's amazing. One of the {many} things I miss about the west coast. Animal style forever
author: Joan I.

description: Yesssss!  So good. It's just like any location. There's a lot of people but service is quick and the workers seem very nice.
author: Tammy W.

description:
I'd been meaning to try In N Out for at least 10 years and was well excited for the visit, as you might expect. I felt like I knew what to expect and was initially impressed that this store seemed pretty clean. We ordered - two cheeseburgers and two portions of animal fries plus drinks. Drinks are refills so it really doesn't matter what size you get unless you're taking away. 

When the food arrived (at least a 10 minute wait, if not longer - all food is cooked fresh and there was quite a lot of people there) I was impressed by the appearance. Lots of veg in the burger and a good side of fries. The burger started well - great bun flavour, lots of lettuce but halfway through I was bored. It lacked flavour and the meat patty was lost in all the other fillings. The fries were gluggy and I ended up leaving most of mine. 

Maybe double double is the way to go as then at least you'd getting a good portion of meat. I think in a cheeseburger the other components take up too much space and the meat flavour is lacking. Would I rush to return? No, I've had better burgers in better locations in SF so I'm not even sure I'd head back.
author: Briony C.

description:
Very over rated. Minus the cheapness,  the long wait and flavor wasn't great. The place is packed like a sardine can and everyone is shoulder to shoulder randomly pushing you to get around you. 
The fries were atrocious. As my friend said "they are like cardboard." I had extra crispy and just normal fries... the worst fries I've ever had.
My burger... Couldn't taste the meat? Buns were just..  Had weird hard tidbits. Not a memorable experience minus the fries that makes me want to cry.
author: Ani Y.

description: Great burger for fast food. They serve shakes as well. Seems to have a wait time at almost any point of the day. I have had better burger but vs other fast food burgers this takes it by a mile in my opinion. Atleast try it once.
author: Jesse V.

description: My first time at an In-n-out burger joint. The burger was absolutely great but the fries were not. I give the burger 5 stars and the fries 3 for an an erase of 4!!  The crowd was big but we still received our food quickly.  Ordered the burger and fries animal style...great taste but the fries were cold. Not sure how a place this crowded could have had cold fries!!!  Anyways it was good enough to still make another trip if I'm close!!!
author: Billy F.

description:
I've recently decided to venture back into the meat-eating world, so of course, needed to have an In-N-Out burger!

This location is indeed ridiculous - we got off the ferry back to San Francisco after 8:30 p.m. on a Sunday, and the interior was still packed (no seating available, dozens of folks waiting for their food, a line out the door soon to develop); it took somewhere between twenty and thirty minutes to emerge with our order. Hint: there's seating outside, if it's not too cold for you!

I had a cheeseburger, animal style, and though I've been completely satisfied with this choice before, it felt like maybe not enough meat? I'd recommend going for the double^2. I've yet to try the fries animal style, but will definitely do so in the future. The shakes I find a bit intense, so will probably skip on those next time.

All in all, I'd say it's generally worth the heinous wait to consume a beautiful burger with fresh fries, but definitely mentally prepare yourself for the crowd and time commitment before you head over!
author: Shendi X.

description:
Average at best. Ordered the double double and fries (both animal style). It was solid but Nothing that blew me away. The sauce tasted exactly like a bottled thousand island. Although I knew it would be similar in taste to a thousand island, I thought it would be a tastier variation. Fries were extremely mediocre, was not a fan. The burger itself was solid but I'd choose 5guys or shake shack over in n out any day of the week. 

2.5 stars
author: Andy S.

description:
The Double Double Animal Style is a masterpiece. However, having had a lot of In-N-Out around Cali I have to agree with some other Yelpers that this is the worst location I have been to.

The fries were kind of nasty tasting but the milkshake and burgers were quite good. Had I never been here I would declare In-N-Out better than Shake Shack in a nanosecond. However, the craziness of this North Beach location and the fact that the food sort of suffered for it makes me hesitant to boldly declare them the king of all burger joints.

The staff, however, was extremely nice and turned our To-Stay order into a To-Go order even when it was extremely busy and I could tell they were under stress.

 I have to say that in my experience, the LA-area In-N-Outs are way better and, if you can, try some Shake Shack instead!
author: Paul A.

description: Come and order a double-double, you will not regret it. First burger I had in the US and the best one too. Decent fries and milkshake :)
author: Karl L.

description: This was a great cheap lunch near fisherman's wharf. $10 for my mom and I to have tasty burgers and animal style French fries! (Ask for animal style burger or fries and you get it loaded with cheese, onions and thousand island!)
author: Olwen C.

description: Stopped in here for a quick bite and the mother in law had never experienced In and Out. When in Rome... I still think the burgers are overrated but some people go crazy for this place but a cheap, burger chain food goes it tastes good and for as busy as this location gets, they food came out hot and fast.
author: Sarah S.

description: I like this in and out here in sf. They are always great with their customer service. No matter how busy it gets, they handle their customer so well.
author: Eric S.

description:
Not worth the wait!!
The queue here was massive. It didn't actually take that long to get the food (about 15mins) however there was a mass seating shortage.
Eventually when we did get out burgers and shakes we were a little disappointed. They tasted so similar to McDonalds cheese burgers that we wondered what all the fuss was about?!
Tasty food. We do love burgers so we are easily pleased. Just think this was a little overrated. Try Johnny Rockets if you're looking for something a bit different.
author: Ali T.

description: If you are lucky you can find seat :)) very crowded place. But cheap and so delicious.
author: Seyma A.

description:
The food is in n out obviously good. 
The workers were very nice and enthusiastic. 
But the parking is horrible, and because in n out always takes a long time to give you your order, you stay for a long time which means that you have to pay for a longer time in the parking structure. And they don't validate which sucks
author: Denise C.

description:
The great rivalry. Nah I'm not talking about Seahawks vs 49ers. That's far too one sided. I'm talking about the other fierce PNW VS Cali match up. Dick's Drive-In vs In-N-Out. And regardless if an Esquire survey already named Dick's the most life changing burger joint in America this debate needs my voice!

The first part of this review will be "objective" toward In-N-Out. Then I'll judge it against Dick's. 

Decor: It's a fast food burger place. There were seats. Not enough of them. It was cleanish. 

Service: Standard fast food service. Nothing fancy. 

Food: Ok let's get down to it. I had a 2x2 animal style with animal style fries. I missed out on the shakes because I don't like to roll the dice with my lactose intolerance before you go out on vacation. Anyway, I really don't like that I need to know a secret code to order my food. It's silly. After an excruciating 12 minute wait I got my order. Having just driven 13 hours I was so hungry I dove into the animal style fries. First bite was delicious, second the same. But two minutes later the cheese coagulated into this hard unappetizing brick on top of strictly mediocre fries. The burger was good the cheese stayed warm and the ingredients tasted fresh. It was a little messy but most burgers are. 

All in all this was a necessary life experience for me. But the combination of the wait, the fries, and the buildup didn't really give them a fair shot. Dick's will always reign supreme, just like the Seahawks.
author: Anthony B.

description:
Double double, animal style, with fries, animal style, and a vanilla shake. You can't go wrong. A quick and dirty but very tasty meal.

Don't be disheartened by the many people in front of you in the line, it moves crazy quick.
author: Tori F.

description:
This place is very simple the Menu is so simple number 1 or number 2 ...lol
The burgers are good the Fries are good. fast service few people always inside late night .
author: Veronica L.

description: When out to the west coast we need to make one stop to a place that has inexpensive food but makes a great burger !!! Noisy , usually a line and nothing  like an animal burgers . I usually get a Neapolitan shake, for those who don't know it's a three flavor shake!!! What !!, you may say it is different ,having three wedges consisting chocolate ,strawberry and vanilla. I don't know how they do it but it does work . In-n-out beats the $55 crab places on the Embarcadero !
author: Jt R.

description:
I love IN N OUT! :) Grew up with it all my life. It's crazy that this is the only location in San Francisco!

The lines can get super long. Good luck getting a seat! But it's worth it. It's ALWAYS worth it!
author: Amy H.

description: This is some of the most disgusting food I have ever tried... did not eat it, had to throw it out. Coming from Mass. and NYC, arriving here I heard all the raves. Haven't you people in California every tasted a good burger?! OMG this place is even worse than McDonald's and I NEVER thought I would be able to say that about ANY food... well, not exactly FOOD. It is all processed CRAP... no nutritional value AT ALL. Go get a burger at a diner where they serve REAL ground beef and a REAL French fry with FRESH tomato and coleslaw and YOUR CHOICE of CHEESE. It will run you the same price, maybe a little more but you will also get a BIGGER burger... cooked the way YOU like it. Not one of these paper thin, gray and flavorless cardboard... whatever they are. Yechh... get some taste LA People!
author: K. A.

description:
Dropped by a few times this week for a double double cheese burger and it hit the spot.   (ps: found that the burgers were very similar to burgers priest in Toronto.

Shakes were thick and creamy as well but kinda small.   Located at the Anchorage Square in the eastern edge of the Fishermans wharf.    Will be back again if i'm in the area for sure.
author: Si C.

description:
If there was a therapist in my life, I imagine they would prescribe with hesitation In N Out. With its calming, austere & simple menu, it reduces choice fatigue. It feels decisive. That therapist would know I enjoy art in the form of marketplace design somuchso I would hang this menu on my entry way wall. And then the off menu dynamic. It's liberating. It tells us it's rebellious. Everything is swift. And the contents of the menu... satisfy rebellion, mischief, nostalgia & 1955 youth. 

Merely witnessing the hidden menu or hearing about it in line is almost enough. Contemplating items like root beer floats, protein style, animal style, the quadruple, and the trendy Monkey Style. 

This location is not ideal. Being the only one in the city makes for an air of competition against our In N Out peers. For seats, mainly. However, the outside patio is the must go to if you're up for bundling up or eating without that classic din of the place. 

Monkey Style: it's DIY. Animal Style fries + double double or any other burger and stuff the ASF in between the buns. It's what it's cracked up to be. 

Every time I want the shake. Every time I regret it. Same with the root beer float. Water really is the best choice for the consumption with a side of root beer. 

I'd eat this anywhere in the world and imagine that Singapore pop up In N Out is at the top of the surreal. If I had a bucket list, Singapore is on it. And if I have one recommendation for someone visiting California, this competes. 

And while it frustrates me these burgers are laced with Proverbs & religious impetus, it maintains that fear of digesting a thousand calories of rebellion.
author: Jon A.

description:
Jesus H Christ. It's a burger. A fast food burger. 

I am not sure what I expected. I first came to CA in 1997 but never had one of these, then moved to NYC and clearly stopped caring. I happened to be in SF over Labor Day and decided to try it since it was walking distance from the hotel. 

Bitch, please. 

I got a meal, waited for half an hour to be called while my BF grabbed 1 random seat somewhere to warm up my experience and waited. And while he waited for me in this one random seat, I waited by the pick up window staring at all the German tourists in their capri army pants and black socks in crazy sandals... Enough said. 

The burger was OK, it wasn't bad, it wasn't great. It was a fast food burger and there was nothing fast about getting it. I ate it fast to get the eff out of there. Did not care for the fries. Sorry about that. 

You got three stars because Dr Pepper makes me smile.
author: Bartholomew K.

description: As Florida natives visiting the west coast for the first time we had to see what all the rave was about. Definitively lived up to all of the hype. Juicy, deliciousness! The fries were amazing too. In n Out is The equivalent of a Shake Shack back on the east coast. Wish we had one in Miami! Maybe one day our prayers will be answered ;)
author: Alicia S.

description:
The double double animal style is simply amazing. 
Fries animal style were really good too. However, eat it right away. If you eat it a little later and colder... it's not as good. 

Service was great too
I asked if I could get an In n Out hat and they gave us some for free!
#souvenirs !!

They need to open up some in n outs in new york.
author: Yong K.

description: I got a burger animal style here and it was pretty nice, of course I only got to eat one fourth of it until a seagull swallowed the whole thing. Nice food-threatening area.
author: Shreya K.

description: I'm not a reviewer, this the one and only review I've ever written. I am so passionate about In N Out that I had to write one. In N Out is my shit! It's my absolute fav. But this location on the Wharf was the worse. The cashier clearly did not wanna be there, but really, no on in the history of jobs, including me, wants to be at theirs ever, but this cashier made sure you knew it. You didn't get that smile, great service or fresh hot food that you are used to from In N Out at this location. The girl shouting guest's order numbers was so angry. I don't know if she was in physical pain, hated her life, or what, but she screamed numbers like a real asshole with a look on her face like she wanted to bite your face off and suck out your soul bc she clearly didn't have one - I just wanted to leave, and I wish I had. Her coworker's working in the back even called her out on her angry yelling of guest's orders and she ripped her around like the fuckin Exorcist and told em IM GONNA KILL YOU! I got my food right when they called it and my burger and cheese was cold when I came to table to eat it. Gross! It wasn't even busy in the restaurant.  When I went up to ask for spread it took as long as it does at a busy bar to get it because everyone ignored me. An old man was waiting before me, as the Demon Shouter worker walked right by him he asked her for help and she passed him behind the counter pretending not to hear him. There was only on worker there that day that had a smile on his face. I will never back to that location.
author: Helen P.

description: Went back again b/c actually was nearby the wharf.  Crazy busy on a Sunday evening.  Miserable time waiting, plus it was really drafty inside b/c people kept going in and out of the side door where I sat at the end of the wait bench w/ everyone else getting antsy as they all kept looking at their receipts every time an order # was called as if they'd miraculously moved up in the queue.  Anyway, got my order totally wrong, didn't even include the burger additions like lettuce, tomato, onion that are standard on one of them, then toasted the buns when I said not to.  The fries were underdone again, the burger patties mealy and chewy, very overcooked on the grill.  I think the kitchen and assembly crew just don't pay a whole lot of attention when you make special requests.  It probably just confuses them inasmuch as they'll likely screw up your order even when you don't.  They're just slinging out the tickets, hit or miss, and it will never be quite right for one reason or another if you are at all picky about such things.  It's just fast food minus the "fast" part.
author: Rose B.

description:
I loved In N Out ever since I found out about it in high school and enjoyed many great Double-Double (sometimes 4x4) with animal fries.  Ever since I became vegan a while back though, I obviously had to give those up however I still was able to enjoy their burgers and fries by customizing it right and it became a very suitable (and much cheaper) option for vegans like me!  The "veggie burger" on their secret menu are really good and here are tips on ordering so you can get the most flavor out this patty-less burger.  Even if you're a carnivore, you should definitely give this a try!

 So how to order a great VEGAN burger.  Order the "veggie burger" with:
- Extra everything (you get more lettuce and tomatoes)
- Ketchup + Mustard instead of spread
- Onions grilled and chopped (a must!)
- Add chopped pickles
- Add chopped chillies

All of these add-ons are free and the veggie burger came out to be just $2!  Add fries and a cup for water + lemon and your whole meal is under $5 with tax included.  Since I don't work close to In N Out anymore and I can't just live on veggie burgers, I don't go here as often but whenever I'm around the neighborhood I definitely go out of my way to stop by and be the weird guy who makes so many order requests for a patty-less burger! ;)
author: Green C.

description: This used to be my favorite place to buy a burger.  I always ordered my burger medium rare.  Laws were passed, and they would not customize the cooking time.  Well done is the only way they were allowed to do it.  Two days ago I ordered a double double.  When I picked it up to eat it, I saw black around the edges of both patties where they had been overcooked.  It was hard to chew an overcooked hamburger patty - no flavor AND tough due to being overcooked.  I am through going there.  I remember how wonderful it used to be when I could order a medium rare patty that had flavor and moisture in it.  Those days are gone, and I am never going there again.
author: Bj B.

description:
I had to wait for almost 10 years to go back here. I have been dreaming about a double-double, I have been craving it, I have been trying to find anything like it in Europe or anywhere else in the world but I knew all the time that it would be a mission impossible. I think I scared off some of the folks in my group with my religious worshiping of In-N-Out Burger that took place right before we went there. After looking at their smiling faces when they had their first bite everything was good again though.

Its hard to tell why this is the best burger out there. Is it the meat, or the cheese, or all those fresh veggies? Is it the sauce or just the funky sign? Nobody knows and nobody cares cause when you eat that double double animal style its a five minute trip to heaven. Whats also remarkable about the food is that you actually dont feel like crap for hours after such as with any other fast food chain out there.

Only thing one COULD complain about (and I wont cause it would be frivolous) is the quality of the fries which is barely average. So my advice, skip the fries, and get two double doubles instead.

I might have to wait another 10 years for the next round, but I will be patient and when it happens I will once again have that smile of pure joy and happiness on my face.
author: Andreas R.

description:
A busy little place in the middle of Fisherman's Wharf.  We got a couple double-doubles, 2 fries, X-large drink and a milkshake half vanilla half chocolate.  Really friendly serivce - thank you!  And luckily we snagged a table for 2 - double thank you!  We thoroughly enjoyed our food being from Southern CA and this being the only In-N-Out in San Francisco.  Normally restaurant chains might raise their prices to compensate for the high rent in Fisherman's Wharf -- but In-N-Out is a class act: their prices are the same here.  They are so busy at this location, I don't think they need to worry about their business anyway!  They do a good job at moving their customers through the register section and waiting for our meal did not take too long - impressive!  

As much as I like this location though, could you please consider possibly opening one near Union Square - hint hint.  ;)  ?
author: Maile N.

description:
Gotta have it. You either love it or hate it but either way it's an institution. 

Try the Burgers :)
author: Michael N.

description:
No Stars 
My first time at an In and Out Burger restaurant and I am NOT pleased. 
The toasted bun was hard as a rock on all edges of the top and bottom bun.  Had to pull it off so I could eat.   The patty was paper thin.  
If this is what In and Out is supposed to be, I can't imagine ever trying it again.  Did I just experience s bad burger?
Maybe other locations are better?
Not impressed.    Should have gone to Fisherman's Warf for fresh seafood.  
BTW, I had to add a star or this wouldn't post.  So now I take back the star!
author: J L.

description:
As some background I'm from the Midwest, and a first timer. I have gone to school with several locals to California that swear by In n Out as "live changing" or "the best food you can get while your out there". To my disappointment it was just extremely crowded and underwhelming. The price point was set extremely low for the very touristy pier 39 area. The double double was just that, a double cheeseburger. While the food was not bad, I can honestly say that it had absolutely nothing over a major fast food chain such as McDonalds in every single regard.

To my surprise the entire time we waited the line to order was out the door. Overall, while not bad, it did not live up to any of the hype that I heard in any regard.
author: Brandon J.

description:
I've tried to believe in the hype for in-n-out. I really have. I've never heard a California native speak more fondly of a regional exclusive than this, but at this point the only conclusion I can possibly reach is that they speak so sarcastically; as if it's quality is so overrated that it's become an in-joke between Californians to just keep the hype going despite the fact that there is quite literally nothing special or even good about In-n-Out. 

The buns are as if they were cookie cuttered from a massive piece of bread from the discount store. The patties are mass produced, lacking any distinct flavor. The sauce is an unimaginative combination of some form of salad dressing and mayo. The fries are tasteless without the various secret toppings. The dining room is, at this location, always packed and crazy loud; I'll forgive this negative though given the tourist presence at the wharf. 

The only redeeming star is that in-n-out appears to be aware of their low quality *everything* and doesn't pretend to be something they aren't. Prices are cheap by any standards. 

There is nothing about in-n-out which would make me choose it over a comparable fast food restaurant like McDonalds; that is to say, I would choose either of them rarely.
author: Michael H.

description:
My first (last?) In-N-Out Burger experience! One Animal Style Cheeseburger, please! Skipped the fries as the calorie count nearly knocked me over but heck, maybe I should have just gone for it. 

So cheap and so delicious... the texture of the bun was perfect... actually preferred it to NYC's beloved Shake Shack. 

Don't let it stop you from visiting but there seemed to be a larger concentration of homeless people in this immediate area since it's tourist central. While I was eating my burger some random guy wandered in, had a minor tantrum in the condiment area, and walked out.
author: Rachel H.

description: Best goddamn burger out there. Almost a California tradition now. The only drawback is that the bun could use some improvement. Feels kinda low-quality and dry. 5-star nonetheless cause they just 'GET' the patty.
author: Ganesh K.

description: This was worth the hype.  My friends have been telling me that this was a very good burger.  It is very similar to a What-A-Burger for those of you from Texas.  I wish there was one near me.
author: Janae N.

description:
Sorry, California. In-N-Out is just ok. This is not on the same level as Shake Shack or Five Guys. The burgers are marginally better than McDonald's, but the animal fries are pretty great.

I am sure someone reading this will be fuming because I didn't order the super secret amazing menu item, but I maintain that a burger place should be primarily judged on their main burger offering.
author: Wilson C.

description:
Awwww DEFINITELY FAV BURGER EVER!!!
In-n-out is literally the best. 
Tried it first time two years ago in Silicon Valley and then fell in love with it. 
The protein style burger and animal fries are unbeatable! 
The location near pier 39 is awesome. The deco is quite different from other in-n-out, but the taste is good as well. 
Waited for like 30 minutes, but very understandable.
Can't wait to go to California and have in-n-out again. definitely a must!
author: Yuki Z.

description:
It's a crime that this is the only In-N-Out in SF and a pity it's in the fisherman's wharf area, a location I try to avoid because of the tourist mobs.

In-N-Out is great, but it's not life changing. It's a California staple, not a delicacy. I can't really handle how overcrowded this location is, and watching tourists take exorbitant numbers of pictures of their burgers makes me gag a bit.

The food is great as usual, but there's no drive through, there are longer lines, and the location is inconvenient.

If you live in California, you probably shouldn't have to suffer going to this particular In-N-Out. You'll get other chances elsewhere. :)
author: Bryce A.

description:
It seems like every time I go somewhere, I end up getting In-N-Out. Isn't that sad?

We came here right when it opened. They'd just started up the grill and when our food came it was AMAZING. The bun was a little crispy, the meat was perfectly cooked and so juicy, and the chilis I had added to my burger were fresh-tasting and so flavorful.

Also, they were really generous with the fries. It was like Potato Mountain on my little red tray.

Even by In-N-Out standards, this place is fantastic.
author: Megan M.

description: What happened to In and Out!  The last time I came here, there was no one taking orders.  Now the person taking orders has an attitude!  This was my go to place, but feeling less inclined to visit.  You're making above minimum, start acting like it!
author: K M.

description: Went I went on vacation to San Fran I knew I had to try an in-n-out burger because of all the good things I have heard. It sadly didn't meet my expectations and I was pretty disappointed by the burger. It was just average and the fries were not good at all. I personally think a whopper from Burger King is better. I had high hopes for the burger. The only good thing was that you got your food semi fast for the long line, it's cheap, and fresh.
author: Sam J.

description:
I am in love with In N Out and they are only a few things that I don't like about them!
Positives:
1.Burgers are delicious and it can be ordered in a few different ways
2. Offers the worlds longest burger the 100x100 but you would need to contact their management for it i believe
3.Fries are delicious and can be ordered in a few different ways
4.They have their own pink lemonade
5.They serve coffee, if you are a coffee fiend
6.They have/used to have pepperocini packets
7.They do not judge your orders
8.They make the food right in front of you
9.They have something called animal sauce which goes either on the fries/burger and they also have packets of it
10. They serve a Neapolitan shake 
11. Their menu is small but have a bigger secret menu
12. Their food seems to be organic 
Negatives:
1.They do not make the 100x100 probably unless you had contacted the management first
2. Their normal fries are not for everybody but their animal fries,ooooohhhhhhhh Yummm !
3.THEY DO NOT HAVE BACON
4. Their patties are thin, that is why they have something that is called the double double which is a burger with two patties and two slices of cheese
5.The price for meals are mediocre and are just a couple dollars more than the last few years
6. Their numbering system for them to complete your order is all messed up
7. It may take either 15 or 20 or even 30 minutes just to get your meal
Overall: The place is the best in S.F./Cali/the West Coast if you are craving an order of burger and fries and if you also have a lax patience ! 10/10
author: Food F.

description: It is said that IN-N-OUT burger is the best burger in west coast. Ang Lee who is one of the best directors in the world also loves it. He even bought a Double-double as soon as   the Academy Award ended. There are 3 kind of burgers-burger, cheese burger and double-double. They are all delicious. The French fries are also perfect. You should have a try.
author: Nancy S.

description:
The burger was alright. Thankfully there wasn't a long wait, but I don't know if it'd be worth coming here as a "destination". I would stop by if I was in the area and didn't have any place better to eat. 

I might come back to try all the menu hacks though!
author: Nicole O.

description:
I don't get it. Are all the people who gush over this place ever tried it while not stoned...? This seems to be the "actual food" equivalent of White Castle. The fries were horrible, and soggy. The Animal fries were a mess with the cheese solidifying into a brick like mass drowned in secret sauce. The burgers were actually not bad but definitely not very good.  Not worth waiting in the huge line. 
Frankly, not much better than any random burger superchain.
author: Assaf G.

description:
I'm so conflicted.  Like, I know this is an institution and was supposedly created by God to give Westerners the beautiful gift of a delicious and cheap fast food hamburger, but I have to stop short of calling it the 8th Wonder of the World.

Realistically, it was just OK.

OK, I'll say it's good-ish, based on the category of fast food, the price point, and the taste, since similar competition is not quite up to par.

But maybe I am biased.  I ordered a cheeseburger (no onion) with fries and a water, and my burger came out with the sickest, stinky onion ever.  No matter what anyone says, that onion flavor seeps into everything (including your breath after - ick!) and, quite honestly, it ruined a lil bit of the taste for me.  The patty itself was good, and I appreciated the crustiness around the edge.  I am unsure what the special sauce was made of, but stealing a couple extra packets for future usage would have been nice.  

The fries?  Standard.  Greasy, soggy, just enough salt, but again, nothing over the top.  Admittedly I forgot to order them animal style, but I was in the heat of the moment.  I mean, when you've waited THIS long to try it and that pinnacle moment finally comes, you forget your words and make erroneous ordering errors.  Oops.

And sorry, I went with water over a milk shake.  HYDRATION.  Call me low-cal Damian, but I just couldn't do it.  

OK, fine, so maybe this review needs an "I'll be back again and will order everything the proper way" disclaimer at the end, so I will oblige.  I'll give it a second shot next time I am within striking distance.
author: Damian C.

description: Crowded but fast, your typical in-n-out, though I personally prefer the one in Oakland (somehow the burgers there taste better)
author: Mingmei N.

description:
I tried the infamous In-N-Out burger while in San Francisco and I don't understand the hype. This place was packed. The bun is soft but the patty is very thin and not much flavor. The fries are skinny as well... 

I guess the plus side is that their patties are fresh, never frozen and all their ingredients are fresh and well-sourced - from the potato fries and buns to burger toppings. 

I was told to try Animal style but I forgot..
author: Jennifer Y.

description: Forget sitting down. There are no seats and the customers being all tourists are the rudest. It's extremely loud with screaming children. Got the protein style for no bun. Hard to remember the secret menu when it's time to order . Had to end up getting it to go and take it back to the hotel after a really mean customer refused to let us have a table we politely waited for. The staff are very overwhelmed and running around frantic.
author: Ashley J.

description:
You want insanity? Go here on the weekend in summer at lunch time.   Standing room only.  Mobs of people everywhere.   The employees were calm and efficient though.  I would have been a wreck!  It was hard enough just being in there. I was frazzled. 
were out on a family bike ride and lucked out getting seating in the shade with room for the bikes but we were lucky.  Seats were scarce.
The food was of the typical yumminess you always get from an In and Out.  
By the time we left the line was out the door and down the street.
author: Gina H.

description:
In n Out does not exist in Vancouver, so I had to try it.

It's fast food.  I know what to expect - it will be processed.

And processed it was.  I can't say that I can stomach much of this type of food anymore, after eating clean for so long.  The soft texture of the ooey-gooey burger was enough to put me off, as well as knowing the damage that it will do to me.  I had a bite or two just to see what all the excitement was.

Had an Animal Style burger.
http://www.yelp.ca/biz_photos/in-n-out-burger-san-francisco?select=16dfYXpTeON8uQDHpkJ0ag#FPo2jP6sWZdNhfyXHn5fPw

Honestly, I don't find anything special about this burger.  The dressing and toppings were a bit diff but really not any better than a comparable fast food joint.  Maybe, it's because I just don't eat this kinda food any more and my palate has low tolerance for this type of food.

So three stars it is.  It's average to me.  Average processed fast food.  Once in a lifetime is OK I guess.  Wasn't terribly expensive for what it was.

The restaurant itself feels totally institutional.

For me, the closest comparable would be Dick's in Seattle.
author: Herman E.

description: Have to say it was a bit of a disappointment. Especially after all the hype I been hearing about. The burger was cooked well but nothing to brag about. My fries were very cold and taste like refried old fries, if that makes any sense. The staff was very friendly and helpful when I asked what they recommend.
author: Cristina E.

description:
We wanted a cheap, quick grab and go dinner while walking the Wharf. This is as cheap as it gets in San Francisco. It was crowded--usually a sign its good. Usually when a place does one thing, they do it well. We got the #2-- burger, fries & a coke. It was hot, fresh, and did I mention.... CHEAP. Glad we tried it. Reminded me of Freddy's or steak n'shake--for east coast people's reference. Would be good for kids. 

This is not upscale or unique, when you pay $6 for a meal, don't expect gourmet!
author: Shana V.

description: Best double burger in entire US. I am from east coast and have recently moved to west coast. Absolutely loved it. Nothing beats this. Must have shakes. Although I would love to see straw with more width.
author: Chintan T.

description:
How San Francisco only has one In-N-Out Burger, I have no idea.

I had, had, HAD to have my beloved In-N-Out during my vacation... otherwise, what's the point of visiting California at all?!

I didn't go as crazy as I could have with my order but I got my standard: Cheeseburger Animal Style with whole grilled onions, fries, and a chocolate shake. I believe that all good burgers should be eaten with a milkshake. I am so not in the right period of American culture.

Overall, my feelings of longing and nostalgia just crippled my senses after my first bite. Of course, I smothered everything in ketchup because I like my ketchup with burgers and not the other way around. The fries were a little light for me (I like them a tad crispier) but the rest? Ahhh#$%$%&%$*%*@#!(()@#%(^^&SDG!RJ%&$*((!!!!!

*collapses into a coma after having intense foodgasm*

How I'll be able to hold out for another year or so without In-N-Out completely blows my mind.
author: Leslie D.

description: The burgers here are good the meat is juicy and fresh but when we went the fries were hard but the milkshakes are good and so is everything else so if you're in California In-N-Out Burger is the place to go.
author: Ferinelys C.

description: Good, burgers, but not up to the hype. This is in a tourist zone though and that may be the problem.  There is always a line.  It is hard to find somewhere to sit.  Still its a good value for the area.
author: Jeff J.

description: Like always, a great quality burgers I can tell this the best burgers I have ever eaten
author: Mohamed A.

description: So delish! The cheese burger was great! I could've defiantly ate a double! The burgers are cooked fresh and the bun is nice and toasted ! The special sauce is amaZing! Overall it's a place worth going!
author: Reilley C.

description:
The infamous In N Out Burger, finally I followed your big yellow arrow signage and entered your doors.

I ordered a cheese burger, fries and a coke. It wasn't till I arrived at my table with my meal that my fellow diners told me that you HAVE to order the animal style meal. This involved a whopper like burger with fries covered in mince and cheese, like nachos, but with fries instead of corn-chips. The animal stye fries were good, but I do prefer a more classic burger and fries experience.

My meal wasn't as greasy as I predicted, just an average burger, much like Hungry Jacks, but with less flame grilled char.
author: Laura D.

description: Not nearly enough seating,especially when diners sit and play on their phones. Also I'm not sure why people love IAOB- the fries taste like cardboard and the burgers are so thin that it give White Castle sliders a run for their money for 3x the price.
author: Ed F.

description: Great all-American food, didn't feel guilty one bit as I'm on holiday!!! Great for gluttony! But super duper busy so try and be quick!
author: Audrey W.

description: Came here in early January during a road trip through part of the U.S on our way home to SoCal. It was packed but we got our food in a timely manner. Had to wait for a family to leave to get a table for my own family, but luckily we got one before the food arrived. Food was delicious as usual and the employees were very friendly and gave my kids hats and stickers.
author: Jen P.

description:
When I moved to San Francisco, I was really excited to try In N Out.  As a side note, I don't think it's comparable to Shake Shack or 5 Guys.  In N Out is way cheaper and good, but the burgers are smaller.  It's upscale fast food.  Regardless, In N Out is great.  For $5.33, it's on of the best deals in San Francisco.

Cheeseburger ($2.70):  Pretty standard.  Burger (about the size of most fast food patties, slightly larger), cheese, lettuce, tomato, onion, sauce.  But the lettuce is always nice and crisp.  No old soggy toppings ever.  A bit salty.

Vanilla Milkshake ($2.20):  Really delicious.  It's a nice mild vanilla, and the price is great.

This location is in tourist land which is awful.  People will literally stand in your way, and you will have to shove people out of the way to get your food.  The workers are so pleasant considering they serve Neanderthals all day.
author: Amanda J.

description: For a really busy in n out in san francisco. Cant really complain. Exactly what to expect from any of the in n outs. Fairly clean. Good staff. Good burger. Just be wary, this in n out can get really busy due to tourists and the nightlife. Other than that. A solid 4 stars from me.
author: Austin S.

description: Great as always. Stopped in during rush lunch time and had a bit of a wait but nothing horrible considering how busy it was. Ordered the double cheeseburger meal and shared it with my husband, delicious as usual. Staff was friendly and they were quick to clean tables.
author: Kristina S.

description:
A few years back when I visited San Francisco for the first time, I walked pass this In-N-Out. I asked my Californian friend what this was and she said "it's just fast food, like McDonald's." Since I no longer eat at McDonald's, I guessed it's something not worth going to. Not until about a year later, I learned that In-N-Out is like a Shake Shack in NYC. So I have placed In-N-Out as a must try when I return to California.

So on my recent trip to California, the first meal I had after I landed was at In-N-Out. Yes, it was that serious of a matter. When I got there it wasn't really that crowded. I ordered a cheeseburger with fries, both animal style and a strawberry shake. The burger was pretty good. The patty was juicy and tender and the sauce was pretty darn good. The fries were good, especially with animal style. The strawberry shake was very smooth and not overly sweet. The entire meal was pretty cheap.

So now that I've had my share of In-N-Out, I can truly say that I really didn't miss out too much. Yes, the animal style and the spread was good, but the burgers at Shake Shack has stolen my heart. Also, their shakes and concrete drinks are amazing! Yes, I do have to admit that one Shack burger can buy me about 2.5 cheeseburgers at In-N-Out. It's not that I dislike In-N-Out, but I think all the rave and hype about In-N-Out has been a let down to me when I finally gotten to try it. Well at least I can cross this place off of my food bucket list!
author: Sandy C.

description: Waited FOREVER to get our burgers.  We were visiting SF from New York.  We don't have In-N-Out in NY!  Shame because they are the best burgers I've ever tasted.  Kudo's to west coast.
author: L W.

description:
Usually really busy but get their food out ASAP. Last night they gave us a soda cup of coffee, not a coffee cup. It was blazing hot, my boyfriend burned his hand. My boyfriend went up to ask for a cozy( coffee slip) and returned with a cup carrier (4 cup cardboard box carrier). Then I burned my hand. I went up to ask for a cozy and was told no, they don't have any. How do you sell hot coffee and not have coffee slips?? I then asked for another cup, the girl told me she could only give me a plastic water one. I told her no, we already had one around the coffee cup and it isn't helping. She rolled her eyes, got out a coffee cup, slid it under another customer ignoring me completely. Which is fine. What isn't fine is their lack of customer service training. Something like this shouldn't happen, especially after a customer is telling you they got burned.

Too much ego for her own good. Bummed I had to experience this here.
author: Anna B.

description: Keep in mind THIS IS FAST FOOD! Don't expect anything gourmet or anything upscale, or anything like that. But for being a fast food chain food restaurant, the quality of their products are great. They keep to west coast to maintain freshness in their ingredients and you can watch them make their fries straight from potatoes from the counter. Ordering the cheeseburger with GRILLED ONIONS! Is something I do everytime and it is great, you gotta get the fries.
author: Alisa K.

description: I arrived at the dinner hour, so I didn't expect amazing service. The wait was long and there weren't any seats available. After some polite hovering by a table we got seated before the food arrived. The food was really delicious and not too greasy. I'd say it was worth the wait.
author: Stacie C.

description: Standard In'n'Out fare, but with long lines and poor service.  Skip it.
author: Cheryl K.

description: Wasn't as good as I last remembered. After trying out Super Duper before trying this place again, I was disappointed lol. I really wanted to love this place like the first time I had In-N-Out back in 2010 but I just couldn't. I still think In-N-Out is a million times better than Five Guys.
author: Hung L.

description:
So many tourists!

It's really unfortunate that there's only one In-n-Out in the city because if you live here, you have to trek out to tourist central to get your fix. Most days, the line goes out the door.

The food is standard and the same level of quality you find at other locations but the seating situation here is just horrendous. You either have to awkwardly hover/lurk in order to get a table or just take your food to go and find a bench nearby and eat there. 

TL;DR: Fresh ingredients, super good prices, bad wait time, and no seating available.
author: Yanni L.

description: Why cant there be an In'n'Out at home in Ireland!!! I still think about my first double double burger and get cravings! Nicest fast food burger ive ever had! After a long day of walking up and down on fishermans wharf..this place really cheered me up and hit the spot. The gooey cheese in between the burgers and the fresh crispy lettuce and tomatoes. Id replace Mcdonalds in Ireland anyday for an In'n'Out..oh why cant we :(
author: Erika G.

description:
We all know that the burgers are detrimental to your health but extremely delicious so this review is based solely on the customer service. 

The cashiers at this In-and-Out might be the friendliest fast food employees ever. I've never had someone serve me a burger and also ask me how my day was going until I came here. While waiting for my meal I heard a cashier wish an older lady a safe flight home. What is going on here?! I think I might come here for moral support when I'm feeling down.
author: Nick K.

description: So me being from the east coast I can finally get to try in n out burger. The burger was amazing, the sauce the patties buns the whole nine yards. The burger was picture perfect, and the fries were a bit of a disappointment. To small greatly salted but not my kind of fry. Even if the animal fries were ordered or not, they are not my kind of fry. But over all good food.
author: Elfego S.

description: Cali is known (apparently) for in n out burger so me and my husband made sure to go. "Animal style" is recommended for both burger and fries, it includes thousand island, grilled onion and cheese. This option is not on the menu so be sure to mention it when ordering if you want it. Good burger joint, fast service but this one is right in fishermans wharf which is super touristy so have a little patience but it will be worth it! Outside seating in the middle of the square/plaza is available and is nice to eat there
author: Josephine L.

description: Came here last month but before that dont remember when was the last i came to an in and out burger. Had the cheeseburger and and small drink. Boy their burger was so good. This place was so busy especially that it was in the fisherman wharf area and it was on a sunday too. Only came here since its cheap and i was hanging out with a friend. Since it was so busy that my friend and i had to find somewhere else to sit. Wouldn't come here again because of the business and i rarely go to this area.
author: Julie N.

description: Amazing food!! But get ready to wait for food and good luck finding a table. Save calories and pass up the fries they aren't very good on the stale side
author: Sanda P.

description: It's a lot busier than your usual In-N-Out Burger since it's in the heart of Fisherman's Wharf.  No matter.  The location may by different and the prices may be a little inflated, but everything else is still the same and that's a good thing!  There's nothing better than having a Animal Style burger after a long day sight seeing at the Wharf.  The only thing missing here is the drive thru.
author: Rodney H.

description:
You could have probably thrown this meal directly at my face and I'd probably still have given this place at least four stars.

This is the In-N-Out Burger at the wharf, therefore it is the one that most tourists and people who are dying to have it and are in town just briefly will get it.  The line at this In-N-Out Burger really reflects the diversity of its fans and just how far word has spread about these tasty little four-by-fours and animal style fries.  We shared a table with a young student from Korea who took tremendous care in eating her first ever In-N-Out Burger.  A few tables away a family of five applauded as their baby girl dove her fingers into her animal-style fries.  Then there were people like me, natives who were driven out of our homes by the obscene housing market and rent.  Kids who grew up on their perfectly cooked burgers, never questioning our Burger Privilege as Californians, just as we never questioned our wonderful weather or proximity to the sea or abundance of good Mexican food.

Anyway, the reason I didn't give this particular store of my favourite chain five stars is that it is impossibly crowded and the restrooms are repulsive. Like most of San Francisco, the storefront has that unique human pee smell mixed with seagull dung.  The seats and tables were all covered in stray lettuce shreads and ketchup blobs - with such a high quantity of customers lurking for the quickest available seat, I imagine the staff don't get a lot of time to clean up here properly.

However, when it gets down to it, I just really hadn't had an In-N-Out Burger in too long as I live in exile, so I ate it, regardless of my surroundings and who was watching and what I was sitting on.  And then, in the true cementing of my cross-cultural marriage, I handed my English husband his frist ever In-Out-Burger (after pulling out the veggies of course, you know how fickle some boys are).  He didn't think it was the bag of hot dog shit I'd been telling him it was since day 1, but hey, at least he ate it and enjoyed watching me destory my burger.
author: Olivia O.

description:
I absolutely LOVE In-n-Out burger. Every time I crave a burger, I will go to In-n-Out. However, this location is a bit too packed and too small. There is barely any seating, there are a ton of homeless bums that tend to drift in and walk around, and there are so many tourists that it's uncomfortable at times.

If the location were a bit bigger, with more outdoor seating, this would be an ideal spot for me to continually eat at. 

I will continue to go here when I have my burger cravings, but now prefer to drive to Millbrae's location, or South Bay to avoid massive crowds. 

Don't forget to try animal style, protein style, etc. 

TIP: You can reduce your charges by removing the cheese, or get 1 slice on a double-double to save $0.25-$0.30. Their pickles rock.
author: Albert K.

description:
We've been to this location many times. It is very busy but they manage to move you fast thru order line. There's always a bit of a wait for the food, but that's true at every in and out since they cook to order.

They keep the beverage area well stocked,,it could be a little cleaner as tourists seem a little messy here.

We usually have to eat outside in the patio because the restaurant itself doesn't have too much seating for the large crowds they get.

The food is always tasty. I get extra veggies and take the meat home. to my dog so I end up with a veggie meal.

We took the F here this morning and then walked to Ross and Trader Joes,
author: Foodlover B.

description: I ordered the double double combo. The service was very fast for the number of people that were waiting in line. The burger was better than the common fast food burger chains. The fries are fragrant and thin but not very crispy at all. There are unlimited refills for drinks. Overall, Shake Shack is better.
author: James S.

description: Not a bad place if you want to eat unhealthy food once a month. There is always a huge line and they obviously don't tried to speed up their service. The hamburgers are tasty , but far from healthy.
author: Boban V.

description:
This place was recommended to me by a couple of people. That and the good reviews encouraged me to make the trip.
In a word... or two... Fairly awful.
The burger was ok (standard cheeseburger) and they get a point for asking if i wanted onions (I didn't). But, it was also cold.
The fried were... better than some, but still tastless.
The reall downer; the place itself. Its just so low rent with poor seating areangement and huge queues of folks waiting for their orders.
Finally they dont take AMEX - which i ubserstand from small places but not from a chain.
They are cheap though.
I probably wont be back.
author: Rick T.

description: The burgers look and taste ordinary. The fries are really bad...they have no flavour to them and are hard to bite. The only good thing about it is they are really fast so if you are in a rush and looking for something to eat real quick, this is probably your choice.
author: Gemma C.

description: I'm from the East coast & what a disappointment. I hear all the hype about In-and-Out burgers & fries but give me a Shake Shack burger any day plus their crinkly fries are a million times better. This place gets PACKED cause Fisherman's Wharf. Barely any room to breathe.
author: Lily M.

description: I don't see what's the big deal about this place. I'm from Kansas City, born and raised. I know burgers! I know beef! My city is practically built atop the bones of those fallen and delicious - with a side of potato. This burger joint - in the 3 visits throughout California I've made - is disappointing at best. There is hardly enough flavor in any ingredient to their burger, their shakes are not rich and creamy enough, the fries are skinny - but better than most - and honestly, there's nothing particularly special about anything at an In-N-Out burger. I suspect they became so popular by selling sub-par burgers to a populous of dubious beef eaters with a hankering for piles of questionable custom food stuffs, who have never had an incredible burger of which to juxtapose, and thus filled the glutinous void that remained after McD's has been tried, and long forgotten by the masses of sheeple. It's almost the same thing, in my opinion. Then you hear about it on TV, from celebrities, and your local, garden-variety wealthy traveling lady-friend, and you now must throw down 10 bucks for a pile of, Meh. Never going to return. Animal style, really? Get your act together, California.
author: Matthew C.

description:
I've tried Shake Shack in New York City however I am still obsessed with In-N-Out Burger. I came here twice on my three day min vacay in San Francisco - that's how much I love this place.

The buns are delicious, the patties are fresh and the veggies are crisp - you really can't go wrong with In-N-Out burger. I usually get my burgers and fries animal style which makes them more tastier!

Don't be afraid of the line-up in here, the staff here operate very efficiently like well oiled machine. They are extremely efficient at getting your orders in and then getting your orders out to you.

The only negative that I can think of here is the washroom are a bit of a walk from In-N-Out so make sure you buddy up if you are walking to the washroom in the plaza area at nigh time.
author: Whitney B.

description: My dad liked it. i wasn't a big fan.  this one was a little dirty
author: Lily C.

description:
In-N-out has by far mastered the hamburger.

All though they only have 3 choices on their menu - hamburger, cheeseburger or double-double, I believe the minimum selection provided is the reason for their success.

With only having three choices on the menu, they are able to put all their effort in hamburger making.

Their hamburgers are consistent no matter which in-n-out you go to. The meat is top quality, their fries are freshly cut and their buns are as soft as a pillow.

The best part of the hamburger is that you don't feel disgusted after eating it and it's by far the best hamburger I've ever eaten.

I am a regular customer and will continue to frequent this chain.
author: Adam F.

description:
This review is only in relation to this particular location, because we all know how amazing In N Out is.  I recently visited this location, and was fully aware that it is one of the busiest locations In N Out operates. But when you have people visiting California, In N Out is definitely a must stop. 

While waiting for our food (in what feels like a sardine can with the amount of people waiting), we finally ended up finding a table. When my number was called, I had to push my way through the crowd to get the food, again, expected. However, when I came up to the counter for my food, the clerk would not give me the food without my receipt. Here's my problem with this: 1) No one ever told us to keep our receipt when we paid, and I don't typically do this at other locations. 2) When he realized how far away and through the crowd I would have to walk to get back to my table to LOOK for a receipt that I wasn't even sure we kept, could he not have just asked me what we ordered? I could have told him item by item exactly what we ordered. When I asked him if it was necessary for me to go back and search for it, he said yes, it is In N Out's policy, and he was quite rude doing so. My issue is that either this is the policy, or it isn't. No other locations make you show proof of purchase to pick up your order, so why the insistence? Either way, I pushed my way through the crowd to our table, ended up finding the receipt after digging through my stuff, and pushed back to the front to get our food. When I stepped up to the counter with a piece of paper in my hand, he gave me the food. He didn't ask for the receipt, he didn't even ask to look at it. So all of that work, for nothing? He was rude for no reason?
