Overall, it was a really crappy experience. It would have been no big deal if the cashier had told us to keep our receipt to pick up our food. Simple fix.
author: Shauna S.

description: Eh this was so so, I tried it because I was visiting and wanted to see what the hype was about. I wouldn't probably go back again. My burger bun was filled more with lettuce tomato onion then a burger. They saying "where's the beef?" Is appropriate. I tried it and that's that. The prices are inexpensive also a combo meal is a cheeseburger , fries. And medium drink for $6.89.
author: Amanda C.

description:
I tried In-N-Out while visiting the area from out of town. I came on a Saturday afternoon so it was packed. The service was pretty fast despite the line. Honestly, I am not sure what the big deal is...Shake Shack in nyc is wayy better. 

The burger was ok and the fries were not that great. They were on the luke warm side. Anyways, I had much better burgers at other places while I was there.
author: Becca D.

description: Best for the Chocolate smoothie and animal fries.
author: Mallikarjun P.

description: From the east coast so we had to try it! All we hear about is how good In and out burger is. We didn't have a wait at all, I think because we went around 3 pm. We both got double doubles which were good with fresh ingredients. Fries were bland and dry. Burgers were okay but nothing compared to the description we've been told. While eating on the patio there was a homeless man rummaging through their trash eating a burger out of the trash and screaming at everyone. Wasn't bad but I could of done without the hostile homeless man and the animal sauce tasted like Big Mac sauce! Staff was friendly though.
author: Morgan W.

description:
After hearing all the strong praises for months about In-N-Out from friends, my husband and I finally got to sample their fare (not once, but twice) on a recent trip to San Francisco.

A great burger and french fries at a good price. Now if I could just afford the calories as well as I can afford the food!

Good as far as fast food goes but why it's only in California?
author: Consuela P.

description: It's Saturday. Crazy busy. Line out the door. Workers happy and so are the people getting food. Good quality food you'd expect at In N Out. Impressed with this store!
author: Jordan H.

description:
The wait here kinda sucks (always like 10-20 minutes) but I think it just makes it taste THAT much better. Regardless, the wait is still worth it.

BUUUUUUUUUUT - I don't know if it was because I was hungry, but this burger somehow tasted better than what I get at the Daly City location.
author: Emily C.

description:
Traditionally I'm all about In and Out Burgers. In fact it's a tradition between my best friend and I when we hit LA that before checking into our hostel and the first meal of the day is In and Out, however, we made some plan adjustments this year and did San Fran for the first part of our trip before heading to LA (Coachella). Keeping along the same frame of tradition I needed this to be my first meal of the day. 

The burgers and fries tasted as awesome as I had remembered it to be, however, my heart is still in the LA one.

They have no washroom for the public inside even though it is packed 93 seater. The washroom you have to use is a public washroom a block down that you need a code that none of the staff are smart enough to inform you with before you go. I had to wait for someone to come out before I could go in.

Plus points that they now have published the calories on the laminated menu board on the wall.

To soften the calorie blow I shared a 20 point meal with my best friend,
author: Shila B.

description: Double double animal style with extra grilled onions. 'nuff said.
author: Sherry L.

description:
Like many others, I'm an East Coaster, and I was set on having my first meal in SF upon settling down at In-N-Out! This was my second time in the city, so I wasn't a total noob on the ins and outs of this place (pun totally intended).

For fast food, honestly this place beats basically every place on the East Coast for many reasons. This location in particular is impressive with service, especially on the day I was there which was the Saturday of Martin Luther King Day Weekend. IT. WAS.PACKED to full capacity, probably mostly tourists, but still, the fact that I didn't see any mixing up of orders and the rate they were pumping out the food just speaks volumes to the management of the place.

The cashiers themselves were calm, friendly, and helpful, despite the endless flock of people churning in every minute. I definitely didn't feel rushed to make a decision of what to order.

I ordered a double double special no cheese (yeah whatever I'm trying to be fat and healthy at the same time), which comes with a side of their regular fries and a medium drink. All that came out to a mere total of $7.50!!!! I'd forgotten how cheap the food is compared to NYC. Seriously, I could live here forever and not starve. You could feed an entire family for probably $20-$30 here. That's an entire mediocre entree that's bound to leave your stomach rumbling at an overhyped mediocre restaurant in the Big Apple! And you will leave this place FULL. 

You might be saying, no duh, it's a fast food restaurant. Well yeah, but the quality of this place takes it up a notch from your dingey McD's. It's Five Guys for the people who would like to save their hard-earned $$ and still be full.

While there is definitely not enough seating inside on a crowded day, it's okay because there's some outdoor seating, or you could just take it to go and enjoy on green near the waterfront. It was always sunny when I was there. 

And lastly, you probably know about their secret menu with the animal fries, lettuce wrapped burger, and other things? Try them, otherwise you haven't fully experienced In-N-Out.
author: Erik C.

description: So I'm not a big fan of this location because of it's location in tourist town, but when I came in yesterday to get some delicious food (because their food is delicious) a security guard tried to throw out an obviously homeless woman. She had paid for her burger, but he didn't even ask her or check-in with a cashier to see if she had done so. When one of the workers confirmed she had indeed bought a burger the security guard went out of his way to tell her that she smells and has to move. I can't stand people like that. She's a human being, and deserves to be treated as such. Teach your enforcers manners and give them lessons on how not to be complete jerk-offs and maybe then I'll contemplate giving you a better rating. I'll still hate that you're located in a touristy spot though.
author: Celyn C.

description:
FINALLY got to try In N Out Burger. Pretty much exactly what I thought it would be:

-Fast food style service, quick and fast and to the point
-Limited seating, but more outside if you can deal with the San Fran weather
-The Not so secret menu, got the 4x4 with my shake; didn't stand a chance

I was debating to give this 3 or 4 stars. I wish the secret menu would just be out in the open already. I like how you can just keep adding patties, but the burgers themselves aren't the best I've had. But they're just as good as Shake Shack.

Maybe serve up some beer options and some more location in the area and this goes up.
author: Shaji K.

description: We had a friend talk about this place for 4 months leading up to our vacation.  The bar was set high.  After eating In-N-Out, I did not get why he loved it so much.  Don't get me wrong, the burger was good, but not THAT good.  Fries tasted similar to any other fast food chain. But if you get to this location at the wrong time, you might be waiting in line for a while.  Guess its a good option if you are looking for something cheap and fast.
author: Ashley R.

description: Came here while I was visiting San Francisco about a year ago. I ordered a Double Double meal with grilled onions. The food was amazing like always, the only down part was trying to find a place to sit. I was literally on the lookout to see if anyone was leaving and luckily I snagged one of the booths for me and my friends. The employees and everyone here were really nice.
author: Naba S.

description: Always busy here but for comes out in a timely matter! I ordered my burger protein style (lettuce instead of bun) and no surprises. I was satisfied with the burger.
author: Lara H.

description: It's the bomb.  Get it animal style and gain 5 lbs from your expressive demand for hamburger satisfaction.
author: Chris N.

description: Great food, nice price! However, we got DISCRIMINATED by some CUSTOMERS... It was so crowded when we got there, so many people were waiting for tables. After ordering the meal, we tried to find a table for 3. There was a table taken by a family and they all finished their burger and fries. So we waited there. The father finished his coke, refilled it and sat down again. Okay, I understand that they were still enjoying their "dinner". However, when I picked up my meal, they left and gave the table to another "white" couple! We waited there for around 10 minutes!!!! So is it just because I'm not white?????!!!!!
author: 昱妍

description: Yeah.... Sorry... Not-so-much. I'll stick with my Five Guys Burger or Shake Shack or Smash Burger on the East Coast! These aren't very juicy or tasty or even a substantial sized burger..... Fresh,  yes.  But so are the others I just listed.
author: Anson C.

description: Love in n out's consistently good food and great staff. They were so sweet to us weary travelers.
author: Christa D.

description: Way worth the hype. The best fast food burger I have ever had. The fries are superb (ask for them extra crispy) and the milkshake puts Shake Shack to shame.
author: Kaylin M.

description:
My first time trying this highly recommended burger chain. I was not impressed. The paper thin burgers were good enough, not great by any means. The fries were plain and bland, tasted like they had been cooked a while ago and then reheated. The insult to injury here was the inflated prices likely due to location. 
The line to order was long, but the staff got through it quickly. Customer service was good. No problems with order accuracy or timeliness. 
The quality of the food did not live up to the hype at all.
author: Adam M.

description:
Q - "No--no words. No words to describe it. Poetry! They should've sent a poet. So beautiful. So beautiful... I had no idea."

A - how I feel every time I eat a double double, animal style

B - a quote from the movie Contact

C - all of the above
author: Garrett P.

description: Always great, cant go wrong with in-n-out. Great food quality and service. Always go with the unsalted fries for the best tasting. Location also moves lines quickly which is great.
author: Josue V.

description:
This place is way overrated, and not deserving of the 4 star rating or its high reputation. 
I don't get the hype about this place. There's nothing special about the food at all, it's your typical average burger. The meat isn't high quality. The flavor isn't strong. you just don't get much bang for your buck here, the burgers are too small and not filling. 
Burger King or McDonalds is better than this place, cuz they have more variety.
Their fries are nothing special either, they're thin and weak fries without the usual starchiness i like in my fries. 
Overall, I'm not eating here again!
author: Jim D.

description:
This is the In-N-Out Burger I go to when I am in Fisherman's Wharf. It is something you can get at an affordable price after a long stroll around Fisherman's Wharf. Their food is fresh!

5/30/2014:
Cheeseburger and French Fries with a soda - always a perfect combo for that quick grub. They do have lemonade, milkshake or iced tea available as a substitute to soda. I enjoyed my meal and I'll definitely be back. Friendly staff members, good food and good service. Outdoor seating is available - PROPS!
author: Bennett W.

description:
Really enjoyed In-N-Out a lot, for it being my first time to one. Great customer service that reminded me of other fast food chains that tend to excel on this aspect, such as Chick-Fil-A and Culver's. I have a strong suspicion for whatever reason I wouldn't have enjoyed their food as much, if it wasn't for reading up on the secret menu beforehand. And unlike years ago, one can now find it on InO's website: http://www.in-n-out.com/menu/not-so-secret-menu.aspx

It does make me a little disappointed that you can't order bacon for any of their burgers if you desire it, nor can you choose to order onion rings instead of fries from what I can tell. And even when I remembered to order the fries well done one time, it only improved their fries slightly. That said, the animal style sauce is absolutely awesome, and I wish M Burger(inspired by In-N-Out, from what I've read) in Chicago actually offered a sauce like InO's animal sauce! (correct me if I'm wrong about M Burger, Chicago area residents and visitors who've been to one) The neopolitan shake was also great(mix of vanilla, chocolate, and strawberry shakes together), and I think it'd help InO to have a second location somewhere else within SF, to reduce the crowds at this location. Agree the dining room often looked really packed, and why I always ordered my food to go each time I visited. Though honestly I admire the fact that the service was never too bad on any of my visits here, and they do seem to maintain decent service at this one, despite the big crowds it gets for being the only one within SF.

If I ever get to another InO(which I suspect one day I will), I'd like to see how their grilled cheese sandwich is like. In the end though(note I've never had a Shake Shack burger, and am only comparing it against other chains in this sentence), my verdict is that I liked the burger here more than Five Guys, but that I prefer Culver's for their burgers, and that both Culver's and Five Guys have better fries(looking at that aspect alone, sans animal style sauce). The animal style sauce is unique OTOH, and something where I wouldn't mind learning the recipe to make such a sauce on my own(lol).
author: Allan M.

description: Breh!! As a person who has only lived on the East Coast and in the Midwest so far, can honestly say I was just expecting another fast food joint, but after that first bite, man!! Great burgers, probably the best I've ever had at any fast food establishment. Fries were also good and the service was great and quick despite the number of customers. Will definitely keep an eye out whenever I get a chance to come back to the West Coast.
author: Ted W.

description: What is the race about? Well the buns are good. Generous portions of veggies.  Meat is okay. Good burger but nothing so extraordinary that warrants lines out the door.  Believe this place has more hype.
author: Arsalan K.

description:
Yeah...it really is THAT good! After arriving in San Francisco from a trans-Pacific flight late on a weeknight, In-N-Out Burger was about all that was open near our hotel. I knew I was headed there at some point in our trip, so off I went while my wife put our exhausted son to bed.

I arrived back at the hotel with a sack full of burgers - a Double Double Animal Style for me, and a Hamburger & fries for her, along with a pair of lemonades. You know how, sometimes, there's just something amazing about a good ol' American burger? Yeah, that happened. We ate our burgers in whispered silence on the floor of our hotel (didn't want to wake the baby!), smiling and nodding at each other.

The cook on the burger is perfect, the bun is toasted, the sauce is delicious, the grilled onions are a perfect compliment to the rest of the package. This is one tremendous burger!

As others have probably noted, their fries are nothing special. McDonald's blows them out of the water. That said, I would give up McDonald's fries for life in order to eat this burger again!

If In-N-Out Burger came to the East Coast, I'd eat there far too often. As it is, I'll make this a regular stop on West Coast trips.
author: Christopher D.

description: Love in and outs always quality served fast. The cheese you can order on the fries is a nice touch, and their secret sauce is pretty good. Their shakes are also good.
author: Franklin J.

description: In & Out is always the best!  Parking is difficult near this location.  It was also unbelievably busy.  The line was out the door and the only open seating was outside.  Watch out for the pigeons!
author: Kristen F.

description: Don't understand all the hype about this burger place.  Patty is small and the fries are super thin - like dried out prune looking.  Five guys on the east coast much better.
author: John L.

description:
I heard that if your on the west coast you have to try In-N-Out. This is a very late review. I visit In-N-Out back in July 2014. First time having it and I was surprised that the burgers weren't dried out and blah. The burgers were well cooked and jucy and amazingly good. I had the double double burger with animal fries.  Ask for animal fries ((cheese, onion and their secret spread) because it's on their hidden menu. 

Overall the experience was a good one. The prices are CHEAP so it won't kill your pockets. Whenever I'm on the West I'll be visiting.
author: Travis L.

description: You'd expect this location to be overpriced like everything else there, in line with the other "upscale" chains (Coldstone for example). Nope. Maybe a few cents more than other locations, but still under $4 for a Double Double. Can't beat that value downtown, and like every In-N-Out location, you're eating In-N-Out, so it's awesome. This East Coaster is thoroughly pleased.
author: Steve A.

description:
I'd go animal style on the burger but not on the fries.  Either way the burgers are way more delicious than the fries.  Whenever I'm in SF I make sure to stop here at least once.  For being a huge chain all the employees seem to be pretty happy.  

Place does get packed but you are still better off eating inside because by the time you walk to the park your food won't be hot.  Check out the courtyard in back perhaps as that is usually pretty vacant.  

Haha I did just read Kenny O's review and though I've never had a bad experience with the employees I could see that happening.  Sorry dude!
author: Tim S.

description:
I rate it... delicious. How could it be anything else?

While this location is as touristy as it gets, and I'd normally avoid Fisherman's Wharf like the plague, it's worth it for In-N-Out. Besides, if you don't make it outside the Bay Area then it's one of the few easily accessible places to get your double double, grilled onions and extra toast on. (medium rare)
author: Nick S.

description: Not as good as other In-N-Outs - the fries were not crispy and hot. There were no lines when we went, but it took us 10-15 minutes to get our meal, which is unheard of from an In-N-Out...
author: Anya S.

description:
My Californian classmates would always rub In & Out in my face when discussing if Cali is the best state. I would be lying if I said I wasn't curious. So during my spring break I went to Cali, dropped off my luggage at the hotel, and sprinted to the wharf. One Animal Fry, One 2x2x later, I was convinced. You win, California.  

PS: Aggressive hobos outside this joint late at night. I know you get late night cravings, but be careful mkay?
author: Shuang C.

description:
In-N-Out likely needs no introduction.

To be clear, if it does need an introduction, you might consider not wasting time reading the rest of this and trying it now. (If you're vegetarian, well, there's still time to change.)

Freshly prepared, never frozen, burgers and fries and shakes and not much else. Yes, there is a "secret menu" but with the possible exception of grilled onions none of it is obligatory, especially for a first-timer.

How good is it? So good that China copied it at least in spirit in "Caliburger" and, doubled prices aside, didn't really get it right. This is In-N-Out. For this cuisine at this speed, it is pretty much as good as it is going to get. Accept no substitutes.

This specific location? What one would expect from tourist central in San Francisco. A code is needed to use the surrounding complex's shared stalls outside but just ask at the counter. If you're lucky, you may enjoy some additional 'entertainment' from wandering homeless if you happen to sit outside on a nice day. None of this will defer either tourists or the faithful which is why it is still busy at all hours. Unless you have similarly easy access to another location, it shouldn't deter you either.
author: Sean C.

description:
Ok so the buzz was about--and I had to check it out...to be honest I'm not sure that I get the hype; that is not to say that this is terrible, but there was nothing about this that wowed me. 

I would put this higher than say.....mcdonalds or burger king, but I mean...not really by a large margin.

The animal style added a bit to the double double but it was barely note worthy.
author: Alexander L.

description: The line was a bit intimidating, but it was worth the wait. Double Double with fries and a strawberry shake; it had been years and it tasted so delicious. I went into one of those food trances where I was just eating like OMG SO GUD and came to halfway through my food. 10/10 will eat again.
author: Kuhray V.

description: Best affordable burgers on the west coast. The patty is juicy and well done. The fries are crispy and aren't all black from used oil. And they have a typical selection of drinks. Really what's great about this place is the easy menu and prices. It's very straightforward to order. Only downside is the amount of people who order here during the day since it is the only in n out in the city! The lines get very long. Best to wait and order during the night if you want to avoid the lines.
author: Anton S.

description:
3.5.

Food is good. I usually order the protein  cheeseburger, but i hate how its the same price as a cheeseburger with buns. Everytime I come here, I feel like the food portions get a little tinier....

CON; THE PLACE IS SUPER SMALL, NO SPACE, and sitting outside with seagulls n pigeons wandering around, eyeing your food    is horrible. Its windy n cold, they need to make this place bigger or open up another in n out in sf because this just wont do.
author: Josie D.

description:
There's no denying that In-N-Ouit makes a great burger but there's also no denying that it should not be compared to the likes of Five Guys or Shake Shack. This would be like trying to compare an Acura to a BMW. While both make great cars, you can't really compare them head to head as they're not quite in the same class (albeit almost).

I'd consider In-N-Out to be more of a traditional fast-food burger similar to Mcdonalds, BK, etc. Within this class, In-N-Out completely dominates the competition as they make great burgers that are juicy, never frozen and topped with an amazing big-mac-esque sauce.

However, I just don't see the merit in comparing it to the likes of Five Guys or Shake Shack. Five guys is in that space between a fast-food burger and a gourmet burger while Shack Shack is on the cusp of full consideration as a gourmet burger.

Eitherway, In-N-Out is damn delicious but I'll still take Five Guys anyday!
author: Michael S.

description:
Even people that have not been to the West Coast have heard of In-N-Out Burger.  The unique chain offers some of the top fast-food burgers in the country.  Though the menu only specifies standards like a traditional hamburger or cheeseburger, there is also a secret menu that allows insiders to customize their meal.  For example, the Protein Style replaces the bun with two substantially thick leaves of iceberg lettuce.  This preparation is messier than the usual version, sending meat juices and their special sauce dripping from all angles.  Though one might need to run and wash their hands after eating, at least they can take pride in the fact that they chose a healthier route.  The burger patty itself is thin and lacking the fire-grilled smokiness of Burger King's version, but the well-seasoned meat is still flavorful.  

When on the West Coast, definitely stop into a In-N-Out Burger.  This particular location is right in the heart of Fisherman's Wharf and provides a decent number of convenient dining tables.
author: Alison C.

description:
No trip out West is complete without a stop or two at In-N-Out, a wildly popular and cult favorite eatery.  Don't be fooled by the fact that this is a chain and has a distasteful fast-food vibe.   You can guarantee that you will get service with a smile, burgers that are never frozen and fries that are actually cut from fresh potatoes and then fried in the back (you can see this happen if you ever happen to look past the register).

In a time where quality is often compromised for price and efficiency, In-N-Out can still boast quality, freshness and a very fair price for what they offer on their menu.  Frankly, I don't mind waiting a little longer for my meal when I know that what I am getting is worth the wait.

If you do a little research on the internet, you will see that there is an entire "secret" menu aka unpublished menu from which you can take your order from ordinary to extraordinary.  My personal favorite is ordering a cheeseburger and french fries animal style, which is grilled onions and this interesting "thousand island" type dressing.  

If you do happen to feel guilty about indulging in fast food, In-N-Out does a carb free version of their burger which arrives in a lettuce lap instead of between a bun.  This is actually very tasty and a great option if you're in the mood for a lighter option.

I wish In-N-Out would make their fries a little thicker because I'm not a fan of shoestring fries, but it's the burger that keeps me coming back .
author: Antaash U.

description:
I'm a biased, NY born, shake shack lover, but I really enjoyed in-n-out. The issue I had was mainly with the fries, and the setup of the restaurant. 

The burger was 5 stars. For the price, it was exactly the kind of delicious, cheesy, greasy mess that I only allow myself to have once every few weeks. I really enjoyed it, and it's competitively one of the better fast food burgers I've had. The issue was with the fries. I did get the animal fries, and I enjoyed the sauce, but the fries were not that crispy. I'm not sure if I came on a bad day, but with the high volume of customers, I can imagine they were making fresh fries every few minutes. They were okay, but just not as good as the burger.

My other issue is with the layout. After ordering, my friend and I immediately found a seat (very lucky, at this location). But after realising that our food might take a few minutes, we got up and let someone else who had food in their hands sit down instead. The issue is ... once we got our food, we couldn't find a seat for 10-15 minutes, because people who had just ordered (and were about to wait 20 minutes for their food, during which time I could've eaten my entire meal three times) were taking all of them. On top of that, people tried grabbing seats that we were standing right in front of, with our food, when they had no food in their hands. Maybe this shouldn't be part of my review, and should be part of my memoirs on why I hate mankind, but I've seen places that disallow you from sitting without having food in your hands, and it works out probably 95% of the time that everyone gets a seat. Yes, even with a line out the door. Management could put up a few signs, and make it the norm that you can ask someone for their seats if you have food in your hands and they don't.
author: Chris H.

description:
In-N-Out is In-N-Out, so, expect the same level of food as you would at any other branch. Are there better burgers? Sure. But for a fast food joint, In-N-Out is definitely still among the better, if not best, ones.

The main purpose of this review is to note caveats about this particular location, which have to do with it being the only one in SF proper, and in the oh-so-touristy Fisherman's Wharf at that, too. What this means is that finding parking may be difficult depending on when you go, and that you should always expect it to be pretty packed. Now, the lines move fast enough - the problem that you're more likely to face is lack of seating inside the venue itself. And while there's plenty of outdoor seating in the inner atrium to the right, as you exit, on days with blistering wind, it's not the most pleasant location to be eating.
author: Johnny W.

description:
In-N-Out Burger... Hmmm.. So much pressure on this one. 

I will start by saying I think everyone hyped it up WAYY to much for me. It was a delicious burger don't get me wrong, but it was way hyped. I actually have no idea why we waited in line for like 20 minutes to eat here. Maybe because Cincy is known for so many delicious burgers that this one kind of fell off the map for me.  

This place was a mad house! It looked the the apocalypse was going to happen and this was the last thing on earth people wanted (Tourists and locals alike). After we finally get up to the line we order, my veteran friend I was with orders for me and says "Animal style of course" I had no idea what it was. Apparently it is mustard, thousand island with sauteed onions, pickles, and mayo? Idk it was a great topping though, I'm glad I got it. The burger itself was plump and grilled to perfection. I love when the outside is crispy off the griddle. The bun however, was grilled with butter, good thought, but mind was kinda burnt and made the rest of the burger taste not so good. 

The fries were horrid. I don't know how because they are fresh cut? Maybe the grease was old or something but I took one bite and didn't eat them. Looking around the restaurant nobody was really eating their fries, in fact. I saw bins, upon bins of them getting thrown in the trash. Sad all those potatoes had to die :/

Overall I'm glad I tried this crazy San Fran fad, but honestly I don't think I would go back.
author: Cindy G.

description:
I am a fan of this place.  

On the outside, it looks very simple, but you can order a lot of things not on the menu.  4x4, animal style, protein burger, etc... It makes you feel part of a special club knowing these things.  

Let's start with the patty.  It's fresh and it tastes good.  The fries are cut right there and then, before it falls into the oil.  I love this place! 

The only comment I have is the onions.  Grilled onions tastes so much better than uncooked onions.  The uncooked onions are too overpowering and kills all the flavors of the hamburger.  Next time, I'll order it without the onions.
author: Reid A.

description:
Maybe I've been in the suburbs too long--and not that used to living in the city anymore--but, I'm not a huge fan of eating while people hover over you waiting for your booth because this is a tiny location and there's more customers than seats! It's kind of an unsettling feeling to feel that you're being stared at only to look up and realize you are! 
Kind of a long-ish wait for food, too--they seem to be a victim of their own popularity here! 
While we were leaving, I saw tons of other place we SHOULD have eaten--but, sometimes you make rash choices when hunger calls!
author: C Z.

description:
I'm from the east coast and everyone always talks about must trying the in and out burgers whenever we come to the west so, here we are. 

I'm not a burger type of person so most of you might not agree with the rating. I'm only coming here because my husband loves burgers. 

We got the fries with the onions and sauce on top and it was not good at all. Mcd fries are so much better. The sauce made the fries super soggy and it was too sour and I usually like sour food. The burger was just a regular fast food burger...nothing special about it. The sauce was ok I guess. 

I guess this is the equivalent of White Castle from the east coast which I'm not a big fan of. I always end up having to go to the restroom the very next morning.
author: Nicole H.

description: In all honesty, I had the munchies, so take that into account when reading this review. Every thing taste good when you're...yeah. So I had a double ( without tomatoes; I hate raw tomatoes) and animal fries. Animal fries isn't on the menu, but you can get it if you order it. Animal fries are fries with grilled onions and some special thousand island dressing. It was good and took care of my hunger issues at  that moment lol. This is probably my least helpful review I've written on here. Ha!
author: Reginice C.

description: Dont need to explain much, SO GOOOOOOD. Cheap, super delicious. But the waiting line is super long and its always packed, can't get seats...I usually do the take-out, best burgers. In-N-Out and superduper are incomparable. Different taste. I could literally do In-N-Out everyday...sooo goooooood.
author: Heidi L.

description: Busy place. Can't beat the fries.  Diana at he's counter was great.  Always find an in n out when we're in ca.
author: Ray C.

description: This was my first time trying Inn-N-Out. It was extremely busy at 9pm when we went. There were no tables so we got it to go. I had a cheeseburger and really liked it. Their "special sauce" was really good although I'm pretty sure it's just catsup and mayonnaise. The fries were really bad & when we ate here again our trip were also bad. Stale 8 cold.
author: Erin O.

description:
I think it's the only in n out in the city. The quality is consistent, and I'm usually here when my friend needs a fix.

Because of the massive traffic (re: tourists) this seating gets busy, crowded, and dirty, but the employees are pretty competent and keep the meals coming.

Impressive operation.
author: Christophe C.

description:
It's In-n-Out Burger. The double-double animal style is a must to order, but I didn't save any room for a shake. It's as good as any of the cheesy tourist trap restaurants surrounding this place on Fisherman's Wharf. I'm not lucky enough to live somewhere that has In-n-Out Burger nearby so I try and work in at least one visit when I hit California, Vegas or Texas.

For this location the downside is that it's so popular that you sometimes can't find anywhere to sit and scarf down your tasty meal. And sometimes that popularity can mean an unexpectedly long (for fast food) wait.
author: Joshua B.

description:
As an east coaster, I have been wanting to come to In-N-Out for quite some time. The lines to order went quickly but what took a while was actually getting your food. This place was really crowded so you had to awkwardly guard tables so you could get a seat (and give people the stink eye if they tried to steal your table).

I got my single patty burger animal style (thousand island dressing, cheese, pickles and burgers mustard grilled). The burger was absolute delicious. I definitely could have eaten a double.

I got my fries well done (extra crispy). I heard that in n out fries are notoriously bad. Very glad I got my fries well done since they were indeed crispy. Makes me wonder what normal fries would taste like then...However, the fries were way too salty.

Vanilla shake was good but nothing special.

The big debate my family was having was In N Out versus Shake Shack? For me, Shake Shack wins.
author: Melissa C.

description:
I'll put my blinders on when it comes to restaurant cleanliness (the tables were a mess, etc), because you can't beat the price, taste of this place.

Double Double Animal style -- two paddies with cheese and russian dressing, so delicious, literally melts in your mouth. Add on the vanilla milkshake to round out the meal, excellent!

I've been told there are secret items not on the menu, so if you are truly interested, may be worth doing research beforehand.
author: Jess K.

description: The only In-N-Out in San Francisco.  As with all In-N-Out Burgers, everything is made to order.  Fries are from freshly cut potatoes and the beef is never frozen.  I always order animal style cuz that's what you do.  The employees are friendly, fast, and accurate.  The place is fairly clean, although often a zoo because it is in prime tourist location at the Wharf.  You may or may not get a seat; but you should probably check it out if you are visiting from far away.
author: Paul W.

description:
Seriously, who goes to California and skips In-N-Out? losers! that's who!

This place has a great hip and local vibe. The flavors are unique for a fast food restaurant, and the not-so-secret "secret menu" is delightfully fun to order off of. 

I love getting animal style anything! But do not wait to eat the fries or else they will get cold and hard and taste terrible. But the burgers are a must! MUST MUST MUST!

I never go to California without venturing here.
author: Gavin P.

description: SF and west coast classic. The deliciousness of the burgers and fries here are not to be understated. The only thing I will complain about is how the location is in such a touristy area, which sucks for locals. It's always crowded, and finding seats can be a pain. That said, it is fast food so tables are clearing up all the time; you just have to be a bit vigilant about it. Otherwise, don't pass it up.
author: Tony D.

description:
Being from the East Coast, I knew I had to check In n Out and compare it to Shake Shack.

That being said, it's completely different than Shake Shack. In n Out feels much more fast food and the patty is a lot thinner. 

Nevertheless, still delicious! "Animal style" it! I just went for the "animal style" burger but maybe I should have gotten the "animal style" fries too!
author: Carol H.

description:
The In-N-Out vs Shake Shack debate is a controversial and heated as talking to a Ron Paul fan. Or deciding the best pizza joint in NYC. 
So I graciously decline to judge the better burger and state I have better access to the famed Shake Shack. 
I finally had the chance to try the famed In-N-Out during a recent trip to San Francisco. The burger was tepid and so were the animal style fries. However, I loved the toppings on the fries- their secret sauce and sauteed onions. I will certainly be back to experience their famed shakes!
author: Doreen L.

description: This is my favorite burger place.It's clean and the food is delicious especially the fries.The service costumer is excellent. One double double, One cheese burger and French fries plus drink .....
author: Mohamed B.

description: When I learned that I would get a chance to visit the West Coast, I knew that I had to plan a trip In-N-Out burger since I have never been before. This location was the closest one to our hotel, but if I had known it was located in an area frequented by tourists then I would have chose elsewhere. This place was slammed, I had to deliberately scout a table where I could eat. That really isn't their fault, but I didn't really expect a fast food place to be the hottest restaurant in town. Anyways, the burger was really good. You could tell it was fresh and the toppings are awesome, love the sauce. I did not love my fries, they were awful. Fries were hard and cold. Mine were almost animal sans the onion, so they were covered in cheese and the sauce. I think the cheese and sauce made them edible because they were so hard otherwise. The fries made my meal to be a bit of a disappointment. I am hopeful that I can come back later in the week if I get chance at less of a busy time because the burger was good and like I said, the sauce is amazing. Lastly, employees were friendly and doing a great job at trying to keep the restaurant clean despite the huge amount of people.
author: Caroleigh N.

description:
Typically I love In-n-Out for a fast food option.
I just don't like this one that much.
Hamburgers are on par with the others, fries were ok.
But the volume of people passing through the place makes it a very chaotic place.
I think next time I'll try sitting outside and seeing if it's any better.
As I write this, I can't wait to get to one of their other locations which have more space on the interior, more seating availability, and are sure to be very good.
author: Ted S.

description: Best value and great tasting burgers, returned visits all the all way from Singapore. Animal fries and double double!
author: Caspere L.

description:
Stopped here since I was on vacation with a friend in the area.

We only had the shakes, and because all the seats were completely filled, we got them to go. Their shakes were delicious!
author: Alexander H.

description:
I need comfort food after the Pacman's loss.

A burger, fries, drinks and chocolate shake please.

Yum.

This location is good after a few at the surrounding Irish Pubs.
author: Reyz A.

description: I can't explain how f#€%+ n amazing this burger place is. A double double burger with animal fries is all you will need to achieve ecstasy for only $10! Happy eating!!!
author: Wepiha T.

description: I went here for the first time ever last weekend while I was visiting San Francisco.  I'm from Chicago, so I'm used to having Five Guys and a dozen other options in town.  The burger was good, but I wasn't impressed by the french fries.  Five Guys beats them there.  The service was a little slow as well.  I'm not very upset that they don't have these in Chicago to be honest!
author: Stephanie H.

description: As a vegetarian, you wouldn't expect me to have a great experience. This is more crowded than other ones since it's really close to the wharf, but i was showing my brother his first time in sf so it was necessary. Good service, the staff were all super polite.
author: Amaresh S.

description:
It's certainly a great place for an old school burger joint and especially as a chain restaurant. Double Double w/ fries and a milk shake hits the spot! Great price and great taste!

-1 because I prefer gourmet burgers, despite the price.
author: Michael T.

description: The cheeseburger with onions was absolutely delicious. The animal fries, however, were underwhelming given their name. Tables were dirty and service was relatively slow for fast food. No bathrooms either. Would go back for a burger though.
author: Liz C.

description: We don't have In-N-Out Burgers in Wisconsin.  I walked two miles from my hotel to go there at 10:45 am in order to have a burger and fries for breakfast.  Do I need to say anymore...?  Simply the best!
author: Bobb S.

description: Fries were good,  burgers were decent.  Not a big burger fan,  didn't see what the craze was.  The wait was long.
author: esther h.

description: I'm ashamed. I'm ashamed because it took me four visits to California until I tried In-N-Out. I was FAMISHED when I got off my flight and it took my almost an hour and a half to get from the airport to my hotel. The first thing I did after I checked in? Dropped my bags and speed walked to the nearest In-N-Out which luckily enough was a couple blocks from my hotel! I still think I prefer Shake Shack, but this burger was awesome. Just got the run-in-the-mill cheeseburger with fries. The fries were bomb - some sort of awesome seasoning on them. Definitely met my expectations!
author: Ali C.

description:
Least favorite In and Out I've been to. We visited in October and the fries were stale, and the burger was just as good as it has been at every other franchise I've been to. 

Also, in the 25 minutes we were there, I saw no one cleaning tables in the restaurant area. Not a good sign.

I love In and Out Burger, but I probably won't return to this location.
author: Pete H.

description:
Pretty good burger place if you're looking for a level above McDonalds.
Be sure to try out their "secret menu" (just google "in and out secret menu"). It's fairly crowded all the time with few places to sit.
Also, there's no washroom in the place but there is one nearby in another building.
author: XiaoChuan Y.

description:
In-N-Out Burger was a must-do for me while in California, since it's something we don't have in the midwest.  However, I never got a chance to have a burger here, only fries.  The fries were fine, but nothing to write home about.  Wish I'd gotten to have a burger!!  I'm filled with broken promises and regrets!!

In all seriousness, I was disappointed that the Wharf location didn't have more of its exterior lighting lit-up.  It was kind of lackluster and hum-drum, which was a downer. But the service was friendly and prompt and they made no mistakes, and the place was pretty clean considering the traffic they must get.  So I just have to come back someday!
author: Johanna K.

description:
I am a huge burger fan and I've heard so much about this chain over the years that I had to check it out while in San Francisco on vacation. 

It did not disappoint. 

As far as fast food burgers are concerned this is a very good choice and conveniently located near Fisherman's Wharf.
author: John M.

description: After eating a bread bowl clam chowder at Boudins and walking to Ghirardelli square, what other snack could be better before going back to the hotel.  Conveniently located to the piers.  Ordered the Cheeseburger and fries both animal style.  My girlfriend doesn't eat burgers but heard about having the animal style fries.  I ate it before but wanted her to try it and in the meanwhile I can also have a animal burger.  Cheese burger and Fries were awesome and had my stomach contempt until we got back to the hotel.
author: Reid I.

description: Oh my God, oh my God!!! There is no employee at any of the in n outs like Shayma. She helped the one taking my order and she's at a face pace all over the place with a nice attitude. I'll be disappointed if she doesn't get recognized for a title or a promotion. I'm most definitely coming to this branch again. Hummmmmm the burger made me say. Good place
author: Mahmoud A.

description: I always stop by an in and out wherever I can since I only eat it every 6 months. Food always amazing and lines always amazingly long. This spot is a tourist spot so be prepared to be annoyed. There are many people who don't know what they want, how to order, many kids running around, no bathroom, no seating, a ton of people because it is cheaper than all the other places nearby. BUT still worth it. Go early to beat the rush.
author: Angel L.

description: The only reason why I'm giving them 1 star is because I was thirsty and their soda was good.. The experience was awful.. A lot of drunk people (kids) loud and very disruptive!! Then there were at least 3 men INSIDE the restaurant asking for money... One even made sure to show people his infected finger (very gross-- especially while you were eating)and the whole place was a mess... Trash everywhere!!!! I read a sign about 63 guests was the cap... Definitely more then that in this.  This place needs some help!!!
author: Anita R.

description:
Now that I'm an "adult" I try to stay away from fast food and eat a little bit healthier.  Talk about boring!

But every once in a while when I sneak out to In 'n Out during my lunch break, I am reminded of how friggin' good it is!  The buttery, soft, warm bun.  The tender, juicy beef.  The fresh, crunchy onions, lettuce, and tomatoes.  I don't even need to go animal style... regular is just delicious.

And um, it's cheap!  ~$4

The employees are also over-the-top friendly.  I love it!

Need to do a side x side with my old favorite in NYC... shake shack!  More to come...
author: Anh D.

description:
i finally made my first trip to california, and of course it would not have been complete without a trip to in-n-out. i hate to give only 3 stars, but i think that is truly a matter of the specific site, rather than the restaurant as a whole.

i went with an experienced in-n-outer, and he ordered a double double animal style, animal style fries, and a strawberry milkshake. i was a little less ambitious and got a burger with extra grilled onions and regular fries. the first disappointment was that the shake machine was broken (which definitely contributes to the slightly lower review).

i loved the flavor of the burger and definitely being able to have the addition of the grilled onions, but the bun was not great. it was a bit dry and hard on the edges, which made me think that it was not particularly fresh. the cheese on the animal style fries was congealed, and in general both sets of fries were soggy.

i have high hopes that there are better in-n-out chains, and i will definitely try again at another location. this still beat most fast food restaurants, and was relatively cheap.
author: Jamie H.

description:
Like any good Californian, I love In N Out.

This particular location gets very busy since it's in Fisherman's Wharf.  My suggestion is to get your order to go so if you can't find a table nearby, you can walk around till you find a nice place to sit.
author: Vira P.

description:
What can you say of a place that only has a handful of food items on their menu, but it is crowded ALL THE TIME  !!     Fantastic burgers !!!  !

Fries were not very good, but the burgers are excellent....done to perfection, sauces, bun, vegetable toppings, all GOOD  ! !!
author: Robert S.

description: A carnivore's delight. Made the walk from hotel near the Moscone Center & glad I did! My first time at In-N-Out and the wait (slight wait) was worth it! Glad I walked also because the double-double, fries and chocolate shake was 1755 calories. Yikes! Advice: skip the shake & grab one instead at Ghirardelli's, just a few blocks away. Enjoy!
author: Anthony G.

description:
As good as fast food gets.

Yeah, I ordered from the "secret menu" I am just that cool, or good at googling.

The staff is nice and helpful. The food is fresh and comes out quick. No gripes. I will be back.
author: Luis D.

description: They literally got every burger wrong. Ordered w/o onions. Got onions. W/o sauce. Got sauce. No pickles. Got pickles.
author: Jason H.

description: This location is ok. Too crowed most of the time. Nowhere to sit. Have to sit outside. Long lines out the door. I will never go back to this location ever again. Instead I will go to the location in Daly City or the location in Millbrae because I will be guarantee a seat inside and I will most of the time not have to wait in line. There should be more In-N-Out Burger locations in San Francisco.
author: Isaac H.

description:
My hangover remedy is as follows: microwaved pizza rolls, water, B12, and sleep the night of the fun. The next morning, it's water with Alka Seltzer, followed by fruit and a Blue Ice Gatorade (you're welcome). 

However while I was in SF for work, I couldn't do that. Something about the Marriott frowning upon microwaving 40 pizza rolls in my hotel room. Fortunately I travel with a genius coworker who had discovered In-N-Out Burger on his last trip to SF, and wisely guided us to this neon-lit beacon of sovereignty to save us from excruciating work days of hell plagued by hangovers. 

First of all, In-N-Out is stupid cheap. One animal-style burger and one animal-style french fry was enough to send my liquor-sloshed tummy into quiet abyss. If you're a boy, you may want more. The boys I traveled with got a hella lot more. So keep that in mind if you're a hungry drunk. 

Second, get your shiz animal style or don't get it at all. You can get fries anywhere. You cannot get fries anywhere else with grilled onions, relish, cheddar and Thousand Island. Get a fork and get to work. 

Third, be prepared to wait. In-N-Out is located in tourist central and the line is always long. Short skirts and tips won't help you get your grub any faster. The food is made fresh (which means it's not a total fast food hell hole as some have described), and there will always be 15,432 people in front of you. 

And fourth, skip the shake. Sugar is no bueno on an alcohol-soused tummy. Get a water and a diet soda if you must and eat your food in-house. It's not so awesome after a 20 minute cab ride. 

Oh, and you can also eat here sober. Naturally, it isn't nearly as good.
author: Sarah V.

description:
I've been to this In-and-Out three times so far.  It's pretty good for a cheap meal, but it can be inconsistent.

Being from the East Coast, you hear a lot about In-and-Out and how it amazing it is.  I think it's pretty amazing for a fast food burger, way better than McDonald's or Burger King.  However, if you expect the most amazing burger ever, perhaps you should pick a local burger joint.  

This is as good as it gets for fast food burgers, but not burgers in general.  Also, the fries here are decidedly NOT delicious, disappointing all three times!  They are too starchy, not crispy, and bland. 

Strawberry shake is solid! -- Real ice cream, creamy smooth shake, and drinkable, unlike some of the thicker milkshakes/custards.  No spoon required, which is what I prefer.

Usual order: Cheeseburger "Animal Style", Fries, and Strawberry Shake.  (I always order this at every burger place  so that I can compare.)
author: Sue N.

description:
I don't understand all the fuss about In-N-Out.
The cheeseburger was huge and I saw the little hamburger patty buried in between the onion, lettuce, and tomato.  Didn't taste it though.
Dried out fries were okay with ketchup.
author: Al D.

description: Best fast food hamburger I ever had!  ( I don't consider Shake Shack fast food)  You can't beat $2.80 a hamburger.
author: Angela L.

description: It was awful! The food was soggy, the burger was gross, and the wait was OUT OF CONTROL. I dont mind waiting for food, but we stood there for almost 15mins for a fast food burger. I almost left, and decided to go to the counter, in front of the other 20 people that were waiting to complain. They instantly handed me my burger and fries, even though I knew there were people who ordered before me. Got outside had a bite of what I thought was going to be heaven like the last time I had it 2 years ago, and it was just plain awful. I ended up giving my whole meal, after a bite ofthe burger that I spit out and a fry, to a homeless guy outside. Don't go to this location!
author: Vanessa M.

description: The employees here are fantastic (most importantly Jason who worked until closing this morning) they're super fast, polite, and most importantly patient! We ran in at 1:28 and were fortunate enough to run into Jason who heard us out. He was incredibly polite and respectful when I was (i reluctantly admit) pushing him to keep the cash register open for four more burgers. Thankfully he heard me out and we got some awesome burgers! I think the food quality is consistent and can say I had a great burger here and at every other in-n-out I've been too. If you're reading this cashier Jason; THANK YOU again!
author: Nicole M.

description:
Animal Style Meets Ansel Adams

Best burger chain is combined with the nearby views of the bay, bridges, and skyline. Sure there are more local, artisan options in the area, but for a guy from the Midwest this is a real treat.
author: Shaun R.

description: Unfortunately it did not live up to the hype for me. I thought the place could have been better well kept. They need more seating for sure, I might have waited longer for a seat than my food. I had a double cheeseburger and animal style fries, it did not satisfy me. I didn't even finish my food - I would rather have umami or shake shack.
author: Leslie A.

description: This is one very crowded In N Out. Though the people there did a great job in pushing out orders as fast as they can. I got a simple double double for a snack. The wait was well worth! My favorite burgers have been from Five Guys, and this place in my opinion is as good as five guys!
author: Andy A.

description: The most horribly crowded In-N-Out I have ever been to. The ordering is quick, but it takes foreverrrrr to get your food. The seating is also limited and goes quick.
author: Diane Z.

description:
In-N-Out Burger never fails. It's a must when visiting places with In-N-Out. I would love to bring just a cheese burger with grilled onions back in my suitcase to Hawaii but I can't. 

We had to stop by for a bite before we headed home. The line was not unusually long. It's always a line at any In-N-Out Burger I have been to. This one was out the door. We also had to head hunt for a seat because there were people standing up like dinosaurs and eating. My husband found one and we ate and conquered and left.

In-N-Out has always been so consistent with their food. I love their burgers.
author: Cheryl K.

description:
I didn't expect an amazing burger. But, I did expect nice crispy fries which I did not receive. Also the "milkshake" was not blended in properly and was just vanilla ice cream with chocolate syrup because they didn't have chocolate ice cream... Service was good, got my food incredibly fast,, thanks to the cashier who felt bad about the shortage of the ice cream... 

Not all what's it's expected to be.

BTW, order the animal fries (Secret Menu)
author: Daisy C.

description:
This In-N-Out Burger is one of the few exceptions that I'll make after saying that I avoid Fisherman's Wharf like the plague. 

For my British guests, this was considered to be a significant highlight of their trip. I don't fully understand soccer and they feel the same way about baseball. So for 2 cultures divided by a common language, a Double Double Animal Style was all it took to maintain diplomatic harmony.
author: Eric B.

description:
Quality you can taste.

Late at night if you're looking to score a filling, cheap, delicious meal - In-n-out doles it out with a big smile. 

Frothy milkshakes, animal- fries, grilled cheese - and a hearty size animal
style burger instant fulfilling gratification was never so easy.

The only bummer is that if you're vegetarian and don't eat dairy -it can be a little tricky to fulfill your evening dining palette here.

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description:
What can you really say about In-N-Out that hasn't been said previously? If you're anywhere the west coast, eating here is a bit of a rite of passage, and just like any good chain fast food joint, you can bet your bottom dollar that each stop will taste just as good as the last... and the location here at the Fisherman's Wharf is no different. Friendly faces, tasty grub, and relatively fast service.

If you don't eat beef, be sure to rock the grilled cheese, animal style. Boom!
author: Ruggy J.

description:
Admittedly, in my 3 years living in San Francisco, I never stepped foot in this particular location of my favorite fast food chain (Sorry stand-alone Taco Bells, Chickfila, Sonic, Whataburger, it's true) for a number of reasons.

1.  Location - Fisherman's Wharf.  Don't really want to deal with tourist lines.

2.  Quality - Because of said location, I'd figure quality of In-N-Out burger at this location would be subpar.

3.  No Drive Thru - Being a lazy coon ass from Louisiana, I'm used to having never get out of my car for fast food.  Thus, I always made the drive to the Daly City location.

Now that I am no longer a resident of San Francisco and car-less, Fisherman's Wharf In-N-Out was my only option to fulfill my craving on my first visit back since moving.

After an all morning-afternoon affair of drinking in Sausalito, the ferry deposited us off back at the Wharf, what better way to shake off that drunkeness?  Surprisingly 4pm visit was relatively quick.  I always assumed lines would be long here.  Not the case, ordered within 2 minutes after getting in line, and food within 7 minutes.  Yeah, I counted the minutes before I was reunited with In-N-Out.

This was a special occassion.  That meant I went with a 3x3 Animal Style.  As the story goes with most, that ish was gooooood.  My San Francisco life flashed before my eyes (kind of like Bruce Willis' life flashing before his eyes in Armageddon pressing the asteroid killer button).

*Hug* In-N-Out...even the Fisherman's Wharf location. You deserve more loving than you get.
author: Kyle W.

description:
Always satisfies my cheeseburger cravings! I always order a double double cheeseburger with extra onions and no tomato. Remember to ask for a packet of spread so you may dip your fries and burger in, yum!

Always incredibly full with hardly ever an open table in sight. I recommend taking the food to go and eating near the pier. I also recommend you don't drive here if you do good luck with parking!
author: Cindy G.

description: I've been to a lot of in and outs but I have to say this is the best one by far. The burger is so well put together and the animal fries are evenly sauced. Seriously can't get over it.
author: Allie Z.

description:
The hamburger was delicious.

The fries were... interesting. I have never eaten any fries like these. They were crunchy like potato chips. Some people might love it, but I am not sure if I really like it.
author: Chun-wei K.

description:
I just recently popped my In-N-Out cherry. After years and years of hearing people wax lyrical about their burgers, I was more than curious. I checked the reviews and googled the secret menu, which is an absolute must: http://aht.seriouseats.com/archives/2011/03/the-in-n-out-survival-guide-we-ate-every-single-item-on-the-secret-menu.html 

I knew what I wanted: Double-double animal style with animal style fries.

The verdict? Underwhelming. It was a good enough burger with a more than adequate size, but I didn't get what all the hype was about. I left the place with my friends reassuring me that there were better burgers to be found in Five Guys and Shake Shack. Guess I'm gonna have to pop those cherries too. 

2.5 stars
author: Racquel N.

description:
I don't what it is about this particular place but I like this location much better than any other location of In-N-Out Burger. One thing I can distinguish right off the bat was how ungreasy the burger was. I can actually taste the burger without constantly wiping grease from my face for once. Service was really good but the other customers here some a little unfriendly. You kind of get the vibe that they want their burger as quick as they can so they can eat. All the other locations everyone seems to be happy to wait but not quite the same at this location. 

Would I come again? Yes I would. I'm not a fan of In-N-Out but ever since I ate at this location I am now! The best part is that its at the Fisherman's Wharf and the view around here is just beautiful.
author: Warren C.

description: yumy food. Who doesnt like great food with great customer service. Love it!
author: Porcelain B.

description:
Pros: accepts credit, same old great tasting food/milkshakes
Cons: small dining space, crowded most of the time

The location of this In-n-Out doesn't help with the congestion that you see here. Because it is the only one in SF and it is close to Fisherman's Wharf, you have tons of tourists and locals that come to eat some delicious double doubles and well done fries. My friend and I came here for lunch around noon and of course tables were a hot commodity. My advice is to start looking for a table immediately upon arriving because if you wait until after you order and receive your food, you will either end up eating standing up, or just end up taking your food to go. Service was typical, friendly and worked hard to keep up with chugging out everyone's orders. Coming at an off time will probably be good to avoid all the problems that you may come across here.
author: Alex T.

description: My friend ordered off the secret menu - so the animal style burger and fries were delicious. This place is, obviously, super crowded. Must prey on people to grab their table when they leave. But if you want a California in and out experience, go here.
author: Stefanie S.

description: This location is consistent with others.  Ordering is quick and polite.  The wait is a little long but you can tell everyone is working as quickly as they can.  The food is simple but tastes great.
author: Joel L.

description:
Im not even sure why I havent reviewed this place earlier. I must have been here more times than I can remember. And it is consistently good every time.

And I can get into arguments about when makes inNout great. Fact is each bite has just the right amount of juicy burger, melty creamy cheese, condiments, and enough bun that completes the bite without over drying the taste.

There is nothing quite like having an inNout burger in one hand and munching on a few animal style fries. Delicious.
author: Jerry K.

description:
Delicious and convenient as always. In N Out is at Fisherman's Wharf! Service is quick and friendly.

Cheeseburger w/ onions is tasty as usual and patty is on the smaller side. 

Fries came out zesty hot but cooled down rather quickly...

...wait for a burger ~ 5-7 minutes.
author: Derek S.

description:
My first In-N-Out experience. I see now why it's the first stop out of the airport for a lot of people. I wouldn't say it's the best burger I've ever had, but it's up there. The fact that everything is fresh is awesome. I also gained a lot of respect for the workers here. Everyone was very quick, efficient and professional, whether they were cleaning up in the seating area or taking orders at the registers.

When we were placing our orders, they were calling out numbers in the 20s... my order number was 70. Holy cow. I ordered my burger with the spread on the side and grilled onions... the girl taking my order had trouble with her register halfway through, and as a result, I didn't get the onions, and had to ask for the spread when my order was called. I've never liked thousand island dressing, but wow, In-N-Out has made me a convert. I don't know if theirs is just different from others I've tried, but it was delicious on my burger. I'm a believer now! Even though this place is ridiculously busy and slightly claustrophobic, I really enjoyed my lunch.
author: Cherine A.

description:
Great burgers! Must get the animal style fries! 
Enjoy!
author: Mau V.

description: This food is good. The only thing I did mot like is there are tons of people here. Hard to find somewhere to sit
author: Veronica D.

description:
Nom nom nom. Delicious burgers, but I've had better fries. A little secret, you can also get it "animal style," "2xmeat," "2x4," which adds more zest to your burgers and/or fries. 

Personal fav, animal style = mustard cooked beef patty with pickles, cheese, and grilled onions on top
2 xmeat = 2 beef patties, no cheese
2x4 = 2 beef patties, 4 slices of cheese, max you can get is 4x4

Animal style fries = everything like the burger, but on fries.

Try it out, you'll probably like it!

Warning! Don't eat outside... the birds will get to your food faster than you will.
author: Melissa N.

description:
I walked the earth for 32 years without sampling In-N-Out Burger.  And after my first experience, I suppose that wasn't quite the mark of failure I thought it was.

Despite lugging around a full stomach, I saw the big yellow arrow and had to indulge.

The burger was a mixed blessing.  I loved the beef, but it was quite thin.  The onions and bun were good.  But I really didn't need 8 inches of sopping wet lettuce in my burger.  Over the course of my consumption, the burger deteriorated and my hands got wet.  No need for that.  I contemplated taking another stab and asking them to hold the tomatoes and lettuce, but then the burger would be approximately 3 millimeters tall.

As for the fries, they tasted odd to me.  They were the same texture on the outside as the inside.  I prefer having a slightly crispy outer coating hiding the mushy potato within.  These are mushy from the moment your teeth hit them.  Odd.  I wanted to like them.

The milkshake, however, was out-of-this-world awesome.  If I go back, that would be my main reason.  Sorry, Californians.  This Midwest boy will not succumb to your mega-chain's charms... except for that wonderful milkshake.
author: Ben B.

description: Tried this for the first time and it was great.  It was not very greasy or anything.  The fries were great.  I am ready to eat here again
author: Leala E.

description: It's a big West Coast chain, which is probably the only reason its not five-star review.  This location sees tons of customers almost all the time, yet it keeps pace to deliver promptly without compromising quality.  I've moved on from animal style to protein style to enjoy those double patties without a tasteless bun getting in the way.  Enjoy it whichever way you prefer and check the web for their "not-so-secret" menu!
author: Michael F.

description:
People need to calm the fuck down about this place.

The food is cheap. Burgers are decent, but did not wow me.

After hearing about all the hype around In-N-Out for so long, I spent about two hours walking in pouring rain and riding in stuffy/gross buses to/from Fisherman's Wharf all because I was expecting In-N-Out to have the holy freaking grill burgers.

I ordered a cheeseburger, skipped out on the fries because the guy at the counter told me it wasn't worth it.  I waited in line with about half a million people (though fairly quick service) in the tiny restaurant where you basically have to fight for an open seat.

A bite into my burger, not bad, but didn't feel any magic.  A few more bites in, oh, it really doesn't taste much better than a burger from McDonald's.  And McDonald's would kick In-N-Out's soggy/bland fries' ass.

As for the secret menu, my friend got the Animal Style.  It was just extra all the ingredients in your chosen burger with a complimentary faster supersizing rate for your body.

Five Guys does it better.
author: Tian Q.

description: Simply the best fast food hamburger place out there. Everything tastes fresh and delicious. The meat's cooked into perfection, the sauce's perfect and the cheese will just melt right in your mouth. I highly suggest the Animal Style = extra spread, pickle, grilled onions and mustard fried onto each patty. Oh yeah make sure you order the Double Double. Just like the name suggested, it's double the meat, you can't go wrong with that lol.
author: Robert C.

description:
This was my first experience at In-N-Out Burger, and it was just okay. It's definitely one of the cheapest options around Fisherman's Wharf! I received my food about 20 minutes after walking in the door, so it wasn't as quick as I'd expected. The girl at the cash register was definitely a pro, so it was fun to watch her while I waited.

My double-double burger and fries were certainly better quality than a place like McDonald's (although it's been awhile since I've been there), but not as incredible as my west coast friends have made the food out to be. It seems to me that if you don't eat the fries while they're hot, they're a lost cause. Also, as painful as it is, I'm glad the calorie count is on the menu - at least I was able to do a little bit of portion control :)
author: Jessi M.

description:
I enjoyed the burgers but the fries were subpar, which is why I am only giving 4 stars.

If you are planning to eat here, please also be aware that this place gets very crowded! The wait for your food and for a table is long. I came around 4pm and when I placed my order, I received an order number of 42-- the order number being called out during this time was #8!
author: Jennifer C.

description: Does not live up to the hype; one of the biggest let downs I've ever experienced. Coming from Canada, everyone tells me 'you NEED to try in n out!!!!'. It's as if this the staple of San Francisco burgers. Before coming here for an internship, the first paragraph of my intern guide mentioned in n out as a must go. In retrospect, I wonder if it's just a troll post. I ordered double double and double double animal style and it was absolutely one of the most underwhelming experiences ever. Like seriously guys? It tastes marginally better than MacDonald's. Marginally. Fries are significantly worse. Maybe if there was no hype, this place could be a 3. I'm sorry guys, the hype needs to die or y'all need to go out more. Actually never mind, I'm going back to Canada and telling all my friends this is the best burger place in San Francisco. They, too, can have the most disappointing burger experience.
author: Michael Y.

description:
Located in Fisherman's Wharf this In-N-Out is located in a prime tourist location. Be prepared to be hovered on! Lines and a mad dash for a table await you. 

When in the west coast, a burger from here is a definite must. Although a fast food chain, you won't find any frozen patties here. The wait is definitely worth it as everything is freshly made. The veg toppings were generous on my cheeseburger and the fries had the perfect crispiness to them.

This chain definitely rivals their east coast competitor Five Guys and all your typical fast food chains that shall remain unnamed. I am not one to eat fast food but will definitely be exploring the menu.

Next visit I will definitely try their "secret menu" and the animal fries to see what all the hype is about.
author: Evelina P.

description:
I didn't realize I ordered the Christian burger & fries. Bible passages on packaging? 

Fresh Ingredients is a nice change though.
author: Zack L.

description: Always a pleasure to stop by In N Out and chow down on amazing burgers and fries.  NOW IF YOU CAN JUST OPEN ONE IN HOUSTON PLEASE!!!  Lol.  Sorry for the rant, but Texas has one in Austin, San Antonio, and Dallas, why not H-Town???
author: Gabriel M.

description: Your Yelp says you close at 1:30am and it's only 1:20. You are assholes. Get on your crew at this location because this is the 3rd time this has happened. There were 5 people waiting outside who read the same thing. At the very least your degenerate staff could acknowledge people waiting at the door.
author: PJ L.

description: Well, fresh, fast animal style cheeseburgers!! YES PLEASE! This place, can't come to San Fran without stopping here! On a nice sunny day it's super crowded bit outside to the right there's extra tables.
author: Zoranna C.

description:
Best fast-food burgers! Everything is fresh and of high quality! Create your own burger by using the secret menu (look it up on wikipedia). It always take a 3x3 which is pretty massive!

Definitely a restaurant you have to go to at least once in your lifetime ;)
author: Laurens F.

description: I LOVE In-N-Out Burger!  This location has nice large windows and there was a lot of light.  The place was clean and the food was quick and delicious.
author: Denise B.

description: It's a chain so you know what you are getting. Best deal in Fisherman's Wharf. Not saying much since the surrounding restaurants have entrees starting at $13. I ordered my double-double animal style, fries, and choc shake to go and are on the nearby pier with views of Golden Gate Bridge, Alcatraz, and the city skyline. Magnificent. All for $8.
author: Dr. Snarkenstein Y.

description:
I loved this place. The food was good I suppose. I wasn't used to the freshness of fries or the food. I'm used to eating Mc Donald's more. But I think I can get use to it. Also the employees are energetic. 

The only thing I didn't like was the the huge line an crowd. There's no seats in the restaurant cause there so much people.
author: M L.

description: This is for all of the tourists that are misinformed & whose tastebuds are out of order.  There is simply nothing better than biting into a delicious double double with grilled onions.  There is nothing more exclusive than ordering a delectable item from the secret menu... If you rate in-n-out less than four stars... Go home, you're drunk  \m/ \m/
author: Lola A.

description: Good food, quick and friendly service. Regular fries were bland but animal style definitely helped.
author: Pia V.

description:
Double Double Animal Style, small fries and a water. Basically, this is a right of passage and everyone is invited. What's not to love about a gigantic "chain," if you will, that serves up a killer burger, fries of all kinds, and other goodies for DIRT cheap. Think my bill came out to less than $6. No joke. You really can't wrestle with a price like that. 

It's a family-owned biz. This location is small and right along the water. Do yourself a favor and check this place out, and any of their other locations if you ever get a chance.
author: Benjamin G.

description:
I had high expectations because of the Internet fandom that In-N-Out has. 

It was about 10pm and the place was pretty packed. Double double animal style was solid, but not mind blowing - noticeably higher quality than your regular fast food burger. Animal style fries were the highlight, followed by a neapolitan shake. The staff did as well as they could to cope with the crowd. Not enough seating here!
author: Danny W.

description: Down here in Texas we have this chain called Whataburger and it's pretty much the same upside down burger with a pattie or 2 char grilled with that blackness on the edges.   Thank you to my fellow Californians for rebuking MC'ds and seeing the burger light at the end of the tunnel.  It is better indeed.
author: Greg D.

description:
was so excited to go to the westcoast and have an in-n-out burger, it was dissappointing. THe burger was so small, it reminded me of the old wendy's commercial "where's the beef", well its not at this place.
the fries were typical fries, kinda dry..i like Shake SHack better, sorry guys.
2 days later, we went to Johnny Rockets on Jefferson, since we never had that either, We preferred Rockets, so many reasons,  it was hot, fresh, tasty and so freaking juicy, we had to use so many napkins, like at 5 napkin burger.
author: Mary C.

description:
In-N-Out is In-N-Out. I don't see the big deal just because it is a westcoast thing.
Burgers are good, I don't care for the fries.
author: D A.

description:
This place is extremely over-hyped, I can't believe how BAD the burger was.

I had high expectations and thought it would be this magnificent burger experience but hands down, this is the worst burger I've ever had since I started eating meat.

The fries (I got animal style) were ridiculously dry and skinny and tasted so bad. The animal style sauce - orange stuff - looks like thousand island dressing or some other bad tasting cheap sauce.

I'm really shocked at how bad this was and how I wasted an Uber ride coming here at 1230 AM being super excited to finally try this place people rave about. It's the morning after and upon reflecting, I now realize I wasted my munchies last night on something that can't even pass for satisfying such a low level palate at that point.

I used to dream about eating here before moving from NY and this place doesn't stand a damn chance next to Five Guys or Shake Shack. I've had waaaay better burgers in SF at other chains esp super duper and Roam who both make BANGIN burgers and fries (super duper has the freshest organic ingredients too)

Anywho, like most cherry-poppin' experiences, meh, glad I got that out of the way and it shan't happen with YOU again. Peace!
author: Mia F.

description:
I'm an east coaster, so, y'know, feel free to mock as necessary for this review, but I didn't love this In-n-Out. Compared to the one I visited in L.A. last year, this location was grungier, slower and the food wasn't as good.

Despite my feelings toward the BBOW* (I don't think it's that great -- not bad, but nothing I'd sell my mother for**) this location didn't compare to the spic 'n span version I encountered in Southern California previously, though the people working the counter were incredibly nice.
