Who wasn't nice? The guy in Teva's standing at the counter complaining loudly to his compatriot about how slow everything was and how the fries should have been out right there. I hate passive-aggressive behavior so, Mr. Laid Back San Franciscan, if you have issues with the ONLY cook doing fries, burgers and whatever else this restaurant does not having your food ready this very instant you could, y'know, tell her instead of expecting to overhear your whiny-ness.

There were free refills on soda, though. And they're open until midnight, which is much later than just about anything else in the neighborhood so if you take a late flight in, they'll help you not go hungry.

* - Best Burger of the West.

** - Unlike some Peter Luger's. Sorry, mom, I still love you, though.
author: Danny P.

description: I was visiting with my grand kids and they really want to go to In-N-Out so, I went, although, I usually don't like fast food joints the burgers here were very good. It wasn't some thin sliver of meat like most fast food restaurants it was thick and juicy like a real burger my wife would make, but a little better.  The place was bustling and service was a little to slow to make me happy but the grand kids didn't seem to mind the wait. The fries were standard not as good as from home but better than other fast food places.
author: Parsons W.

description: I ordered a burger and i ordered it with everything on.  I got my burger and it had no tomatoes or lettuce and I told the in n out employee that I ordered everything on it. She grabbed the burger with her bare hands and had a guy squish a tomatoe in my burger and put a slice of lettuce in there. She gave me the burger and I told her that I'd like a burger that was not touched and she rolled her eyes and gave that burger to another customer. The manager came out and said they'd bring one to my table and it took them 10 minutes to get my burger to my table when they weren't even busy. The potatoes were very dark in color and also cold.
author: Andradesteph ..

description: Having never been to an In-N-Out Burger and going to California, everyone back home on the East Coast was like you have to go here, it is amazing. The way they talked it up I was ready for some sort of higher consciousness to be achieved. Sadly, that didn't happen. However, it is a good burger and superior to the crap you would get at McDonald's or Burger King. This location is packed because it's at the Wharf so expect to be herded like cattle through the place. Seats are hard to come by, but it's grab and go so who cares.
author: Joshua C.

description:
Weird. Of all the good burger joints in the city, I still crave In-N-Out occasionally! Gotta have my animal style! 

This location is in the heart of the tourist area, which sucks because it's always packed and there's barely any tables. 

Then again, it's In-N-Out, of course it'll be packed!!
author: K N.

description: I've had In-N-Out before in LA. It was quite a few years ago, but from memory it was really good. However, the burger I had during my visit to this location earlier this month, did not live up to expectations... maybe it's just the location?
author: Jackie M.

description:
When is an In-N-Out ever bad? Seriously!

Their menu is so simple but the secret is knowing what else you can order. The special sauce that they smear all over everything (when requested) is so disgustingly awesome. (Also known as animal style)

I got my standard cheese burger and animal style fries. And loved every second of them. Sure you come out feeling gross and nasty and smell like grease for the rest of the day...but it was totally worth it. And I have no regrets.

The wait here is always SO long though. And I've never seen one not busy. Be prepared to wait.
author: Sarah M.

description:
It's a good place but to too many people. The place is small but location is awesome. My family came over this weekend and we ate here sort of there was no were to sit and almost no were to stand. I would never come here and spend my money because these burgers are kinda small but very delicious and I would rather go some where were you can get double the size for the same price.

But if some one invites me I will not hesitate,  but I will have to suffer the wait and time for something small and delicious 
 

Ps: they been here for a very long time and never changed. You would assume you expand and make the place bigger and more roomier. It's a must especially in that tourist location
author: Anthony G.

description: great customer service and welcoming environment, and their food was just exceptional!
author: Avalon M.

description: What else are you suppose to eat at when you go west... In-N-Out of course! Its nothing special other than you can only get this on the west coast but it still tastes so good at the same time.
author: Vanessa S.

description:
I am from the east coast.  There are not any In-N-Out Burgers anywhere near me so  I thought why not give them a try.  
In-N-Out Burger has two menu items, burgers,(one patty or two) and fries.   The patties appear to be a standard 2 or 3 ounce patty.  What does that take to cook front to back 2 maybe 3 minutes?  How is it even possible for two burgers and fries to take over 10 minutes.  I am baffeled at how slow they were.  There was a little bit of a line but they were far from crowded.  It was clear that it wasn't just my order that was taking so long.  I saw a lot of people waiting for food with me.

The burgers were okay at best.  They are not close to as good as say Wendy's, McDonalds, Burger King, Whataburger, Red Robin, Chargrill, Hardee's, Arby's, Sonic, White Castle, Krystal, Dicks, Roy Rodgers, Fudruckers, A&W, Cook Out, Jack In the Box, Morning Star Burgers from the freezer case, or Dairy Queen but the burgers aren't that bad.  
I am at a loss to understand the great reviews.  In-N-Out burgers are a thin patty of meat with onion, lettuce and tomato period.  There is little or nothing else to them.  What do all these people see in these mediocre burgers.
The bigger question to me is who are the people who can stomach their fries.  In-N-Out Burger's fries are without question the single worst fries I have ever eaten.  They are not even on par with fries you get in TV dinners.  There are god awful and that is being generous.  I am here to say the emporor has no clothes.  

The service was a bit spotty.  The cashiers I spoke with were nice but  the young man that gave me my food handed it to me and vanished.  I all but had to nearly physically tackle another employee to get some ketchup for my fries.  

As for the restaurant I found it odd that it didn't have a rest room in or near it.
author: Brad P.

description:
I know the menu is small and that it looks like a McDonalds, but their burgers have been my favorite since I began high school many years ago. They were worth cutting class and most importantly: cheap!
I loooove it here!
author: Mary C.

description: Keepin' it simple is what In-N-Out is all about. You won't find burgers covered in bbq sauce ala mcrib. In fact, the buns don't even have sesame seeds. what you'll discover is simply a juicy burger with the usual suspects (onions, hand torn lettuce, tomato) that's what makes this place great
author: Connie M.

description:
Day 4 of MWLAWMBF:
So we were researching In-n-Out for some random reason on the internet when we were apart from each other during my winter break, but we decided on getting some burgers one of the days since supposedly this In-n-Out is different from the typical ones they had. I think that is because they don't have the palm trees in front and things like that. 

Anyways, after Chinatown, I decided...not my boyfriend for once...to walk all way to Fisherman's Wharf. It was quite a long walk, but I didn't mind too much. 

Anyways, back to the food. We got 2 cheeseburgers, animal style fries, and neopolitan shakes. Best things from the store. DELICIOUS.

It seems like it should be more packed, but the people moving in and out...there are quite a lot of people going in and out. Just like the store's name, people don't tend to stay for too long. CRAVING SATISFIED.
author: Nina Y.

description: Double Double Animal Style - you cant beat that ). I come here pretty often and get the same stuff . It is simply awesome
author: George B.

description: I've been in the midwest for the past 6 months and the first place I ate at when I got to Cali is this place. Every Californian knows that the coming home to a Double-Double animal style is the only true homecoming there is:)
author: Esther F.

description: New Yorker signing in here. This was my first In-N-Out burger and fries. I got a double cheeseburger with fries (Animal style, of course) and I have to say that In-N-Out supersedes Shake Shake. For the price that you pay for a meal here is the equivalent of ONE Shake Shake burger in NYC. Damn it, come to NYC In-N-Out.
author: Melanie T.

description:
The food looked good, but the mayhem  atmosphere was horrible. I threw my food out. Lottering  homeless people within the restaurant wondering about grabbing what they can. Then had an individual set down beside me (seating just inches apart) that shoved food into his mouth while eating with his mouth open. Just not for me. 
Will not visit again.
author: Randell T.

description: Great burgers - not so great fries! Unless you get the fries "animal style", the fries are bland and tasteless. The burgers are yummy. This location is - as one would expect - incredibly busy and perhaps not the cleanest. But, a great stop in for a CA staple!
author: K. L.

description:
I imagine the religious right finds solace from all the Biblical references in the paper cups and burger wrapping papers here, but alas, I remain an unrepentant heathen despite the subliminal messages encouraging me to display my inner goodness. No, it's a hopeless cause as I push aside the baby strollers and foreign-speaking travelers without remorse to say those magic words --- "Double Double with Cheese".

It's not that I am not being punished for my rudeness. After all, why else would IN-N-OUT locate their one and only city store in the most pedestrian-congested, tourist-infested, cable car-constipated, fishy-smelling block of San Francisco? But it's worth my penance to get the best chain burgers bar none. I respect a place that knows how to focus, focus, focus --- burgers, fries, and milkshakes --- and that's it. No healthy salads. No monster tacos. No jalapeno chicken sandwiches.

As we have all seen, the chains that spread themselves too thin with their menu options are doomed by their mediocrity. As we all know from "Survivor", the team is only as good as its weakest link, and that applies to those 100-item menus at McDonald's and Jack-in-the-Box. The quality of everything suffers at those places. You want variety? Try their secret menu, for example, the 4x4 for four patties and four cheese slices and the Neapolitan shake that mixes all three flavors. A secret handshake is not necessary to get them. 

Seating can be an issue at this cramped location. When you get your number, make sure to scope out any empty plastic seat. I usually hover around people who have the audacity to be chatting after they finish their meals. A couple of clearly audible sighs as you carry your red tray usually do the trick. If not, you may want to consider limping and looking forlorn. Battle the crowds and your sensibilities and come to IN-N-OUT at the wharf. It's worth the suffering.  

FOOD - 5 stars...best burgers bar none 
AMBIANCE - 2 stars...clean but crowded and chaotic
SERVICE - 4.5 stars...efficiency defined
OVERALL - 4 stars...just because they need to open a few more where real city dwellers live
author: Ed U.

description: This place definitely hold up to in-n-out high standards. It's expensive for me, but there is a great assembly line of "chefs" also always nice to be served by diana.
author: Dominic F.

description: Great burgers and fries, we went late at night so it wasn't packed.. But if you get there at lunch or dinner good luck you most likely won't get a seat! There is no bathroom inside which is a downfall when you get there at night and all bathrooms are closed...
author: Cyn L.

description:
Visiting the West Coast for the first time, I was told that In-N-Out was a MUST. I decided to go all out, and ordered a Double-Double Animal Style, Fries, and a Chocolate Milkshake. For the most part, I was not disappointed!

The burger was juicy and delicious and the flavors were phenomenal. The milkshake was thick and creamy and cold. The fries on the other hand - meh. I had them plain, so maybe that was my mistake. They weren't crispy enough for me, so I didn't end up eating them. But I guess that saved me a few hundred calories, so maybe not the worst thing.

I'm hoping I make it back out to the West Coast soon so I can go again!

P.S. If you sit in the outdoor area in the back, be aware of the pigeons. We had an ignorant parent let his two children run around and chase the pigeons, who are not people-shy at all, and got very close to us and our food. Yuck.
author: Jordan N.

description: My first InNOut experience. I had the double double, Yum! Would have got 5 stars but...... InNOut, why your fries so crappy?
author: Joshua M.

description: What can I say... It's a must "to go to" restaurant in the west coast. Not sure why I love this place but I do! Lol
author: Isabelle T.

description:
As an Eastcoaster I have heard about these mythical burgers but had not had the pleasure of having my mouth meet one until recently.  I still have dreams at night about their juicy goodness.  My friends in Cali now send me "food porn"- shots of their burgers when they go.  OH MY GOD THEY ARE SO GOOD!
When I return- every possible meal and snack will be In-N-Out... 
Double double Animal style, split, fries light animal style 
or double double animal style protein.  Oh so good.  Being away from them is just cruel.  
Pleas expand.  
I love you.
author: Abby M.

description:
Hello In=N=Out peeps

OK.
Now I get it.

Please bring your very awesome buns to Miami....and your fries...oh...and don't forget your milkshake.

We like sexy hot buns in Miami.

Thank you.

Amen.
author: Gina H.

description: Let's just say they got the name right. Keep your wallet IN and yourself OUT. This place is just flat out horrible. If there was a choice to give zero stars it would have gotten my vote. The burgers were nasty and I have gotten better burgers at a McDonald's. The fries tasted like they were made out of cardboard. They were cold and had no taste to them what's so ever. There isn't enough salt and ketchup in the world to even make these fries bearable. I'm not sure if it was just this one restaurant because In N Out is very famous for having good food which is the only reason why my family went there. Did I mention it was a 25 minute wait on line and another 10 for the food to come. It was a very big disappointment to all of us and ruined our lunch.
author: Kalvin C.

description: I'm not sure I can add anything to the nearly 1000 reviews for In-N-Out. The Double Double rocks, the fries are great and its a killer alternative to the standard fast food burger joint. I make a point of stopping when ever I am on the west coast. If you haven't had one you need to get it on your burger bucket list.
author: Shawn R.

description: OK I finally tried my first In-N-Out Burger at Fisherman Wharf, SF...I was not impressed considering all the other 4 stars reviews. This place was super busy at this particular location, lots of tourist...it was packed and we waited at least 15+ minutes our order. I figure with the major turn around of burgers it will be good...Finally got our burger & fries, and both were just OK...not that more tastier than a quarter pounder at McD....the fries were abit chewy and didn't seem fresh and again McD fries are tastier. I think the burgers at the other franchises are better, but I am willing to try other In N Out place but there really not that many or if any in CT where I live. I think In-N-Out need to "kick it up a notch or two."
author: J T.

description: Thank you for my last minute animals fries you guys are awesome. Eleonora thank you so much!
author: Kahealani R.

description:
Mmmm.... I'm not a big burger and fries kinda gal, but this place is REALLY REALLY REALLY good! The cheeseburger had good meat and was cooked well, bread was fresh, ingredients were fresh. All cooked to perfection. 

And it only cost me $2.43 (tax included) for that sandwich. 

I'm craving it again and I'm 3 time zones away! Only thing I regret is not trying their fries (I'm not big on those). Oh well. Next time! =) 

People seem to compare it to Five Guys here in my town, so I think I'll make a trip there soon.
author: Julie A.

description:
Oh double-triple with grilled mushrooms and toasted buns and your crunchy well done fries! I'm not a big fan of fast food but when I need my fix, I definitely go for In-N-Out Burger! 

This is the only restaurant in the city and due to its location (relatively near Fisherman wharf and Ghirardelli square) you can often spot an interesting crowd.
If you are visiting SF and want to try one of the best fast food chain in the nation, definitely go get a burger @ In-N-Out. Don't forget to check out their special menu for their hidden items :-)
author: Cedric L.

description:
Kids, don't try this at home, do it at in&out burger joint

One double-double cheeseburger please, 
oh,make that two and a small diet Coke to go, I'm on a diet!!!
and bring to Hooter's and eat in front of the Hooter's model and waitresses. 
great plan for the night!!
author: Matt G.

description:
Fuck... I really love In n out haha

A cheeseburger, animal style fries, & a vanilla milkshake is one bomb ass meal!!  I'll take it over dicks(seattle's famous burger chain) any day... ANY DAY!

Only reason I give it 4 stars is because there's no locations in WA State.... BOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO :(
author: Charlene J.

description: Burgers so fresh, hot & juicy. Diet coke so cold. Fries so salty. Line always out the door. Makes you fall in love with fast food. Bonus was that I saw a guy that looked like MC hammer in there last night.
author: Court S.

description:
Honestly, who doesn't like In-N-Out? 

My usual order is a double double animal style. Sometimes I get fries animal style as well. Be sure to ask for some peppers at the counter if you need a little kick.

Milkshakes are delicious!
It is always packed. Best times to come are right after the lunch rush or right before the dinner rush. There is probably only a good 2 hours where it isn't swarming with people.
author: Brenda A.

description:
Wanted to see what the rave was about so I gave in. For people not familiar with this place it was a lot like Dick's in Seattle, but sit down restaurant style. 
I had ordered a cheeseburger, fries, and a vanilla milkshake. The fried were alright, but the cheeseburger was pretty amazing as well as the shake. 
The service was also fast, which I really appreciated.
author: Katherine L.

description:
As always, double-double with animal style everything. 

Crowded during the day, but still remarkably good. I just wish they would get one of these things on the East Coast....
author: Jake K.

description:
Gotta love in n out burger.   I am from Chicago and wish they would expand to the Midwest .  I have come to this location many time and have never been disappointed. Great burger and many items that are off of the menu.  Very busy even in the late evening but they don't make you feel rushed to get out.

This place is always on the agenda when I am in town
author: Ron Z.

description: This place is a tourist trap. We went there with my friends and the line was 2 hours long. The wait was kinda worth it just because their cheeseburgers and fries are awesome!
author: Paris O.

description:
mind blowing burgers- better than going to the planetarium. 

horrible fries, worse than the stuff they eat in spaceships maybe.
author: Chessie C.

description:
I've heard so much about In-N-Out Burger and since it was right next to my hotel, I knew I had to try it before leaving town. On my last night after walking back from Pier 39 I decided to find out what all the hype was about. The line was long and there were tons of people sitting around and waiting for their orders. I could tell that In-N-Out Burger was feeding some serious food addictions.
 
What was most notable was how efficient the staff works. They were like automated robots. Working at those speeds would give me a headache. The process went something like create-a-burger, scoop-some-fries, make-a-shake, yell-out-the- order...repeat. I've never seen people make shakes so fast in my life.  My eyes were bopping all over the place trying to keep up with them.

I ordered a veggie cheeseburger without the patty. I am not sure they even have veggie patties. It's basically a bun with toppings (L,T,O - pickles are not automatic) and special sauce. I was not even hungry when I ordered the veggie burger since I had just eaten a crepe, but I was just too curious to pass it up. Oddly enough the best part of the sandwich was the big hunk of onion. Normally onions are not my thing but the onion was so fresh it tasted like an apple. The cheese was also thick and creamy. Despite being full, I ate the entire sandwich and yes it was worth it! 

I also think it's cool that they have secret menus and that the staff actually has to know the secret menu well enough to take an order even though people don't always order from it. I read a pretty cool article about a guy who ordered everything off of the secret menu and the cashier was elated to get to finally put his knowledge to the test. These are some serious burger people.
author: Angel W.

description:
I love In-N-Out. 

Clean - yup not quaint however In-N-Out is consistent, super fresh ingredients, efficient service, smiling faces. Itsa, chain but with HIGH standards for their food ingredients & preparation. Every now and again grabbing a burger n fries and walking down to the bay ( 5 minutes) to the park near Ghirardelli Square to enjoy the view and the burger. Although it sometimes is fun just to eat in the joint and watch all the tourists stumble by with their maps. Want to try the "animal style" burger next time:  http://www.in-n-out.com/secretmenu.asp

Quaint &  "neighborhoody" burger joints (no views of the bay):

http://www.yelp.com/biz/flippers-a-gourmet-hamburger-place-san-francisco

http://www.barneyshamburgers.com/
author: Matsuo U.

description: Dirty, dirty, dirty. The floors, the tables and the counters were dirty!! I was waiting for my food where you wait for your burger and someone came in and placed and dirty box with a dog in it on the same counter!! I couldn't believe it! The burger was ok...it wasn't worth the hype.
author: Natty K.

description: obviously the food here is amazing, but 3 stars for the rediculously long lines at all times. Maybe get some more people taking orders. If you can, go to the one in Daly City. Much easier access with the same great food.
author: Kyle H.

description:
Yes, I would give a burger spot 5 stars. Why? Because the customer service was excellent, the food was delicious, and the order came quickly considering this is a super touristy area.

My first visit 2 years ago, I order a double double animal style, fries animal style, and choco shake -- which turned out to be far too unctuous for one meal.  This time I ordered a double double, Animal style, extra pickles, no lettuce no tomato, regular fries, and a strawberry-choco milkshake. I asked for my meal to stay and sat in the shade with the pigeons around the corner.

The first thing I did was rip that paper blanket off and eat saucy side first, mmmmmmmmm.  Then I poured 2 packets of black pepper into my ketchup and stirred with a fry, because that is how I roll, yummo! By that time, my shake had developed that slightly melted outer portion which is a great chaser for salty fries.  As I savored and devoured (savoured?) my meal, I enjoyed watching the pigeons bomb dive into the trashcans for fries and also scare unknowing diners when they threw their trash in. I'm from NYC, pigeon behavior amuses me so long as I am not their target. After I could not eat any more, I placed my dish of fries on the floor so the birds wouldn't crowd the trashcan while I disposed of my trash. Tell you what, it is HILARIOUS to watch non-urban folks react to pigeons. I heard "gross", "disgusting", "piranha" several times.  After the birds were done, I waited for them to clear and I threw the paper boat away. 'Twas a wonderful lunch time, reminded me of dining at a certain famous burger spot in a NYC park, yanno?

A few days later, I brought my husband and I ordered for the both of us: 2 double doubles Animal style no lettuce no tomato, regular fries, choco shake, and Coke. This was plenty for 2 people to eat. I enjoyed my burger more this time because my previous one was too salty due to extra pickles. My husband said that he prefers the burgers of a certain chain that serves peanuts while they fry up your never frozen patty, because he prefers the taste of beef to the taste of spread.   Me? I just love a burger.

Tip: Make sure to ask for the bathroom code.
author: Siu L.

description: Oh my fxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxing hell. Even looking at the pictures is having me getting all hot and bothered again. Best Burger ever I think. When I move to America in a couple of years burgers will be something I look forward to most. And in and out will contribute to a big part of that. The vanilla milkshakes are epic too. And anyone who reads  my reviews knows how much Milkshakes matter to me!
author: Carmela S.

description: Great Food! Great Service! highly recommeneded
author: Carlos S.

description: Might be the best fast food out there. My go to order is a double cheeseburger and fries (both animal style). The combination of sweet grilled onions, cheese, and a secret sauce combine to make animal style. You may need a fork for those fries. This location is always packed with tourists but it is still worth the visit.
author: Michael C.

description: Animal style fries are unique. However double double burger is just so so. But a good place is to go for someone who is allergy to seafood when visiting Fisherman's wharf.
author: Tina Q.

description: The food is pretty good. Especially the burgers. The fries are made from actual potatoes, not frozen ones (I seen them make it live through the window from the outside view). The price isn't too expensive and its great that they used gloves. A customer back then complained that they didn't use gloves, and this solved the problem and made the food taste much better than before.
author: Kevin Z.

description:
Best bang for your buck burger. 

After the hype died down in SF it still take a little while to get your order compared to most fast food joints. With that said... it is by far still the best tasting fast food burger ever! When i go to burger restaurants, i always ask myself is this burger $10 better than an In n Out burger? Most places are not.

I always take my out of town tourist friends and family here for some reason. Its a great bite to eat and chill.
author: Ryan R.

description: Piggy girl wanted to try this place so as long as there is something for me to snack on then i'm good, had the fries which tasted pretty good and the smoothie.  The smoothie is the same exact ones from McDonalds, I swear... The burgers are dirt cheap but too bad i'm a pescatarian and didn't have any.
author: Bakchun K.

description:
I've been to this location few times and its always packed which is bad because I can never find a seat. Hehe...

I had a chance to eat the best burger few days ago and I brought my family to try it out. I got my usual (which is a #2 combo (cheeseburger and fries animal style plus a drink) and everyone loved it. Yay! *doing the happy dance* LOL. 

My family loved it because they had said that they like the freshness of the lettuce & tomato. I miss In-n-out. Haha...
author: Jana M.

description:
In n Out is fantastic.  Most people seem to agree.

Ordered a triple-triple protein style w/ grilled onions.  They said no problem.

Delicious shakes.  Of course.

Fast, friendly, easy on the wallet.  Naturally.

Only complaint is the store is too small!
author: Brian P.

description: I will keep this one short.  On vacation from the East Coast, people tell you you have to try it right? Yep. Totally had to talk myself out of waiting in line again for another burger it was so good.
author: Tony B.

description:
For years and years and years I've heard about this mystical place called In-N-Out which lives in the West Coast.  "It's the S@@@"....Um just remove The from the quotes and you have what I felt represented this burger.

I appreciated the simple menu and the staff were clearly working hard and on top of that had to deal with primarily teenagers.  They all deserve raises.

I know its fast food and its cheap food but its really bad food.  I wouldn't want this after drinking or for a quick lunch or anytime for that matter.  I can say I tried it.  I'm the minority that doesn't like it but there just is nothing memorable about this place for me other than thinking about the 50 rude people waiting for their food.
author: Chris M.

description:
Always worth to come by. Great food, fresh ingredients and that classy style... Famous since it's a part in the Movie 'The Big Lebowski'.

Fresh food as you won't find any freezer in the kitchen. The perfect place if you like burgers but are sick of all the 'fast-food' chains.
author: Oliver M.

description: Great location for In N' Out. The service is a bit slow but that is understandable being in a highly concentrated tourist area. There's better In N' Out stores but this one is still solid.
author: Jarrett P.

description:
The inside of this place was pretty unkept.  I know its a fast food joint, but its still a place where people eat food.  Maybe it was because we were there at about midnight on a Sunday night?  The burger and fries were just as good as any other In N Out I've been to, so really the only thing different I noticed was the cleanliness which was meh.

It's hard to rate In-N-Out any less than 3 stars since its one of the best fast food burgers in the world.  Everyone says get "Animal style" which is good, I'm a fan of grilled onions, but sometimes you just want an original In N Out cheeseburger, which is just as good.
author: Kevin W.

description: Worst in n out I have ever been to. Long lines and understaffed. French fries aren't fresh every time. Step your game up in n out.
author: Teddy K.

description:
The cheapest Paleo-friendly fast food meal in town: Protein-style double meat no spread with whole grilled onion. 

The pleasure-to-cost ratio is sky high.
author: Henry F.

description:
this is one of the best places to grab a quick meal if your in a tourist area like Fisherman's Warf, it's a Cheap & fast burger joint

you wont get ripped off here, no over priced tourist trap like other places, everything is fresh made the old fashioned way! I always order the triple meat patty 3x3 with onions & fries.

and to avoid the crowd just walk down the street and sit by the beach and have a little picnic by the beach.
author: Mr Bolo B.

description:
I have had many an amazing burger in my life. This wasn't even close to one of them. 

What i expect from a burger place, even a fast food one:
-- Well spiced juicy patty
-- Melty cheese
-- Warm buns
-- Hot crispy fries

What an animal style meal In N Out is comprised of
-- Lackluster meat
-- Soggy buns
-- Goopy thousand island dressing
-- Sad frozen french fries, also covered in goopy thousand island.

As far as I'm concerned, and i know this is sacreligious, but the myth of In N Out must be perpetuated by really drunk or high broke folks or kids who ate nothing but this in college... because that's the only way I can see a person raving about this food.
author: Kelly S.

description:
The animal style cheeseburger was good.  Fries were good, fun to watch the guy cutting the fries.  Good shake!  Place was packed.  Was waiting for a table as a couple was picking up and a women and her daughter pushed us out of the way and sat down...looked at us and snickered.  So sat outside. 

The service was friendly and with a smile!
author: DJ J.

description: Being relatively new to California, I was dying to try In-N-Out Burger. I really enjoyed my burger and fries. I was impressed with the girl who took my order as well. Since it was my first time there, I wasn't completely sure how I wanted my burger dressed so I changed my mind a couple of times and she still got it right! Although I didn't find the burger and fries to be better than a McDonald's burger and fries, it sure was tasty and the overall experience was better than any McDonald's I have ever been to. Let me warn you though, the patties are pretty thin, so if you go in there with a big appetite definitely order the double burger with two patties and you will not be disappointed. P.S. There is outdoor seating so you can bring your furry friend along.
author: Kelsey K.

description:
The taste was amazing, don't forget to add extra onions. 

Higly recommend for burger eaters.
Very affordable price.
author: Nejc T.

description: Finally tried In-N-Out for the first time while in San Francisco. There is one in my hometown now, but it is really far from my place and I figured why not try while in California. Plus, it was walking distance from the place we were staying. So...why not, right!? Anyway, it's ok. It's not AMAZING like everyone always makes it seem. It's JUST OK! Don't believe the hype, y'all. Lol!
author: Ashley V.

description: This place moves a ton of food!  In-N-Out is my favorite place and this location doesn't fail!!!
author: Keith R.

description: Burgers burgers and still more burgers! The succulent patty with its mouth watering atoma, the crispy lettuce, the tomato, the onions and the most important: the inn n out sauce!  Be careful: the sauce is great, you can get more! But dont think you can add the sauce to things at home and get the same magic!  Aint gonna kid about these things!!
author: Dushyant U.

description: I too feel like it's overated.  It is what it is...nothing special.  Lots of meat and cheese, it's okay...
author: Kathy W.

description: I was extremely happy to find this place in the middle of the tourist traps of Fisherman's Wharf. I try to take out of state friends to In-N-Out because it's a California staple and probably just as important as seeing any other landmark. It's a basic burger place that's anything but basic. As an indecisive person, the short menu is the best. If you want a cheeseburger and you're in the area give it a chance.
author: Nicole V.

description: Overpriced compared to drive thru, waited 10 minutes for food and the staff was average. Compared to Arizona where they just exude customer service this spot has a long way to go.
author: Todd A.

description: The famous west coast In-N-Out burger! The infamous must try for all us living on the east coast. We just had to try it! Well... I'm not impressed. I tried the "double double animal style" with fries and a soda. The burger is an upgraded version of a McDonald's Big Mac. It's a good burger but not as good as all the hype. The fries aren't that good. We can finally bury this from our must try list.
author: Jenn R.

description: I came here with a really good friend on 4th of July and it was super crowded as expected. After the celebrations and fireworks were done we decided on grabbing burgers before we headed home. We both got cheeseburgers and for drinks I got a small cola and he got coffee. Surprisingly the service was pretty fast for a restaurant with a line that went down the street. The down side is that the meat patties were too thin and the buns were flaky. Also the fries weren't satisfactory. At least the taste compensated for the thin meat patties... :)
author: Sahar H.

description: I was excited to find out there was one at Fisherman's Wharf.  We don't have them in Seattle so I always try to get one when I'm in California.  Excellent!  I tried to talk my vegetarian sister into trying one, but she had fries instead.
author: Kelli S.

description:
I can't believe this is the only In-N-Out in the San Francisco area.  This might help explain why it seems to be constantly packed to the brim.  Nonetheless, turnover seems to be quick on the tables.   

Service was friendly and fast.  I opted for an animal style cheeseburger and well done fries.  Both tasty but if you don't like runny sauce and drippy sammies, go for the plain.
author: A. M.

description:
They get 5 stars just for being themselves in SF 

Haha just kidding.

I mean who doesn't love in n out ?

I know some people who have rather been disappointed by the place, but that was because they were exposed to so much of the hype and fandom through internet and/or friends beforehand and had just too high of expectation.

Line is long and it is packed, but it's in prime tourist destination (Between Fisherman's Wharf and Ghiradelli Square) so it's to be expected...

Unless you have to have some form of seafood in the area, go here. It is the best under-$10 meal that you will find in the area
author: Christina P.

description: We waited about 10 minutes in a short line to get in on a Friday morning; it was just before noon and the line got longer, later. We had the cheeseburger special with "animal fries" (regular fries with cheese and sauce on top). Those fries are not on the menu, so you can ask for them. The burger was good, but nothing too special. The fries were good, but nothing too special. We liked the place, however, and we would go back, especially since it's so convenient to the Wharf. But the food wasn't very memorable (but hey, it's only a burger joint after all). The staff was busy as heck but very friendly and accommodating.
author: Bill W.

description: The only reason why I am giving 1 star is to get this review read. This place is disgusting the meat was uncooked and pink the fries were gross we got a refund but the manager was rude as well as her staff. She argued and said that the meat is cooked like that pink unless you ask for well cooked! And that it was frozen so that made it okay! Needless to say we will never be coming back.
author: Elizabeth S.

description:
I'm an east coaster so it was exciting to try a new burger place!  I got the double double and a shake.  Definitely delicious and while inside is small, there is great outdoor seating!

I enjoyed my first experience especially as I read the box which informs you that those fries I'm eating were handcut that day and that the meat patty was never frozen.

When is this place coming to Boston?
author: Laurinda U.

description:
My best friend took me here and made sure to pop my cherry animal style. 

For a fast food burger, it's pretty damn good! Like if Wendy's & McDonald's had a love child, this would be it. Tasty patty and fresh fixin's. The fries totally sucked though. Unusually accommodating staff. In the 10 minutes we were there, a staff boy came up to us twice. Once to see if we needed anything, so he got us ketchup and the second time to throw our garbage out.. classy!
author: Lizz K.

description:
No trip to the West Coast is complete without worshiping at the altar of In-n-Out. Possibly the finest burger I've ever had. I have a slight moment of anxiety every time that it's not going to live up to the memories, and every time I've breathed a huge, meaty sigh of relief. 

The menu is simple. Burgers, fries and drinks. They have a much famed 'secret' menu, but essentially it boils down to combinations and numbers of patties and cheese slices. There's also the patented 'animal style' fries and burgers, slathered in onion, cheese and mustard and worthy of poetry. 

The fries are a little floury but not too greasy or doused in salt. The patty is meaty, thin and wonderful. Served in a white sponge dough bun, not too much taste, but that goes some way to soaking up the sauces. If I was complaining, I'd say that there was little too much onion for me but with the slice of tomato and piles of lettuce, it's certainly enough to count for a portion a day.
author: Rich M.

description:
Not many fast food places in the city...so it's great having In-N-Out so close.
If you have never had a double double and animal style, stop missing out!
author: Quinn S.

description: I'm not going to tell you anything you don't already know. This is on par w 5 guys.
author: Andrew M.

description:
The Conservative Christian class have a damn tasty recipe for a hamburger. 

Also, they take good care of their employees (which depending on your political point of view, could be considered ironic or not), and they all seem geniunely happy to be working there. 

For that, I can't hate. In fact, I gotta love.
author: Stevie D.

description:
I so wanted to be a fan.  I'm an East Coaster, always looking for a great burger. I rarely get out to the West Coast, so when I was in San Fran last month, I went out of my way to take in one of these California "masterpieces".

Boo hoo.  I watched for over 15 minutes as the crew assembled the patties and carefully wrapped each one like a precious present.  I was not sure what was best to order so I just went with the cheeseburger with everything, thinking i could take off what I didn't find appealing.

But tiny size 0 girls ahead of me were ordering the double, and I wondered if I was doing something wrong with my request.  Anyway, I milled around with the other dozen or so patrons waiting on the order.  This place obviously had an international draw, as french/german/dutch folks were posing for pics as if they were on the Hollywood walk of stars. Hmmm....

Finally, bag in hand I rushed to one of the outdoor tables.  It was later in the afternoon so I didn't order fries cause I didn't want to kill my dinner appetite.  

I unwrapped my present.  The burger looked good, stacked with tomato, lettuce, pickle,  onion, and I think some special sauce.  I took a bite waiting for nirvana.  Then I took another, napkin in hand, anticipating the need  to wipe my chin.  Nothing.  Zero.  Just a big hit of raw onion with soft bread.

Ok so it may be the same "situation" as Five Guys where you really have to order the double so that all the ingredients co-mingle and produce a party in your mouth.  Unfortunately, my In and Out had too many ingredients fighting for the palate.  Maybe I need a local to tell me what to order.
author: Regina S.

description: Ran from my home, it only took thirty minutes, the animal style cheeseburger gave me the dose of proteins my brain needs for the mad gains in the gym later.
author: Nijiko Y.

description:
No visit to The City by the Bay is complete without a stop at the In-N-Out Burger on the Fisherman's Wharf! The word is fresh, OK? Don't forget to get your fries Animal Style (check out the link below to the "secret" menu)! It's also veggie friendly: LOVE the grilled cheese with tomato and grilled onions! It's fantastic!

Bonus: It is one of the cheapest places to eat in the area if you're traveling on a shoestring.

The Verdict: Seriously, whether for lunch or after midnight, you've got to hit this place up.

Psst! Here's the secret menu: http://www.in-n-out.com/secretmenu.asp
author: Cara S.

description:
INO to Wharf or Daly CIty is the same travel time. 

It's In-N-Out. If you don't know it, you live in a cave.
author: Christopher V.

description: I am officially an In-n-Out Burger believer!!! I heard so much about the joint. So glad we made the stop while we were in town. These guys beat Five Guys, no questions asked!!! Will definitely hit them up again!
author: Debbie C.

description:
I love In-N-Out, but this tourist-trap location was quite stressful.  My party of 3 split up to try to stake out tables while we waited for our food, but we had no luck.  We ended up asking them to re-pack our order to go, and we found outside seating near the Subway around the corner.  It was ok except for the wind and aggressive pigeons.

Our food was fine - I didn't notice a difference between what I got and what I'm used to at other locations.  But the place is too tiny for the number of people waiting for food and the tourists don't know what to do.  

BL: If this is your only chance to have In-N-Out, go for it.  If you are a local, it is best to avoid.
author: Nicole A.

description: My second go-around for the west coast In-N-Out burger and I have to say, it improved.  Perhaps because I learned my lesson and had a double-double instead of just a cheeseburger.  I could actually taste a meat patty this time.  I still had it animal style and it wasn't bad.  But it wasn't great either.  I definitely wouldn't be craving it but if my friends want to get a burger, I guess I wouldn't mind getting an In-N-Out burger.
author: Nancy P.

description:
Who says you can't eat semi healthy at a fast food  place.  You really do have a choice and if you want a quick bite and don't want to over do it with the calories you can always customize  your burger at in out 

Ask for  a protein style 2 by 1  that's two patties only  1 cheese and instead of buns they wrap it neatly in lettuce with tomatoes.  Make sure you request onions.  I'm not a big fan of the spread so I just ask for ketchup and mustard instead.  

If you must have fries split  them with a friend and while their fries are freshly made I feel they are very under cook so I ask for them well done.

They are a ton of ways you can order at in out and  you can find all those out by doing a simple online search.

Another thing the employees are friendly and extremely fast but Tourist love this spot so if you see a line at the door you might want to reconsider.
author: Manny R.

description: As usual whenever in the West Coast, first stop out of the airport is In N Out!  Location was packed and eating area is tiny.  They do not have a drive thru in this location.  Food was great as usual but felt uncomfortable with the people that kept coming in for free sodas and just scanning the room.  It may have been that we were there close to midnight.  Will still eat here, just not this location.
author: Maria S.

description: As far as burger places go, I don't see what the fuss is about In-N-Out. They're McDonald quality and the fries were over cooked. At least I can say I went to one.
author: John H.

description:
No matter what type of crazy fitness kick I am on, or what new year's resolution I have made, nothing, and I mean nothing, comes between me and my In-N-Out. You know how with some fast food, you have to weigh the pro's and con's? Is this worth the calories/guilt/extra time at the gym? Yeah, well, let me tell you that In-N-Out is worth all of the above, and then some. 

I always go for the double-double, animal style, which, just as it sounds, is double trouble for my waistline, but is one of those experiences that you I absolutely savor. From the first bite, to the last, this burger is finger/paper wrapper licking good. Fresh baked bun, juicy, moist patties, mustard grilled ONTO the patty, secret sauce, grilled onions, and pickles... LOTS of pickles... ohhh, I am quite tempted to leave the comfort of my hotel room and go get one this second! While the value meal is an appealing option because of the price point, and the combo of burger/fries/drink, if you do go with a double-double, don't even bother with fries. You won't have room for it. No matter how much of an eater you may be, the burger alone is so satisfying that there just is no need for fries. I also suggest you skip the soda as well, and go for the gold in gluttony, with a vanilla milkshake. Made with homemade ice-cream, this thick, dreamy, frosty is every fantasy you have ever had, come true. 

I will be kind enough to tell you that once you finish said burger and shake, you will not be able to move. And because this particular location is rather tight as far as seating goes, you'll want to pace yourself, because other gluttonous devotees are eagerly anticipating their turn to sit down and go to town on their order. If you can avoid this spot at lunch time or when people get off work, you'll likely miss the major crowding and lines, but the cashiers are so friendly and fast, that if the food alone wasn't worth the wait, their smiles and terrific customer service would be.
author: Elly S.

description:
Heaven on a bun.

People watching is crazy here, and the homeless signers out front are very entertaining.  Never know who, or what you are going to see in here late night.

Please come to Chicago!!!!

DblDbl        3.65
FF   1.65
Sm Coke   1.50

Total - $7.40
author: Matthew W.

description: We so need a reality check here!  Folks, In-N-Out isn't gourmet, it's a full step above McD and BK-- elevated grunge.  Without question, using meat which has never been frozen benefits both taste and texture; BK's beef is never frozen either.  The burgers are thicker, have some discernible seasoning (other than salt) and are served on a premium bun.  This brings In-N-Out to the level of a decent Jersey diner burger.  The In-N-Out burger is extremely greasy, and the little beef flavor they have is lost to the mustard and ketchup.  Why this place is packed to the rafters during lunch hour is part trend, part lack of inexpensive neighborhood dining options.  There's absolutely nothing special about their fries, and the attitudes of the counter staff are just sad.
author: Steve G.

description:
So great I came here twice on my recent visit to the Bay Area. I got the 2x2 animals style. Oh, yeah!

The fries were a bit dry - more the reason to get animal style next time.

I also recommend getting a chocolate+vanilla shake. Not everyone knows you can mix chocolate, vanilla, and strawberry in any way you'd like...

Relatively speedy - though this is "fast food," right? - and, if you want seating, you'll most likely be able to find it except during peak hours.

And, never fear - parking isn't too difficult in the area.
author: Jess L.

description: Come here if I want a fresh hamburger at lunch. I would say there burgers are the best because In-N-Out makes everything fresh. I would also recommend their  animal fries that is very good. Do not come here during the lunch rush because it will take forever for your order to be finished.
author: Peter C.

description: Have been going to this location multiple times the past couple of weeks. This past Thursday, my flatmate and I went for some food later in the night. The next day, we both had Salmonella poisoning. Considering this is the only meal we had that was the same over the past couple days, it's hard to attribute it to anything else. It's a shame as I otherwise thought this was a good spot. Will probably be a while before we go back here.
author: William J.

description:
Seriously, do I even need to tell you.  Double double animal style burger with animal style fries! HELLO! That's what you should order! Yes it might be a tad too much animal style sauce but its' so good!!.
Everything taste awesome! fresh made burger with fresh chopped fries. Great cheap eats! Best fast food burger joint in the world!

Warning about this inNout: there's no bathroom at this location!
author: Ying F.

description: This place was a pleasure to have considering they are not available in NYC. It was great. What I really liked about it is that it did not make me feel nasty and tired after eating it. Burger joints tend to do this to me back in NYC.
author: Ali F.

description:
It's In-N-Out. What more do you need? :)

The place can get crowded, especially on days like Fourth of July, but the wait wasn't that bad and tables become available quite quickly.
author: Soo Jung R.

description:
I'm from the Midwest, so stopping by here is a MUST. I went to an In-N-Out in LA about 5 years ago and it's haunted me since (in a good way).

Two awesome things happened on my visit here:

1) I ate a f**king awesome double double, and

2) Randomly ran into a childhood friend from Des Moines, Iowa.

I think I got an old batch of fries because they were cold and sucked. The burger was worth it, though.

NOTE: if you need to go to the bathroom, you won't see one in the restaurant. Don't be discouraged. Just go up to the counter and ask where the nearest bathroom is and they'll give you a small slip of paper with a numeric code for the bathrooms in the complex. If you're planning on sticking around this area for a few days, just hang on to that code because I don't think it ever changes.
author: Alex K.

description: I always enjoy it here. Keep it simple for me; plain fries with a double-double and I'm happy.
author: Newton W.

description:
I cannot give In N Out less than 5 stars (because they are all around awesome), but I have had better experiences at pretty much every other In N Out that I have visited.  First issue is that there is only one location in all of SF, and second is that the location is in the middle of a tourist trap.  While walking towards the location, I was tempted to turn around, jump in SF bay or even end it all, but once I saw that yellow arrow pointing down, all was forgotten. 

Was not overly busy for a Saturday night at 10pm, but there were a lot of drunks around, which was more entertaining that anything else.  Had my usual of 2 double double burgers and a shake, neapolitan in this case.  Grilled onions always and I did try one of my burgers protein style, so instead of a bun, burger is wrapped in lettuce.  Food and service was excellent, but again please get another location in SF.
author: Andre B.

description:
I'm not a huge fan of fast foods but I enjoyed the burgers here - it was simple and tasty. 
Nice strawberry shakes.
Friendly staff and efficient processing of orders.

If you want your chips crispy - ask nicely.
There is a special menu or 'secret menu' shown online which can be ordered at the store.

Visited June 2013.
author: Rosie N.

description: Craving some quality fast food? Then this hamburger chain is the place to go! If you're from San Francisco, you know you can't go wrong with In N' Out. Their double burgers and to die for! So are their fries.  Although if you want a fast meal, go somewhere else because he lines inside are super long. Of course, if you want quality burgers it's definitely worth the wait. Another plus: their super tidy bathrooms.
author: Osvaldo R.

description:
Pfft. Three stars previous. Talk about a leap. Talk about adding this gem to my list of new-favourite-places-now-that-I-eat-meat. I've been schooled in the art of burger by one Christopher M, husband-to-be, and this man states that a good burger should not be a gigantic brick of meat piled high with unnecessaries on a giant bun with a stick through it that you can't get your mouth round. I.e., gourmet burgers. Nope, they should be handheld snackable little beauties with a thin patty, gherkins, sauce and cheese.

Getting a cheeseburger here animal style doesn't ruin that concept. It ENHANCES it. I also got animal style fries, as I remember them being a bit lacklustre last time round. Rookie mistake. My dear friend Diana P recommended afterwards that I should get the fries well done. It apparently adds a hot crispiness to them that they otherwise miss. Well, trusting her judgement I've kept the fifth star. Next time for sure. So now I know what all the fuss is about, and I'm looking forward to experiencing it again. I should have had more than one of these burgers before returning to the UK!
author: Emma Louise M.

description:
1.5 stars. This In-N-Out, by far, is the worst one I've ever been to. We came here shortly it opened for the day, so luckily there wasn't as much people. We wanted a cheap, but decent quick lunch, and you can't go wrong with In-N-Out even though it's fast food.. Or so we thought..

This place lacks the standard customer service and upkeep and everything one would normally expect of "In-N-Out." If the CEO or any other manager walked into this place (as an undercover boss--or not even undercover), they would be appalled by the horrendous service at this location. The service was both slow and unattentive. It seemed that high schoolers were the only ones running this joint: talking behind the counter amongst themselves and on their phones while customers are waiting for them for their order to be taken. I felt bad for the few workers who were busting their butts to get the food out while the cashiers leisurely lounged around. We sat down after we ordered and chose the cleanest vacant table. As we were waiting, we noticed other seated patrons before us haven't received their orders. The place gradually became busy packed and we still haven't received our food--they must've been out back slaughtering the cows and grinding up the meat for us. 

Wait time for our food was about 10mins. Keep in mind that this In-N-Out does NOT have a drive thru, so the workers only have to tend to whoever walks through the door. I've received 5x speedier service at all the other In-N-Out locations I've been to (when there was a full-house & a 2nd parking lot full of cars waiting at their drive-thrus)--all without neglecting customer service. Yes, this place is slow, not only for an In-N-Out, but for a general fast food joint.

Honestly, when I saw that there was no drive-thru at this location & that the place was barely a quarter full of other patrons, I was thinking "Yes! No wait time!" --Guess my thoughts jinxed this experience. 

The food tasted as it should. The tables weren't very clean (sticky + residues + garbage), but that's probably because the prior customers and the youngster workers  who chatted up a storm behind the cash registers didn't feel like cleaning up the mess.

I have a lot of respect for fast food workers & workers in the food service industry general. Especially places that are always super busy like In-N-Out. I can't respect those who are on their phones or socializing amongst themselves instead of doing their jobs/tending to the customers--at least take the customers' orders 1st, then go back to ignoring customers. While waiting for our order, I saw the same kids ignore other customers who wanted to orders. I hope this experience was a candid-camera sort of thing and/or the kids happened to be volunteers. If they were actual employees, their paychecks should've been distributed to the few workers who were actually busting their butts to get orders out for the customers. I watched this the entire time I waited.

For out of town drivers: if you're lucky, you can get street parking (metered); if not, pricier parking garage is an option. I initially put in 20min worth, but had to run back to put more money in since the wait was long.
The prices here (possibly a Bay Area/SF thing) are a bit pricier than usual--about a dollar more for a hamburger.

Will I be back? Sadly, "maybe"--if I feel like having In-N-Out when I'm in the area again. I guess if this is the only In-N-Out chain for miles (which it is), you can raise your prices to however high you want & treat customers however you want if the end product is essentially the same. It has been a while since this happened, so hopefully these youngsters have either straightened up or are gone & this will be a typical In-N-Out. The lack of attentiveness ruined this experience for me. The 1.5 stars are for those few hard-workers in the back who actually tried to give a care for the customers (&/or their jobs) by pumping out their orders.
author: Julie K.

description: We are from out of state and my daughter insisted we try these burgers. If you know smash burgers then it really did not compare. Bun and toppings were above average but the meat itself was not particularly tasty or juicy. Could not really understand the fuss to be honest. Marginally better than McDonald .
author: Gavin K.

description: In-n-out is the pride fast-food chain of the West coast.  A very small and traditional american simple menu, but one of the best burgers and fries you'll ever eat.  The reason I give it three stars is because the seating area is very small for a very active restaurant.  It seems at times they are too overwhelmed to be able to serve in a timely manner (it took about 15 minutes to receive our two double-double burgers after we ordered).  If you're staying around the Fish Wharf area, make sure you find time to stop in and have bite at in-n-out!
author: Chris R.

description: Great food, friendly service. So much better than what we get back in the UK. The food came out very quickly, and we were offered ketchup and chillies by waiters. Place was clean and well looked after. A very pleasant experience.
author: Ben C.

description:
Two-star food. An extra star for price. 
Although the price is nice, I am still willing to pay extra for Five Guys.
author: Kate D.

description: I've been waiting five years for my first In N Out experience. It was so built-up that I was a little disappointed. It's not bad for a chain restaurant. Burgers are made to order etc. But I feel being an east coast native Shake Shack is my #1 choice. I'll still enjoy in N out though.
author: Scott F.

description:
I like giving 5 star ratings to burger places because that means - 

a) I've pigged out and 
b) their burgers taste like they've been laced with food cocaine 

On my last trip to San Francisco, I made it a point to try In-and-Out Burger - I've heard some great things about it and after taking the first bite into my Double-Double the tastebuds were not disappointed. I can certainly see what all the commotion and debate is over whose burgers "reign supreme." My recommendation is if you are not morbidly obese get 2x Double-Double, yup it's that good, live a little. 

The bread was soft, fresh lettuce/tomatoes, and the meat was medium well - this is coming from a place that looks like a McDonald's but tastes exponentially better, that's the beauty of it. The fries weren't all that good, but I wasn't there to get that so it's all good. 

I've had some pretty freakin' good burgers in NY - Shake Shack, 5 Guys, Blue 9 Burger just to name a couple, and am certainly glad to add more notches to the belt of great burgers whenever I can. 

Happy Fooding?! Heck ya.
author: Jason N.

description: all day everyday. even if you don't eat red meat, like myself, get a grilled cheese (a burger without the patty), get it animal style so you get the grilled diced up onion in your bun, mm so good, chocolate shake, wow.
author: Thomas D.

description:
let me start out by saying that SHAKE SHACK IS BETTER THAN IN-N-OUT BURGER!

there, i said it, i lost many friends because of this statement.  now i want to make a few things clear before i get attacked on yelp.  i didn't try the animal style (which i heard was the best thing on the menu).  i'm simply comparing a regular double cheeseburger from in-n-out to a regular double cheeseburger from shake shack.  apples to apples people, you can't start throwing all kinds of ingredients on one and not the other.

i think in-n-out tries to lure you in with their "special" sauce which taste a lot like thousand island or the sauce they use on big macs.  secret's out.  even with this little cheat, i still think shake shack is far superior.  shake shack's meat is just tastier.  pause.  

having said all that, in-n-out is pretty good.  next time i'll try the animal style and update this review.  

also one plus in-n-out has over shake shack is that there isn't much wait.  and the price is pretty cheap.

but in summary, shake shack is better.  east coast is better.  new york is better.
author: Steve W.

description:
Emily C: FRIES ANIMAL STYLE!! DOUBLE DOUBLE ANIMAL STYLE!!
AND A LARGE VANILLA MILKSHAKE PLEASE!! (BIG SMILE =D )

The cashier processed my order without a blink of an eye. Maybe she's grown accustomed to crazed, excited people ready for a taste of the first bite of their famed In-and-Out burger. And the never-ending line that goes out the entrance and beyond. After 15 minutes, I got my piping hot fries and double double cheeseburger. Let's just say I would considering moving to the West Coast for this. 3000 miles is just too far away.
author: Elle C.

description:
I'm always a fan, but I must say that this location is super consistent. I'm not sure how they do it, but every order I've ever had has been correct, tasted great, and just like before. 
I try to go right before their lunch peak on weekends, about 11. Better than brunch.
I think they still give out stickers and hats as well, I need to get one next time I go.
author: jeremy d.

description:
I really don't get why nearly everyone on God's green earth puts In-N-Out on such a pedestal.  The burgers AREN'T. VERY. GOOD.  McDonald's is so much tastier, and it irks me to say that.

The place has character, though.  I'll give it two stars for that because I'm feeling generous today.

I went to San Francisco on vacation with my boyfriend-at-the-time in 2006, and we decided to see what all the hoopla was about with regard to In-N-Out.  Neither of us thought the burgers tasted very good.  And of course we didn't know how to order in the top secret lingo, so we got a lot of nasty looks from yuppity Californians.

My burger was just plain bland.  Bland, bland, BLAND tasting meat.  It tasted like it wanted to be a Wendy's cheeseburger, but it flunked Taste 101 at University of California Burgley.  And what's with all the lettuce?  Was there a special code word I could have shouted to keep my burger from becoming a salad with a bun?

The place was super crowded despite their subpar food, so we had to sit outside on the pavement to eat.  That was the best part of the meal because it got us away from the LITERALLY unwashed masses inside the restaurant.  Granola and incense are wonderful, but patchouli and b.o. stink, guys.

I have to assume Californians are so smog-stricken that their taste buds have been rendered useless.  Or, In-N-Out is constantly filled with stupidly curious tourists like me.
author: Catherine T.

description:
I'm kind of reluctant to write this review as it did not live up to the hype.  I mean, yeah it was okay and the price was good and the service fast.  But what does it have that every other fast food doesn't?  

I think Shake Shack needs to franchise in CA...
author: Amber E.

description:
Love for In-N-Out is all about the expectations. If you expect your burger to taste like a fast food burger, then you'll be pleasantly surprised. But if you're like me, a person who's eaten over 50 different burgers in the past year and change, then you're appreciative but not fanatical about In-N-Out.

Animal sauce on the burger is an overload IMO, but animal fries are a delicious mess. The regular fries don't have as much salt or grease as I'd like. 

My favorite story involves a hybrid Hindu-Christian wedding out at a Pleasanton winery event center. After a couple hundred of us ate, drank, and danced for hours and hours and hours. And then...back at the hotel where a couple dozen of us weren't giving up on the night...someone shows up with burgers and fries for the whole group. My gf and I found out how well bourbon and red wine went with In-N-Out at 1am.
author: Mike H.

description:
Well if you go to In-N-Out Burger it's pretty consistent at every one. This one is really beautiful though, as it's just off fisherman's warf. You got the ocean, views of the golden gate bridge, Alcatraz, and yeah you get the occasional bum asking you for spare change. But that's San Francisco for yeah. 

A few times a week here makes a great bike ride lunch.
author: Toby H.

description:
Hell yeah for In&Out burger.
Needless to say, they serve the best and cheapest burgers in town!
It is a fast-food store and the price is cheap!!!!!
author: Apple L.

description:
As a vegan, this place is my kryptonite. If someone mentions In-N-Out, I HAVE to go and I MUST get an animal style burger. To pretend like I am still being vegan I get it without cheese (yeah I know that makes no sense).

P.S. If you do not eat this burger right away you better be hella drunk to enjoy it later on...
author: Caitlin H.

description: This is the second time I've been to In-N-Out burger.  The other time was about a year ago in San Diego and I had an absolutely amazing experience.  Everything was cooked perfectly and tasted amazing.  Today when we were at In-N-Out around supper time the meat wasn't cooked thoroughly on either of our burgers and our fries (including animal style stuff and "melted" cheese) were cold.  The person taking my order looked like she didn't want to be there which was a coincidence because halfway through the meal I started feeling the same way.
author: Jamie C.

description: service was terrible, the cashiers had a really bad attitude.. didn't even great us. asked for no cheese or tomato & they messed up the order twice. i ended up waiting 45 minutes for one double double.
author: Manuel C.

description: Great prices I honestly couldn't believe how cheap it was for me and my boyfriend to each get a loaded double cheeseburger, fries and a refillable drink. Love this place.
author: Michaela M.

description: The only In-N-Out burger in all of San Francisco. That being said, this place late at night (and I even also assume during the day) is a total zoo. Be prepared. Bring kneepads, possibly a helmet. Suppose it's all worth it for the In-N-Out, though...
author: Mel G.

description:
This is the only fast food chain that I eat at. 

What to order: Double  double combo, Animal style (meow, woof woof! ) with vanilla milk shake!! There is no other way to go!  

The only thing is not to go during big events.I went during 4th of July and there was a line wrapped around the corner, WTF, it's good but is not that good! Needless to say I was pissed because I never to I never go to the Wharf, so every time I go its like a little treat for me !

I decided to skip the burger and get a baguette, cheese, and some wine in a little Italian shop. 

Also, don't be a tourist! take public transportation because parking is horrible,  the iconic trolleys will leave you right there!
author: Angela R.

description:
What more can I say about this in-n-out?! They're all awesome! Seating was pretty hard to find here but someone left RIGHT as we got our food. 

Protip: order your fries with "no salt" and they'll make you a fresh batch of fries!
author: Andrew S.

description:
It's hard for me to give In n Out anything but five stars...

This particular location was really busy (but, aren't they all...?), and there just isn't enough seating.  Luckily I snagged two seats within five minutes, so I'm not going to knock off a star just for that.  I didn't like how the bathroom is outside, but again, that has to do with location and not necessarily the company.  

I had a #2 the week before in Torrance, and it just wasn't satisfying for whatever reason.  On this day it was excellent!!!  :D
author: Lisa S.

description: The place was crazily over-crowded by tourists from all around the world. Trying to find our way to place our order at the counter was already hectic! Trying to find a place to sit in the restaurant was a whole other story (it was impossible)! Luckily for us, the sun was shining and the weather warm enough to sit outside (yes, they do have some few tables and chairs outside). Read more on http://theforbiddenmeal.com/2015/03/04/california-diary-in-n-out-burger-the-hype-behind-californias-first-drive-thru-hamburger-stand/
author: Forbidden Meal ..

description:
This was my first time EVER visiting an In-n-Out (sorry locals, I was one of those tourists there a few days ago). This place gets really packed, though, so a New Yorker like myself can understand that this place can be a pain.

Regardless, I went the safe route and got myself a #2 (cheeseburger, fries, soda). The verdict? The burger is yummy, the fries taste like cardboard, and the soda was, well, soda. They give you salt and ketchup, but the fries are so dry and have no flavor. What is up with that? 

Loved this location, but they really need to get more In-n-Out locations in the city.
author: Doreen L.

description:
Everything you've heard about In N Out, how amazing it is, how we don't have it anywhere in Canada, how fresh the ingredients are - everything, it's absolutely true and is by a MILE the BEST fast food restaurant I've been to IN MY LIFE and hands down worth every penny and every second of your time to try out.

This was my first time trying in N out as this was the first time I've ever been to west coast America. Getting here was a mission, we waited an hour for the cable car and it took us another 30 minutes to ride the cable car and walk here. When we arrived there was a line going out the door and we had to wait another 30 minutes for food. The staff (even during the busy dinner rush) was EXTREMELY friendly and smiled taking every order (why can't chinese places be more like this?). Anyways we ordered the standard double cheeseburger and cheeseburger combos. They give you a number and then they shout it out through a microphone and man they are QUICK.

When we got our combo, I looked at my friend and asked him to take a bite. I had overhyped the place like no tomorrow - I've been telling my friends in Canada how amazing the place was even before I even go the chance to go haha. Anyways, my tired friend took a bite of the burger - looked at me and said: "Holy shit that's a good burger". Anxious enough, I picked up my own burger and took a big bite out of it. I had never tasted anything quite like it. The meat had a CRISP to it and the cheese and onions just melt in your mouth. I couldn't lay my finger on it, ALL of the ingredients just worked together and it just culminated into one amazing burger. 

The fries actually taste like real potato rather than some processed crap you get from other places and compliment the burger in every way. If you guys still don't believe this place is amazing, my friend - a small little girl that never finishes her food (Yes, we all have one of those friends) absolutely DEVOURED the burger and finished it before I did. It's not even physically possible. Anyways, I'm reviewing this place as a tourist who's never gone to in N out so if you've never got the chance to eat at in N out, get yourself a ticket to California and come here RIGHT NOW. Don't worry, you won't regret it.
author: Aaron P.

description: Can't go wrong with this classic. Get your burger animal style and fries well done. Dodgy location but that's SFs fault.
author: Tiara Q.

description:
I loved In-N-Out during my last two trips to Los Angeles. Knowing there was one in SF, I added to my list on my trip.

Service was excellent (as usual) but I just wasn't blown away by my animal style cheeseburger. Maybe I've just had too many Shake Shack burgers in DC?
author: Theresa S.

description:
I love In-N-Out Burger but this one is way, way too crowded for my taste.  It's not In-N-Out Burger's fault, but it's in the heart of the most popular tourist destination in San Francisco.  I've never been to an In-N-Out that wasn't crowded, but this is shoulder to shoulder "Am I at a rock show" crowded and not really worth it if you ask me.

Get your animal style fries at another location if you can!
author: Dana C.

description:
Two stars would better summarize how we felt about the food (meh, we've had better), but we liked the ease of ordering, the friendliness of the folks working there, and it wasn't bad for what it is...fast-food burgers and fries.

The beef patties were small (like other chains small), but the veggies tasted fresh and the bun was flavorful and soft.  The fries had an interesting texture; not quite crisp.  

We're glad we ate there just for the experience, but we won't go out of our way to eat there again.
author: Olivia R.

description:
Five stars for the price - I got the hamburger and paid less than $3 for lunch. 

The taste was good, esp for a fast food item.

However, I got sick afterwards, so minus 2 stars.  3 stars is my assessment for In n Out despite the hype.
author: Geraldine K.

description: WHY CAN'T IN & OUT COME TO THE EAST COAST? ? ? This is by far the best "fast" burger on the planet! I really enjoy watching how the staff works in unison to get the product to the plate. Courteous, quick, always consistent. This is what I expect of a burger joint. LISTEN ! It's not fine dining or cuisine extraordinaire why can't others get it right?!?  The fries were tasty and not overly salted, the shakes nice and thick, what more can I say.
author: Bill F.

description: This is one of my favorite In-N-Out burger chains the only downside is theres a lot of foot traffic so it can be hard to find seating for more than two people at a time.
author: Lawrence A.

description: Simply the best. Double double, fries, milk shake.
author: Reid R.

description:
Really good cheeseburger but not best ever I had. 

Checked bucket list!
author: Samantha L.

description:
I hate to complain about the tourists at a place when I'm a tourist there too, but MAN this place was packed with tourists. 

On a trip to San Francisco my mom and I stopped in after being well aware of the insane amount of hype surrounding In-N-Out. Going in with high expectations, we were met with a lunch rush, two loooong lines, and a dining area with zero tables available. We both went with the single cheeseburger, fries, and a soda. After finding two very dirty seats we ended up eating next to a friendly and very persistent homeless man who eagerly solicited our food until we left. I am definitely not trying to downplay homelessness or sound like an insensitive jerk, but this kind of thing obviously impacts your experience.

That being said, I appreciate their fresh and simple approach but the burger was nothing to write home about. A lot of people are comparing it to Five Guys and I do think Five Guys is better. I would definitely be willing to give it another go at another less-packed location.
author: Chelsea B.

description:
Seriously? how could you give this place a 4 and 5 star rating? I mean, really. some californian's have no idea what good food is.  (see my starbuck's review) I mean, This is one of the worst burgers I have ever had in my life. twice, I gave In&Out a shot. both time this was absolutely disgusting. Both times, the Fries were completely Frozen in the Middle. (sounds a lot like my lee's Review). You know there is a reason why its called in and out....

cuz after you eat it, its going to come right back out again. Most likely the same hole it  went into. This is some nasty.
author: Damien K.

description:
Great business. Do one thing and do it well. I even read the book on In-N-Out's family history.

For a fast food chain (I compare to the likes of McDonald's, Burger King, Carls Jr., etc.), they produce a consistently high quality burger. I love the chain's focus on using locally sourced ingredients and never using frozen goods.

Anyway, this particular location is in a touristy area and the wait time is quite long between standing in line and getting your order made. It's worth it though.
author: Jae C.

description:
Just a Burger? Just a burger. Robin, it's so much more than "just a burger." I mean...that first bite--oh, what heaven that first bite is. The bun, like a sesame freckled breast of an angel, resting gently on the ketchup and mustard below, flavors mingling in a seductive pas de deux. And then...a pickle! The most playful little pickle!
