Then a slice of tomato, a leaf of lettuce and a...a patty of ground beef so exquisite, swirling in your mouth, breaking apart, and combining again in a fugue of sweets and savor so delightful. This is no mere sandwich of grilled meat and toasted bread, Robin. This is God, speaking to us in food.

lol
author: Francis M.

description:
no comment needed

except im not a super fan of the animal style.. thats just me
author: Jeffrey C.

description: OMG I love this place. We came to San Fran for vacation and tried this place for lunch the first day. We ended up coming back for the next two days for either lunch or dinner. I can understand why it got ranked as the best burger around. Everything was delicious. The ingredients were fresh and tasty. The people behind the counter were not only nice but helpful in explaining what everything was to a new customer. On the third day we even requested the paper hats and stickers and wore them proudly.  The only negative about this place is that it's hard to get a seat because its so popular.
author: Cheryl M.

description: Love this place. As it's the only one in SF and being I the middle of a very touristy area, it is thronged with people. Order off the secret menu for your burgers, drinks and fries. Don't miss the double cooked extra crispy fries. Best things ever.
author: May C.

description:
I heart In and Out Burger. Double Double and Animal fries are my favorites. If you don't know what animal fries are, you have to try them to know. 

This location does a great job of serving customers despite of all the touristy traffic it gets. Plus it is open late everyday, always a plus!
author: Kanwal A.

description:
Because of it's proximity to the pier, this location is even more bonkers than any other In-N-Out I've ever been to.

Regardless, don't forget to order off the "secret menu" and you know it'll be good!
author: Jenna S.

description: Best In-N-Out, busy location but they're great staff provides quick and excellent service. Safe to say my favorite fast food join will always be In-N-Out. Doesn't get much better than this;)
author: Azlynn T.

description:
This in-n-out is super busy, located right in one of busiest tourist areas, Fisherman's Wharf.  I'm from NYC, so I've heard a lot of people say that they are right on par, if not better than Shake shack.  I have to try for myself.

Trying In-N-Out burger was one of the top 3 things I wanted to do on my trip to San Francisco.  So, I was super excited when we were finally there!  We were really lucky to find a table or we would have had to eat standing up outside somewhere.  The staff  is really nice and are super quick with their orders.  

I ordered the double double animal style (in english, that's 2 patties, 2 slices of cheese with grilled onions and mustard on the pattie), friends, and a vanilla milkshake.

The wait for the food was much longer than the wait to place the orders.  We had to wait for about 10 minutes or so to get our food.  The fries were already a little bit cold when we got everything.  The burger was delicious and very juicy.  I asked for extra spread (in-n-out's special sauce, kind of like big mac sauce) and was delicious on the burger. I would definitely say in-n-out's burger is on par with shake shack, but in my opinion, shake shack still has my #1 vote.  

The fries were extremely disappointing.  I think it would have been a better choice if I ordered them well done.  They were tasteless, limp, and just kind of gross.  I would think the well done fries would be much better.  The vanilla milkshake was rich and creamy.  

The best thing about in-n-out is the price.  Everything was under $5 (if i remember correctly).  So you can get yourself a full meal for pretty much under $15.  Also, remember to look up the not-so-secret secret menu before you order!
author: Maggie Y.

description:
I know this is a West Coast thing, but I don't get all the hype. Wafer thin well done burger with little flavor. Fries were bland as well. I kept eating waiting for that Ah Ha moment where the hype revealed itself. That came when I walked out and saw vendors with their fresh seafood at Fisherman's wharf and realized I had wasted a lunch with a burger that is not nearly as good as the major chains. 

Sorry no time for the in out love. Just came to read the meter.
author: Dan G.

description: Cheeseburger, double-double and animal fries lived up to expectations. Forgot the 'secret menu' but server was cool to help out when I asked. Staff are quick and polite, only waited a few minutes for takeout.
author: Jules H.

description: Order was correct and the staff was courteous. They move quick and deliver hot food. The only complaint I have is, if a manager knows they have a high demand establishment then it would be a good idea to have one crew member on hand during peek hours to maintain the front lobby. Making sure you have clean tables for arriving customers is important. Also, making sure your condiments and necessities such as napkins, lids and straws are plentiful is key. The dine in experience wasn't bad but with these suggestions it would make the experience much more enjoyable. On a side note, there is no public washroom.
author: Marquelle S.

description:
Burgers were fantastic, as usual, but this location is a total tourist trap. 

We wanted a super cheap meal and got it here.

I just don't understand how they can justify NO bathroom! WTF! 

It was super crowded, very bust, but service was pretty fast. Seats were very limited and tables were dirty. We had to clean our own table.
author: Rosie P.

description:
My first west coast visit in 20+ years, and I finally got a chance to see what all the hype was about/settle the debate for myself about the best national burger chain (In N Out vs. Five Guys).

So let's do a comparison:

Bun- not at all impressed by the buns they use here, reminiscent of the over processed variety you'd see at one of the bigger chains. A Five Guys bun tastes fresh and looks like it's actually made out of bread.

Burger- way too salty and also overcooked (ie dry). At Five Guys the burger still manages to taste juicy despite the fact that you have no other option than medium-well (they say it's well-done but it's almost always medium-well). 

Toppings/Condiments- No comparison here really, Five Guys wins out by a huge margin as far as customization within these two categories. Animal style certainly made the burger taste pretty awesome but overall it didn't seem like much more than a glorified Big Mac sauce.

Fries- I didn't have room for fries on this visit but the animal style fries looked amazing. I'm not all that impressed by the fries at Five Guys.

Shakes- The chocolate shake I had here was really tasty. I don't even think Five Guys serves shakes.

So in conclusion, Five Guys wins out easily in the burger department. But for the full package deal (ie shakes, fries,etc) I would probably go with In N Out. Still, if someone were to ask where to get the best (national chain) burger, I would quickly point them to Five Guys.
author: Johan B.

description:
In & Out at Fisherman's Wharf is a lot more tastier after walking from the Bart Station all the way down to Jefferson St. and The Embarcadero and walking through the fish market and dealing with hobos.  

Pros:
prices are reasonable
the fries are freshly cut (the fries are not the frozen nasty kinds.)
so much employees, so there's not much wait.
there are plenty of chairs and tables
milkshakes are properly made
my 4x4 was so big and juicy so I'll surely kill myself early.
I didn't have to take long ordering because there's only like 10 items on the menu
bathrooms are still clean 
tables are being cleaned constantly for more customer
author: Rheine T.

description: This is the first place I went to eat after checking into my room! I'm glad this In -n- Out was so close to my hotel!! I guess being from Hawaii and not being able to go to In-n-Out makes it a treat!! Just had a regular burger with everything and fries. Yum!! Didn't get it animal style this time around, maybe next time. We were fortunate it wasn't busy when we went there. I got my fix this time, I'm good till my next trip, but I sure wish we had one back home!!
author: Dave F.

description:
After hearing In-N-Out's rave reviews both on and off Yelp, AND hearing it be compared to my beloved Shake Shack in NYC, I just HAD to try it when visiting California this past week for the very first time.

Shake Shack wins, without a doubt. I ordered my burger 'animal style' as suggested by several Yelp reviews I read. While their signature sauce is very good, their patties are miniscule and slightly dry. 

The fries weren't all that and the chocolate shake I ordered didn't taste very special to me. It was like melted soft serve. Tasty, but not extraordinary.

I was STARVING when we got to In-N-Out and experience tells me that the more hungry I am, the better things taste. That doesn't say much for In-N-Out. I will say though that the location was very clean and the service was pleasant and efficient. But, I don't need to go back.
author: Stephanie G.

description: Everyone already knows this tip, you want animal style everything and anything possible. The real tip though, is to eat it fast before it gets cold.
author: Adrina W.

description: Attempted to go to Lou's Fish Shack before midnight but they seemed to have closed a little big earlier so we didnt have a choice but to eat right across the street at In-N-Out. Dont. Eat. Here!! Service was sooooo slowwwww & fries were soggy. Smh
author: John P.

description: This was my first time at In-N-Out. I got the animal style cheeseburger,  and animal style fries. I loved it! So delicious! I wish we had this place on the East Coast :) The only drawbacks were  the long line and how packed it was inside, but luckily there was outdoor seating available.
author: Alanna T.

description:
If you ever want to anger an Austrian, tell him that his plans to hit the legendary In-N-Out Burger have been vetoed at the last minute... tables flew, angry words were fired out, growls followed snarls.... we went to In-N-Out.

Oh the joy. Take a Mc D burger, throw it in the bin and buy yourself one of these. Meat, cheese, bread and more meat. The dude abides and so do I.
author: Chris D.

description: My 1st In-N-Out burger, finally! We had just flown into town and checked into our hotel located right in Fisherman's Wharf. We decided to walk around the area and find some lunch. Just a block or so away we saw the sign... In-N-Out Burger! Yay! It was busy so we got in line, ordered, and took a seat. It was good, but not as good I expected from all the hype I've heard over the years.
author: Magan T.

description: Been all around the world and to every state and this place is hands down the best of the best! Wanna save a buck, don't like to wait in crowds to order, or your a transplant not accustomed to the California way then leave please just leave! But if you want the best burger and fries in the world eat here and do NOT read reviews listen to me I am feverish for one right now and I've been eating them all my life.
author: Miss San Francisco D.

description:
I've been to In-And-Out twice, but the last time was the first time I actually understood how to order. 

I got the burger animal-style and had no regrets about it. It was awesome, smothered in all kinds of sauce and burger accouterments.

The fries? Not my fave. You can order those animal-style too though. Maybe that makes them a little better.
author: Annie D.

description: This place is great. Quick and friendly customer service, even during the rush. I even saw staff bring a chair out from the back to a accommodate a family of five at a single table. Thanks for another great burger.
author: Ben S.

description: Incredible burger and fries were not bad either!  The service was better than Ruth's Chris too!  I wish we had these in SC!
author: Fred W.

description: Actually, ironically, really hard to get in-n-out of this location, due to it being in Tourist Central. But hey, it's still easily the best fast food burger you will ever eat, hands down. Get two for yourself!
author: Joe V.

description:
This was my first In-n-out experience, and I think that I would have thought it to be awesome if not for reading too much about in-n-out on the internet and forming unrealistically high expectations. 

Got the double-double animal style. It was really delicious, but you can't really taste much of the secret sauce nor beef. There's good flavor from the grilled onions, but honestly I think I'd prefer a shake shack burger any day over in-n-out except that the value at in-n-out is way better. I think it was like $3.75 for a double-double which was very filling. 

The fries are shoestring, but I have to admit McDonalds does a better job with the fast food fry. Maybe this location doesn't fry as well.

The place is busy, and the hamburgers are made fresh, so be prepared to wait a little bit. I think this is the closest in-n-out to the metropolitan area so if you're in town from the east coast, I highly recommend trying this place, even if it's in the touristy Fisherman's Wharf. At least Musee Mecanique and the sea lions are nearby.
author: Julian V.

description: I had heard great things about 'In-N-Out' - apparently Kim Kardashian likes it(?) so of course I just had to try. This branch was filthy, there was a lunatic mumbling at people and it was over-crowded. The food was really bad. Worse than McDonald's.
author: Kira G.

description: I'm a vegetarian and get the grill cheese and fries animal style, and it's delicious!
author: SMarta S.

description:
The location is okay, but there isn't enough street parking. 
Animal style is my favorite; it is heavenly deliciousness. The french fries themselves are dry so the animal style really helps them out. The food quality is superb overall. I love the sauce that they put on burgers and stuff. Minus 1 star for the long wait and no parking.
author: Idk A.

description:
I always visit In-N-Out when I'm in SF. I only wish SF had another In-N-Out away from the touristy Fisherman's Warf. This one is always sooo crowded it makes me not want to go. However, every time I have visited I am so impressed with how the staff handles the crowded mess with a smile. They are always upbeat and my order has never been wrong. AMAZING.

Of course, I always order my burger 'animal style'. Is there any other way??
author: Emily S.

description:
One of the few In-n-Outs that don't look like the others. This is always guaranteed to be crowded with tourists at any time of day. Expect a long wait and being hit by lots of backpacks and DSLRs.

On the bright side, the location is kind of nice and you can get your food to go and eat at a different location.
author: Paulina D.

description: when i  first came to in-n-out burger in san fran  about a month ago and recently made a visit a couple of days ago. this place is close to pier 39 i had to try this place,  in-n-out has Good fresh burgers and you can stack as many patties as you want  and add the works to make the burger complete. love the fries here you can get them with cheese on them or make them animal fries which is a special sauce with cooked onions gotta try it. the only thing with this place there is not much seating indoors but theres seating outdoors other then that i will def. come back when im in town.
author: Edwin R.

description: I wish in-n-out was worldwide it's so much better than any other fast-food burger places! Nothing beats animal style :-)
author: Rita A.

description:
One of the most expensice In N Out's I've ever been too.  

What?  No drive thru.  This place is awesome and at a perfec spot.
author: Arnel D.

description:
Being back in SF, and also playing as host to my boyfriend, I had to go to In and Out for a burger and fries.  We stopped in on a late Friday night and ordered 2 cheese burgers and 2 fries.  Service was quick and the foot was piping hot. 

The burgers were just as good as I remember...and the secret sauce was super yummy.  The fries tasted like real potatoes and not some compressed reformed version of what a french fry should be.  

I wish they had one in Seattle...maybe I should start a franchise.  =)
author: Shari d.

description:
I came here after a semi-full meal at a nearby chowder place and still wanted a burger from here. Cheeseburger with animal sauce was all i needed.

I needed new pants right afterwards. 'Nuff said
author: David C.

description:
This In-N-Out is definitely for the tourists.  Although the food here is fresh and just as good as any other (especially the animal style), this location is jam packed with tourists and local alike.  Because of this, the food here does take longer and you must snipe out if you want to snag a table. 

Tip:  Have one member of your party stand in line to order food while the rest of you camp out in different spots for an open table.  There are also a couple of tables outside if you go out and to the right of the door furthest from the counter.
author: Aurora L.

description: Maybe it was because I ate this burger about an hour or two after I ordered it and was also out in the cold, but I just couldn't see what was so spectacular about it.  Ordered the burger animal style.. but it tasted merely like a Big Mac.
author: Tina W.

description: Incredibly busy, but efficient. The biggest problem was getting around the waiting area, but this was definitely an In-N-Out. Burgers, fries, shakes, delicious!
author: Kaitlin D.

description: Spent a long time riding out to Muir Woods and all I wanted was a greasy hamburger to cap off the time.  Got a double hamburger and fries both in "animal style". May have consumed more calories than I burned but it was tasty!
author: William D.

description: Finally had an in-n-out burger and first hand witnessed what the hype was all about.  The burgers were great here and the fries were okay.  Be wary, it can get packed but def. worth the wait.  Wish there was one where I live back on the east coast.
author: J J.

description: love this place good service, make sure to look over the secret menu on their website if you arent in the know
author: Leigh G.

description: I mean, it's In-N-Out Burger. It's wonderful fast-food goodness. Being from the East Coast, when i moved out to SF, I knew I needed to try In-N-Out, and I will say I was definitely not disappointed. I am not a huge fast food eater, so I do not get it often, but it's just so good every time.
author: Katelyn B.

description: Soley on customer service I would give this place 5 stars. In our time here waiting for our food we have seen 2 separate people be the rudest I have seen over 49 cents and a cheeseburger and these employees handled it like champs. So accommodating and sweet when I personally would have wanted to tell both of those groups to what was really up.
author: Nikki M.

description:
I have not visited any In 'N Out Burger joint in almost five years now. First and foremost, I am not fond of driving to Fisherman's Wharf because of the tourists, parking and how small this particular venue is. Trying to find a table to sit here is as interesting as finding a duck that does not have a watertight ass!!!

So....I decided to come and check it out with a friend visiting from overseas. First time in the United States and he had heard that In N Out was da bomb!!!! That's right.....bombed it in the bathroom!!!!  The food is always consistent and they have always gotten my order correctly. I am the type of person to always order the alternative such as animal style (grilled onions), protein style (no buns, just lettuce), etc......so I give them credit they pay extra attention to the orders.....

I feel that after the opening of Super Duper (which by the way..they are opening in every corner like Walgreen's) the comparison is so different! The Super Duper has much more flavor, fries taste better. This particular visit for me at In N Out, the burger was really salty and the fries were cold and dry!!!!!

If you want a cheap meal, homeless people bothering you and yelling for your change, and waiting for a seat....go to In N Out. If you want a better tasting burger, a bit more expensive, and somewhat greasier to soak up the alcohol from the night before with less tourists...Super Duper!! (I recommend Castro and the one in the Marina on Chestnut.....the one on Market St next to Four Seasons is a mess....waiting in line during lunch for 45 minutes just to order your burger...not worth it....)

Enjoy your burger, bitches.....
author: T M.

description:
Burger was good, Fries so so, it may be fresh but it's no Five Guy's Burgers like on east coast. 

Overall the restaurant could use a good cleaning, it really pretty dirty.  Super Crowded on Sunday night @ 8:00 I had to eat standing up as there wasn't a single open seat in the place.  Staff was polite and friendly.

For those of you from Cali who have been preaching the virtues of In-N-Out I think I am missing something.
author: Brad A.

description: The food is nicely done, and their burgers are amazing. However, the service is sometimes disappointed because when they get busy, I have to wait for at least 30mn to get my burger, and I don't like to wait at all. I wish they would put more cashier to help serve the customer better in the near future.
author: Limsamrith V.

description:
Living as I do on the east coast, I had never eaten In-N-Out. So when a friend suggested we go, I jumped at the chance. 

We hopped in a cab and headed over to the Fisherman's Wharf. The cab driver overheard where we were headed, and said, "Oh, they still eat beef on the east coast?" (OMG! LOL! We're so behind the times!) 

He then proceeded to lecture us on why the practices of the beef industry should keep us from partaking of its juicy delights.* However, if I was to hunt my own food, he has no issue with that. Well, I hope he's not reading this, because:

1. I really do care what the vegetarian cabbie thinks of me. Really.
2. I don't plan on giving up mass-produced meat until I actually purchase a gun.**

So I ordered a "Double Double, Animal Style," as I was instructed. And you know what? It was really freakin' good...for fast food. Best of all, it was cheap and quick, the way fast food SHOULD be. (I'm looking at you Five Guys.)
_______

*This was strange for me. In NYC, all the cab drivers assault is my sense of smell; generally they leave my morals alone.
**So if you see me on 10th and Broadway next month, crouched behind a mailbox with a rifle in hand...shut the fuck up; you're probably scaring all the cows away.
author: Peter D.

description: I tried my first In and Out burger. I tasted the protein style  burger and the rest of my family had normal cheeseburgers. Well what can I say. This is the most over hyped piece of crap I have ever tasted. I anticipated I was to experience a great burger. The burger had no taste and was sloppy with all that vomit sauce. My family was not impressed. I preferred McDonald's to this shit excuse of a burger place. I'am really sorry about writing this but it needed to be said. Very disappointed!
author: Colin G.

description:
So after hearing people rave about In-N-Out, I decided I had to try it when I saw one in San Francisco.  The price is great in the tourist trap of Fisherman's Wharf.  Wish I had read the reviews about animal style before I went but now I know.  

Being from Austin, I much prefer P Terry's...a very similar concept but local to Austin.  They have a few additional items on the menu and I think it is a better burger than In-N-Out.  Check them out if you are in Austin sometime.
author: Adam F.

description: Really.....okay California what's the big deal about this place.  Haven't you heard of Steak 'n Shake?  This is an average hamburg place with a limited menu and is not worth the calories.   My regret is I actually this tasteless burger and dry fries.  If you are forced to go ask about the secret menu as some people order special things to cover the taste of this food.
author: Joe M.

description:
(review dated 3/09):
recommended by friend, went to try it out while visiting.

it was quite crowded around the clock, so when we went in (about 3pm), grabbed seats as i saw them. menu was simple w/only 3 choices of food (like, regular, cheese, double patty), couple choices of drinks (soda & ice teas/lemonades?), 3 different combos (mix & match of the same things).

let bf handle the ordering, and he got himself an "animal style" burger (w/grilled onions and all) while giving me the regular double patty w/raw onion. j*rk.

well, the burger... honestly, burger is a burger to me. didn't find it soooo much better than other chained fast food joints, but it wasn't any less grandiose than the "gourmet" ones offered in nice restaurants. fries are good though--it's made fresh and not greasy. didn't see they had milkshake (coz i was too desperate to grab seats); would've tried one otherwise. told bf i wanted lemonade (seeing there's pink or light, or something like that), he got me the light, which i don't like just as much as any other "diet" drinks. 

it was a good meal, all things considered. like their principle on using fresh ingredients and being a little more health-conscious (ex. not using re-fry oil) than other fast food chains.

two complaints about this location: 1) it's kinda far from pier 39; had to walk all the way back to eat (coz when we first passed by we were still full) then back to pier 33 to board a cruise; 2) there wasn't a bathroom in the restaurant!!  had to walk out to use the public ones in the plaza. nothing major, just a little whining.
:)
author: Francisca W.

description: Fresh cheeseburgers and fries!  Worth walking down to Fisherman's Wharf, I think.  I'm not too keen on the touristy-ness of that neighborhood but occasionally I'll venture down to hit In-n-Out.  If you like super golden crisp fries, try ordering them "well-done".
author: Paige W.

description:
There's a Hooters next door. 

It's In-n-Out. 

Hot pants. Hot hamburgers. Next door to each other? Get out of town. I did.
author: Will C.

description:
As a resident of the East Coast, In-n-Out was worthy of two trips during my week-long stay in SF. The cheeseburger, whether animal style or old school, always fits the bill: for lunch or late night slightly drunken eats. Even if you have to take a cab to get there. 

Service at this location was friendly and bubbly, as service as In-N-Outs always seems to be. While some may not be fans of the not so salty fries, I much prefer their fresh crisp taste to those sodden with sodium chloride. 

I know I've asked you a million times, but In-N-Out, will you please forge eastward? We could really use you around here.
author: Kathleen M.

description:
One of these things is not like the other, one of these things is not the same. 

What could it be? How could this In-N-Out be any different from any other location? They're really all the same. The same burgers, the same fries, the same menus. Everything.  The food is good, great for fast food, and it fulfills that nostalgic need for me and every other person that had some double-double action when growing up. So what's the difference?

Shared bathrooms. You need a secret code to access them. They are dirty. Filthy even. And far away, down some stairs, around the back, down a hallway, and protected by a combo-lock. 

Otherwise, this is another fine example of how everything should have extra sauce and pickles.
author: Don B.

description:
I can see all the "WTF is wrong with you???" looks now.  

Yes, it's true, I didn't think In-N-Out was so special.

On my one sunny day in San Francisco, I walked all over the city, and my stop for lunch was In-N-Out.  I bypassed all the delicious Italian food in North Beach and all the seafood at Fisherman's Wharf just to have the fabled Double-Double, fries and a Coke.  

I really don't see what all the fuss is about.  I-N-O was better than a lot of fast food burgers I've tasted.  I'd gladly choose I-N-O over McDonald's and BK.  Would I choose it over Shake Shack, Goodburger or Five Guys?  Probably not (to be clear, I'd enthusiastically choose I-N-O over Five Guys NYC, but definitely not over Five Guys DC).

The fries were unremarkable.  I was not adequately advised about the Animal Style Fries prior to my vacation to SF, so I didn't get to try them.  I did, however, see Animal Style fries at the Redwood City location, and I'm kind of glad I didn't.

The register guys at this I-N-O were really nice, and when I told them where I was from, they gave me stickers and little games, which of course I saved for Roderick.  It took me a while, but I did manage to get them to him.
author: Maria M.

description:
Well, I heard so much about it, and it is mentioned so frequently in pop culture, I had to give it a shot.

Sorry, Californians, but if you think this is gourmet burger, you are out of your freaking minds!

It really depends what is your basis for comparison. If you are comparing In-N-Out with fast food chains (McDonald's, Burger King, etc) than yeah, it is much better. But comparing to good burgers, either gourmet restaurants or small chains, leaves in-n-out way behind.
author: Shai H.

description:
I'm from Phoenix, so I'm not an In-N Out, fanatic, but I've been craving it for a few days. So after one muni ride up to the wharf, I ordered myself one animal style cheeseburger, animal style fries, and a neopolitan shake. The place is very crowded, even on a Wednesday, so don't expect large groups to fit. It's a shame they put it in such a touristy spot. Regardless, it isn't really too bad.
The food is ok. AT the end of the day, In-N-Out just kind of tastes like fast food to me. I love fast food, but I can think of a few places (Sonic, Carl's Jr), that I enjoy the food more at. ONce you get over the secret menu, it's just kind of... blah.

Look for the bible verses printed on the hamburger wrapper and drink cups! I'm not Christian but if I was I'd probably get a kick out of it.
author: Montana O.

description:
It's like everything you love about In-N-Out, except less.  Specifically:

- No drive-thru
- Longer lines
- Fewer places to sit

The establishment's saving grace is that it's the only In-N-Out in the city.  It's an easy way to show out-of-state friends what they are missing (and you can hit up the rest of the Fisherman's Wharf sites as well).
author: Bill H.

description:
I just don't get it. People raaaaaave about In & Out, but I don't get the appeal! I had tried it years ago, and wasn't wowed, but decided to give it another go. Here's the thing:
1) It's near a tourist trap, and there was a line out the door.
2) Because of the line, no place to sit inside, and pretty crowded outside, but managed to score a spot.
3) The burger (and the fries) really not that great. I've been told the problem is that I didn't ask for it animal style, but honestly, I'm not sure I want to waste the time and money to give it another go. Sorry in & out. =(
author: Frances A.

description: The burgers was kinda soggy and wet with lots of dressing dripping out. Lots of people and kinda chaotic so the staff don't have time to clean tables and floor. I usually like In-N-Out but this was a disappointment.
author: Mikael H.

description: What is there left to say besides what we already know? In-N-Out is hands down the best ever burger even made on planet earth. I'll be a customer even if they doubled the price that's how good they are. One to to the newbie when ordering fries tell them you want them well done you'll thank me later. Lastly to the owners please relocate this restaurant far away from tourists we've all had enough of them here in San Francisco and most would agree another friendly location far from tourism would be nice.
author: Michele C.

description:
In-n-out has very consistent food across all franchises....so the food here is delicious - as you'd expect.

So why the 3 stars? People, prepare yourself for craziness. The rating is ... I guess not so much the food or the service, but the sheer smallness of the place. With such a traffic-y area, this in-n-out is TINY. Packed with people waiting for food, and scouting empty tables or standing over people waiting for them to leave.

I hate scavenging for tables, but at this location, you must, or prepare to stand. If this is the only location you can go to for in-n-out, then by all means try it. You'll love it! But if you have a choice, opt for the one in daly city - so much less stressful and crowded.
author: Carol L.

description: Doesn't live up to hype, just a basic old hamburger place like Dick's in Seattle (or pick your towns retro burger joint). Small menu, long wait, mediocre food. Better burgers can be had at a variety of other places: Carl's Jr., 5 Guys, Fat Burger, just to name a few. Service would have been faster at McD's and the fries hotter. Nuf said.
author: Alex S.

description: It was a fast food burger. I would rate it about the same as Wendy's for us Midwesterners. I do have to say for all the hype I thought it would be better. Fries were straight soggie.
author: Torry H.

description:
In-N-Out Burger is a religion. Millions choose to fall in line, while a smaller subset beat the drum with fervor. I happen to be a non-believer, so this review may or may not be for you, depending on your degree of indoctrination :)

I'll start off by saying that In-N-Out is not a bad burger. The food itself is three stars. However, it is, at the end of the day, a fast food burger. Yes, it's better than Burger King,  McDonalds and even Steak-n-Shake, but it is still fast food, plain and simple. The burger is fine, but for a few dollars more, you can have an out-of-body experience at Smashburger, or any of the other "better burger" fast casual places that have been popping up in the last few years. True, it's not a fair comparison, because Smashburger and others really compete in a more premium category, but the title of "World's most craveable burger" definitely doesn't go to In-N-Out.

This particular location's proximity to Fisherman's Wharf is the reason for the one-star reduction. Unfortunately, being in the middle of a tourist trap means that this In-N-Out is constantly mobbed by out-of-towners trying to get their fix. The customers are clambering over each other, trying to grab the last remaining seat, while others are draining the ketchup dispensers. Furthermore, you have to hike to get to the restroom. It's a madhouse, and is something that no self-respecting burger lover should want to be a part of.
author: Safford B.

description: A trip to SF would not be complete without In-N-Out! I ordered from the secret menu this time so I got animal style fries and each of us got a single burger without chopped chillis and grilled onions! Every bite was like a dream and I can only wait until I next get to eat here again!
author: Julianne Z.

description: On a recent trip back to California i (of course) stopped here to once again hug my dear old burger sweetheart. Food-wise, everything stays the same as when i left (tears). What i like to add is DO NOT FEED THE PIGEONS WHEN YOU DINE IN THE OUTSIDE SITTING AREA! Holy shit those pigeons are crazy over your french fries. I mean crazy enough to jump on the table and stare at you in a GROUP! I run the hell out of there before they get physical. Oh and these pigeons fly INTO the trash can for the fries. I don't know if the animal control people should come over and take a look, just for the pigeons' sake: aren't they gonna get type II diabetes by eating like this?!
author: Cathy S.

description: I finally lost my in n out virginity...jeez...why did I wait so long? The burger--animal style of course--was juicy and out of this world. Worth the walk to fisherman's wharf and WELL worth the ridiculous wait. Lucky I don't live anywhere near these chains or I"ll be 100lbs heavier from eating these burgers.
author: Maria G.

description: Unbelievable service at this In-N-Out there was a line out the door and we got our food within 15 minutes of standing in the line and placing our order. On top of that the food did not seem rushed and I did not feel cheated on my portions as I sometimes do at a busy fast food restaurant. All in all well worth the "wait" and crowded tables. **Also a tip is to leave the busy inside dining and exit the doors near the soda to sit outside in the overflow seating.
author: Joey B.

description: Great to see this fabulous burger place in San Francisco.  Menu is simple, and not fancy, staff is friendly and efficient.  And the in n out burger is perfection. Dime may not like the fries, but this is because they always use fresh potatoes and make the fries fresh not frozen,  so they taste a bit different than what most people are used to.  This is a West Coast classic
author: Lisa C.

description: Really small dining space relative to the popularity of the location. However, the food is nice and cheap. I came because I always hear the hype of this place, but I didn't think it was any more special than other fast food places that are more widely available. Make sure you find an online menu first before ordering.
author: Stephen M.

description: In-n-out. Not sure what more needs to be said. They are consistently good no matter which one you go to. They only reason I didn't give this one 5 stars is the fact that there are tons if tourist running around. But you know that going into it.
author: Robert F.

description:
This was my second trip to In-N-Out ever!! I lived on the East Coast so I always heard about this burger joint, but never been close enough to one to try. I didn't get the famous "Animal Style" because I don't like onions. I head that is what you need to order. I loved that you get a lot of fires but the burger is something that is not too big to fit in your month. Its also a great place. I am looking forward to trying it out again.

I will say on this location that you may have to share your table with people cause it does get pretty crowded. But I end up meeting some cool people that way.
author: Justin C.

description:
I never realized how much I loved In-N-Out until I left California for college. Honestly speaking, I only had In-N-Out a handful of times in my 18 years in California. Since I've been away for college, almost every time I come home to California, In-N-Out is one of my must-go-to places. 

First and foremost, you HAVE to order from the "secret menu". You've gotta do that to maximize your value at In-N-Out. My favorite is double double protein style (try to make myself feel like I am being healthy, which is a double cheeseburger with lettuce instead of bun), and animal fries. Honestly, animal fries are probably one of the worst things you can have, but the potatoes are SO fresh, definitely worth it. PS the wikipedia article for poutine says that animal fries are a "play" on poutine. Since I first tried the well-known Canadian dish, animal fries win, hands down.
author: Chrissy H.

description:
I am from California. I love In N Out... It's a given! 

This In N Out is the ONLY one in SF!! YES THAT IS CORRECT ONLY ONE!  so for that I can not dock them for the super long wait for food seeming how the line is out the door! 

Located in the Wharf (Tourist central) it gets a lot of business. My favorite part about the long wait is all the non-Californians talk about how they are excited about the place or ask how to order. It's super cute!

It has the same exact taste that you would expect from In N Out! 

love it
author: Dawn N.

description:
You can never go wrong with In-N-Out.  It's the best fast food burger place out there.  Hell, it's the best burger out there.

Great customer service, delicious food, we were able to score inside seats.  What more can you ask for?
author: Analily V.

description:
While in SF for work, I took a trip down to Fisherman's Wharf specifically because I knew there was an In-N-Out and I had been dying to try the burger. 

The burger (double double animal style) was very good...but it was a burger.  Yes, the veggies were fresh and it tasted good, but again, it was a fast food burger.

The fries were mediocre and not that great.

I would go back if I was looking for a fast food burger on the fly and I was in the area, but am I craving it nonstop now that I'm back on the east coast?  No.  Did I seek it out again on my trip? No.

Pretty good, but when I'm looking for a better-than-mcdonald's burger from a fast-food place, Five Guys is just as good.
author: Cat S.

description:
My friends were in town from the East Coast and didn't stop bothering me about wanting to try In-N-Out, every time they mentioned it, I would say you know..lets try something closer. I just was deviating from walking to Fisherman's Wharf because that place is full of tourists who buy "I Love SF" sweaters because they seriously brought the wrong clothing to SF thinking it was going to be hot, and not to mention how boring and touristy it is. But they insisted and I had to take them. 

It was like a Friday afternoon and full of people.  We ordered the cheeseburger, fries, and soda. There was no where to sit inside, so I told them I'd go find a table outside. I spot one table available and sit down. Before I know it, I had not 1, not 2, but like 6 pigeons attack me and yelling KAW, KAW, or whatever cooing sound they do. Did I have a crumb on me or something? Maybe, but these nasty birds were crazy, I'd never has one as a pet.

When my friends came outside with the food, I said you know maybe we should sit inside, these pigeons are giving me the crazy eye. So we couldn't find anything inside and just stayed at the first table. As we started to eat, all the pigeons brought their friends and went crazy! They were desperate for our burgers and fries and wouldn't go away. It became so annoying that more kept coming, only deformed ugly ones this time. I could not eat my burger in peace, but it was okay and cheap! Maybe this place is better late after going out, but not so much in the day.
author: Stephanie M.

description: Went here to try the infamous burgers while visiting California. I got the cheeseburger with onion and fries. It was good, but not the best burger I've had from a fast food place. I was glad I finally got to try it though! Didn't really like the fries, and the place itself was super crowded with tourists just like me. If it's nice out they do have some outdoor seating.
author: Christelle S.

description: Got to love the burger and price.  I've had a lot of burgers across the USA and really like the freshness and mix of condiments.  Had the double double with fries and a shake under nine bucks!  What a country!  Be prepared to wait a little as this location is loaded with first timers and tourist like me!
author: Mark A.

description:
I don't get it. We have CookOut in NC, so I guess that's what I compare In-N-Out to. If you haven't had CookOut, you just don't know.

Plus, what's with this "secret menu?" WTH is the point of a secret menu when apparently everyone already knows about it? I ordered my food (granted I got it animal style because i was prompted by the girl at the register to) but I don't see why a restaurant would have an "internet only" menu. 

The bun was toasted. I liked that. And the burger was pretty tasty. The fries are nothing special. And I would have loved some Cajun seasoning on them...was that on the special menu that I should have asked for?

Yeesh. And for 560 Calories that chocolate shake was not worth it. Give me a Mint Oreo Milkshake any day.

I'm sorry you west-coasters may never know the joy of CookOut. You're really missing out if you think In-N-Out is the bees knees of burger joints.
author: Lauren P.

description:
A friend of mine had two part-time jobs in high school, one at a Burger King and one at Wendy's. Can you imagine?! It was before the days of In-n-Out in NorCal or she could have dumped that bk job!

Anyhoo, I always get my cheeseburger "protein style" which means that it comes wrapped in a large leaf of iceburg, rather than a calorie/carb laden bun. It's good! Try it, you know you want to. I do not believe that lettuce has any protein, but don't let that stop you from enjoying this taste sensation.

The fries are good and I've never even noticed the biblical passages on the burger wrappers. Maybe I'm just close enough to g*d that I don't need the written word, so it does not manifest itself to me.
author: Gwynnie P.

description:
I like the burger always, love it sometimes.  Probably says more about my fickle taste buds than the burger.

Good things:

Have it your way
Everything cooked to order, not pre-made, and comes out quickly considering that and the volume of burgers cooked
More than fairly priced for size and quality
You can see them making fries with whole fresh potatoes going through a slicer
Ridiculously cheerful and friendly staff.

Not so good:

Tourists who apparently are unaware of how to act around others in a confined space in an urban environment
author: Steve S.

description: 4 out of 5 stars. Great place to eat. We found the in and out burger unfortunately towards the end of out stay in San Francisco. It was a great and fast restaurant and not only was the food good but it was also relatively inexpensive. All the other places we ate in this area were expensive. I mean, one plate at Denny's cost about 13 or 14 dollars and there were 6 of us constantly going out to eat. So this was a nice break for out wallets and food was good too. Just not a whole lot of variety on the menu but besides that, a great spot to check out!
author: Adam Y.

description:
Great Service. Everyone is always so friendly taking the orders and serving up the very good food! (plus kudos for all these very professional young people handling such a huge volume of customers -- including some not so nice tourists and local homeless, druggies, etc).

Plus they do a great job keeping the lines moving and the place clean. Wish more restaurants had this amount of pride in their food and their restaurant (indoor and outdoor).
author: John G.

description: Quick, friendly service. Difficult to find seats even during not typically busy hours. I didn't know about the secret menu. I will say, the burger was great! The fries....not so much. They need to be crispier!!!
author: John W.

description:
oh boy.. i am starting to get SICK of animal style and fries.. .I think I should have went next door to Hooters.    Drinks too sweet, fries way too salty.  Burgers are thin and dry.  Veggies on burgers are eh... .  

Do go if you need a cheap eat fix.. but make sure to turn off your taste buds, you won't need them.  

Good for groups if outdoors or crossing the street.
author: Tito Y.

description: The hamburgers here are so daaaam good but they are way too small and also the lemonade here is bomb asfuck yummmmmmm really great food.
author: David R.

description:
YUUUUUUUUUUUUM.

Ok. Seriously, being from the South I had no idea why Californians are so crazy about this place they call In-N-Out Burger. Here we have Five Guys, which might be the equivalent to In-N-Out.

This wasn't my first time eating at an In-N-Out, last year I ate at one in LA, which I thought sucked. So upon my return to California, I decided to give this one a try. For some reason it was way better. Fresh food and I finally got to try animal style. No bathrooms here though. And on the night we flew in we came here to eat and a hobo wouldn't leave us alone inside, but I enjoyed my burger anyways! We ate here at least 3 times on our trip.

Please come to Georgia! I miss you already.
author: Jessica E.

description:
My favorite burger on the west coast. (Shake Shack wins the east coast)

The grilled cheese is surprisingly good as well - for a hamburger bun with a slice of american cheese on it.
author: Little C.

description: I can't believe how good these burgers are!  Had to come here twice while in town.  Nothing new to add other than these are the best burgers under $4 that you can buy.  For me, I skip the fries and just eat a couple of their burgers... now that is a perfect lunch or dinner or late night snack!
author: Katie F.

description:
In-N-Out isn't just for Southern California anymore--the chain has spread throughout the state and has outposts in Arizona, Nevada and Texas. Being East Coast-based I decided to visit an In-N-Out to see what the fuss was about, so we descended upon the sole store in San Francisco, located somewhat unsurprisingly at Fisherman's Wharf.

In-N-Out's menu is simple--burgers, fries, shakes, and drinks. Its "secret" menu containing such items as a "grilled cheese" (a burgerless cheeseburger) and "animal style" (special sauce and fried onions) is no longer a secret; one can find it on the official website. We went purist--a couple of burgers for my husband, a "double double" (two patties, two slices of cheese) for me, fries and drinks for both of us. Place your order, get your drinks, and wait for your number to be called.

We were there at lunch and had about a ten-minute wait, as the burgers do not hit the grill until your order is placed. We both thought the burgers were very good. The toppings--lettuce, tomatoes, pickles, and Thousand Island dressing (onions are optional)--were fresh and still held a refrigerated chill as if the burger was put together at somebody's backyard cookout. The actual patties were thinner than I thought they would be but still tasted great, and the bun was perfect. The fries... some here have said that McDonald's are better and I would have to agree--they were very bland and starchy. The red-and-white tiles in the place are reminiscent of the East Coast (but rapidly spreading) chain Five Guys, and I remarked to my husband that if I could have an In-N-Out double-double with Five Guys fries that'd pretty much be the perfect fast-food meal. In-N-Outs are numerous enough in California now that you don't really have to seek one out, and as far as fast food goes you can do a lot worse.
author: Patricia B.

description:
It was another hangover.  

It started off just like any other hangover...but really, i was dying.  I felt poisoned.  Shaking like a stray cat left out in the cold

But it was to become the greatest Saturday of my life.

As i started crying on the bathroom floor, my friend looked over me and knew this was serious.   My eyes welled up with tears and i could only speak in guttural moans.  "Be downstairs in the car in 5 minutes", he said.

I knew as soon as we hit the Wharf,  that In-N-Out was where we were going.  I immediately regained a small amount of color in my placid, ghostly face and quit dry heaving out the window for a moment.  "I'm going to make it...i'm going to live", i thought to myself.

As soon as i entered the blood rushed to my head and i had to hold onto the counter top for dear life.  I was going to be damned if i died or blacked out before i had even put my order in.  I started sweating.  

Time to focus, Kirsten...you drunk bitch.

"Three animal style ... and animal  fries ... and a lemonade.  Please hurry."  

I'm not sure what it really sounded like.  I was panting heavily and was probably not making any sense at all.  My friend advised me to "Go sit the fuck down and wait...." while he took care of the rest.  

Then it happened.  It arrived.

You know, i'm not a religious person, but i think experienced something very special that hungover Saturday that might be one of the closest encounters with nirvana i have ever had.  

The experience was other wordly.  I saw rainbows and puppies and marshmallow skies.  I cried a little, i'm not going to lie.  It made me a woman, straight up.

When it was all said and done it was as if i had been given a new lease on life.  I vowed never to drink again (which i broke 1 day later) and walked out of that place satisfied in ways i never knew possible.

so why 4 stars?  Its in Fishermans Wharf, duh! And if i have to get attacked by that Bush Man or the Silver Statue guys one more time, i might give up In-N -Out forever.  Trust.
author: Kirsten S.

description: It's a fast, trendy paste burger joint on the west coast...What's so good about it...hmmm... I really didn't see anything of surprise...But the gimmick of knowing the secret password of the day..to super size your meals for free... is kind of cool. It's what any fatty boy/girl dream, would want! I hear their fries are amazing! But yet to try it..due to the fact that were bouncing off one restaurant to the next.  But the shakes were good! I honestly will rather go for a diner burger any day... cause they know how to roll ~ But I would go back again, and get the real deal experience next time! But for now... u get's a passing grade! woot!
author: Johnny Y.

description: I honestly don't even know where else to get a burger(for under $20). Everything about this place is efficient, and I really appreciate that. Comparing the fries to anywhere else is a pointless exercise--just find out how they can make them the way you would like, and they will. Will surely bring all my east coasts friends here to say that we did.
author: Joe A.

description: 3 stars is only because this place is so packed! Not enough seating and no drive thru is a bad combination. Entire time your eating your table is being watched over by someone trying to pounce on it! But other than that staff is very friendly and burgers, fries, and shakes are awesome!!!
author: Gilbert S.

description:
This resturant in Irvine is terrible. I found spider in their sandwich. I hate in and out of Irvinr.
When I ask them to explain, they did not even answer my question.
author: Bahareh M.

description: Always solid food but as a resident the wait times are frustrating. This is the only location within San Francisco so it's not a surprise it's always busy. However the staff looks overworked and could use some help. There should be at least 4 more people on staff for each shift to handle this type of volume.
author: Christopher M.

description:
How simple can it be to order a burger? In-N-Out makes it as easy as 1-2-3, literally. 

McDonalds, Burger-king, Jack In the Box all have menus with over 20+ choices to order from. In addition, they contain less nutritional value and more artery clogging nutrients. In contrast, In-N-Out has a simplified menu of #1 being a Cheeseburger, #2 being a double double, and #3 your basic hamburger. In addition there is also a SECRET MENU that consists of intriguing options that adds a twist to your basic fries and cheeseburger, such as animal fries and protein style burgers. Also, it just seems healthier to eat here when compared to the other burger spots.

It essentially costs as much as the big food chain restaurants but is just as delicious. My favorite order is the double double with onions, no tomatoes with a fresh order of French Fries. The average wait is about 5-10 minutes depending on the time you eat there. The meat tastes delicious, the condiment they put on the burgers also adds a great flavor to the burger and overall makes it a great experience. If your more into trying something different, ask for animal style fries and try ordering a 3 by 3 or 4 by 4 burger. Massive amounts of cheese, buns, and patties that will fill your stomach. For better quality and  taste, eat all your food within 10 minutes, especially the Secret Menu items because they tend to decline in taste as they get colder over time. 

I would say the only trouble with this place is the extreme number of tourists that cram into this place, but that's business. The workers tend to be young and move efficiently and are usually friendly. I've never been farther East than Nevada, but I'm pretty sure In-N-Out is a top 5 burger joint here in the West and would give the East Coast burger spots a run for their money.
author: Jesus A.

description: This place is crazy busy, but they work through people really fast.  Good luck finding a table though.
author: Mike M.

description:
They should call it In-N-Out Fries (btw, we have a burger). The fries upstage the burger every time. Freshly cut, shoestring, and light, usually perfectly seasoned.

The burger is of good quality, under-seasoned and haphazardly slapped together. Animal-style is a must.

Worth the wait? Maybe for the fries.
author: Ryan L.

description:
This place is swarming with tourists, but occasionally you'll get lucky, like we did yesterday, and they'll provide you with enough eye candy to whisk away your grumpiness at being in Fisherman's Wharf.

If it's a sunny day, secure a table outside. For around $35 you can buy lunch for six of your friends (and yourself) as a thank you for their helping you move.
author: Miriam W.

description: I dig Bud's Broiler when at home in New Orleans, but I buy an In and Out Burger when I am way out west. It is basic burger/fries type menu, but it tastes like the cow was recently deceased.
author: Andy S.

description:
Oops let my domain lapse so that zenlemur.com link is not mine any more.  Secret menu is now on the official In-n-Out site anyhow: http://www.in-n-out.com/secretmenu.asp

I am trying to get them to create a new secret menu item for onion lovers/pickle haters - it's called "genex style" and it is:
animal style, no pickles, add fresh onions 

I keep ordering it this way and about 66% of the time they get it wrong so hence I believe it is due it's own designation so those millions like me who don't like pickles, but love onions can have total In-n-Out bliss!
author: Gene X.

description: I live in NC. Always wanted to try In N Out whenever I go to Cali. Which I did, at this location. Very disappointed. Burger was dry. Fries were stale. Not good as I thought. But! I still have hope. I will definitely try it again whenever I come back to Cali. Just a different In N Out location for sure.
author: Kim N.

description:
I would give it six if I could.  So what if I was on a diet before I came here after I had already eaten lunch. So what. 

This place is true love.
author: Mark M.

description: Extremely crowded and I understand why... I LOVE IT !!!  The burgers are pure heaven, perfectly cooked, juicy, flavorful and delicious, the topping just put the burger over the top.  Oh and did I mention the cost... unbelievably reasonable!!!  I've paid much more at burger joints for much less of  a delightful taste.  The chocolate shake was outstanding, cold, creamy, mildly sweet and the perfect consistency!!  My son and husband loved their Double Doubles as much as I loved my Cheeseburger.  The service was efficient and friendly.  It was fun watching all the controlled chaos in the kitchen.  Wish that In-N-Out Burger was in Virginia because I would definitely be a loyal regular
author: Patricia G.

description:
Really, it's not worth the wait.

You stand in a long line with tourists who can't make up their mind over a minuscule menu, you place your order, then you wait, and you wait, and sometime during your already refilled soda your number gets called.

The Double Double is pretty darn small.  I'm not too sure if the two mini patties together even equal a quarter pound of meat.  They're cheesy though and sloppy greasy.  No real beef taste in the patties, just an overwhelming taste of oil and processed cheese food.  I asked for grilled onions in mine and got maybe a teaspoonful at most.  It tastes pretty much like a fast food burger except this place isn't fast.

I like the idea that the fries are freshly cut and prepared, but even that was poorly executed.  My fries were limp and oily.  This place makes McDonald's and Wendy's seem like four star restaurants.

The only saving grace ... unlimited soda refills for all that time you're waiting.
author: Wilhelm Y.

description: I love In-N-Out burger - I wish we had this on the east coast!  They have the best fast food by far!
author: Maureen B.

description: after my flight to san francisco i decided to hit up in and out burger. ive always heard people raving about it. the line was ridiculous even though i went around midnight. my only real complaint is the burger. stick to the double unless you want a thin burger. the fries and shake were good though, i wont lie. it didnt seem like it was worth the hype.
author: Floyd A.

description:
This is almost too easy to review.

THE GOOD: Price, quality, taste, fries, service, the "secret" menu

THE BAD: This is the only SF location!?! Come on dudes, open another one in the City!

THE BOTTOM LINE: With new to the area competition from the likes of 5 Guys and The Habit, In-N-Out still remains the undisputed KING OF ALL FAST FOOD BURGERS, period.
author: Robin S.

description: This is the third best burger I ever had (#2 Shake Shack, Madison Square Park, NYC. #1 Flippin Burgers, Stockholm, Sweden). Great location near the water, quick service, not too long waiting for a seat if already full... and yeah, it's all true, In-N-Out does indeed give you a fab, quality, burger meal for a cheap price!
author: Stefan P.

description:
The In-N-Out Burger on Fisherman's Wharf was my first ever experience of In-N-Out. I somehow ended up spending $15 on my meal. No it isn't expensive, I just ended up eating THAT much of their fast and delicious greasy, cheesy, burgers. Grilled Onions..YUM! YUM! YUM! Okay I'll dock a point cus their fries aren't that good, but their milkshakes are DELICIOUS-NESS!  Needless to say I left with an In-N-Out T-Shirt to remind me everytime I wear it... that I need to go back to Cali so I can get my In-N-Out fix. Damnit Washington get your sh*t together and get an In-N-Out up here...that and a Sonic Drive In.
~G
author: Gavin N.

description:
I was in California 7 days, and how many times do you think I ate In N Out!? 

DING DING DING DING!!! I ate In N Out 7 days in a rowww!!!!!

This is seriously as good as it gets in a burger.

Warm, lightly toasted buns...
Juicy perfectly cooked beef...
Fresh crisp lettuce...
luscious ripe tomatoes...
oozing melted cheese....
grilled onions slathered to perfection...
those thin, long, sublime fries...
and that heavenly thousand island dressing...

Animal style everything, you won't regret it. 

If you do not eat In N Out burger, you are worthless... That is all.
author: Rutit P.

description: My favorite burger for a fair price. Try animal-styled fries or protein-burger.
author: Björn G.

description: In-N-Out burger... this one, like all of them is ALWAYS packed! I am gluten free and thankfully almost everything but the buns, are gluten free. Yummy, and prefect for late nite burger craving. I had to splurge last night and enjoy a cheeseburger with the bun, lol. Hubby ordered a double double with cheese, kid order just plain old hamburger. Whole order was prefect and we all enjoyed our favorite burger spot!
author: ashley n.

description:
I have never ever been to an IN-N-Out in my 35 yrs on Planet Earth. I am an East Coast boy so the opportunity doesn't present itself too often. Now my wife has been raving for yrs about how great the burgers are and so naturally when we passed by one at Fisherman's Wharf, she insisted we go. I was curious and wanted to try it out, but it was hard to pass up on all that seafood they have all over the Wharf. Still, she insisted...and she didnt really have to twist my arm. 

The burger is better than anything from BK of mcDonalds...but I would put it on par with a Wendy's burger. So needless to say, I wasn't blown away. The fries were pretty good too and I hear they are hand made fresh every day. The line out the door for this place was sick, we got in just in time.
author: Rich J.

description: It's July 26 2014 I walked in the restaurant at 10:30am I was the second person in line the grills were just heated up and I had to wait for 15 minutes this is not like this restaurant usually there service is quick wouldn't want to go there at lunch time.
author: Jerry H.

description:
ghetto....funny because where it is located is a tourist attraction alongside the pier, but I definitely do not see any tourists eating here. But then again, why would you come here if you are visiting from afar. 

I had a scary/bad experience here. I felt like my bag was going to get stolen from me. It is hard to find parking with this location and when you finally get inside this fast food chain, it looks filthy. I do not think the workers clean the tables or anything because it feels super greasy. The food itself I would give it a 3 because I do like In-N-Out Burger. I think that this location is a big turn off and I would rather drive the distance to the location in Daly City than eat my food here.
author: Katrina T.

description: Absolutely the best fast food burger out there! This has to be our favorite fast food place when it comes to burger. We live in NYC & they need to open one out here. The place was clean. The service was great! Friendly staff! Grilled onion is a must for the burger!
author: Mr F G And Mrs M S.

description: Great food, good service.  However, we arrived when the restaurant opened and within 20 minutes the homeless began occupying the dining area.  I was on vacation and don't really want my kids solicited, nor do I want to watch someone using the soda fountain to bathe.
author: William L.

description:
I totally wasn't expecting to find an in-n-out in SF, this was a nice surprise.

minus 1 star for not having a bathroom. but then i read the previous review that says it's out back? but still -1 star for making me run to hooters to pee and come back to order.
author: Solomon C.

description:
This review comes from a local who lives near a few In-N-Out locations down in Silicon Valley.

Why the hell is a local at Fisherman's Wharf? Hey, I like playing tourist once a while. Shut it.

Anyway, I was in the area, and was really hungry. I didn't want seafood, and I wasn't willing to spend much. I got in the stupid-long line, but at least it moved quickly. I waited about 10 minutes for my animal-style burger and fries. The burger was fine, but the fries were better than at other locations. 

Basically, it's the same as any other location. It's just really, really crowded, hence the three stars. (Oh, and the prices are a tiny bit higher). If you live in SF, haven't tried In-N-Out yet, and have a car, go to the one in Daly City. If you're a tourist from outside the west coast, it's worth a visit.
author: Julia G.

description: For the serious grease cravings, I recommend In-N-Out for an alternative to the more traditional McDonalds and Burger King scene. The fries are less crispy than aforementioned but that is because the style of cooking is better. It is not tourism central must have, but it's a genuinely good alternative when you feel like burgers, shakes and fries! Enjoy.
author: JJKay

description:
No parking unless you consider 2 1/2 blocks close enough..if you're lucky.

does a chain like IN N OUT need a review?  i guess so.  

its okay.  i've been nearby here looked and saw the line was short so i went in and ordered whatever i feel like having anywhere from a regular cheese burger to a double.

for as long as any burger and fries that come out of here its just too slow.  it takes that long even if there was NO ONE in line in front of me.  i guess it should be great because its done so fresh.  but its not.

for this waiting period i would rather go to...um, nevermind its not fair to this place to advertise for someone else.  you'll just have to see my other burger place reviews.
author: Bing D.

description:
What is there new to add to a review of In-N-Out. Double-double deliciousness? Animal-style fries awesomeness? Milkshake mouth-watering-ness? 

Everyone has already pretty much covered it. In-N-Out is the king of burger chains and I will forever remain its loyal subject.

What I will add is that this particular In-N-Out joint served as my own personal 'White Castle' goal this last weekend. Foolishly (albeit drunkenly) walking from the Tenderloin, we arrived both famished and fatigued. But ohh man, just like the movie, that first bite into my Double-Double was simply magical.

4 stars though because this In-N-Out lacks a bathroom. I usually just hop over to the Hooters next door, but it's still an inconvenience.

In-N-Out. Like I said, what is there really new to say?
author: Tom P.

description: Not sure why In-N-Out has such a cult following, and wanted to refresh my memory of what an In-N-Out burger tasted like. Verdict? Eh. Solid burger but nothing I would kill someone over. The fries were hot, tasty and crisp, I'll give them that. The burger was everything a burger should be, and yet...nothing about it made it super special or memorable. Perhaps the charm in In-N-Out is that it is perfectly consistent, and consistency is a creature comfort.
author: Rebecca L.

description:
I go out of my way just to get my hands on one of there delicious burgers, very great tasting value for money. love how they have such a basic easy menu, but also have a secret menu. love there cheese fries there the best.

 this place is always packed. only downside is you are lucky to get a table. 
and sometimes you gotta wait about 15 minutes, but thats expected you can just see how hard the staff are working.
author: Jimmy L.

description: I have no idea why people love this place. Fries were stale and cold, totally in edible. Burger was plain, boring and tasteless. I've had better burgers from hospital cafés.
author: Amanda C.

description:
2x2 extra toast, cheese fries well done, coke float.

Eat it and spread the word.

What distinguishes In-N-Out is not necessarily the beef, but the ingredients AROUND the burger.  Sure, the beef patty itself seems to be a slightly higher quality, but ultimately it's still fast food beef.  The bread, lettuce, tomato, onions, etc...THOSE are exceptionally fresh and delicious!

The SF location is always mad busy, so be ready to wait on line (not too long, though), and to take your loot to go.
author: Dmytro A.

description:
Feels strange eating here after not having eaten a burger here for like 6 months. Funny thing is some people eat here every week!  Anyhow, came here with a couple of friends when I spent the weekend in the city.  This is easily the busiest in-and-out I've ever been to, plenty of tourists plaguing FW... which can be both good and bad. You probably won't be able to find a seat inside for a group, and there will be those people who stay much longer than they should be. 

I thought the quality of the burgers were good here and the service was just quick enough to be considered "fast" food.  We were able to grab a table outside, with plenty of cool SF ocean air which can even feel cold during July. The place is a cheap, but extremely busy.  The public bathroom is rough, but not the worst I've ever seen in the city.  I always like to at least wash my hands after eating a burger.
author: Kenny P.

description: I LOVE In-N- Out Burger; it really doesn't get much better than this. I love to bite into my juicy burger and not have that awful feeling you get when you eat at a Burger King or McDonalds. At first, I did not like the french fries; however, that takes some time getting used to. They taste like real potatoes, not the garbage at other fast food joints. One negative about the restaurant is that it can be quite messy and takes staff a while to clean up after other guests. My advice to anyone who has never been to an In-N-Out is to order a double double animal style. Animal style is not listed on the menu but you will be more than satisfied when your burger comes out! Animal style uses a mustard-cooked beef patty combined with additional pickles, cheese, spread and grilled onions on top of your already awesome burger. Absolutely delicious.
author: Tommy C.

description:
This is review 2 of 5. I think I've been to every In-n-out in the bay area (Pinole, Mill Valley, Oakland, Daly City and SF).

This is the only place I'll eat if I am forced to be anywhere near Pier 39. 

What can I say about In-n-out: Best fast food burger. Ever. I am a burger man and this is a high honor.

The meat is juicy and salty (mmm, that could be taken wrong) and all of their ingredients are fresh and not frozen.

You even see the guys cutting the potatoes. Now, you ever seen that at any other fast food joint?

I'm a double double man myself. I like their lemonade. Most places have soda (which I don't drink) but no non-carbonated options.

If you go I recommend asking them for cheese fries. It's a special order, but they'll do it.

Their shakes are freakin' awesome.

I can't help but think of an outspoken friend who would claim that if you found a partner that could suck down their thick shakes that you had found a winner (PG 13 version of that story).

Price-wise: $6 gets you a burger, drink and fries. That's a damn good deal.

This In-n-out is ALWAYS crowded. Shoot, sometimes there's a line out the door (usually weekends). This place is full of tourists. Good luck finding a table. At least this one has outdoor seating. You can watch people walk into Hooters. 

This in-n-out doesn't have parking or a bathroom. For parking...you're screwed. For a bathroom you need to go a couple of doors down for the public bathroom.
author: Carlos A.

description:
I'm a fan of In-N-Out.  I try to stop at least one time during trips to California.

This was my first visit to the Fisherman's Wharf store.  I got there later in the afternoon (about 4:00) and there was a line to the door.  The staff were quickly taking orders so the wait wasn't long.  I was able to find a seat inside but it looks like there is outdoor seating in the nearby courtyard.

The crowd slowed down about the time my order arrived but was surging again by the time I left.

The double-double was tasty as usual.  The fries, however, weren't that good; stubby bits that, while crispy, lacked the fluffy center.
author: Joe P.

description:
The only exception to my Vegetarianism, i sometimes indulge in a Double-Double and rightfully so.

Best Burger Chain in the world, must check out.

Location is great for tourists, but long lines and waits are typical (though it keeps food fresh).
author: Ayall S.

description: The absolute best-value dining experience+view on the wharf.
author: George T.

description: I try to avoid on a weekend because it gets jam packed with tourists, but its within walking distance of my apartment. The one thing I truly love about living in north beach (And i dont love much about it, believe me.)
author: Britney K.

description:
Every single In-N-Out Burger in the great state of California is mind bendingly awesome...except for this one.

Here, there is a dankness and even a sandy feeling to the building beacause of its proximity to the water (though it's funny about the sand because there's no beach). 

The place is filthy, and packed to the gills with derelicts and young hoodlums who are LOUD. The service, though carried out by the same earnestness found in other franchises, is helplessly slow and sucky.

The food comes out lukewarm at best, and the fries lack their usual sass. 

There is no restroom, unless you count the one under lock and key in some wet, far off alleyway which is multisex and shared by about ten other Fisherman's Wharf businesses.

Just don't bring an out-of-towner here for their first In-N-Out. They won't appreciate how great it can really be. The nearby Ghiradelli's or tacky figurine shops have better wow-I'm-in-Cali value.
author: Jia J.

description:
I'm always a fan of In-and-out. The food was ready in the standard 10 minutes. Our cheeseburgers and animal fries were deliciousness. 
Not the cleanest floors, but our table and chairs were clean enough.
author: Candice T.

description: Better than your average burger place. Super packed but the workers are amazing and work as fast as possible to get the orders completed. Every burger tastes amazing and they don't need any salt or pepper at all. The fries were crispy and fresh, made throughout the day. It's rare to just see fries sitting there waiting to be served . The vanilla milkshake was average but it complements the burger and fries.
author: Bibiano L.

description: It's the only In-N-Out in the San Francisco area! But this location brings the goods. I'm a fan of the protein burger (where they remove the bun in exchange for two peices of lettuce).
author: Andrew M.

description: My only gripe is that there isn't a location on the East Coast!!! Who doesn't LOVE In and Out!?!? It's unpatriotic if that's the case!!!
author: Christa B.

description:
You're a victim of your own success, In n Out. 

I love your burgers but I won't come here for lunch. I only wait that long for burgers from Pearl's, Benders, or Zeitgeist.
author: Christopher K.

description:
Being from the east  coast, I hear people rave about this burger chain constantly. I went here when I was on vacation to San Francisco and was incredibly excited to try it. And the two star rating of "Meh, I've experienced better." was exactly how I felt when I left. Think of Wendy's. Pretty much the exact same thing. I feel like McDonalds and Burger King are both better, and that isn't really saying much. The service wasn't very fast, the burger was very very average for a fast food place (it really reminded me of Wendy's). Granted, it was better then Carls JR, which sucked, but that also isn't saying much. The shake was tiny and wasn't very good either, and the fries were really just weird, and not in a very good way.

Don't believe the hype. You can get a better burger at any McDonalds, or just spend 2-3 more dollars and go to a real restaurant for a burger which is probably about 10-20x better.
author: Sam O.

description: Classic in-n-out but with a looong wait (at least for lunch on Saturday's).  Plenty of seating area, both inside and out.
author: Alex B.

description:
I am from Texas and the girl I went to visit in San Jose said I have to try In and Out Burger before I go home.  We were at the Fisherman's wharf and decided to stop by. 
She ordered the "secret menu" items including the Protein Burger, Neapolitan Shake, and Animal Fries.  
All were excellent.  The problem is the seating.  We went around lunch time and it was jam packed so where we had to watch for who was getting up from there seats and snag them before another person sat down.  It was freezing outside back in January so we had to get a seat inside.  Bad part was so did everyone else.
Overall a pretty good burger just be prepared to take it togo or fight for a seat.
author: Robert A.

description:
Holy Mackeral. If you want the best burger and fries in town for the price of a Starbucks latte - head over to this In-N-Out. 
And don't forget to ask for a cheeseburger animal style.
Comfort food and a great reason to visit the mostly-despised-by-locals Fisherman's Wharf.
Five stars!
author: Nigel F.

description: Lots of my friends rave about In-N-Out Burger and lament that there is no Hawaii location.  So when I found myself at Fisherman's Wharf and saw that Yelp reviews of the Wharf restaurants were lukewarm at best, I decided it was time to finally try In-N-Out.  Unfortunately, I found nothing at all special here.  Five Guys blows In-N-Out away, especially when comparing fries.  The burger is just there but for the price, I didn't expect anything special.  The fries are shoestring, had no taste (not salted at all), and were cold and stale.  Yuck.  Should have gone to Hooter's next door.
author: Eric M.

description:
My first In and Out action! I arrived here and was very quickly told I had to try this place, and "animal style" was mandatory.

So we ordered a double double & fries animal style and a Strawberry shake and let the eating commence...
