Burger was great! I love the the array of condiments that make it animal style.. they turn an average beef patty into an awesome burger!

Fries again transformed by decoration, average, slightly soggy fries give some wow.

Strawberry shake, good! recommended to all!

Location is very touristy and always busy, so although service is fast sheer volume of people will slow you down.

I do not want to know the calorie count for that little lot... but as a in frequent splurge well worth a visit.
author: Chris M.

description: In-N-Out changes the bar for fast food. The hamburgers taste so fresh you would think the cows they came from were killed in the kitchen, cooked, then served to you. You could actually watch the employees make the the fries. The milkshakes are heaven. You must eat something from this west coast staple if you ever get the chance.
author: Laura B.

description:
Standard order: Double double, animal and protein style.  I actually couldn't go back after i went protein, it tastes better than bun!  Fries, animal style, well done.  

Shakes aren't that great though.  They definitely make the best burger at that price point.
author: Erika C.

description:
This is review is for their superior service today:

Yesterday, my office made a large order (40 burgers, fries, and lemonade) for a 12:30pm pickup today.  The manager John was very nice and reassured me that the food would be ready when I arrive to pick up even though they don't have a store phone (at least not for the public to call in).  Around 11:30am, I got the word that we need the food earlier than we expected.  In a panic, I called the 1-800 number to have them contact the store that I would be arriving around 12 for pickup. 

When I got there around 12:10pm, all the burgers and fries were ready in a box easy for transport and they had 2-3 staff on hand to get the lemonade ready for us.  I originally didin't think they can move up our order since it was lunch hour, but we only waited for about 10 minutes to have all the drinks ready.

Well done, In-N-Out team!
author: Joy Z.

description: Yay! Stopped here on the way to my hotel from the airport and wolfed down the best tasting burgers! Double double animal style with a side of fries! YUM!  The guy at the front (Jonathan I think) was very nice and pleasant.  The food is pretty quick and as always, delicious!
author: Diana C.

description:
This In-N-Out has everything I would expect. These restaurants are notorious for being slow, this location is no exception. I know that they have a lot of orders, and they pride themselves on having their food be 'made to order'. This concept doesn't resonate well with me when there are 20 orders ahead of me, and they are churning out an order every minute or so. I did wait roughly 20 minutes just for a cheeseburger and fries.

Bottom line: If you're on your break from work, don't go here. If you're a tourist, or have nothing to do for an hour, go here.
author: Kyle S.

description: I love In N out I rather have this then McDonalds or Burger King. This place is amazing I love how fresh they are. I am a patient person so can wait for my order. Order takes up to like 5 mins so while you wait go get a soda and find a seat if possible. I like eating outside rather then in.
author: Victoria T.

description:
I made a simple order, fries and a shake. Since fries and a shake are pre-prepared, it shouldn't take 40 minutes to get it out. Unfortunately, that's how long we had to wait.

Oh, and we saw a waiter spit in the iced tea while waiting. Very appetizing. 

Fries were very soggy. I can tell that In N Out is no longer what it was. I am very disappointed.
author: Jenny C.

description: When in Rome...so I had to try this Cali place while there. Burger was delicious, no issue there. Thousand Island dressing? I guess, but it sure as heck wasn't a Big Mac. The yellowish peppers they had next to the ketchup were spicy too, I thought they would be like the ones Papa Johns offers. The place was packed and there was a wait but it was the one by the Wharf, so no surprise. The fries are where I dock a star here. They were crap. I ate them because I had just come back from Alcatraz and was hungry, but once they come to TX I will stick to just burgers
author: Tone A.

description:
The only In-N-Out in the city.  A great place to go during a day of sightseeing around Fisherman's Wharf if you need a pick me up and don't want to pay the outrageous prices being charged to tourists.

Good reliable In-N-Out.
author: Jean K.

description:
Jared, weight loss guru here.  Y'know, way back when, when Supersize Me was just a glimmer in some dumb jerk's eye, I had this idea.  I'd get really fat, like 350 fat, and then lose it all by eating 2 Double Doubles a day at In-N-Out.   And since my name is Jared, and Mormons and hence America loves to take advice from Jareds, I'd make like a million dollars.  

My calculator says it's easily possible if you don't get scurvy first.  A Double-Double (complete with delicious thousand island spread!!!) has 670 Calories in it (that's kcals for the nerds).  If I had a cigarette and a black coffee for breakfast, a Double Double for lunch, and Another Double Double for dinner, that's only 1345 Calories per day.   The pounds would melt away at a cost of $6.10 a day!   (if the coffee is free at work).  Suck on that, Subway Jared!  You lie to kids and eat those boring half sandwiches and you're still kindof a doughy dorkface.

If you make a million dollars because you actually have the time to gain a hundred or so pounds and then try my revolutionary fad diet, please buy me a Porche 356 convertible like the one in _Faster, Pussycat Kill Kill Kill_ as a token of your gratitude.  Or if you're already pretty fat, even better!  Buy me two.
author: Jared L.

description:
I strongly suspect In-N-Out infuses their burgers with an addictive substance... 

I went to In-N-Out in Tucson, AZ over a year ago, and it may be the #1 reason I moved from the east coast to the west.

Get an animal style cheeseburger (or double-double if you aren't under 5 ft tall and trying to avoid becoming a sphere). 

Believe me, you'll be back.
author: Melissa H.

description: A new habit has been born.  Must stop at In-N-Out on the way from the Airport when in San Francisco.  Simplicity at its finest - there are no choices (except for onions - why does every restaurant in California make a point to ask if you want onions?) In-N-Out serves burgers and fries, next time I will try a shake too - and add on a workout!  The burgers are fresh and REALLY good and the fries claim to fame is that they are made from real potatoes right at that location.  They are tasty and of course you need to have fries with that burger!
author: Jamie F.

description:
All In-N-Out spots are always good with the food, so I'll talk more about the location. 

Seats are few inside the location, but walk outside and you can find more benches. On a cold night, it might be a tad chilly for dinner, but if you find a warm, sunny day, it'll be your fortune!

Parking might be tough, so unless you happen to be in the area, this would be a place to have a great burger!
author: Jeremy L.

description: Either you're a fan of In-N-Out burgers or you're not. I've found that they're just not for me. Flavorless meat. Bland bun, and cheese. The whole thing is just kind of a monotone flavor. Salty and unsatisfying. Designed for a very unrefined palate. This location didn't help either. It was packed with tourists and there was nowhere to sit. It was also loud inside, and there was jackhammering going on outside. When I got my food, I wolfed it down at a cold table outside, while seagulls and pigeons tried to swoop down and take my food. I was hungry and it filled a void. There's nothing to enjoy about this experience.
author: Brian C.

description:
I want to give this place a higher score but we only bought fries to take on the go.  It's a good thing we did get something because we waited over an hour just to take the trolley car back to downtown SF.
Donny in "The Big Lebowski" was right: the food is great here.  The fries were easily the best I've ever had.  As I waited in line for my turn to get on the tourist trap that is trolley, the aroma that wafter from the bag tempted me, beckoned me to give up my spot on the line and go get another order of fries.  And while I was there, I should get a hamburger or two, too.  Even now I hope that one day I will find one some place closer to NYC, preferably while in an altered state so that I can give into temptation and plunge into the tasty goodness that is In and Out Burger.
author: Francisco H.

description: So, I feel very awkward giving a fast food burger joint 5 stars, since I mostly give even award-winning restaurants only 4; I tend to feel uncultured. But hey, I go by my emotions, and this place can make me RIDICULOUSLY happy. I don't think I need to explain.
author: Eva G.

description:
Thanks for the late night munchies.
I'm always happy with In-N-Out Burger, and my hotel was very close by this location. 5 stars from me, wish you were in Florida too.
I recommend this place to everyone.
author: Jon C.

description:
When I have those day-after-drinking (read: this does not refer to a hangover; rather, it's just one of those, "hm, that was fun, I feel like going out again but until then, I'd like to eat lots of food and continue the fun") days, I usually keep a pizza on-hand.  I'll eat half of it for lunch, and then eat the rest sporadically throughout the afternoon and evening.  This also happens when I actually do have a hangover.

My dog also decided that pizza sounded delicious, so he climbed up on my counter while I was in the shower, pulled the pizza box (Domino's deep dish with roasted chicken and mushrooms) down, and ate the 4 remaining slices.

I told my neighbor, who had an epic hangover that whole day.  She was pissed off because she wanted to hang out and split the leftover pizza.  So, at 10:30 PM on a Saturday night, after consuming some more tasty drinks (Lime), Jul and I decided that we wanted fast food, since leftover pizza was obviously not an option.

We Yelped the McDonalds on 3rd St. and Townsend, the closest one to us.  They were closed.

I don't know what it's like where you're from, but in LA or OC, fast food joints are open til at least midnight, if not 24 hours, and the drive-thrus are usually the same way (I've seen many that are open 24 hours while the restaurant portion closes around midnight or 1).  So, SUCK IT, SAN FRANCISCO MCDONALDS IN SOMA, BECAUSE YOU COULD'VE HAD OUR BUSINESS.

We went to In-N-Out after deciding that we didn't want to go to the TL for Domino's, and since neither of us had eaten In-N-Out in months, it was worth the trek across town.

There weren't many people in line, although 98% of the tables were occupied.  A double-double for both of us, hers animal-style, and the great debate on whether or not to order a milkshake at 11 PM.  We decided on "no."  Our food came out about 10 minutes later, and we finished every last bit of our burgers, even though all the innards were squishing out by the time we got to the last half.

Their burgers aren't really as good as I remember them; did they shrink?  In my opinion, they're not any different from McD's Big 'n Tasty burger.  But oh well, it was attainable at that hour, and the fries were halfway decent (we both were big-time McD's french fry fans).

My favorite "secret menu" item is the neapolitan shake: chocolate, vanilla and strawberry goodness all layered on top of each other in their signature palm-tree-printed cup.  Separately I'm not a fan of shakes, but together, they just make magic in my mouth.  Shazam.

Overall, this place is clean, albeit touristy.  Parking after 11 is easy, because the weird meters go off (seriously, who installed those?) and there aren't as many people around.

Oh, and this sounds completely trivial, but they have really good pink lemonade.  Not as good as their neapolitan shake though.
author: Tori S.

description:
Always wanted to go to an In-N-Out to see what's it's all about. Went on a Thursday and it was packed during lunch. Just 3 choices of burgers and fries...not much of a selection...no vegan option (wtf...j/k).

After the order, we waited 10 minutes for it to be done (standing amongst the millions and I mean millions of In-N-Out fans!). They churn out a ton of orders and are TNA (no not that - preverts...TOTAL NONSTOP ACTION), so 10 minutes was quick! :p 

Although freshly made, I found the burger and fries to be very bland. Fresh  fries that aren't crispy and on the soggy side is a total downer. When you thank "ketchup and salt" as your friend, you know the food was below par.

I had the cheeseburger combo...would have done a double except they put the calories next to each item!

I much rather have a Whopper (if I had to choice between various chains) and McDonald's fries.

Overhype, unimpressed.
author: Peter L.

description:
Awesome burger. Best fast food burger ever. Animal style was amazing with chopped grilled onions. The bun is what makes this burger great. It's a bit chewy and not too soft. Toasted on the inside gives it a great crispy chewy texture. Worth flying to San Fran for? Probably not. But if you are near one you must go!

Fries weren't awesome like the burgers. Even doing it animal style they weren't that great. I would skip it.
author: Steve C.

description: A first timer at In-N-Out, I decided to order fries & cheeseburger animal style. For the price of the food, I was definitely satisfied! The animal-style sauce added flavor to the fries and burger. The burger itself was well prepared & satisfying. The only concern was their fries were a bit soggy when I got them -  probably as a result of all the cheese/sauce.
author: Bonnie C.

description: Eh. This place is always dirty!
author: Margaret R.

description:
Post-company party, a horde of yelployees were hankering for some not-fried grub -- grilled doesn't technically count as fried, right?  So we caught a cab in the drenching downpour of Thursday evening from Pier 39 and rolled a few blocks up the street to the nearest In-N-Out.  This seemed like a brilliant idea, two Chimays and one Blue Moon in.

As usual, my chocolate shake was creamy satisfying goodness.  Plus, the animal style fries I ganked from someone else (sorry to whomever ordered them -- you weren't eating them anyway, and I didn't want them to go to waste!) were so fulfilling in the way that only food that must be incredibly bad for your arterial system can be.

It wasn't until we left In-N-Out that we discovered this location is apparently devoid of catchable cabs on a Thursday night.  And so was Pier 39.  And so was the intersection of Embarcadero and Bay.  Repeat this lack of available cabs all the way from Fisherman's Wharf down to SoMa.  In the rain.  Sideways rain.  Of the cold variety.  The kind that feels like hail.  Allow me to illustrate: http://bit.ly/9QGCsh

The bottom line: the shake's worth the trudge through inclement weather.  When inebriated.
author: Kevin L.

description: This would be the best place to grab a bite and go. Be warned, the place is always busy. Yet, the customer service is excellent and the line goes fast. Additionally, finding a place to sit is difficult at times, but it's worth the wait for some tasty burgers.
author: Josué H.

description:
MY FAVORITE BURGER IN THE WORLD!!!

I DO NOT go to San Francisco with out having a burger here. As a matter of fact, it is usually my first destination after leaving the airport!

2 words: Animal Style

This is the first place that I've seen that cuts fries fresh for every order! So fresh, that when you order them, they are still a Potato! Really folks, they don't cut the fries until they call back,"Large Fry!"

And I have never waited more than 5 minutes for my meal, even when the line is out the door!!! They are that on top of things and organized! This is a Premium Cheeseburger Factory! Not a fast food chain!

Authentic hand made shakes as well!!! 

SOO FREAKING GOOD!!!!
author: Don P.

description:
Ohhh In-n-Out, how I love you so.

Cheeseburger animal style + fries (animal style if I'm feeling like a fatass) + extra spread on the side + iced tea=TRUE LOVE.

This location is pretty crowded. ALL THE TIME. After a drunken night at Fiddler's, this place was crowded at 2 a.m. The staff really do their best and get people in-n-out (heh) as fast as they can.

My ONLY complaint is that it is so effing far away...while this is probably good for my waist, its NOT good for my In-n-Out cravings! UGH.
author: Stephanie C.

description:
Well, I have been to In and Out a million times now and still loving it.  I went back again because my friend has never been there!! I couldn't believe it!!!! So we went.  Took us a while to get there but we still got there and order 2 cheeseburger, 2 animal fries, and a Neapolitan shake.  The cheeseburger, as usual, was great.  Animal fries were good too, not as good as I thought it would be, cause everyone said it was the bomb, which i think wasn't.  The shake was good, umm, can be better.

In and out is still the best place for fast food.  Totally recommend this place!
author: Lily L.

description: I can see why it's named In-N-Out Burger because the line is usually in and out the door.  There is something wholly oxymoronic about  fast food place that is not fast at all, however it seems to work here.  I waited about 7 minutes in line to place my order and another 10 minutes for the food to be ready.  That's almost 20 minutes in a fast food place.  The wait however, was worth it.  The servers were super sweet and friendly, the burgers and fries were fresh, delicious and prepared with a great deal of attention.  A double burger with fresh cut fries and a medium drink was all of $7.50 including tax.  Please come to the East Coast !!!!
author: R.B. D.

description:
"What do you want for lunch?" I asked as we exited out of Cost Plus, after we made our minimum $10 purchase for 2 hours of free parking. 

In a tourist friendly area like Fisherman's Wharf, one can expect food prices to be higher than average, so I was prepared to pay a more than usual for lunch. I was expecting the girls to suggest a place in Pier 39, or any place with clam chowder. 

"In-N-Out Burger." They all replied. 

"Are you sure? We can go any In-N-Out near our house," I said. 

"No, we want In-N-Out." 

"OK," I said. 

Located along Jefferson Street along Fisherman's Wharf, this location gets a lot of foot traffic. Being a rather cool day, most of the diners preferred eating inside instead of eating on the outside benches. As a result, it was pretty crowded and cramped between the tables. 

Here's the plan, I'll take the kids with and wait in line to order the food. My wife and the youngest will stake out the dining area, and when a table opens up, they pounce on it. Worked out well, even though my youngest and my butts shared a single seat. 

I was expecting a long wait for our food, but surprisingly, our order came out relatively quick. 

The older girls each ordered a cheeseburger, dirty fries (fries topped with melted cheese, grilled onions, and their secret burger sauce), and a vanilla milk shake. 

The youngest just wanted a chocolate shake and fries. 

Food? Taste? Just like any In-N-Out, not bad, not good just OK. Like any In-N-Out, one has to quickly eat their fries, or else they become cold, rubbery shoestring potatoes. Not good. 

No complaints, we knew what to expect.  kids were happy, and I was happy to out of there when they finished. Just in time. I was feeling a little claustrophobic.
author: Steve L.

description:
My stars and tags say it all.


 Be sure to order a Double Double Animal Style.


 Bon appetit.
author: FlickrJunkie

description: I love their animal fries! I think that is nice how their menu is so easy to read. Best fast food restaurant !
author: Jonh S.

description: My first time and it should be my last. I had the animal style burger and I think the beef patty should be thicker. It was extremely packed inside. I couldn't stand how dirty it was inside either. I didn't want to touch or sit on anything.
author: Amy L.

description: Not sure what the hype is with this place. I came from the east coast and had heard that this was the burger place to eat at in the west. The burger was okay, but comparable in quality to McDonalds. The fries were terrible. They were cold, flavorless, and had the texture of styrofoam. I say give it a try for yourself to see what it's all about, but I wasn't impressed.
author: Tina A.

description:
Yes, 4 stars.  I realize this is a little silly. Four stars for a fast food restaurant when you can be so stingy with stars on real, sit-down restaurants?  Well, I'm considering it 4 stars in the fast food spectrum.  Its obviously not 4 stars on the whole restaurant spectrum.  But I digress...

This is a great place to come for a quick bite.  Its not gonna be healthy, I'm sure, but the foods gonna be great, made fresh, and it'll be quick.  When I was last here, I was worried upon walking in.  The place was jammed!  Nevertheless, we were eating in about 10 min!

So yeah, the fries are fresh cut and taste great.  Could use a little salt tho- which is odd for me to say because its a pet peeve of mine when people salt their food.  The burgers from what I remember (and judging from my boyfriend's) are great!  The patties are thick, cheese looks yummy, and the veggies all look fresh.  They have a little condiment area too making it easy to get condiments.  The shakes are real ice cream, not some weird air shake thing like you'd get at mcdonalds.  And they are drinkable through a straw!  Hip Hip Hooray!
author: Erin K.

description:
Note to self: Go home and change Yelp profile from:

"Find Me In"
'N OUT.  Please?

to 

"Find Me In"
'N OUT.  OHMYGODThank You! 

I look forward to this stupid little beef pattied burger magic every six months. It turns me into a lolcat... among other things.
author: Laura N.

description: As a Californian recently relocated to the midwest, I realize that I have taken for granted the gloriousness that is In n Out.  So a visit was near the top of my list of "Things to Do in California," and since the boy was getting hungry as we strolled along Fishermans Wharf, we popped in here, only to be inundated by the crowds.  We ordered, and then lurked around waiting for a table.  It is ridiculously busy and crowded here, and although the staff does as much as possible to get orders out in a timely manner, there is simply not enough seating to accommodate the tourist traffic.  This is the only reason for docking two stars off this review, as the food was steller as always.
author: Sara C.

description: An IN N OUT in the city, what's not to love! Sure it gets packed, but then again, obviously it's right in the heart of the touristy part.  Still, in the land of over priced this and mediocre that, I certainly appreciate my old regular, the always dependable, always delicious Quality You Can Taste of IN N OUT.
author: Kevin T.

description:
For fast food, this is a goos as it gets. While the menu is small, it is the freshest, yummiest burger you can get this fast. The fries are also freshly cut potatoes (you can see them putting real potatoes into the machine in the back) and a wonderful crispy, yet tender fry.

Yum. yum.
author: Aimee B.

description: I frickin' LOVE in-n-out!  I get mine protein style so I don't have any stomach problems.  And animal style.  My MOM even likes the burgers here.  It satisfies the animal in me!
author: Eileen L.

description: I'm from Alabama and when I landed in San Francisco I had to get a double-double.  It was only my second In N Out experience and it was betther than the first!  You cannot go wrong with an In N Out.  When I went it was a very large lunch crowd.  The staff handled it very well, even when I had to get back in line for a shake.
author: James B.

description:
My boyfriend tried their burgers over 3 years ago and has been going on about how awesome they are ever since. I tried In n Out burgers for lunch yesterday and they were pretty epic. 
If you haven't been before, check the secret menu online before going in to make ordering easier. 
We went in and ordered two double burgers and well done fries, animal style. After waiting about 10 minutes for our number to be called we finally got our order. 
I have to say, with all the hype my boyfriend was giving it, I was apprehensive. I didn't want to get too excited in case he was wrong. But it was delicious! 
I love that it's fresh and they're very generous with their ingredients, but there was something that wasn't sitting right as we ate our meal. Towards the end I realized the problem, the cheese was too salty! It didn't fit well with the rest of the burger. Animal fries were awesome, but when you order well done be warned: it's really well done. It's all crunch, no soft potato inside. 
Overall, I would definitely be back again. I heard you can pick the type of cheese you want so I'll try that next time. Service was fantastic even though they were slammed at that time, and the pink lemonade is delicious! Worth the trip to San Francisco for a burger :)
author: Chantelle T.

description: Consistently great burgers! Friendly staff and great food. Every time I make it to San Francisco I make sure to visit In N Out at least twice. If you go to the one at the wharf you are guaranteed to see some crazy stuff. Usually, this consists of the bush man attacking scaring people outside or people wondering in and chanting things to themselves. Doesn't bother me! The food is keeps my attention just fine.
author: Ryan H.

description: I'm from NYC and heard all about the In N Out burger in California. On my trip to California I had the chance to try this burger joint out. I had the cheese burger, fries, and strawberry shake. The burger and fries were okay and the shake was pretty good. I had better burgers.
author: Jin Y.

description:
It has been over 5 years since I ate at In 'n Out and maybe it'll be another 75 before I have another.  They were the rage in SoCal when I was a
chic~lette and they still are ~ WHY, OH WHY, OH WHY???????

Yes, it is a Tourist place, so what?  You are at the wharf.  Yer right the derelicts are there and one was "EFFING" an employee and he got the BOOT ~ YEA!

My Double~Double is a shrunken version of the past and the meat wasn't
juicy, it was flat as a pancake and the 2nd one didn't add anything special.  EXCEPT THE GRISTLE was there and that's a BIG NO~NO.

HAHAHAHAHAHAH..........................................  The fries are a VERY BAD
VERSION OF FRENCH FRIES.  Golden ?  Yes!  Crispy, not really.
Flavorful????   ABSOLUTELY NOT.  The packet of  "Sort of Thousand Island Dressingwe use on our burger", DID ZIP, even with lots of pepper and salt. So they're fresh and prepped there, BIG DEAL.  Mickey D's are still the best.

THE ONLY PLUS ~ RECOGNIZABLE FRESH PRODUCE.  
T E R R I B L E, GUMMY BUN

NO FUTURE PLANS TO RETURN!!!!!
author: ELINOR H.

description:
I had such high hopes for my first trip to the elusive (for an east coaster) In&Out burger. I had listened to stories from my husband and friends about how great it is and how I would love it. Not the case at all.

The line was to the door and included a homeless gentlemen begging for money or someone to buy him a burger. Fine, guys gotta eat too, and if the food is as good as I've heard, I would expect the line to be as long as it was. There were no tables in sight and lots of people milling around waiting to pounce as soon as some one got up. You really needed to be pushy if you wanted to grab a table. We were lucky to grab one without having to push too many kids out of the way. 

I got a cheeseburger and fries. I'm not one for "spread" on my burgers so I ate it plain. Maybe the spread is what makes it great, but I wasn't very impressed. I'd much prefer a 5 guys or even a Burger King burger. The fries were even more disappointing. Crisp, but not fresh. Tasted like they had been in the freezer for too long. Normally, I could devour a plate of fries. This time I left over half. 

Overall not very pleasant experience. My husband assures me that this is not what he has come to know as In&Out. Looks like we're going to have to take another trip out west so I can experience the real thing and not a touristy  imitation.
author: Lisa W.

description:
As part of my vacation to the west coast, I put In-N-Out on my "to-do" list. Probably can't add much more to the 500+ reviews on here. All I will say: tasty and worth it.

I will be back when I re-visit.
author: Judith L.

description:
Hurrah for In-N-Out, Tastiest Fast Food In The West.  There's not much to say about the quality - it's an In-N-Out and it's good for fast food.  You'll get a 5th star when you uproot this restaurant and put it in the Sunset.

Or just put in a few more around San Francisco.

Come on, I'm broke and I'm hungry.
author: Jennie K.

description:
Tourists hold your tongue if you're complaining: Californians LOVE this place. Seriously, all of them. 

It's definitely a good solid place. Halfway between fast food and a real burger at a sit-down place. They make it fresh, so depending on who is making the patty and cooking (and chopping and frying fries) it you may be waiting a few minutes. Not "fast food" in a strict sense.

"Animal style" is really popular. Basically just onions and some sauce on top of your burger or fries. Personally, I think the sauce is just a salt block, but if you stick to the burger and fries you're solid.

One of the nation's better regional burger chains. If you haven't been, you should check it out definitely. It's a California destination, each one.
author: Cameron O.

description: Typical fast food hamburger. The only reason they got 3 stars because the french fries were hot and fresh! This location is super packed!
author: Melissa B.

description:
My name is Ray Bautista and I've been living a lie.  I'm not proud of it, but I figure it's time I come clean and face this problem head on like a man.  Thinking back, I guess I would say it all started when I was 13 years old.  You know, that's a very impressionable age, and I just wanted to be a part of the in-crowd.  I didn't enjoy doing it and I really didn't enjoy doing it with my friends.  I just wanted to fit in.  If I close my eyes and listen very carefully, I can still hear them talking to me: 

"You gotta try this!" 
"It's amazing!"  
"Everyone is hitting it up after school, you have to do this with us!"

As I got older, things didn't change.  I was still living a lie, and every time I felt that peer pressure, I would give in to it.  Not anymore.  No sir...today Ray Bautista takes his life back and stops selling out.  TODAY, Ray Bautista is finally ready to admit that IN-N-OUT BURGER IS EXTREMELY OVERRATED! Seriously, it's sooooooo AVERAGE!  Ahh, that felt great.  All these years of living a lie and I finally feel like a huge weight has been lifted off my shoulders.  I know, I know, I'm from California.  Even just having these thoughts about In-N-Out is blasphemous, but what can I say, I'm a rebel.  Like James Dean, minus the cool hair, money, fame and good looks.

So why do I think it's so average you ask?  Peep it.

For starters, how about the taste?  Can any of you reading this review honestly say that there is a unique taste to their burgers or fries?  Seriously, I'm pretty sure I can make burgers and fries that taste just like this at my house (for those of you that doubt me, I got my Iron Chef hat ready for battle).  As much shit as my friends give big name fast food chains like McDonalds and Burger King, you all have to admit that there really is a distinct taste (even smell) to these franchises' food items.  I really don't believe that In-N-Out has these qualities in their food, but then again my palette is used to the finer things in life. And by finer things, I mean a Sourdough Jack meal from Jack In The Box at 3am in the morning.

I know, I get it.  In-N-Out is synonymous with California and it's an easy, cheap place to bring your out-of-town guests too.  A majority of the time, your guests / friends will probably ask if you can take them there because they've heard so much about it.   Plus, who doesn't enjoy looking all hip and cool in front of an In-N-Out virgin by using that crazy In-N-Out slang while ordering, "Yes, I'll have one Double Double, a 4x4, Animal Style with extra fry sauce please."  Yeah, I'm guilty of it just like everyone else, BUT all of this (including the secret menu) doesn't make the food taste any better.

Don't get me wrong, there are things about In-N-Out that I really, really like.  I don't think anyone can deny that their milkshakes are AMAZING. I gotta give them a lot of love for this.  The consistency is always perfect and the flavors are always dope.  If you've never had one, then you suck, and you should go get one right now!  I'd recommend getting either the Strawberry or Vanilla flavors for all those n00bs out there reading this review.  As Ray-Ray from 10 years ago would say, "That shizzle is the bomb yo!"

Also, In-N-Out's prices are pretty awesome.  You get a good amount of food for the price that you're paying and in my book, that's always a good thing.  I also like the look and layout of the restaurant.  Atmosphere is always important to me, and I have to say that In-N-Out got this right.

That's all folks!  That was my roller coaster ride review of In-N-Out Burger.  I hated some things, I loved some things, but the most important thing...I cared.  That's right fuckers, I cared enough to review In-N-Out Burger to begin with.  In the world of Yelp, that means a lot.  So in closing, I would just like to say that In-N-Out's burgers and fries are still SUPER AVERAGE.

In other words, stick to animal style condoms, not burgers.
author: Ray-Ray B.

description: Great place for a quick burger and its pretty cheap. There food is pretty consistent every time i eat here.
author: Ash R.

description:
This In-N-Out, like many others I have visited, absolutely rules. That's just the food, though. You can't f*ck with Animal Style.

The actual location of this particular INOB is prime pickin's for the touristy Pier 39 set, which means that its always flooded with wannabe thugs from the East Bay/Peninsula, a cross section of Middle America and the occasional Japanese/Euro who stumbles in. Seating is at a premium, so be prepared to stand for a bit while said crowd finishes their burgers and fries.
author: Wes T.

description:
ANIMAL STYLE BABY,,,

Dare to take on the 4*4 Animal Style..whoooaaa

The lemonade is Bananas... and the the simple inexpensive burger also.... TOO BAD the Fries,,, suck......
author: Daryl N.

description:
This is among two local In-N-Out's. The bugers are delicious. Yum, yum, yum. 

The customer service is surprisingly good. Is this really a fast food joint?!

Go here after spending some time at Pier 39, while cruising around a very beautiful part of the city, or just because.
author: Paulina F.

description:
I don't eat burgers but I still greatly enjoy In-and-Out and never object to stopping by for lunch with my burger-loving friends! I love the grilled cheese (secret menu- basically a burger without the patty), shakes (Neapolitan with all 3 flavors is really yummy, so creamy!), french fries, and fries animal style (only if super hungry, grilled onions and special sauce all over the fries!). 

Almost all the In-and-Out's I've been in have seemed super clean too which always scores points with me. I like their t-shirts too and loved to wear them on the East Coast to sport some California pride!

The prices are reasonable and the food is so good and a bit healthier than other fast food though not healthy-per-say.... if you have not yet discovered In-and-Out, please make sure you do!
author: Meghan P.

description:
I recently took a trip to San Francisco for the first time, and it was suggested that I should definitely capitalize on the opportunity to visit In-N-Out. Thankfully I did do so, and am glad I did.

I really enjoyed the menu's simplicity. Instead of 50 different menu options that people always take an eternity to pore over, it offers the following:

Burger
Cheeseburger
Fries
Drink

What a breath of fresh air.

I got the cheeseburger and it was really fantastic. Just the right size (not too small, but not ginormous either) and very tasty. As a point of reference, here's how I'd rank the burgers of several large fast food chains, from best to worst:

1. In-N-Out
2. Wendy's
3. Jack In The Box
4. Burger King
5. McDonald's

The only reason I'm giving it 4 stars instead of 5 is that I did not, in fact, manage to get in and out. There were long lines, a huge amount of people milling around waiting for their numbers to be called to pick up their food, and all of the tables were taken (I had to wait around for a bit for someone to leave before I could sit down). But these are just side distractions and I can't complain about the food one bit. Very glad I dropped into this elusive California family-owned chain.
author: Chelsea R.

description:
I love In-N-Out Burger... need I say more? 

Beware of burger nazi's... relax people, it's a fast food burger.
author: Iman J.

description:
why is this place such a big deal ??  it's like eating a veggie burger.  where's the beef??!!  plus, the fries were like luke warm chalk after the 5 minute drive back to the hotel.

i continue to be totally unimpressed by this place.  i just think west coast people have very little culture when it comes to grease.

honestly, wendy's is better than this place easily.
author: Bradley C.

description: You can't go wrong with this location. Well staffed, hot when served, fast and convenient.
author: Gustavo M.

description:
I've eaten In-N-Out in many so-cal cities (LA, OC, SD) and they've all been consistent in quality (easily 3-4 stars), but this particular In-N-Out was an exception to the consistency. 

My fries were cold and tasted like paper. Trying to figure out what was up, I nibbled on the fries, and stared @ its inside like a monkey with a new tool. Cold and under-fried must have been it. The double-double cheeseburger was supposed to be juicy, but wasn't. How long the patty sat unattended before the juices evaporated was beyond my knowledge. Perhaps the patty could have been flipped over one too many times while on the grill, but I'm just starting to speculate.

Being crowded here is nothing new, the service is fairly quick relative to the volume of orders (potential cause of the problems above). No restroom? That's new, but there's a Hooters @ the next stop over.

It's nice being an outlier, but not on the poor end of the spectrum. I'm hoping that I am one of the few cases of In-N-Out nightmare.
author: Robert Z.

description:
In-N-Out serves some of the BEST and CHEAPEST burgers in the area. They have a secret menu, so check it out if you want to make sure burger more exotic. :D

The problem is that this is the closest location to the Berkeley...and even then it's still really far away.
author: Charles L.

description:
I'm a New Yorker and have heard the magical place called "In-N-Out Burger" from family members.  Fast food burgers to me are from McDonald's, Wendy's or Burger King, burgers I generally try to avoid.  When I visited San Francisco December '09, I made it my personal mission to visit In-N-Out.  I decided on the double double with fries and a drink.  The burgers were made to order, since there was a bit of a wait for fast food.  The wait was not a big deal, since I knew the burger was going to be good.  Plus, the place was crowded and the diners looked happy eating.

I took my food back to my hotel room, so I can enjoy my burger privately.  My companion was with me and he forgot to order fries.  Don't worry, I was a good girl and shared my fries.  

Back at the hotel room, the fun started.  I took the first bite of my double double (after taking a picture and sending it to my jealous cousin who loves In-N-Out, but also lives on the east coast) and was in an euphoric trance.  I described every bite as I made my way down the burger.  The cheese was perfectly melted and bun toasted just right.  My companion swore I was making love to my double double.  Suffice it to say, I had a good time devouring my burger.  As for the fries, they were perfect: partly soggy and partly crispy (I like soggy fries. Don't judge me). 

I'm glad In-N-Out is only on the west coast.  Because if one ever emerges in New York City, I'd be overweight.
author: Jenn C.

description: Overrated. Heard so much about this place, we couldn't wait to try it.Waited over 15 minutes for our "fast" food, only to find the burger patty thinner than a McDonald's patty. The toppings were fresh, but other than that, I didn't think there was anything special about it. Tasted like regular fast food. Don't know how anyone could compare In-N-Out to a Five Guy's.
author: Winston R.

description:
I ordered fries and a cheeseburger, the build of which was quite odd. From the bottom up: sauce (Thousand Island-relish combo), tomato, lettuce, burger, and cheese.  The bun was grill-toasted. Nice flavor and consistency. The veggies were fresh, cool, and crisp. The patty was standard thin fast food fare--nothing special. The cheese was yellow American and melted uniformly across the patty.
For fast food, it was very good. Compared to a McDonald's or Wendy's burger, it was top-notch. If you find your way to the west coast, check out In-N-Out.
author: Michael M.

description: Accurate and speedy service especially considering how busy they typically are!
author: Shav S.

description:
Hey it's In N Out! Finally. 
But this In N Out was kind of messy - so be warned!  
Order "Animal Style" for the secret off-the menu sauce on your fries or burger.
author: Snowmagnolias M.

description:
Yeeeeepppp, it happened.

300 days and some. At least I made it as far as I originally planned last summer when I started the Great Meat Sabbatical - I gave myself the 9 months until May 2009 to be free of sweet meat - and I lasted one month longer than I planned - to mid-June 2009 as part of my great American Road Trip Adventure.

Yeah, I should start hail Marys now to repent from eating meat, but oh, daaaammmmnnnn was it good. And I'm in California, which I seem to grace their lands every 5 years or so, so who knows when I'll be back - and what happens in Cali stays there (that is until I write a yep review nearly 4 months after the fact).

The burgers were awesome, the fries are freshly made (none of the frozen crap for In-n-Out) and the fountain Coke seemed extra refreshing and yummy!

I'm back off meat, but I'm glad for my little detour away from veggie land just for one lone week in June 2009.
author: Jerry M.

description:
This is the review of a Midwesterner's first visit to the ol' In-N-Out, so I'll be discussing the cuisine only and not this particular location.  

Actually, I'll also be discussing the entire Western Coast population of the United States.  You guys have built this place up entirely too much.  It's a perfectly tasty burger, but good grief.  This magical spread is essentially Thousand Island dressing, and it's available at every store in the United States.  

Fries were undersalted and not sufficiently crispy.  I did like the toasted bun, which is a nice touch that all fast food places should be required to adapt.
author: John H.

description:
Sometimes I come to this place after the gym.  In order to completely nullify my work out I usually order 2 4 x 4.  Why don't I order an 8 x 8, logistics my friend.  The food is what you expect, the service is what you expect, the long journey to the bathroom is pretty lame.  

All in all, it's a great place for a burger.
author: alex l.

description: Great food! It's busy as all get out at this location, but the staff is friendly and efficient. Seating inside is difficult to come by so it's best to try outside as well. Also, you may need a code to use the bathroom (it may be busy enough where you may not need it, but just in case, it's on your receipt).
author: Southern W.

description: What else can be said? They are the best fast food burger chain around. If they had not been so conservative with their expansion over the years, they would surely have World domination by now. I would like to know their hiring technique. Their employees always amaze me. I wish In-N-Out was in New York. I would pilfer some of their employees. Also, sometime while waiting for your food, check out all the custom equipment in the kitchen. Everything has a purpose. They are like burger Einsteins.
author: Yelper X.

description:
Since I'm not a fan of fast food, it makes sense that I didn't have a scintillating meal at In-N-Out Burger. As Kathleen M. notes, the staff is pleasant--strangely bubbly and eloquent, even, compared to the service at other greasy joints. 

Because the line was so chaotic and fast, I forgot to order the animal, whatever that means--and I quickly blurted I'd have a cheeseburger. The thin patty, entire ring of fresh onion, lettuce and tomato formed just an ordinary burger. The fries sat thin and salty in the bottom of my bag, paling in comparison to those of Checkers and Chick-fil-A. 

The poor pigeons who hang out in this area of the Fisherman's Wharf are fat at sluggish--a clear warning to not consume fast food on a regular basis. 

My Muir Woods tour guide told me a funny story about In-N-Out. When the area kids get bored, they remove the "B" and "R" from the sign, leaving In-N-Out Urge.
author: Bobbin W.

description:
Ok San Francisco, you have won me over. I went back to In & Out, this time knowing what to expect. I ordered a Double animal cheese burger and regular cheeseburger. They both rocked my world. The service was much quicker, seats were easy to come by, and I'll openly admit, the burgers were divine.

You have earned yourself another star. I doff my hat to you!
author: Leon C.

description: In-N-Out Burger - this is by far my favorite fast food burger in the country. If you are on the west coast, it would be a crime against humanity to not stop in and try this place. Seriously, I love it...I wish they would open in Chicago.
author: Shelly A.

description:
In-N-Out Burger is a cultural phenomenon. Anywhere you go in North America (and most of the civilized world) people have heard about California's little burger stand that could. The unique thing about this chain is that they are not franchised. Every store is owned by the Snyder family who started the business way back in 1947 in the sleepy Los Angeles suburb of Baldwin Park. So it takes a lot longer to grow a corporate chain rather than a franchised one. Don't expect In-N-Out to open a store in the Northwest anytime soon, though they say they will make it up here eventually. 

The Fisherman's Wharf location is San Francisco's only one, and can be quite busy as it feeds the city folk as well as throngs of tourists dying to get their hands on the most coveted burger in America. The location is spiffier than most, and is the second nicest location I've seen after Westwood. Oddly enough their is no bathrooms so I had to walk a few blocks to find a place to wash my hands afterward. If you've never had In-N-Out than definitely stop in on your vacation to try the simplest, yet arguably best burger available.
author: Andy Z.

description:
Being an easy-to-please vegetarian, I've always been more than satisfied with an order of animal style fries and a chocolate shake for lunch with some friends here. And I've always known about the secret menu. However, I apparently didn't know ALL of the secret menu..
 
VEGETARIANS, KNOW THIS: In-N-Out has a grilled cheese! 

It's everything the burgers are [supposedly], just no meat. Yummy, melty cheese, lettuce, tomato and onion on a delicious bun. And it's animal style. And it's only $1.84. You may ask, "Are you kidding me?!" But, no. No.. I'm totally serious. Enjoy the secret, guys. I definitely do.
author: Sarah S.

description: Once again, the public confuses price and quality.  This is the most over rated burger place i the world for one reason, it is cheap.  Unfortunately, most yelpers think that quantity and price is a 5 star experience and actual taste is an after thouht.  A greasy cheeseburger and average fries at best.  I have tried it 5x and each time I am left scratching my head as to the cultish following this place creates.
author: Steve G.

description: Good burger, but way crowded which means a long wait, and you have to brave the fisherman's wharf tourists.... scary!
author: Mark B.

description:
After one aborted attempt due to an absurd line on a Saturday afternoon that drove me instead to Hooters next door, I finally had my first In-N-Out burger. I do not see what all of the fuss is about.

I CAN say, however, that will all that grease soaking the bun and wrapper, it truly WAS an "in and out" burger, ifyouknowwhatImean (and I think you do).
author: Hugh R.

description:
I knew that I was going to try In-N-Out the minute I set out to walk to the Wharf. In Seattle, we do not have In-N-Out- we have IMO equivalent (similar style and type) burger shops though... Dick's, Kidd Valley, & Red Mill. When I arrived at the location it was packed, but I noticed that the plastic fast food seating was revolving door of customers eating quickly so I decided to stay. I ordered a burger with cheese and onions + fries. 

The burger was cooked to medium- hallelujah! and the toppings- onions, tomato, cheese, and lettuce- were fresh. The burger had a great taste and the sauce on it was awesome. The added onion really made the burger. I found that my In-N-Out burger was better than the burgers at the Seattle equivalents. My fries, on the other had, were tasteless, hard, and ick- I will eat most any fries (McDonald's, Wendy's, Red Robin, Burger King, etc, etc) and I threw these away... why put tasteless things in my mouth? -1 due to the fries... so sad... because I love fries... 

FYI's~ 
* I found a love for In-N-Out burgers- they are a great fast food item
* The burgers aren't overly large and their portions aren't out of control 
* Limited menu- only a couple options for how to order a basic burger 
* Combos are basic burgers + fries + drink 
* Order at counter and wait for your name to be called 
* Meals arrive on a red high sided cute tray 
* CHEAP! $2-ish for a burger and $2-ish for fries
author: Natalie W.

description:
$2.10 for a burger- $1.45 for fries, ten minutes for your food and wallah- hunger be gone! 
I have lived here almost 4 years and not set out to try In-N-Out yet, how sad. I was super impressed with how quick they were and equally impressed with the quality of their food. I watched through the patio window as the chef cut up french fries- what a job! He jammed potato after potato in to this cutter, it was amazing! 
I will probably be back now that I have itched that craving!!
author: Janell D.

description: Mmm, good. This was my first experience with this famous West Coast chain. The place was crazy busy because of the Thanksgiving weekend but the service was fast and the burger was awesome. Everything from the toasted bun, melted cheese, fresh vegetables, and the perfectly seasoned patties (get the double, of course) were delicious. Order it "animal" style to receive some extras the less informed won't. I recommend ordering your fresh-cut fries animal style as well. The fries were lackluster given the fact that they were too dense and not as crunchy as I would have liked. I found out later that you can ask for them to be crispy....next time. There is a reason this chain is so popular...good freakin burgers!
author: Quantas G.

description:
Another patented Porter death march down as we got into San Francisco for our honeymoon. I am truly ravenous as we walk along the waterfront & have started to think there may be no hop for my belly. Than hark! What does my brilliant husband see but someone throwing away an In-N-Out bag. 

After a thorough interrogation, our spirits are renewed & we are off & running the next 5 blocks. No McDonalds! No touristy knick knacks! Straight to that California gold In-N-Out. 

A hoard of fresh cut fries, creamy chocolate shake, and ridiculously large animal style later our hunger is finally staved. That was awesome.
author: Erin B.

description:
When I lived abroad - one of the first things I had in my return back was an In & Out. 

When I lived on the East Coast and returned to the West, same story. 

When I learned I had a gluten intolerance and could no longer divulge in the bread - In & Out offers their burgers "protein style" (aka wrapped in a giant pieces of lettuce) it was a small piece of heaven in my life. 

This is the closest I eat to fast food. I love their fries (they are crispier now!) and I love when you go in an order the employees are always in good spirits. It is cheap. And, it tastes deeeelicious.

Simply put, I love them.
author: Giorgia H.

description:
I guess I could see how if you grew up on In-N-Out, it brings about certain nostalgia and loyalty. But if you really break it down, it's not that great of a burger. Don't believe the hype!
I'm gonna start a East coast vs. West Coast burger gang war and have to say I give props to Five Guys for fast food burger joint.  I'm not sure what my gang sign would be, I guess form an oval with both hands like you're simulating holding a stacked burger. First my Five Guy crew gonna have to take out Ronald and his gang with a drive-thru. Make sure that clown is buried alive in a 6 foot chicken mcnugget carton.
Then we'll get that red-headed Wendy addicted to crack. Why is that girl still single anyway? She hasn't been with a man yet, something gotta be wrong with her. Or does she have a lil' somethang going on with Dave Thomas? Anyway, who knows what she'll do for more "diet coke", like handover her franchise. And White Castle, those medieval bastards got nothin' on our mustard gas and potato guns.  Soon enough, we'll have monopoly on American turf.
author: Luan N.

description: Let me just say that 3 stars for a fast food place is good. I'm sorry to be such a snob but I cap out (unless it's AMAZING) at 3 for a place like this. That being said, please bring In-N-Out to VT! I'm not a big fan of fast food (I used to be a much bigger lady because I couldn't stay away from Mickey Ds...) so I rarely eat at them but this was delicious. My husband and I arrived at peak time here and they were incredibly busy. The girl behind the counter clearly was stressed and ready to end her shift but treated us okay and the kitchen staff busted out our burgers in record time. I'm not gonna lie- I might have to come back before I leave SF. The burger had some sort of magic saucey  goodness with actual veggies on it! Legit had a salad on top of my burger and I could have not been happier with it! Thanks In-N-Out, it's probably not a bad thing that you aren't in VT or else I'd gain back everything I've lost!
author: Catherine K.

description: This is a mediocre In-N-Out on all fronts.  Not bad, but not amazing.  The service isn't as friendly as most, the food isn't as quality as most, but it'll do.
author: David P.

description:
This West coast chain is off the hook! after i ate a burger and fry combo at this joint, all the east coast chains don't taste so good anymore....

probably not a good place if you want something healthy, but you have to try it at least once!
author: Eugene H.

description:
As good as home made and better because my house isn't stinking of grease.

The burger is the style that I would make my own burger. I would have it medium well and put plenty of fresh veggies and a nice toasted bun. Is this a special burger with blue cheese or made of kobe beef? no. It is good all american burger. Don't be too flattered but never be insulted.

Did you also read the psalm on the food boxes? I love those. Surprisingly, I actually enjoy the secret Christian messages. It makes me think that the people who work there and the managers are thinking a little bit out of the coporate box. There is nothing wrong with that. That only made my experience better.
author: Jade H.

description:
Typical In and Out.
Decent fast food...but this is in the heart of tourist central. This makes the order line real slow and annoying.
author: Kathleen E.

description:
There is a lot to like about In N Out Burger.  The burgers are good, though they are nasty little grease-balls just like McDonalds.  The staff is always friendly.  This location is great!  But honestly the reason I keep going is for the fresh cut fries!

Yes, they make their fries every day from scratch.  And you can taste the difference.  Occasionally you end up with a lot of tiny little ones that just annoy you, but when they give you a good batch of well cut fries it's heaven.  If they don't do it right, just ask them to redo it and enjoy!
author: John P.

description:
It was good. They all taste the same.

The only thing i didn't like was there were a lot of bums in here.. I guess I can't blame them for wanting food but not able to get any.. and this was at 1 in the morning..
author: Lilly N.

description:
Being a fan of the Big Lebowski, this was a must...despite just having had a full meal an hour prior.  But hey, I may not have had the opportunity again; So, I indulged my fancy.

Place was packed.  I ordered and was number 72.  They just called 56.  Considering the that 16 people were ahead of me, it didn't take that long (probably 7 min) to get my food.  The burger was good.  It may have been better if I wasn't already full, and been drunk at 2am.  

I still might have to tip my hat to Dick's though in Seattle.  In all fairness, I think I owe it to In and Out to return to San Fran, get drunk, and THEN have their burger.  Yes, I have just rationalized my trip back.
author: Chris F.

description: First I was out and then I was in... then out then in... So it (the burger) was okay to good... but not blow my socks off, a little to much hype but now Ive been in so that makes me out...  I love the fact that if I was to forget the burger in my pocket or leave it on the counter top for a year... Im sure the thing would have disappeared unlike other burger (macs) joints we know of !!!
author: Daniel L.

description:
I just love In n Out....If I could marry the restaurant I would. 
I've been goin since I was a little kid and will continue for as long as I live in California. 
In this location you do have to be on a good lookout for seating...We sat outside and there were some pigeons eyeing our food but its expected when you're only feet away from the ocean. 
The wait does take a little while but hey, your food isn't sitting under a heating lamp waiting to just be handed, it is prepared when you order it, therefore making it super delicious!
Animal style is best. For everything! Double double animal style with animal style fries and a shake!!
Their shakes rule if you've never been here, get one.
If you're on some crazy diet, you can get your burger "protein style".
I just simply love love In N Out.
author: Polette S.

description: When visiting California, this is a must. I like the freshness of their burgers and fries and the overall cult factor behind this place.
author: Catherine K.

description: I have to say that was the best hamburger i ate in San Francisco. I went there a couple of times, and was always fresh and delicious. And the Frenchfries were excelent as well. If you go to Pier 39, and wanna have some fast food, there is the place! Really good!
author: Danielle S.

description:
I'm one of the many devoted in-n-out followers.  It's true, I can't resist their delicious fresh burgers and fries.  A shake as well if I can justify it to myself!

The main thing I can't stand about this in-n-out is that there is no bathroom.  Fail!

Anyways, go to in-n-out, cuz everyone has an opinion of in-n-out, whether it be delicious or just overrated...
author: Van W.

description:
It's In N Out! What not to love? 4 stars for the location bc its like the only one in SF, but I do love the outdoor seating despite it being a mad house zoo. You can order how ever you want which is great for me since I am a non meat eating In N Out-er

My Order: Grilled Cheese, with everything, grilled onions, french fries (if I'm feeling crazy, i'll order animal style fries) and iced tea.

Pretty basic, cheap and good. For the huge crowd, it didn't take too long and they didn't mess up our groups orders.
author: Audrey L.

description: This place is almost always busy. For some reason I have always been able to find a place to sit here. This place has fewer seating than other in-n-outs and I think its a lot dirtier here too. That is why it is getting 3 stars.
author: Sarah C.

description:
obviously perfect location for tourists. Very busy, makes you worry that there wont be any room for you to sit while you place the order...but it seems to work out as people don't tend to sit for too long.
Burger - ok, too salty for my palette. 
Fries - LOVE them. I used to believe McDonald fries were the best ever.....years ago before I gave up fast food.(I know, In-n-out is fast food too, in way.) However, in-N-Out beat those fries, by far! 
Service; very well trained personell! Friendly, smiles, an honest "thank you" it makes the place even more popular.
author: Gabriela R.

description:
I could eat anything...literally shoe leather, if they did it Animal Style. 

This place is an absolute must if you are in Cali especially since we east coast folks are unfairly deprived of these CA landmarks of culinary excellence....
author: Andrew M.

description: 2x3 (2 patties, 3 slices of cheese), protein style (no bun), extra pickles, extra sauce, extra lettuce, hold the onions (because they cruelly give me migraines) = Super effing-tastic good. I wish I was hungry enough for two, but that would just be gross... (Right?)
author: Max L.

description:
The one thing that struck out at me was its simplicity.
So simple!

Burger, fries, and a shake is how it was done back then, and now it's classy as ever. Fries were really good. They aren't generic and perfect like McDonalds, but rather classic and tasty. The size of the portions were pretty good. Not too small, not too big. 

This is a perfect place if you're in the mood for a burger and would like to get a good bite of good stuff.
author: Alex L.

description: I have heard of these for years, so I was really looking forward to checking it out.  I can get over the "Chee-Burger, Chee-Burger, Pepsi" style of the place. In fact, I am good with that. I can even say that the burger was good.  A good, typical, meh burger. Then again, so is a Wendy's burger........
author: Scott S.

description:
Great location if you're sightseeing around the Fisherman's Wharf area! It's like a more delicious, healthier McDonald's.  Great prices too!!!  If you're not a big fan of the natural, fresh-cut fries, try ordering them 'animal-style'.  They'll load an order of their fries up with their 'special sauce', grilled onions, and cheese! You can get this done to your burger as well. YUMS!

Just be prepared to wait a bit for your food because there's usually a long line.
author: Michelle J.

description:
As a whole In-N-Out rocks as my favourite burger place. Their service & food are always uniformly good. 

Unlike other chains like Mc Donald's & Burger King, In-N-Out's pricing is simple & consistent -- not higher in touristy locations. 

The whole operation is simplicity itself. They have a very limited number of items to choose from, but they make them fresh & as good as they can. The fries are cut fresh from whole potatoes on site. The burger meat is mushed on location. 

The employees are clean-cut & friendly. I have yet to encounter a bad customer service experience at any In-N-Out. Unfortunately I cannot say the same for any other chain. They send out a person w/ a towel to wipe things down & pick up trays regularly. They also pay the employees better than usual starting pay.

They do have a quirky less noticed aspect to them. They are owned & operated by the Snyder family, who hold strong religious beliefs & thusly have Biblical scriptures discretely printed on the bottoms of their cups, wrappers &replicas. They also are against any "modern" clothing closures--meaning no zippers, velcro, or snaps. You'll notice that they even use a giant bobby pin the secure their aprons instead of tying them.

As w/ every In-N-Out location I've visited, they have a self-service drink fountain. Their lemonade is made w/ real lemons (which you can add yourself). This location shares a common restroom in the complex.

Santa's Yelper sez: "Great fries, good burgers, great service! Yum!..."
author: Tadashi Y.

description:
Okay, I am an uber vegetarian liberal. I can survive on lentils, pasta, and soy for weeks on end.

But you know what? I love burgers. Not the tranny burgers of the vegan world. But a real burger, filled with blood....grilled onions...a toasted bun...the perfect amount of ketchup and mustard. Served with a delicious side of fries from a real potato.

Makes me forget I am a vegetarian for a few moments.

That is all.

I'd take one star for this place being next to a Hooters. But hey, I heard Britney's new song.
author: Lana P.

description:
I'm a huge In-N-Out fan, but this has got to be the worst restaurant in the entire chain.  

Though, like all locals, I normally wouldn't be caught dead at Fisherman's Wharf, we were driving past and my five year old and I started craving burgers.  A double double in the City sounded like a fine treat!

The place is not only crawling with tourists, but homeless too.  Get halfway out of your seat and they run to your table and grab anything you didn't eat.  Service is very slow and the place is filthy, too.  Felt like I was at the McDonalds in the Haight.

Catch ya next time I'm Tahoe-bound In-N-Out. This one is gross.
author: Mitchel H.

description:
Ok, so I just heard an NPR story on the history of the In-N-Out Burger chain as well as info on a new book with the same content.  All I could think about was the Animal Style burger and Well done fries (extra crispy) i had a few years ago while visiting San Fran.

In-N-Out burger is not overhyped or overrated.  All of their potatoes are brought in and cut daily. Nothing touches a freezer or a microwave.  The burger are freakin awesome and there is no fast food chain on this earth that can compare.  I know they'll never come to the east coast, and that's probably a good thing for my health.

This location was super touristy, but who cares.  It's so worth waiting.  I was also a "tourist" so I cant really complain.  God, talking about one of these hand crafted burger beauties makes me so damn hungry. 

mmmmmm...burger (in a homer simpson voice, of course).
author: Evan H.

description:
I stopped by and got a plain burger around 10:30 am before the lines and all the tourists started pouring in.  I have eaten one of their East Bay locations and the food seems to be consistent.

The food was priced well (not as  expensive as Burger Meister) and the meat was delicious.  Loved the fresh condiments (tomato, crispy lettuce,) on the juicy burger; additionally, they  had grilled onions on it.  Wow, that was a treat.  

The calories will kick your buttt.  I did not get any fries this time, since the burger was about 600 calories.
author: Vanilla C.

description:
Relevant to rating: The best quick burger place. Ingredients taste fresh and anything animal style is delicious. Especially recommend the shake.

Other details: Crowd here is a bit sketch or touristy.
author: Tuhin S.

description:
Ok so the whole morning and most of the afternoon was spent on touristy, CR*P.

I heard In-N-Out has the best burgers around.  The only problem was I have never had one.  Everytime we are in Houston, my friends are so shocked at how I never tried it since I've been to many west coast cities, well the problem is every trip the people I travel with have already had it and want to try something new so I'm left a In-N-Out virgin.

NOT THIS TIME!!!

I was planning this trip and I said no matter what I am trying a damn burger from this place.

Was it worth it?!??!?!

DAMN RIGHT IT WAS!!!

This burger redeemed my whole trip to Fisherman's Wharf.

It is officialy my new BEST BURGER!!!, Hands down #1.

Double Double Animal Style, with Animal Style Fries.
author: David N.

description:
In-N-Out is usually really good, but not this one- it's like all the ghettitude that a fast food chain has all went into this one location, instead of being spread out among them all. 
What are you doing down in the wharf, anyway? It's for working fishermen and tourists, and I don't see no hooks on you.
author: Jonny A.

description:
Oh boy! Just when I thought that messy fast-food fries and cheeseburgers were losing some of their respect and popularity in the more modern, health-centric market I had to find my way into an In-N-Out Burger! In preparation for my April trip to San Francisco I was given many tips and recommendations for my vacation and, to my surprise, a fellow oenophile gave me very specific instructions to find such a location and to order and to order "a double double, animal-style with fries, animal-style." After going online to research this odd order I realized that he was taking advantage of the not-too-"secret menu" that is known only to In-N-Out lovers who are privy to the list of offerings that are not displayed on the official restaurant menu.

After my long up and down-hill trek to Fisherman's Wharf from Union Square I decided that I had gotten a sufficient enough workout to justify a midday snack from the fast-food mecca. I did not expect the sizable line and patiently-waiting crowd that I saw when I walked in but I was not intimidated and I immediately jumped in the queue. A friendly In-N-Out team member was taking my order before I knew it and took my order as if it were written on the menu board right above my head. The wait to get my meal was a bit longer than I am used to at most fast-food joints, but then again few of these types of restaurants near to own home get quite this busy and none really put as much care into their burgers as these guys do. I made a quick exit as soon as my number was called and rushed to devour my order. The done, yet still very juicy and flavorful, patties were perfectly  enrobed in melting cheese, the onions savoringly griddled and sweet and the sauces excellently proportioned to the fillings and toasted bun.

A couple of days later, on my last whole day in San Francisco, I took on the long walk back to In-N-Out and indulged (just because I can, and because we do not have these locations on the east coast) in the 3x3, animal style with the same fries. Wow. Meaty deliciousness for way less than you would pay for an equally-sized, rich cheeseburger at any nicer establishment. I CANNOT WAIT for these to either head east or for me to head back west!
author: Abby M.

description:
It makes me sad that this is the only In-n-Out in SF.  Parking can be tricky depending on time of day.  We got there around 9:30 on a weeknight and scored rockstar parking out front.

I thought all In-n-Out prices were supposed to be the same!  I don't remember a #1 being that expensive, but I digress...

The place is pretty dirty, but the workers try to be diligent about it.  Good thing it only takes two minutes to scarf down a cheeseburger (grilled onions, no lettuce).

The restrooms are out back, with a security code.  That, surprisingly, isn't extremely dirty like I would imagine.

I guess I just have low expectations...
author: Jenny L.

description:
This place rocks. In fact, every In-N-Out rocks. I am from east coast where there are no INOs, it gives me satisfaction every time I go to West Coast because this is the only time I can have INO. 

Always gone for Double-Double and their Friesss..... off the hook. Fries from fresh cut potatoes, sweeeetttttt

Won on vacation for a week in west coast and ate INO for about 3 days
author: Kunal P.

description: One of the best burger places in the city, even better than pricy places like Umami burger!
author: Monica R B.

description: This is the spotttttt! I ain't gonna lie. My usual is just a #3, grilled onions & animal well done fries, & a vanilla milkshakes (sometimes), if not I'll just get the regular soda. Never failed me once.
author: Emily L.

description:
The patties have DEFINITELY gotten smaller over the years. Who's with me on this one? Eh? Ehhhh???

Also, this place is 30% more expensive than if I just went 15 minutes south to Colma. The tourists can have this one.
author: Andy A.

description:
Came here last week with my coworkers after a night of drinking. Nothing better like a greasy burger to soothe a hangover! We tried to beat the lunch rush by coming here before noon. Got here around 11:45 and it was pretty packed. There was 7 of us so we were all scoping out tables and chairs. We were able to get a seat for all of us, so it was perfect.

I ordered the cheeseburger and it was delicious! I love the fresh cut fries too...tho I wish someone ordered it animal style so I could try that. No drive thru here, and this location tends to be filled with tons of tourists. Lots of people here, so have patience for your food!
author: Betty S.

description: My Burger Heaven for good Fast Food.  Just love this place.
author: Daniel P.

description:
Oh how I love this place! 

Simplicity and frankness abound. One can't complain for a lack of choice, since all their burgers and milkshakes are equally great.

This place is cheaper than other fastfood restaurants. I can get my tummy satisfied for a mere $8.
author: Martin V.

description:
So I actually have something in common with Paris Hilton???

I frikkin love these burgers. I don't think it would be the first place I would go after a stint in the slammer.  Or... would it?        Does Alcatraz count?

I guess unlike Paris I am a bit of a virgin when it comes to sloppy eating... but I really loved my first     In-N-Out "experience"!
author: Peter S.

description:
In-N-Out is a California institution.  This is the fast food burger of the state, and don't let anyone tell you otherwise.  Another must if you live and/or travel in California, at least once.

Five for In-N-Out, knocked a star off for this North Beach location, only because there can be a dodgy crowd that congregates here at various times of the day and night (it's Fisherman's Wharf, tourist central - and where the "white shoes" show up, the swindlers are sure to follow who try to take their money...)
author: Todd S.

description:
I'm in ur  In N Out. Nommin ur cheezburgers.

Nice big windows in this location, great for watching Bush Man scare the bejeezus out of the chubby white tourists.
author: Rachel H.

description:
2 doudle doubles animal style every time I'm in SFO, usually 2 or 3 times per trip. The location at the Wharf is by far the worst location I have ever been to, but only in terms of the wait and the sheer volume of tourists with no clue how or what to order.  This is the only In-N-Out within the actual city limits of San Francisco and the Fisherman's Wharf is probably the most touristy spot in all of San Francisco.  I think Im-n-Out does a pretty great job of ensuring quality across the board in terms of their food, almost every visit I have made to any In-N-Out is pretty much exactly alike. 

There are in fact bathroom here, they are just outside the main restaurant around the corner.

It's still just fast food, very good fast food, but still just fast food.  As my mother said on her first visit ever, "It's a little better" when I asked if it was the best fast food she had ever had.
author: Christopher T.

description: Everytime i go to San Francisco this is my first stop (besides my hotel room!!!)  I'll be there next week!!
author: Tracey D.

description: This is my first visit to an IN-N-OUT and I have to rate it as one of the best burgers I have ever eaten.  I had my Double Double "Animal Style" and it was excellent.   The fries were fresh and crispy. I am a big fan of Five Guys and this burger was better.  The price was right, too.  Under $6 for the entire meal.
author: Doug C.

description: The food was reliably good, but the Fisherman's wharf location promised an overwhelming tourist presence. The restaurant was packed, it took forever to place the order, even longer to receive the food, and it was difficult to find a seat. Annoying experience, but the food is still reliable.
author: Christopher B.

description: In-N-Out Burger is probably the worst place ever to go eating. I had the most horrible experience there. Here's how it went: My family and I were hungry and we all suggested going to In-N-Out Burger. So we went there and we walked up to the cash register and we all ordered hamburgers. We all ate and enjoyed very much. But then that night, one hour later, me and my WHOLE family who ate there got sick. And all night we were throwing up for a week. We had gotten food-poisoning. UGH WORST EXPERIENCE. Will I go back? NO. ~
author: Jessica R.

description:
PIER 39 in San Francisco  In-N-Out  stinks, no wonder, PIER 39 is for tourist & morons.

The food is awful, it has no taste.  Everything on the menu has a "fake" taste quality.

It is better than CrapDonalds though.
author: Ferdinand B.

description: Don't see what the big deal is. It's just a cheap  cheeseburger. Ask them lightly toast the bread or all you will taste is burned bread. The fries suck. Staff are supposed to give out the code to the bathroom (yes, the closest bathroom has a number lock on it) but when I asked two of them they didn't offer it. They Gave  it to another person right in front of me.
author: Sara S.

description:
animal style. sooo good. 

the trick to this fast food burger joint is knowing that you can order things that are not listed on the menu, such as: 
1. ordering both burgers and fries animal style - special sauce with sauteed onions
2. asking for a veggie burger (which isnt actually veggie burger, but rather a burger minus the burger plus all the vegetables.  so essentially a grilled cheese)
3. asking for in n out stickers and hats!  dont believe me?  check my local photos!

so order your food, then wait in earnest for your number to be called.  then stuff your face and enjoy your freshly made burger (or grilled cheese for you vegetarians out there) and freshly made to order fries.
author: Pearl O.

description:
The mixture of people in here never fails to amuse me:  hardcore INO fans, homeless, and tourists who have no idea what INO even is.

The animal style double-double with fries is the only way to go. If you get the fries done up animal style it's just overkill because you can't taste the potatoes, and the same is true for the 4x4 because you just can't taste the beef.

It's just too noisy, crowded, bathroom-less, and dirty to warrant that fifth star though. 

Why is there only one In-N-Out in SF, and why is that one located in the Wharf?
author: Adam Z.

description:
The worst things about In-N-Out Burger?

Fries made in front of you? The double double for $3.50? The fresh tomatoes? Crunchy lettuce? Or maybe the milkshakes so thick they give you a suck muscle workout? No. 

The worst thing about In-N-Out Burger?

Absolutely fucking nothing.
author: Jan V.

description:
I live in NYC and am spoiled by Shake Shack. The burgers just can't compare!
