description: It's the same as any other In-N-Out I've been to. The pro of this place is that it's near the Wharf, so when you go and do something around here you can grab a bite of something great to eat. It's at a decent price compared to everything that is expensive around the Wharf.
author: Richard C.

description:
GET THE NEAPOLITAN SHAKE! Why choose between chocolate, strawberry and vanilla when you can have them all? It goes so well with my usual order of a cheeseburger extra toast, and animal style fries. 

This place is nostalgic, the food is fresh and it's all very SATISFYING.
author: Rachel H.

description:
In a utopian society, it would be the only option for fast food.  Nuff said.   
If you dont know about the secret menu, then you just dont know.
author: Dan G.

description:
Go figure, there's a lot of tourists here, but the line moves fast!

This is what I order: 

2 double double, protein style, no special sauce, onions yes, ketchup/mustard yes!! 

No soda

No fries

I get the tray and proceed to the exit and sit outside because there's just wayyyyy too many tourists inside! NO COMMENT....

It's nice when you can snag a seat with the umbrellas. But, be careful to watch out for the pigeons! and please don't feed them! or else they'd be on you like a two bit whore on crack...
author: Lester L.

description:
Good burger. Doesn't beat Shake Shack though - sorry, Californians!
Fries are tasteless, awful, I left half of them and it's really rare for me to leave food. Skip the fries.
author: Tim H.

description:
I am an east-coaster and former In N Out hater. 

When I came out to visit before moving here, I ate In N Out burger once and immediately started hating on it. I started saying how overrated it was. Well, actually In N Out burger probably is overrated but that is merely a function of how famous they are. Look at it this way, I'd heard of In N Out since I was a kid growing up all the way across the country. It isn't like there are many eastcoast restaurant chains that the Californians say "oh, I've heard of that." Therefore, there is little chance they can ever meet the expectations of an eastcoaster, especially those who's first introduction to the burger was from The Big Lebowski. By the time the eastcoaster gets around to eating the burger, the expectations are on a mythic scale. But I digress...

The reason that I am now an In N Out fanatic is due in large part to their efficiency. Every day during lunch, they have a line out the door and yet they still seem to power through the thing in a matter of minutes. Also, the prices at In N Out are comparable to other fast food places...yet it is 10x the delicious. On the east coast, our most famous burger spot is called "Five Guys." It is also pretty damn tasty but it takes forever to get your food. This is a big deal to me.

In N Out burger loses 1 star due to lack of bacon. Bacon is incredible and is certainly worthy of its own star.

Oh and as for the fries, I still agree that Mcdonalds has better fries but YOU HAVE TO ORDER YOUR IN N OUT FRIES WELL DONE!!!
author: N S.

description: When my work takes me around the Fisherman's Wharf area I sneak over to In-n-out. Its not very crowded (unlike the Daily City one which is almost always a zoo) but parking is difficult. The restaurant is small so I recommend walking a little to the west and eating at the waterfront.
author: Murphy O.

description:
I'd have died of a heart attack by now if these were on the East coast.

The chocolate/strawberry shake? Still thinking about it a week later. 

I also wanted to point out that we had the sweetest cashier. I think her name was Jackie? My friend and I were both impressed by her awesomeness.
author: Caitlin N.

description:
In & Out is GREAT!

I love to order to go from here and eat somewhere in the neighborhood whether it's Aquatic Park or the Wharf.

They cook their burgers, make their own fries, and provide good sauces #AnimalStyle.

The only problem with this location is that the bathrooms are kind've far and it can get quite crowded with the tourist but this is a good place that stays open late. Shoot, I am getting hungry now just thinking about their double cheeseburger.
author: Brandon H.

description: Such good burgers! I could eat here everyday but I know I shouldn't hehe.  If you've never been definitely go and get your fries animal style.
author: Frankie B.

description:
There is a new sheriff in town, and his name is In-N-Out.  While Sheriff In-N-Out is in town, no soul shall exist without the opportunity to eat the little morsel of perfection known as the double-double.  What's the double-double you ask?  What's the double-double you ask!!! I should have Sheriff In-N-Out throw you in jail right away!!  The double-double is the right hand of justice.  It puts all other assortments of ground chuck to shame.  It is immaculate.  It is indescribable.  It is scrumptious.  For most patrons, it's love at first bite (I know I called my old favorite burger and let it know that I was seeing someone else and it probably wasn't going to work out anymore).  But then... what's this?  What are these luscious spears of deliciousness, crafted by the finest potato blacksmith Sheriff In-N-Out could find, that have been so generously placed on my tray?  Oh the fries.  Oh the fries!!!  Freshly cut from the smartest potatoes in town (helps you in school kids!) sent here to bring euphoria to my taste buds.  All flanked by a goblet of icy cold coca cola.  I will leave you with this, hungry yelper: Sheriff In-N-Out does not disappoint.  Give the man a chance, and you too will speak of his legend.

Long live Sheriff In-N-Out!!!
author: Alejandro J.

description:
The only reason to ever step foot on the Wharf is to go to In-N-Out.  Everyone loves their burgers.  They're frickin' world famous.  But the one in SF couldn't be in a worse spot.  This place is packed and crammed with tourists waiting for their number to be called.  Do yourself a favor and order it to go.  Enjoy your food anywhere but Fisherman's Wharf.  

You might be asking, "How could you not give In-N-Out 5 stars?!".  Ill tell you why.  This particular location sucks: minus 1/2 a star.  Also, their fries are overrated unless you order "animal style": minus 1/2 a star.  Result: 4 stars.
author: Scott G.

description:
If we can go to the moon and back, can't we discover how to take the fat out of delicious food?

Man o man do I love me some In & Out.  

Cheese burger - animal style - and the French Fries - MY GOODNESS!  I don't even need ranch or Ketchup with these delicious pieces of potato!  

Chocolate shake - now we're talking.  

It's all so yummy... just wish that when I walked out of there, I wasn't aware that I just consumed over 1,000 calories.  **sigh... but, of course I'll be back again - soon!
author: Noneya B.

description:
Damn I love me some In-N-Out burgers!!!! For a while there I was eating it once a week (I know, real bad)....I can't help it. Everytime I go I always get a #2 (cheeseburger combo), with grilled onions and sometimes extra cheese but I'm trying to be healthy here so lately I skip the extra cheese okay, and animal style fries. One time hubby didn't order me animal style fries because I told him I was trying to be all healthy and stuff and i was super PISSED!!!!!

Also, I sometimes come here after working out at 24-Hour on Bay...not good...
author: C. T.

description: There is no In-N-Out on the East Coast, and being an East Coaster, I have never been to an In-N-Out.  All of my friends in the East Coast try their burgers when they visit the West.  And so must I.  I ordered the Double Double.  It was good, but I must say, I still like Five Guys more, and I think I also like Shake Shack more.  But I thought their fries were great.
author: Radford T.

description: I was very excited to come to the West Coast so I could try InNOut burger.  I was not dissapointed.  The burger was delicious; I just wish that they had more a of selection with food and also more toppings like bacon and mushrooms.  But other than that, it was delicious.
author: Big J.

description: While I normally would give any In N Out a five, the last time I tried to go to this one, it was so mobbed with tourists wearing "Alcatraz Psycho Ward" T-shirts and the like that my friend and I couldn't bear to wait in line to order.  There's a reason I never go down to the Warf, and I was reminded of it on this trip.  I have nothing against tourists in other parts of town, I just hate all the congestion and crap being sold here.  So, I'll put on my list for potential upgrade, but as I don't go here that often, I have to use my last encounter for the rating.  And I know a restaurant can't help being popular, but it still affects the experience.  That said, if you can stand the mob scene or go at an off-time (if one exists) the food is awesome here as with all INOs.  For me, I will probably just get my fix at one off a freeway sometime.
author: Marc S.

description: I LOVE IN N OUT. You can steal my car, take all my money, and ruin my life- but buy me a cheeseburger, a neopolitan milkshake, and a side of fries and you're forgiven.  You can mix and match the milkshakes however you like but a regular milkshake is actually a small and a medium/large is a regular sized milkshake.  Grill the onions and try it animal style if you want. Look carefully under the cups and bags for bible verses/
author: Samantha L.

description:
Quality inexpensive fast-food = Yum =P
I know there are better places to check out if your around the Fisherman's Wharf but I was a Tourist and got lured to the trap. 

Good Burgers Good Fries Good Shakes 
Good Times...enough said.
author: Alvin N.

description:
Although this place has a line always and is crowded, at night time, it isn't as busy as the one in DC. I came here after a long night of work with my coworker at around 1230 in the morning and there were only 2 others in there. Food is the same and service is friendly and fast as usual.

From my In n Out review for DC:

A #2 (cheeseburger)- 480 calories 
fries- 400 calories
Large strawberry shake-690 calories
___________________________
    Calories consumed = 1,570
author: Juliane N.

description: This is one of my fix points whenever I'm on the West Coast. I don't really care for the fries but the burgers are really really fresh and very tasty and you can easily have 2. Was there on a Saturday noon and there was no line and no wait time. Haven't tried their shakes yet but will definitely come back and have one with my burger :)
author: Andreas P.

description: Everyone should love In-N-Out, even if the interior of their drink cup bottoms does have a bible quotation written on it.  Tasty milkshakes, bomb-ass hamburgers, and fries that in my opinion are truly unique.  They taste a bit like Classic Lay's potato chips.  You can watch them making the fries in the back, slamming potatos into the extrusion machine with abandon, it's a wonder they don't lose a finger now and then.  Burgers are much better with the double cheese action.  Don't miss out!  Go now.
author: Walter K.

description:
If there is a tourist hell i bet it's just like in-n-out burger on fishermans wharf.

seriously wall to wall people.  i had a panic attack, ordered and waited outside...so i could breathe.

if you like orange sauces order your food 'animal'

if you like your soda religious make sure to get a drink too.

not bad but never again, too many tourists, too much religion and a whole lot of trans fat
author: kiki b.

description:
I was basically violently taken to this place by a few friends of mine who need their portions to be huge in order to satisfy their hunger and for me ... junk food equals bigger ass, which I don't need right now or ever as I already got one and pretty obvious not a small one! 

My friends promised that this place is better than most of the junk food places for burgers, but I still didn't order anything for myself. I tried what they ordered (whatever it's called double-double or something with everything on it) and wasn't impressed at all, though probably better than McDonald's that I've never tried :-) 

Little touristy I shall say too....:-))))))))

What i like is the color combination of the place...RED is HOT :-)
author: Katja S.

description:
If they had a drive through, it would be a five.
But...if you're lucky you can get a table outside with a view of the Hooter's Girls next door. It's like the best of Hooter's (the view) without the worst (the food).
author: Johnny O.

description:
I take exception to the shitty fries comment. Not many fast food places make fries fresh from real potatoes. The secret is to order them well done. Do your heart a favor and don't order the fries animal style.

I only score them with 3 stars.... they are still fast food.
author: Ed r.

description:
Double double burger is exactly how it sounds: double meat, double cheese, double grease.  And the In-n-out experience, thankfully, ISN'T exactly how it sounds.  Well, the in part went by quickly...  

And I can't believe I'm writing a review about a fast food chain.  Alas, it was my first in-n-out burger experience, hence my review.

For all the people visiting from the Northeast out there, you gotta go to In-N-Out.  I hear there's a secret menu, but since I didn't want to have a heart attack that day, I let this menu remain a secret.
author: Shaina P.

description:
I love, love, love In-N-Out Burger but this location is kind of a pit. Sure, they're all crowded, but this one is also dirty. The first bite of my double double was inedible, as in I'm not certain it was a part of the cow that is normally eaten by humans. Aside from that, everything was basically as it should be. Either the food here was somewhat lacking, or the bloom is off the In-N-Out Burger rose for me.

The super-friendly and helpful staff gave this review an extra star.
author: Booda B.

description:
Same great taste that you would expect from any other In-N-Out, only this one has no parking and is loaded with tourists. I guess you can't be surprised since its located at Fisherman's Wharf (right next to Hooters). Seating at this location is severly limited as well. Just hope that your order doesn't come up before a table becomes available.

I guess the one good thing about this particular location is if you are lucky, you can catch the Bush Man chilling out front scaring unsuspecting tourists. That in itself might be worth a trip down here alone. Well, that and a double double with cheese and fries.

If you don't want to bother with the wait and the crowd (aka tourists), go to the In-N-Out in Daly City.
author: Kathleen N.

description:
We were looking for something cheap and (preferably) good in Fisherman's Wharf.  So I checked Yelp, and since my brother had heard good things about this, and it had tons of (generally positive) reviews, we checked it out.  And it was disappointing.

The burgers simply weren't particularly tasty.  And the fries especially so.  I mean, for the price, you are not allowed to complain (at $5 for a Double Cheeseburger w/ fries and a soda, your complaining rights vanish), but it seems like there was simply no taste here.  I don't generally eat fast food, but I can't imagine that this is the best quick burger, let alone the best burger out there.  Sorry.
author: Alex B.

description: My husband was underwhelmed but I love in n out. Always nice service, good food at a good price.  Animal style is the way to go which means house sauce and grilled onions on the fries and burger.  I'm not a huge fan of straw fries but it works.  We have a lot of good burger places in Chicago but I count this as a fast food burger place much better than our fast food burger chains.
author: Esther C.

description: In-N-Out is a great place for a burger & fries.  Their menu is small, so you know they specialize.  They cut their potatoes into fries fresh right in front of you.  Love the Double-double!
author: RJ B.

description: Everything a burger place should be and their milkshakes are SO GOOD when you have a sore throat.
author: Piper D.

description: Best burger I've ever had! It's amazing!  First time trying in N out but it was definitely worth it and extremely cheap!  Perfect for a night dinner.
author: Caleb M.

description:
Best Burger in the West Coast for the price .
East Coast = White Castle 
I like the Double Cheeseburger with Grilled Onions 
Only wish they had Bacon on the menu .
if they have a Bacon Double Cheeseburger --- 5 Stars !
author: Kay B.

description:
I guess I'm one of the 'annoying' tourists that all the prima-donna San Franciscans refer to in the other reviews, but oh well.  Hopefully they didn't realize I was one, as I'm not one of the people who stands there and stares at the three-item menu for five minutes trying to decide what to order.

Anyway, I've been to San Francisco twice now.  My favorite movie happens to be The Big Lebowski, and anyone who has seen it knows that there's a very memorable scene that references the In-N-Out Burger.  So, when traveling to CA for the first time I had to make it a point to visit one.  It was really just so I could say I'd been there; at the time I didn't have any idea that it was going to be as good as it was.  Everything was made fresh, to order, and it's about as un-fast-food tasting as fast food could possibly be.  The staff are friendly and it really is one of the best burgers you'll ever have.

In all fairness to the other reviewers, yes it is always packed and it's certainly not located in a very convenient part of town for people who actually live there.  Even as a tourist myself, I'd prefer it were in a less touristy place, but what are you going to do.
author: Matt G.

description:
Overall: 4
I hate loving this place so much

Food: 5
I get sucked in here everytime I'm at Fisherman's Wharf and then I feel so guilty after I'm finished eating. Stick with just a hamburger if you don't want to feel like a fat load. 

Service: 4
They take your order so fast that there's always a crowd waiting for their food.

Decor: 3
50's style diner, not enough seating during busy times, so be quick and sneaky as soon as you walk in.

Value:4
The combos are super filling and will probably leave you stuffed and practically in a food coma.
author: Roger H.

description: I always get #3 animal everything.  Since its in a huge tourist area, hard to find a seat inside but they do a good job getting orders out right away.  There's additional seating outdoors by the bike rental. Just watch out for all the pigeons scrounging for food.
author: Mookie L.

description:
I so wish we had In-N-Out in Colorado.

I went to In-N-Out for the first time a few weeks ago, and was actually quite impressed.  The Pier 39 location is always a madhouse (it is, after all, in tourist hell), but the staff knows how to turn tables, so to speak.  I had a regular cheeseburger, and it was actually a lot better than i expected for fast food.  Not only tasty, but unless I miss my guess, this may very well be cheapest food near the Embarcadero.

It was good enough that I came back the next day before going out on a story.  Next time, I'll have to use that secret menu.
author: Andrew B.

description: Seriously guys, this place is good but its not some kind of manna sent from heaven. Its a great burger I'll agree.. but when I went last time the fries tasted like total ass. I even returned them asking for another batch and they came back with the same ass taste. I'll take Nations Burger or Fuddrucker's over In n Out any day.
author: Henry W.

description: Animal style!!!! First thing I did when I got got off the plane @ SFO, is go to In N Out.... It was my first time and it was magical!!! It is a crime that they are not in every city. Mcdonalds, BK, Wendy's have nothing on In N Out!! It was utterly amaezing, from the fries to the burgers AWESOME!!! I have been craving it ever since i got back to Miami... Hmm the interesting thing is there is no franchising info on the website!
author: luis s.

description: Best burger and fries in the city.  Other places charge a lot more for lower-quality.  Only drawback is the homeless inside sometimes.
author: John S.

description: Smallest dining room I have seen in an in n out but it delivered. Late night mix of local baked teenagers and awkward foreigners.
author: Christopher R.

description:
Double Double Animal Style. As Led Zeppelin says, that's the way it's gotta be. Honestly, even though I'm a 10-min walk from this place I've only been twice on account of it's location in the dark heart of the Wharf. But hey, sometimes you can't resist the pull of the In-N-Out and you just cave to your crave. This location has pretty good service despite the mob that's perpetually dominating it. I love their food for the big things like taste and freshness, and for the little things like the way they stuff the burgers into those tiny paper wrappers. Yummmm. 

In-N-Out is a California staple and really is in a class of its own. If I'm craving a burger, I'll go to Polkers, but sometimes you don't want just any burger -- you want two beef patties greased with Secret Sauce and good ole fastfood nostalgia. You want silly servers in dorky hats. You want fries just cut from spuds 5 minutes ago. You want the experience. You want In-N-Out.
author: Andrew K.

description: Let me start off by saying that i am a HUGE fan of In-N-Out! this particular location is lovely. i cant eat gluten (celiac disease) and they were quick to help me with an order that would be tasty and safe for me to eat. they got my order confused and unlike alot of other fast food places they QUICKLY made me a new burger, brought it to my table and then 10min later came back to check on how we were enjoying our meal. great job guys! you are my fav!
author: Lindsey H.

description:
God.  In-n-Out, what can I say? I LOVE IT.  Personally speaking, there is no better fast food burger joint out there.  

Double-double (or a 2x4) with onions, a coke and fries.  I'm happy and that's it.  Hell, I eat the burger so fast I forget to breathe most of the time.  Whether that's a good thing or bad thing, you decide.

Go to Wikipedia to look up their secret menu.  There is quite more to this place than meets the eye.
author: Serge S.

description:
I searched the world over and thought I found true love. Actually I did, it's called the double double. I have been ordering them animal style but I eat them so fast I don't notice the difference. Really gotta stop doing that.

If you're new to California and usually don't eat fast food, do yourself a favor and try a little in n out; good food, good service, good business model, go already.

In reference to the touristy comments..

 I myself like to sometimes go to "touristy" parts of cities i.e. Quincy Market, South Street seaport, Ala Moana etc.. Tourists are cool, they wander about in a state of grace, temporarily detached from the mundane, even when buying an Alcatraz psych ward t-shirt. I wonder though about me watching them watch me, who then is the tourist?
author: Matt P.

description: We were hungry after a morning of walking the hills of SF and we needed a burger.  Where else can you get a double-double animal style?  When we got there, it was packed. I could barely move and it was a Sunday at 3:00 pm. After ordering our food ( 2 cheeseburgers and 2 double double animal styles with fries) my family tried to find a table. We found one outside where the pigeons freaked out my daughter. When I bit into my burger it all went away!! The burger is worth it! They have the freshest fries. Overall it was a good meal.
author: Pat M.

description:
~In-N-Out burger review. An honest review by Me.

(Note: This covers all In-N-Out restaurants, I just picked this one)

WOW with a capitol W. This is probably the best fast food I've had in my life. IN-N-OUT is my hands my second favorite restaurant behind Pizza hut. Friendly staff all the time, and Delicious burgers! Eating at this particular one in Fisherman's Wharf was great. Located next to Hooter's and close to Subway, you'll soon realize why the two are virtually empty.It did have a lot of people, but it's worth the wait and spending that extra two bucks on quality.

Nothing else to say, you'll have to try it for yourself.

Spenser "Spense" O.
author: Spenser O.

description:
What's this "hidden menu" I'm reading about? 

So here's my story: maybe it's because I'm not a Californian, but I don't really get it. Scott H. was the first to point out to me the awkward placement of the tomato and lettuce. 

It's UNDER the patty? 
 
I've come to understand how tragic that simple mistake can be. Things just aren't stable enough for you to enjoy. Thanks, Scotty, for pointing this out to me. 

I like thicker burgers and thicker cut seasoned fries ( i.e. Good Times). Some salt would be nice, in the case that I'm in the car, driving, and I cannot seem to open those silly salt packets to season the fries myself without salting my entire seat.

I've never rejected a meal from here. I NEVER turn down food. Unless it has something to do with cream of broccoli soup. But, that's besides the point:  I just don't understand the hype.

Maybe the hype is in the hidden menu and the "double double animal style" that caught my eye in other's reviews. I'm keeping an open mind.
author: Meghan L.

description:
Okay, so the prices are a little high, parking is bad, public transit is worse, and I still love there French Fries, served animal style.

San Francisco needs more of them, but for now, Fisherman's Warf will have to do. When I was in college, there french fries were like my medicine after a night of drinking.

I don't really eat burgers, but I love there French Fries, served Animal Style (no meat) and there Milk Shakes. This is perfect for comfort or recovery after drinking.

It's fast food, but that doesn't mean it's bad. I have a lot of class and I still frequent this place once in a while, so give the fries, served animal style a try. Don't worry, I won't tell!
author: Christopher W.

description:
I really like the archeticual design of this In-N-Out Burger place.  It is located in Fisherman's Wharf area, which means a tourist trap.  When my friends come and visit, I take them here: low price for burgers and do the touristy things at Pier 39.

minus 1 star for going around the back of the building for the bathroom. and minus another star for being packed!
author: Elliot Y.

description:
I hate fast food but I like In-N-Out Burger. 
The fact that you can see a Potatoe being turned into French Fries scores points with me.
author: Marcus R.

description:
This is fast food.

But this is one of the only gluten-free french fries I've found in the City - and for my three-year-old and myself, that means everything! You can watch them fresh-cut the fries and stick them into the fryer. Pretty cool.

You can order the burger "protein style" and skip the sauce. I'm sure there is still the possibility of cross contamination but I've never gotten sick there.
author: Megan H.

description:
Seriously fantastic, straight to the point burger.

I had been in the city for a few months from the East coast when I finally had my first taste of In-N-Out burger.  I had tried Burgermeister and Pearl's already and they didn't do it for me.  

+There was a line of ten people, and all the seats but three were taken in the place though I only waited for ten minutes.
+Onions were a delicious addition.
+Cheap!
+I have to commend all the employees there.  They were friendly and just ON KEY with every order.
+THAT BURGER.

-The fries....meh.  Just ate them when I ran out of burger haha.  Still giving this place 5 stars because it was the best burger I can ever remember having.  

No one told me about the "secret menu" till afterwards.  Gives me a reason to try them again though!
author: Tim S.

description: Just may be the best restaurant in the Wharf!  You have to fight for a table, but at least the food is good.  Needs its own bathroom.
author: Amy D.

description: Located in the wackest area of SF, but who cares?  When you're from out of town and you haven't had In-n-Out in years...you would travel to the depths of hell.
author: Ava R.

description:
I'm visited this location once. It seemed okay as far as cleanliness. Its usually packed around lunch time with tourists and locals. The burgers are okay overall. I'd say they are tasty but Wendy's when they had them in the city are just as good. The fries are okay. I prefer Mickey D's and Wendy's overall in the fries category.
I'd visit the location again for an overall nice meal with average burgers.
author: Wong, D.

description:
When I first moved to CA, all my CA friends could talk about was how great In-N-Out burger was.  So, naturally, I made my way down to the Great Tourist Region to dine at the city's only INOB (enjoy the acronym while it lasts---Apple will be trademarking it when they release their new, Internet-enabled vibrator in Q2 2008).

Disappointment, thy name is crappy cheeseburger served with Ore-Ida french fries.  I am willing to entertain the notion that my INOB experience was not the norm given that the place was crowded with frat boys with barb-wire arm tattoos going chest bumps and calling each other "bra."  But, honestly, what audience was a fast-food burger joint expecting?  Admittedly, I did not order from the "secret" menu because, as a good, quiet Episcopalian boy from the mountain states, I am not in the Bible-belt initiated inner sanctum
san(c)torum which runs INOB (motto: free misleading Bible verse with every meal purchase!  Whether you want it or not!)

But, all that aside, shouldn't this most honored of burger joints (Hail INOB, full of grace, blessed among burger joints...) deliver the goods when you order the cheeseburger and fries?  Isn't that the slow-pitch watermelon ball of the fast-food set, ready for the beer-league clean-up hitter to knock out of the park thus securing a win for the home team?  And yet, like mightly Casey, INOB struck out, delivering a generic, greasy meat-assemblage with fries that I could swear I've seen in the freezer section at Cala.

BTW, house cut fries?  BFD.  Let me drop a little Todd Barry on you: what's this in my drink?  House frozen water?  Wow, I thought they out-sourced that to India, where child laborers froze the water for pennies an hour.  I am so pleased to hear that all the ice here was frozen on the premises.

See you at Pearl Burger.  Frat boys need not apply.
author: Ben P.

description:
Prior to my trip to SF in March 09 it had been three years since I last had In N Out.

When I knew that I would be staying in SF after returning from Sydney, I literally started dreaming about In N Out. This place is heaven on Earth. 

Once I got into SF I realized my US bank account was closed due to inactivity (hadn't been in the country for over a year). So money was tight. I was on the other side of town from Fisherman's Wharf but found that to be the closest In N Out. So like any fast food starved individual, I walked three miles to the restuarant. The burger was even better than I remember. I went with the classic Double Double Animal Style. I wanted to cry it was so good. 

If you've never eaten here, it's a must. Yes, it is fast food, but it's damn good fast food!
author: Ryan C.

description: kinda small, but who wants to eat their dream burger inside a fast food place when there are so many beautiful places nearby to picnic? Get it to go, extra crispy fries, and head down the street to the park.
author: Susan M.

description:
The definitive division line between the merely good and the great burger. Not sure which side of that razor's edge In N Out is on, but with cost a factor you are never going to leave disappointed. 

Animal style please; don't really care too much for the fries though...
author: Matt C.

description: Yes yes yes! I love in and out, it is just a shame how few and scattered out they are in the bay area. Good location though, right in the middle of the tourist area near the cable car pickup. Service was good, store was clean, double double for the win.
author: Drew H.

description:
Every single In-n-Out is the same....perfection.

cheap prices
simple menu
great associates
delicous burgers and fries

This Company is a wet-dream assignment for Investment Bankers, but alas, they continue to resist going public.  If this Company only ran the gov't, we'd live in a near utopian society.  They keep it simple and keep getting it right....how many places can induce you to drive a 100 miles b/c you miss their burgers?  The Bay Area is a much better place now.
author: Laurence H.

description:
When some tourists visit San Francisco, they might stroll around Golden Gate Park , check out the Museum of Modern Art, or possibly take a cable car to Fisherman's Wharf. The number one priority for my East Coast visitors is never to see the marvelous masterpieces at the Museum of Modern Art or beautiful landscape of Golden Gate Park but rather first to grab a burger at In-N-Out Burger. Museums, landscapes, cable cars, I mean who cares about that crap?   It only cuts into eating time, and we have a schedule to keep.   

I had a visitor arrive from Framingham, MA last night and took him to Marnee Thai for a solid meal.  When it came to dessert, my friend, let's call him Larry H., declined on dessert, and I had the look of shock on my face.   We did order two chicken dishes and shared a soup but I knew this friend was not full.  I knew the he was up to something so I declined dessert as well. 

As we left the restaurant, Larry H. said, "You still hungry?  How about In-N-Out Burger?" I knew that Larry H. had a plan when he declined dessert at Marnee Thai, and as expected, he came through with a great game time decision.   Who needs to have coconut ice cream or a fried banana dessert, when In-N-Out burger was still on the table as an option? 

I'm a huge fan of In-N-Out Burger.  Leaving a little room after the meal at Marnee Thai, we had a burger apiece.   The inside of the burger bun is perfectly toasted, and the meat is flavorful.  For around $2, you can try a burger while strolling around Fisherman's Wharf, or as in our case, instead of ordering a dessert at your local restaurant, you can drive a few miles out of the way and grab a more filling hamburger dessert.
author: Josh K.

description:
Good food as usual, wait time is what get's me. Crowded always and no seating during dinner time. Touristy area of course.
Nice location.
author: Smooth R.

description:
First of all, yes, I know this is a chain. In my defense, I have been a loyal In-N-Out customer for years- maybe even decades! I knew In-N-Out when they use to have commercials- yes, commericals. The jingle went something like this: "In-N-Out.....In-N-Out........that's what a hamburger's......all about!"  I don't think they have had to advertise since then because word of mouth took care of any advertising needs. 

With only a handful of locations, it was always a treat to have an In-N-Out burger. Today, thankfully, they have quite a few more locations.  However, they have been able to keep this institution as it was way back when- awesome burgers, fries, and shakes at really, really great prices! 

I love In-N-Out. I really do.
author: Kristine Y.

description:
Why do people love this place?
The burgers taste better than the mammoth chains, but so would sawdust covered in bum sauce.
author: Tom S.

description:
Former slave to the In-N-Out B-URGE-R right here. I am currently (Unfortunately) on a much needed diet and can no longer inhale the delicious double double burgers anymore. 

If I could alter some things about this place I would alter the traffic flow. It seems to me that they have a shit load of registers with a shit load of employees and some long ass lines. It is in a tourist area so what do you expect, a quiet slow work day? I also think they should do something to make their french fries taste....Oh, I dunno....good?!?! They feel like little tiny sticks.

But overall, I will give this place its propers because it has sustained me many a night when I worked down there and all the other comfort food places were closed.
author: James J.

description: After seeing" The Big Lebowski" I've always wanted to visit an in-n-out burger. I wasn't disappointed. The food was good, fast service, especially for being located in a huge tourist spot. My order didn't get messed up, which is a huge problem with fast food on the east coast. It was a fun atmosphere as well.
author: Ashley C.

description: A California staple!  All I got to say is when I'm in need of a happy-caloriefest high, bring me a cheeseburger with extra grilled onions and my fries well done, animal style.  Big meal, big smile!
author: Lisa R.

description:
As the one beacon of goodness within the Fisherman's Wharf area, IN-N-OUT stands proud.  
Why do our ONLY animal-style fries reside in the worst part of the city!?!  
A drive to Daly City or Mill Valley usually will trump a FW trip.  Honestly.  That peeves the crap right outta me!
author: Robby T.

description:
It's great to have an In-n-Out at Fisherman's Wharf...especially when you don't feel like clam chowder or other seafood from the vendors.  But this place can get too busy with tourists sometimes, which makes it harder to keep up with cleaning the tables and floors.  

Ask for a free hat!
author: Jay M.

description:
It's In N Out. It's yummy.

Don't take your food to watch the sea lions, though. A sea gull dive bombed my head and took part of my sandwich. While I was recovering among the shocked and laughing tourists, another one (or the same one?) tried again. Craziness.
author: Monika M.

description: Had my first In-N-Out Burger experience in Vegas and it made a huge impression on me ever since. Because there's no In-N-Out at where I live, when I stumbled upon one in San Francisco during a vacation I just had to have it! Sure enough the burger was as fresh as I could remember and the sauce tasted good, but for some reason I feel the beef patty wasn't as juicy as the one in Vegas...
author: Michelle N.

description:
Pretty much the only fast food place I frequent, if once every couple months is "frequenting" a place.  Double Double with fries and a neapolitan shake to go, eaten outside near the waterfront.

I remember when In-N-Out was a treat reserved for visits to family in the LA area.  I love having one nearby--I live just blocks away--but miss the nostalgia of it being a special place.

This location at Fisherman's Wharf is always busy, but clean and moves quickly.  And it's always fun to watch the staff working and realize just how very fresh the food is.  I'm always amazed that they don't get their milk for shakes from a cow on-site!
author: Gretchen J.

description:
"The reason why In & Out is always packed is because there are so few locations in NorCal."- my cousin

I guess being in a foody city like San Francisco, there's really no need for a fast food burger joint- not even In & Out. There is a lot of hype that surrounds this chain and I think the brand has more to do with California than it does with being a quality food chain. In fact, eating here almost seems like a novice foody- move but heck- I'm from NYC, I was really eating it to see if it could compare to Shake Shack.

So I had a cheeseburger and cheese fries animal style. I really can't explain animal style except it has a whole lot of stuff on it including onions and more in & out secret sauce. I think most people outside of CA would never know of this except I dine w/ native CA-ers and I do as natives do when I'm out of town. 

Overall the burger is quite salty. I last had in & out about a year ago in SoCal and thought maybe it might be unique to the location however it wasn't- its just usually a salty burger. I think the sauce (I'd consider it a jazzed up thousand island dressing) does have an advantage over NY's Shake Shack sauce but it doesn't enhance the mediocre patty and bun or the hand cut fries.

I guess I'd go back regardless because I do enjoy burgers so much and it's become more about the In & Out experience rather than just the food (if that means anything to any of you guys out there.)

On a side note- when I saw the employees make my burger, 1 of the employees didn't use a glove but another did- in fact, I saw this a lot in SF. What's up with that?!?! I won't judge since I do dine in some of the dingiest of places for the sake of food but really....you're a fast food joint...should your governator be regulating this or something?
author: D N.

description:
I luv In n Out.  I luv animal style fries!  However, I usually order mine with 2 forks and seek a partner to indulge an order with....I am not brave enough to go into an order alone. 

Side note:  If you ever need to use the bathroom at this In n Out.....be ready for a hike.  First you must request for tokens and you walk out the building and into a very very dark tunnel (ok there are lights).  If you don't have tokens be prepare to use your best negotiation skills with the person ahead of you.
author: Sherman H.

description:
Double double animal style all the way!!!  This location get so insanely crazily maniacally packed and busy during lunch hours, especially on weekends.  Yes, I'm dumb for going there on a weekend.  But still, it's like a mating season seal colony that smells like frying meat instead of rotting fish.  There's outdoor seating, but unless the weather is nice, it can be fah-reeeeeeezing outside even during our indian summer.  Plus, you will have to explain to the greazy, hobbly pigeons that in a civilized society, people buy their own food and they don't walk on the table and start pecking at someone else's lunch.

In-n-Out burgers and fries are always five stars and then some, but I don't like the location here so knock off one star.
author: maiko h.

description:
It's gotta be a good burger if it makes me venture to this part of town. 

Enoy the fresh cut fries
Double Double or nothing.
Enjoy the people watching
Do not enjoy the bird poop filled outdoor tables.
author: Douglas C.

description:
I am so very thankful that I live near to the only In-N-Out burger joint in the city.  So it is in the midst of the tourist trap area. But I am more than willing to venture out there for a double cheeseburger animal style with fries and a chocolate shake.

==========

Update move out the area. Bah
author: Chris C.

description:
In-N-Out is a great place for a cheeseburger & fries.  The menu is small but satisficing. The best part is they are  a Christian company  & only hire clean cut well groomed people, not a nose ring or tattoo in sight  a nice change for us San Francisco natives  if you look closely at the packaging you can find special messages. :)

John 3:16
author: John M.

description:
Hey, look! I'm the first to review this one. (Hahaha no.)

I'll have to go along with most of the others though. Double-double with fries and a vanilla shake hits the spot every time.

The fries do indeed get cold quickly, and this particular location is busier than most, so minus one star. But there's a magician out in front; who doesn't love a magician.
author: Elliot J.

description:
I was dying to try this place while I was in San Francisco but never had the opportunity until my last day. I had a 12pm flight but took the F-line to the Wharf hoping they open early. Got there at 9am but realized that they open at 10:30. Did I give up and head to the airport? 

I went to Ghirardelli square, bought some souvenir chocolates, had some calamari, got some coffee at Boudin, and In-N-Out was open by 10:15. 

That was the best cheeseburger and fries I ever had in my life. I arrived at my gate with 10 minutes to spare if anyone is interested.
author: Mike S.

description:
All I have to say is

"Double, Double animal and protein style with a Neapolitan shake please!!"

They only lose a star because I for one HATE the fries.
author: Alexandra P.

description:
This is the best bang for your buck in the Fisherman Wharf. the food
is consistence ,the associates are very service oriented and you will
have money to spend on cheap t-shirts. the bad things are no parking
and usual a line. go around 11:30am or "you'll be sorry".
author: Howard J.

description:
OK, yes, fast food, bad food, greasy food.
Most of people in San Francisco seem like crying and hollaring about how unhealthy and bad it is, blablabla. 
ok, HERE: if you dont like it - AVOID those places! Period. (here's my middle finget for you) :)
Occasionally I have a fast food rush: that's how it goes - I crave - I see - I walk in - I getZ and i eatZ! My juicy-woosy burger! Bruh-bu-bu-skitskit! MMMMMMMMMMM!
author: Cat of a Donut J.

description: Seriously, hands down, the VERY BEST burger I have ever had!!!!!!!!! And the fries are fresh cut, no preservatives. I really wish they had one on the East Coast where I live.
author: Tanya L.

description: Awesome. No explanation needed. 3x3 animal style extra toast fries well done and a vanilla shake. Then a nice nap to end lunch. Not a fan of the tourist trap area or the 10-15 min wait, but it's so worth it. Hopefully it's nice outside so you can sit in the courtyard, otherwise scarf it down, standing room only.
author: Mark H.

description: best burgers the double double and and animal style burger which has russian style/thousand island dressing. the crowds are crazy many tourists and people who happen to be there, it was a bus ride to get there and I don't know if I would do it again but it's the best fast chain burger place, better than 5 Guys.
author: N A.

description: I love In-N-Out, but this location is hell. You will be bombarded by the amount of people trying to place an order. If you find a seat...guess what? People will literally stand right by you the whole time you are eating just to snag your spot as soon as your bottom is barely lifting off the chair. All In-N-Out food is exactly the same no matter what location, but I would steer clear of this one. It is technically the only one in SF, with the next one being in Daly City. With all the amazing seafood choices nearby, local vendors with seafood options (i.e. clam chowder, calamari, etc) I don't see why you would settle for In-N-Out. Go get a real taste of Fisherman's Wharf and grab food from a vendor!
author: Surge C.

description: Love this place and its almost always full of people and lines due to tourists.  They are fast and it probably helps that their menu is very simple.  They do have some other items they sell that are not on the menu you see above the casiers.  I love animal style burgers.  The food is fresh and gets to you pretty quick for what their workload is.
author: Jesse C.

description: It's definitely much more about the hype. The burger itself isn't all the great and I'm sure places serve just as great if not even better burgers but don't get nearly half the hype of in and out. This is just a place to try and see how it really is and if it lives up to its hype.
author: Alice W.

description:
Everyone else at my conference went off to eat clam chowders, seafood etc in the fisherman's wharf tourist trap. I was in SF just for a day and for the first time, and I had to go see what the In and Out burger fuss was all about.
The simplicity of the place was a little bit of a jolt as was the fact that you basically chose from 3 types of burgers, that is it! I ordered a cheese burger and fries which automatically came with onions and other standard seasonings. One bite of the burger and the taste and freshness of everything, told me what the fuss was all about. Very tasty burgers which contrast beautifully with the fresh crisp veggies, seasonings and the tasty bun. The whole meal was just about 5 or 6 bucks.
I have to take a star off for the fries, which were a little bit on the drier side and not what I was expecting. But as I sit here in Chicago, typing this review out, I'm already craving this burger again!
author: Rajan G.

description: One of the best burgers you can get from a fast food chain or otherwise.
author: David W.

description: Just back from the East coast and I'm craving a good burger -- go figure that I end up here. I love In-N-Out for all their simplicity and... the animal style version of fries. This spot is definitely a bit more busy than the others I've ever seen but don't let that discourage you. Grab your food to go and hit the Pier if necessary but if you're an omnivore you really ought to make a stop here.
author: Shauna S.

description: They don't have a huge menu but what they do have is flavor.  Excellent double-double and cheeseburger with cheese animal fries and coke.
author: Cathaleya C.

description: This was my second time to try In-N-Out Burger and let's just say....YUCK!  I got the double double and fries animal syle just as everyone recommended.  Let me start with the fries.  They are like dehydrated pieces of potatoe and have no taste.  The animal sauce may merely cover this fact for some, but the reality is - they are not good at all.  The burger was just a burger.  Sure, the animal style sauce and grilled onions add something new to the equation, but just cause it's new and different from what I am used to does NOT make it better.  I  much prefer a good ole Whataburger from Texas.  Those that believe these fries are fresh cut, must be smoking crack  - yuck.  Fast food changes such as Whataburger and Chick-Fil-A definitely are definitely superior.  Hell - I would even prefer a McyD's to this place.
author: Heather E.

description:
In-N-Out is good for fast food but you can defiantly find a better burger and frys that are fully cooked.

People say "the burgers are filling", yes I have noticed that they hit your stomach like a load of bricks but being filled by food does not make it good. I think that flavor, freshness, and quality have something to do with it too.

I think that In-N-out is slightly better than the Mc wendy kings of the burger world but nothing compared to a greasy spoon style burger from a mom and pop style hamburger joint.
author: howard h.

description: Delicious burgers and awesome "animal style" fries! Lives up to the hype I'd heard when I first got out here to the west coast.  The ingredients on the burgers were fresh, and even though there was a huge line, I could see the line workers were going as quick and efficiently as possible, so waiting ten minutes wasn't really a problem. The only problem was the seating. Maybe it was because it was Fisherman's Wharf on a Saturday around 1:30 because every table was taken and there were people waiting around to scout out tables for people leaving so they could swoop in and grab a seat. My bf and I just settled on sitting on the plastic bench where you'd wait for your order and balancing the tray on our legs. Food was delicious and what I thought it would be, but next time I'd make sure I didn't go during a peak time, or at least get it to go and find outdoor seating.
author: Erin F.

description:
Okay, east coast transplants--In 'n Out or 5 Guys?? I, personally, love 5 Guys, but In 'n Out is muy delish, too! When at the Wharf, go for cheap yummy burgers! 

please check out my food blog for a full review with photos!
author: Lily K.

description: Who couldn't love In 'n Out? It's the reason to be a meat eater! Okay so I don't really go there that often, but I do love my occasional In 'n Out on a lazy weekend. Minus one star however due to only having one shop in SF and it being in the most crowded part of town...
author: Jennifer P.

description: Two words..ANIMAL STYLE!  ;) Also the friendliest and most cheerful staff for a burger fast food place, though I prefer the Daly City location or the one by were we currently live in Fairfield, since it's rarely over crowded.
author: Petra S.

description: I'm a big fan of In-N-Out Burger. Service is wonderful and the food is always fresh. No frozen fries, here. Try the 4x4. You'll need plenty of napkins. My favorite In-N-Out is on Stockdale in Bakersfield, CA.
author: S.A. D.

description: We came here just out of pure impulse...great decision. I'm not a fan of their frys, but the burgers are very tasty.
author: Roman K.

description: My boyfriend really wanted to go here, so I gave it a try.  I've never been to one before and I was moderately excited as I do enjoy cheeseburgers and fries.  There was just this teeny-weeny patty between two gigantic, dry mouth inducing buns.  If I had eaten it with my eyes shut, it is likely that I would have thought I was just eating a mustard and pickle sandwich as those were the only prominent flavors.  I think this place is way over hyped or perhaps I should have tried it animal style.  I think the East Coast wins with Five Guys.
author: Megan C.

description:
Dear In-N-Out Burger, 

Your grilled cheese animal style with a side of fries and a milkshake are artery clogging heaven wrapped in deliciousness. 

Please consider opening up an east coast location in Boston and/or New York so that we can see each other more frequently. Long distance is just too hard. 

Love and Kisses, 

Lindsay
author: Lindsay D.

description:
The burgers are really good for a fast food place, but anyone who claims In-N-Out has the best burgers period is simply out of their minds or completely ignorant of burgers that aren't served by fast food restaurants. Yes, you can get hamburgers at sit down restaurants; they cost a lot more but they also taste a lot better than In-N-Out burgers.

I'm under doctor's orders not to eat red meat, so I didn't really have many options at In-N-Out. I'm not complaining here--if In-N-Out doesn't want to sell chicken or turkey burgers, that's their right as a private business. I just find it interesting that something so "Californian" does not offer non-red-meat options.
author: Peter K.

description:
So you're at Fisherman's Wharf, doing touristy things instead of hanging out in the authentic parts of San Francisco. Guess what? You can still experience a genuine California establishment, a place that makes the West Coast so special.

In-N-Out is only in CA, AZ and NV. Its because they are not franchised and can only have stores within a certain distance of their meat packing plant. They got a very good write up in Fast Food Nation of all books. They pay their employees well. They use fresh food. The fries are made from potatoes that at the Fisherman's Wharf location, you can see being pressed in the window.

As far as In-N-Outs go, this one is very crowded. Its worth the wait. And as Fast Food Nation points out, they are cheaper than Burger King and McDonalds AND they pay their employees better.

Fries animal style. Do it. 

The chocolate shakes are also great. I can't wait until I'm in California again!
author: Tom M.

description:
They do what they claim to.  Well.

As for the "thick and juicy" burgers described by a recent review... uh, what?  The burgers are thin patties, grilled through.  If you're looking for something thick, get a couple of patties on your burger.  There.  Infinitely discretely variable thickness burgers.  IDVTB.  Someone should patent it.  What will they think of next.  If you can come up with a more proper description of the nature of the variability of the thickness of these things, let me know.  

They make claims to the freshness of their ingredients and their open-plan kitchen displays their adherence to these ideals.  There's always a line, but it moves.  Fast.  A must for tourists and new-comers.
author: ben y.

description:
Ok, seriously, when it comes to fast food joints, I hate to be one of those In N Out groupies, but this place is really good.  The prices?  Even better.  Even when I get a burger "animal style" that is sopping with cheese, I don't feel too bad about it for some reason.  Maybe it's because I'm basking in the goodness of it all.

Yes, the fries are a bit different from McDonald's or Burger King, but I like them better because, well, they taste fresh(er) than the alternative.  Even though they're still artery clogging.

If you really want to make the meal even more refreshing, get some of the lemonade and mix it with the tea.  You'll feel much better about yourself instead of drinking that Coke (plus, it evens out the score when you order a double).  Even though this In N Out is in tourist central, I'm willing to jog down and eat to my stopped up heart's content.
author: Shay F.

description:
In N Out is just okay.  They're pretty good, service wise.  Fast, I guess. 

But it's overwhelmed with people.  They're everywhere!  

Oh, come on.  You're going to open a popular fast food chain restaurant here, in Fisherman's Wharf, one of San Francisco's tourist spots, and not factor in the amount of customers you're going to get?  There is never any space to sit, unless you go outside.

Food-wise, it's just okay.  I mean, definitely better than Burger King or McDonald's, but I think it has something to do with their "secret sauce" and toasted bun.  There isn't actually a lot of meat or anything.
author: Keegan Q.

description:
Do I really need to review In-N-Out Burger?? Nahh! 
I will just say top quality fast food. Yum.
Oh and check the (not so secret) secret menu! 

http://www.in-n-out.com/secretmenu.asp
author: Malika K.

description:
best "fast food" joint in SF

I love this location, particularly because whenever my family visits SF, and I don't wanna eat FISH.........I'm able to satisfy my Kow Kraving, while my wife & daughter eat at Nick's.  Meanwhile, Nick's validates our parking ticket for 3 hours of Fisherman's Wharf sightseeing......

My favorite burger is NOT on the menu.......its called the "Dbl Meat" and is only $2.35 (basically a "Double Double" without cheese).  Its 50 cents cheaper than the "Double Double" and its soooooooo good.
author: Matt C.

description:
Consistent, as are all the In-N-Out locations I've visited. Consistent, that is, in quality. Outstanding in the amount of drunk slobs I've seen. Last night was the group from St. Paul, Minn. (as evidenced by the St. Paul Fire Dept. t-shirt ... and this was not worn for hipster cred). Two guys -- one older, one younger -- and a chick who kept hooting, drunk.

Drunks can be funny, but these guys weren't. The fries tasted good, though.
author: Allison L.

description:
In N Out burger, how I love thee.  This is the original SoCal institution of fast food, and it's the best burgers and shakes you can get anywhere (fries are a different story alltogether).  All of the food is fresh and is made right in front of you.  The beef is never frozen, and you can watch the staff slice potatoes on the french fry press while you're waiting for your food.  

This location is the ONLY one in San Francisco sadly and it's right in the middle of Fisherman's Wharf, the locally hated neighborhood that's even more overrun with tourists than Union Square.  Parking can be a nightmare, as there's often 10 million people trying to park in the same place as well as the mobs of pedestrian tourists. -1 star for the actual location.

Anyway, back to the food.  The burgers here are awesome.  I enjoy mine with grilled onions (no raw onions for me please) and with the regular sauce on top.  The fries I normally get "well done" but I'm not really crazy about them (McDonald's fries are WAY better, even though they are not made from fresh potatoes).  The shakes are made from real ice cream and are awesome as well.
author: Kathleen B.

description: This has to be the White Castle of the West Coast. No one who is not from here can possibly understand or appreciate what all the fuss is about greasy burgers sopped up in white bread buns and fries smothered in cheese and onions. Strictly for kids. But adults who have lived here for a long time also seem to crave it. Beats me.
author: joan b.

description: This was the BEST In-N-Out that I have ever been too!  It was so good.  Always packed...I think we ate here like 3 times.  Service was fast.
author: Reanna R.

description: What's the big deal? When compared to McDonald's or Burger King...sure, it's better. Fries are good too...especially when done animal style. So for fast food burgers yes it's good. Is it better than my favorite home town burger Five Guys? No way. But can't really compare the two since Five Guys is more of a gourmet burger where In n Out is strictly fast food.
author: David C.

description: Doublecheese burger was good but the French fries were not very good
author: John L.

description:
Standing there in line with the large swath of tourists and noise, I think I can not believe I am really here, condescendingly mind you.

Then I order and get so excited. I love being an insider and ordering something that is not on their menu.
O the fries are sooo good and now I've learned you can get them crispier.  This place is really "have it your way".
Well you're way and the Lord's way.
What does that mean? Turn your cup over and you'll see what I mean, 
John 3:16 thank you very much!
author: Sean S.

description:
I had lunch here today and it was so crowded during the lunch hour. Between the people who work nearby, the tourists and everyone else, it was hard to get a table inside unless you prowled like a hawk. It seemed like all of the people who were sitting around us were gabbing in foreign tongues. Sort of cool. That's one thing you don't find at all In-N-Outs. 

I would recommend grabbing a table outside if it's a nice day, rather than inside. It gets a bit mucky because there isn't free airflow.
author: Amy D.

description:
The food is delicious.  It's addictive, and probably very bad for you.  You crave it, you need it, and you've memorized their "secret" menu. Unfortunately you have to go to Fisherman's Wharf to get it, and there's a long line of all the other addicts in front of you.  The In N Out Burger teller line and pick up line are pure chaos.  There's never anywhere to sit, and you can't sit outside because the aggressive beggers are everywhere.
Still I still find I must have an In N Out burger every once in a while.
author: Michael D.

description:
In-N-Out Burger is the bomb, they have great fries, good service as far as fast food goes, they keep the burgers to the basic, no bacon, one kind of cheese, no mushrooms as well as many of the extras that you sometimes want on your burger. However as far as burgers go they are the top of the fast food chain when you consider the taste and freshness of their burgers and fries. You can watch them cut up the potatoes for your fries. 

As far as fast food burgers In-N-Out Burger is at the top, however dealing with going to fisherman's warf to get one of these tasty burgers keeps this one from a getting 5 stars.
author: Bobby B.

description: It's cold in San Francisco.. thank goodness for cheesy, hot & greasy In-N-Out!
author: Alessandria R.

description:
Laurence H. says it all.  I recently visited San Francisco for 2 weeks.  I ate here twice.  Count it: 2 times!

The shakes, however, need work.  The machine is similar (the same?) as the one used by McDonald's.
author: Sarah B.

description:
I love In-n-Out. as with many people, it's about the only fast food place that I frequent.

One time I brought my aunt, visiting from Canada at the height of their mad cow scare, to In-n-Out, whereupon she asked in her sino-canadien accent, "do you have any chicken sandwiches?"

It was then that the entire restaurant, including that creepy woman who shouts inaudibly to herself and the smelly homeless dude, broke out in laughter in unison. It was a kodak moment.
author: Bernie L.

description:
Well. I (update-- USED TO!) work right near here. I'm talking a stone's throw away. So I've a thing or two to say. One is-- doesn't anyone feel bad for the workers? It looks so stressful, and everyone's staring at them. Also. I don't really like their French fries.  I like my fries mushy. Gross, I know, but these are crispy, crunchy, and empty. I don't really like the smell of them either.

I also had a bad experience where there was a miscommunication about my order, and the guy behind the counter rolled his eyes and, in a very rude and alarming fashion, threw the fries (which I had honestly NOT ordered) over his shoulder as if I was just another annoying tourist. He was incredibly good looking, too. Shame.
author: Emily H.

description:
Why are tourists taking pictures of In-N-Out cups?

A big dirtier than I prefer my fast food places, but it's still an In-N-Out.
author: Keane L.

description:
Every now and then, i need to get outta the TenderNobb and clear my head. Sometimes, the low-rise, stout buildings and the sad souls that linger in their doorways make me feel claustrophobic. So then I hop on the 19 bus & get off at the last stop which is Ghirardelli square, and walk two blocks to In-n-Out for a burger.

There never was anything particularly catchy about the food at In-n-out, in fact, i used to swear that i hated the shit. But after numerous discussions with my English mates about their best burger experiences in America, they always go on and on about "In-n-Out" - so, 50 percent of me goes for the benefit of the doubt, and the other 50 goes for the ride out of the TenderNobb.

I order my double double with only a single slice of cheese (cause i wanna taste the meat yo) order my fries crispy, but that still doesn't help me enjoy them any more, or less than i usually do - a root beer and a vanilla shake to interchange the wash-down.

All in all, the lunch was uneventful, but i guess that's why i went there in the first place.
author: The Shmooze ..

description:
I'm kind of into how chipper everyone always is who works at in-n-out.  The woman who was my cashier was super-woman, she was doing everything in that place including making my milkshake, carrying stuff out for other customers, fixing the ketchup dispenser, explaining to me when they started taking credit cards.  Awesome.

I recommend animal styling the burgers, but maybe not on the fries.  They put more of the animal stuff on the fries than at the other In-N-Outs I've been too.  It can be, well, excessive.  It induced stomach unhappiness in my brother, and he lives (and eats) in Houston these days.
author: Leo C.

description:
Here's the simple story of a girl from the big apple and a big, in-n-out, animal style burger.

My grandparents live near SF, and I used to visit yearly with my mother as a child. Pretty soon, every time the airplane wheels touched the ground, the first thing I would say was

"Can we go to In-N-Out?"

Since moving to SF, I have been able to enjoy their burgers far more than yearly, and while I don't eat them every day I can say, without hesitation, that in all my world travels, I have never had a better burger.

Also, being able to customize the crispiness of my fries is like, heaven. Who else lets you do that?!
author: Avery L.

description:
I'm not a fan of In-N-Out Burger because whenever I go there is always droves of people waiting in line in cars and once even in a taxi. 

This past sunday I got lucky and there wasn't a swarm of people waiting in line to get burgers.  I mean we walked in a was standing directly at the counter! Talk about amzing.  

I order the no.2 combo, waiting while it was being cooked, and heading back to the car.  Now I'm going to assume when you're hungry In-N-Out must make the best burgers ever because I was done with my burger in about 5 minutes or less. I think because it was pretty small as well. I can say it was well done had everything I wanted on it  and kind of  filling. 

As for the fries they were fresh a little greasy and salty but yummy. I'm trying to eat healthy and stay away from salt but damn they're like Pringos and Lays you just can't have one! 

Well I would go again when I'm hunger and when its not busy.
author: Karim R.

description:
So, I'm not a native Californian (thank God I'm TEXAN!) but I live here and listen to people always raving about In-N-Out.  
So I take that $10 taxi ride over and try their cheeseburger/fries/shake and I have to admit, it's pretty good.  Sort of tastes like a Sonic burger w/mayo and mustard.  However, it will never compare to WHATABURGER... the best fast food burger maker in the world.  That's why it's called WHATABURGER.  Get the #1 w/cheese and you will be in cheeseburger heaven.  You'll be in TEXAS after all and make sure to get a Dr. Pepper to drink or else you will be run out of the country (the Republic of Texas) for high treason.
author: F K.

description: It took us over 15 mins to get our food. The burgers were ok and the fries were dry. This joint may be the staple on the West Coast but it still does not beat other fast food burger joints out there. I still prefer Five Guys Burgers - hands down.
author: Pugsly W.

description:
By far the best burger in the world. 
Love animal style fries!


 If you can stop by - don't dare to drive by.
author: Markus F.

description: real american burger. this is something different than others. it's a must for burger lovera
author: Alper D.

description:
Ok, ok, perhaps 4 starts are too much.... I don't know.

What is true is that In-N-Out defines the threshold for "food". Anything worse (read here all the rest of the fast food chains) is not "food". Anything better "is" food. 

Having said that ...  "Give me a double double and french frites animal style!!"
author: Javi V.

description:
how good is in-n-out?
i've eaten it all my life. even if i've just eaten thanksgiving dinner, if someone suggests in-n-out, i will get a cheeseburger.

but i realized the extent of my love for in-n-out one (un)fateful day last December 2011:

I had a double-double with the bf from this location around 10 pm. The next morning, at 5 am, I am kneeling at the porcelain throne, offering all the contents of my stomach. The food poisoning was so killer my bf had to taxi then carry me to the doctors, I had to get an anti-nausea injection, and I still managed to throw up on my way out of the office. We are still wondering if in-n-out was indeed the cause of the food poisoning since my bf ate the same thing but was perfectly fine.

But this is how good in-n-out is: 2 days later, I was in Los Angeles, eating a double double again. and when i telephoned the sf location just to alert them that i had food poisoning, they were extremely nice and comp-ed my food.
author: C W.

description: Pure awesome in a burger and shake. Superbly busy on a Sunday evening, I popped in here for a quick burger and fries a la Americana. Very quick and fun, the place doesn't feel corporate and the food is tasty. The empty McDonald's down the road and the packed In-N-Out are a stark contrast to each other.
author: Alastair M.

description: Best place ever, animal style, neopolitan shake, that is all
author: BJ G.

description: Im from canada and i have dreams about In n out burgers. LOVE THIS PLACE. MILKSHAKES ARE AWESOME HERE.
author: Nehal A.

description:
"Why are you so happy?" I think to myself as a beautiful girl takes my order at this fast food place with 40 people busily walking back and forth by the soda machine.

In reality, In-n-Out is the best fast food in the fucking universe-- though now that I live on the west coast my dreams don't live up to expectations.  It's kindof like fucking the prom queen to find out she sucks dick like a baby turtle?

Too graphic?  Sorry.

But yeah, this place is good enough.  If you're unfortunate enough to be a non-tourist in the Warf stop in and get a double-double animal style.
author: L J.

description:
I should say up front: I'm not big on fast food. Not at all. I'd been to In-N-Out a few times before and come away mostly unimpressed. Sure, compared to any other fast food burger, you could definitely do worse. Then I learned that I just wasn't doing it right.

You probably already know about Animal Style. It should be mandatory on any In-N-Out visit. I also started ordering Protein style, and the crisp lettuce makes all the difference. I find myself far more satisfied than with a bun.

I was tempted to give In-N-Out four stars because the burgers are cooked all the way through so the meat doesn't have too much flavor. But this is as good as you will ever get for $3.50. I get the hype now.
author: Greg S.

description:
I don't often go to this In-n-Out because it's mostly just all tourist cause it's in Fisherman's Wharf. But I've been here enough to say. It's just the same as any in and out, it's always crowded but if you want to eat some good burgers go ahead. Here's a litte something for my review which my friends often get cause they wanna be in the KNOW.

http://www.tiburon-belvedere.com/cgi/home.cgi?c=In_N_Out

In and out's secret menu!!!!!!!! They love Animal Style.
author: Kimberly S.

description:
Should Jesus really sanction America's obsession with greasy food and an early death due to coronary disease? Next time you indulge, check the packaging for the Bible chapters that are printed. Nice to know Jesus is there with you when you pollute your body.

Over hyped Jesus burgers and 3rd world fries. Shakes are well worth the trip as long as you don't have to wait more than five minutes ;)
author: Steve S.

description:
Can't believe I haven't written about this yet!  This location was the first time I have ever tried In-n-Out.  And it was AMAAAZING!  I had the normal cheeseburger and fries.  It was only after that amazing night that I learned from my SoCal friend that there's the 16x16, sloppy burger, and all these other weird burger names that are not named on the menu.  

Other funny thing was that I ate here as a tourist and since that time I have only visited this location once as a resident.  

It seems about time to make another trip!
author: Alan T.

description:
After moving to West Coast, all I heard from people was that I needed to check out In-N-Out. Good burgers. Great burgers. The best fucking burgers ever. And don't forget the fries and the milkshakes and it's all fresh and the bible verse and blah blah blah

I finally made it out there one day. And I had a burger. A 2x2. And it was good. But not great. Definitely not the fucking best. And the fries were pretty soggy -- apparently that's how they do them there.

People told me I did it wrong. I should've asked for animal style, and ordered the fries crispy, and the 3x3 is the only burger combo blah blah blah. So I tried again and again, and it was good. But not great.

I'm not sure where I'm going. I need to stop giving into the hype. In-N-Out: Good burgers. Not great.
author: Chris M.

description:
I wish they had more seats!

Food comes pretty slow, but that's because the burgers are so good and the fries too. I love In & Out!
author: Milton Y.

description: Good burger place when lunch sucks at work.
author: John L.

description:
I usually give in n outs 5 stars, but this one loses a 1/2 a point because they take even longer than other in n outs. this one should be called "in an hour." it gets pretty crowded since its on the wharf and probably the best place to eat in the area.

another 1/2 because there is usually a homeless guy right outside the door and sometimes another one or 2 inside. 

then minus 1 more point  because to go to the bathroom you have to first get the code from the cashier, exit the building, and walk to a back area (where people are waiting for you to get in). one of the best things about in n out is they keep their bathroom pretty clean. since this one isnt technically inside in n out, they dont maintain it and it gets pretty messy. and maybe grab some napkins from in n out before you head over. feel free to take your time though and wash your hands thoroughly cuz when you get back your order still wont be ready.

on a side note...the meters outside run everyday (including sundays) and to a later hour (maybe past 7)
author: JeF m.

description: Not for one moment do I regret the last double-double I got here, even if it did cost me $40. I would happily cab there solo from a bar in the Mission and immediately back to my house again if it meant another taste of sweet, sweet animal-style goodness.
author: Stephanie P.

description:
I don't really need to write a review for this place.  It's cult following does a good enough job of notifying the world of it's greatness without me ... but I must say this:  "double double, with grilled onions, and fries well done."  Fast food doesn't get any better than that.

That is all.
author: Omar S.

description:
Fantastic fast food.  There's nothing very comparable in the midwest, except for some good mom-and-pop shops.  Every time I'm on the west coast, I choose to eat at LEAST one In-n-Out meal.  Just too good not to.  Love love love dipping the amazing french fries in the "spread" that normally comes on things that are "animal style."  

And you really can't beat their burgers.  A+++ for this old-school burger chain.
author: Ang R.

description:
I do agree with several below reviews with the "cheap, fast" thing. My problem, the hamburger patties are so little! Not sure if it is the fact that this location is in tourist city USA, but I would say In-n-out burgers in LA are far better. 

This is definately one of those "I want to eat grease" places, but I think they one way to make it worth it is to get the double double! 

Could just be me...
author: Lindsay C.

description:
Hover-N-Snatch.  This is my most feared game to play with the overly aggressive tourists in search of open tables at Fisherman's Wharf.  And I think this In-N-Out location is the tournament headquarters.

Frankly, tourists are scary and I go out of my way to avoid them, but it's simply impossible to do so here.  The only time I ever go here is when I have visitors, but when your tour guide feet are tired from walking from the Ferry Building, and need rest before the walk back to Union Square via Chinatown, don't go to this In-N-Out for podiatric relief.  Hover-N-Snatch can be brutal!

Onto to food.  I love In-N-Out!  As I approach the counter, I always think to myself "Fatty McFat-Fat".  This usually prevents me from going overboard at fast food joints, but I will invariably order a double-double (animal style no less), fries, and a diet soda ('cause ordering diet alleviates some of the guilt, right?).  The meal is quickly devoured and I think to myself, "Thank God I hate coming to Fisherman's Wharf and I don't have a car".  Otherwise I WOULD be Fatty McFat-Fat.
author: Vicente G.

description:
BEST BURGERS EVER!!!
I never felt guilty eating their burgers as i would eating mcdonald's...in n out did sell me on the organic fresh advertisement...i guess thats why it tasted even better and healthier...i guess?!?!
weird thing...they have lotza stuff that arent on their menu list, like the animal style fries or the 5 by 5 or 10 by 10 burgers.
if uve never tried the animal style fries, then u should go now, find the nearest in n out chain, and get it right away!
if u wanna know whats 5 by 5 or 10 by 10 burger, then u should go now, find the nearest in n out chain, and get it right away...haha!

"animal style fries and double cheese burger with meal!"
author: Natalia T.

description:
There is pretty much nothing I can say about this In-N-Out that hasn't already been said, but I just want to say, "Thank God there is at least one In-N-Out in San Francisco!"  I was born and raised in an area with an In-N-Out close by, and I was thrilled to find out I could walk to this In-N-Out from my apartment.

Like most In-N-Out Buger joints, the service here is excellent and the burgers are always hot, fresh and exceptionally tasty!  I salivate for them! :)
