The only downside is the tourist factor, but I'm pretty sure that's the main reason this In-N-Out was built.  I'll take the tourists if I can get my burger!
author: Jacqueline T.

description:
There's something very sexual about the name. and the entire experience.

I've only ever gone to the in-n-out in san ramon before this, and that one is better because its not at fisherman's wharf, but really... i will never speak badly of this chain. SoCal loves in-n-out, Norcal loves in-n-out, east coasters who visit love in-n-out...

how could anyone hate on a double-double animal style? or the milkshakes made with REAL ice cream?? and the hand-cut fries... i know a lot of people think theyre better "well done" or animal style or whatever, but i think they're fine just the way they are. They taste like real potatoes cooked in canola oil, not trans-fat cooked in more trans-fat. (They're still deliciously bad for you though, dont worry)

Also I think this place has a starting salary that's higher than what i'm getting paid now.
author: A K S.

description:
LORD HAVE MERCY.
I love this place. When my mom and I went to San Fran together, we ate In N Out. The line went outside of the place but it was well worth it. Great deal for burgers, fries, and a drink! Fresh cut fries, fresh ingredients. I LOVE IT.
author: minji k.

description:
"In-n-out saved my marriage" 

That's what I bet I'm going to say....when I'm married. Seriously, I go here every weekend, and sometimes during the week. This one in SF is a little dirtier than others, normally they are spotless. 

My favorite two items not on the menu:

1. Cheeseburger with ketchup&mustard instead of spread (significantly less fat and calories without the spread) 
2. DoubleDouble protein style

This is the first place I take anybody who comes to visit outside of california.......it never disappoints!
author: Ema H.

description: What a disappointment! Even Mcky D's better than this crap. However, in SF -- SuperDuperBurgers is out-frikin-standing! Tried their Mini Burger -- with everything, cheese, jalapeños, and a whole egg on it -- really good (and so is their lemonade)! But no one can be compared to Shake Shack!
author: Iqbal K.

description: In-N-Out Burger in the heart of Fisherman's Wharf? Beautiful marketing strategy! I'm sure all of the Bay Area Dems are in shock that this place exists in their haven of solitude. If you want your organic salad, go to Mill Valley, and leave the beef (even near the wharf) to me. I love In-N-Out's simpleness.
author: Jeff K.

description: For the amount this place was hyped up, I was really disappointed. I was told things like I would never look at hamburgers the same way again, or that In-N-Out is not in the same league as any other burger joint I've been to. And all I have to say, is Five-Guys is better. A lot better. First and foremost, the fries at In-N-Out are a joke. Even McDonalds has better fries, and I'm still not convinced McDonalds uses real food. But the burger itself is OK. Not great. Not wonderful. Not mind blowing. Better than McDonalds. Just okay. For the money, I would much rather go to Five-Guys. The fries are better and the burgers are too.
author: Seth H.

description: HOLY HAMBURGER HEAVEN! This place is the epitome of great cheap burgers. Surpasses any other burger joint I have ever been to. If you get the chance to go, try the loaded fries with their special sauce. The burgers are never too greasy and they are just the perfect size, not like these gargantuan burgers you see at some places. It's really a shame they do not have one on the east coast! Please bring In N Out here!!
author: Janine R.

description: My wife and I were visiting from Chicago and I had heard a lot of good things about In-N-Out Burger. Since our hotel was right around the corner we decided to give it a try. If you don't like to think much about what to order, you'll appreciate their menu, which offers very little. I ordered a hamburger and fries. Given their name and the small number of patrons I was a little surprised at how long it took to get our simple order. When I got my burger I was underwhelmed. It's about as basic as a burger can be and really wasn't special. The only thing I noticed was the abundance of lettuce and lack of meat. The fries were average as well. I think In-N-Out Burger succeeds on its simplicity and buzz, but little else. If you have the opportunity to go to one I'd suggest skipping it.
author: Michael R.

description: Anywhere I go in the bay, I always love the great customer service they have for a fast food place.
author: Jay L.

description: I'm sure its entirely because I can't have In-N-Out in NY that I begin to crave it until I make it out to Cali again. Once its in my face its fine, but I'm never floored. The comparisons to shake shack are a joke. Solid fast food, good fries and I love finding the bible references on all the packaging.
author: Dave P.

description: They are pretty fast for being so busy. The location of this place is awesome because sometimes I don't feel like eating the fancy food on the piers. The service is really good, sometimes it might just be hard to find a seat
author: J R.

description: The food is wonderful- the atmosphere is in need of management. The dining area is being over run by LOUD loitering misfits! Please get them out so I can come back!
author: Holly W.

description:
This is about the only fast food restaurant I can think of where the workers don't look like they're hours from suicide.  The positive attitudes exhibited by the rascals working here may actually result in better produced food, or at least food without spit and semen in it.  Well, at least food without spit and semen INTENTIONALLY added to it.

  The deliciousness of the junk here will imprint itself upon your memory and force you to come back time and time again, even after you see videos of cows being murdered for beef production.  Good food wins out over conscience, I guess.  Rats.
author: Eric P.

description:
It's so random and touristy to have an In 'N Out at the wharf...but when you're traveling in SF, sometimes your food budget can be totally blown earlier in the trip than you anticipated. 

This was an easy way to get a quick, cheap meal while we walked around the Wharf.
author: Senor P.

description:
Sure, it's not the best burger in the world but this place is still uniquely Californian. The Fisherman's Wharf location of course is ungodly crowded, packed with typical tourists and perhaps a handful of locals too in search of the state's perfected fast food cheeseburger.

After wading through the throngs of hungry masses with my amigos, I secured my holy Double-Double. We promptly went outside, and chowed down on this greasy goodness. If I were to compare it to McDonald's or Wendy's, I would suggest that this burger has a higher quality of preparation and overall taste. It wasn't sloppily thrown together although it was still slightly messy with it's gooey cheese. Nonetheless, it had a far superior bun and toppings in contrast to the junk which populates your other typical fast food chains. Not to mention two solid beef patties to round off the whole finished product. Couple it with some decent animal fries and you've got yourself a near perfect meal right there on the otherwise boring wharf. 

Don't go in expecting lots of variety, the menu is sparse for a reason. This place makes burgers fast, cheap, and delicious. Simple business rhetoric. 

It's not a culinary achievement to mankind, it is however the best fast food burger I've sampled and furthermore, a welcomed treat to any visitor in beautiful San Francisco. I would happily love to see this chain on the East Coast, but then it would probably lose it's quality ingredients and turn into McDonald's.

So to California and it's beloved In-N-Out restaurants, I say godspeed, I look forward to dining at you once again.
author: Blayze O.

description: Don't you wish everything in life could be ordered Animal Style!?!  Great after a night of raging on the duck!
author: Jason S.

description: The best burgers around. Just make sure you go double double and have a fresh milk shake. Yummy!
author: Hank M.

description: Came to this In-N-Out right after I got off the airplane.  Love that it's open late since I didn't check in to my hotel room until 9:30pm at night.  The food is really good and cheap.  Love their french fries especially with the sauce.  Their milkshakes are good as well.  Wish they had a In-N-Out in Hawaii...
author: Ku'ulei R.

description:
It's an In-N-Out, only way busier because it's the only one in SF proper.
Expect a 15 - 45 minute wait, followed a burger so good you'll forget about the 15 - 45 minute wait.
Also, you'd be hard-pressed to find friendlier staff at ANY fast food chain.
author: Justin B.

description:
This cures all ills for me:

Double Double
Animal Style
Medium Rare
Extra Toasted Bun
with whole grilled onions
extra pickles

and 

French Fries Well Done
author: Justin B.

description: No matter which location you choose, if you are going to indulge in 'fast food', you aint gonna find no better than In-N-Out!  It's like a blast from the past, where its an authentic burger joint, not concerned with beating out competition with gross, greasy, oversized portions of ridiculous concoctions.  All ingredients are fresh and you can taste the delicious difference.  The milkshakes are creamy and oh so good.  I had my first delightful experience on a road trip through California, and I was hooked.  I am not a fast food junkie, but I could eat In-N-Out anytime and be a very very happy girl.  If you've never had the chance to try it, you are seriously missing out.
author: K. X.

description:
This is the only one in SF. 

It's cheap, tasty and filling.

There are tons of crazy homeless people, and they rush in with their dingy, battered plastic mugs to fill up at the soda fountain. Gratis, natch. The staff will never stop them because the place is nearly always packed and the action is so hot. Zombie-like fast food acolytes lick their lips and impatiently clutch their tickets, waiting for their order to be delivered at the counter...fresh, griddled beef and undersalted, wilted "fries".

I give it five stars not only for the food, but also because it's maybe the only respectable place in the northeast end of the City where you can act like the drunken, cracked-out fool that you are. AND THEN there will always still be someone that is more fucked-up than you that wants that burger more.
author: Derek C.

description:
In N' Out ROCKS.

My only wishes about this place are: BACON!  And add more tables with regular chairs!

One thing I don't get... some people are complaining about the bible quotes on the packaging.  My first reaction was, "there are bible quotes on the packaging?"  That's news to me, and I've been eating at In N' Out for 27 freakin' years now.  Never once have I ever even NOTICED something like that, nor have I ever heard anybody mention them before reading the reviews here on Yelp.  In fact, while writing this I just asked the friend who's introduced me to In N' Out back in 1980, and he's never noticed it either.   How noticeable can it be?  Now I'm gonna have to look next time I go.
author: Mike F.

description:
Chicago does the best hot dogs. California does the best burgers. I have   a special salute I do whenever I'm passing an In-N-Out burger location. And it's hard to pass it up sometimes. Bible verse or no Bible verse - who cares? They have the process down. Burgers, fries, drinks. That's it. 

Only  a select few locations spread tens of miles apart, and the place is always packed FULL.  I like to keep track of how many numbers have been called from the time I sit down to eat until I leave. 

Watch them cut the potatoes while you wait for your number to be called. Best damn fries anywhere.
author: K P.

description:
Burgers and "The Secret Menu" = SWEET

Very basic menu and 3 meal deals along with the "secret menu" (Whoa!).  I usually sneak in at night when there is parking as the lunchtime period often has lines even out the door thus the waiting is the hardest part (thanks Tom Petty & The Heartbreakers).  The Fisherman's Wharf location is busy at times thus the night time sneak in approach.

As for the food, it is all good as everything is fresh from the tomatoes, lettuce, onions (I keep forgetting to get them grilled but so be it) and bun. The burger itself looks a bit dinky thus you may want to go double-double.  The fries can be a bit "weak" thus have them "well done" for crispness.  The grilled cheese  is okay as the spread makes it interesting.

Ordering from the secret menu makes ordering plus the experience fun. Items such as the grilled cheese and fries with cheese along with how large you want your burger with cheese are a sampling of what you can order.  The company's web site & Wikipedia's entry are has a list of what is on the secret menu.

As for price, this place definately earns the "Cheap Eats" award from various SF magazine and publications.  If you order from the basic menu, roughly at least up to $5+ for a meal.

Service varies from standard efficient to friendly but overall, the crew takes care of your order.  The place itself has seating and the workers keep the place as clean as possible.  On top of that, free stickers and a merchandise catalog if you ask nicely.
author: W L.

description:
No matter what city your in you can always count on a tasty burger, with some fresh hott fries from In-N-Out...  My drink of choice is usually a lemonade with a splash of sprite, but if I'm felling saucy I'll grab a chocolate shake

I never understood all the different order slang that goes on around here, although  the "Wild style fries" as they call it is BOMB.

Good thing there's one in the CITY!!!
author: Robert M.

description: Great burgers, great place and great price! Great fast junk food haha, but I truly recommend you this place!
author: Fede M.

description: We don't have In and Out Burger on the East coast and for years I would hear people in California RAVING about how good it is. So at long last I finally got to try their fare last summer in L.A. And guess what -- they suck! A few months later In San Francisco just to be fair and to be sure (but against my better judgement), I tried them again. All I can say is clearly this is food for drunk people and stoners. Because if you are in full possession of your taste bud faculties, there is no way one could think that crap they serve belongs on anyone's best burger list. Avoid.
author: Husky M.

description: i love fresh cut fries.. there's just nothing better. Thank goodness the wait for the burgers are short and fast cos standing at InNOut gets me hungry all the time. Truly a fast food place.
author: Meredith C.

description: I always find myself in the area every other weekend, and I've totally forgotten how much I love their burgers (in comparison to other fast food joints) and fries (taste like potato chips!). I haven't had an In-N-Out burger for probably over a year now. We got two cheeseburgers animal-style with a side of fries and it was less than $7! Whaat. I even had enough money for a Ghirardelli hot fudge sundae, but unfortunately (or fortunately) not enough room in my tummy.
author: Zell C.

description: For a fast food joint this place is really kind of great. Generally the staff is very nice and all seem like happy people, but really it's the burger that's star. Grilled on a flat top and placed on a toasted bun with fresh lettuce, tomato, onion and a Thousand Island spread. Combine this for a simple yet great experience.
author: PurryKitty

description: Giving them four star on the food.  Late arrival in The City, motel close by and we wanted a quick meal before check- in. Unlike other In n Outs you have a very good view of the kitchen. In n out always looks so clean and shiny.  This one had food scraps all over the floor in the area of making up the hamburgers and cooking the fries. Very unappetizing!  Place was packed, wasn't hurting business...!  But, you're finally in S.F....make a better impression.
author: Mimi L.

description: What's not to like here with the burgers? It's still In n Out. It's hard to beat the bang for your buck you get here... my only gripe (and my friends who grew up in California either roll their eyes or lash out at this point - I'm convinced Californians are brainwashed to love In n' Out at a young age, and anything said without proper deference is considered sacrilegious. Oh well, a discussion for another time) is with the fries. They taste just like potatoes (yes I KNOW that's where fires come from). That's not what I want at a fast food place. Give me salt and grease and MSG. Give me something thats going to leave my fingers salty and oily. I'm already out for fast food I'm obviously not concerned about the potential health benefits of any of my choices. I don't want strips of all natural potatoes. I'm convinced that In n Out came up with "animal style" to hide the overwhelming blandness of their fries (yet another position I am crucified for)
author: Taylor C.

description:
The burgers here are great.  But make sure that they fully cook your burger before recieving it.  My last burger was kinda raw.  The Fries and shakes especially the strawberry shake is awesome!
I still love bagels more.
author: Ricky B.

description:
Best Fast Food Place to go to for BURGERS!!!!

Their patty is amazing with no aftertaste!!!!! Crsipy Buns... In-N-Out special sauce.... lettuce and tomatoes... (you may have onions, as they do originally come with onions) its cheap.... and after you have finished one.. yu just want another!!! located right by fisherman's wharf.. it does get quite crowded at lunch time. but they are sooo worth the wait!

-x3 shells
author: Lily X.

description: So good. It's as awesome as everyone says it is. I think it's the simple beef patty surrounded by veggies, like how much lighter the whopper is vs 2-patty big mac. I like.
author: Sarah T.

description: Alright. I left hawaii at 8 o'clock with no food in my tum tum from post thanksgiving pigout. To curb my hunger on the long flight I purchased an incredibly bland cliff bar.     Finally we arrive at the rediculously crowded in n out .  and all that was on my tum was  a 4x4, animal fries and a choco shake meal. We order ed. And scavanged for a spot to eat. Finally number 77 was called and we were sitting. My burger was finished in half the time of my fathers double double. I ate half the fries and still was hungry. I purchased another burger. A double double.   I feel good now. 2 pounds heavier and a brain full of happy. Thanks in n out we will meat again.
author: Peter H.

description: LOVED IT!  I am from the east coast and have heard such good things about this place and they are all true!  The burger was delicious!  I have had better fries, but let's be honest I came for the burger. I can't wait to go back.
author: Amber T.

description: I have to say that the burgers are addicting. They taste so good! the double double cheeseburger does it for me.. Great food and great service to go along with it..
author: Frankie M.

description: It's like they're trying to torture the natives by nestling their delicious burgers amongst the unbearable tourists. Very much worth the drive to Daly City to not have to listen to some dude from Ohio ask for onion rings and extra bacon.
author: Claire C.

description:
A little disappointing after all the hype in the guidebook about it being 'the' burger chain of California.


 It's a simple operation, just three different burgers or meals to choose from which was a refreshing change from the huge menus you get in many fast food places these days.


 The burgers were good but the fries were dry. They do use a healthier type of cooking oil but unfortunately it shows in the taste and crunchiness of the chip.


 Full marks for preparing all the food, including peeling and cutting the potatoes on the premises.


 A good alternative to McDonald's and Burger King.
author: goldielegg

description:
I don't see what all the fuss is about, the only good thing here is the price of a burger....(you get what you pay for in life)

there buns are fresh but there is a 8 to 1 ratio on the bread to meat scale.  need i say more.... go try the Jack in the Box Angus burger and you will see a real burger(in the burger chain category)

ohh and by the way your frys suck.
author: rasaka s.

description: Living on the east coast means no opportunity to eat at an In-N-Out, so this was my first time: it was not a disappointment. I understand why in the pantheon of fast food restaurants this one would rank quite high. The fries were great. The burger was really good too. My only problem was the fact that it was SOOOOO crowded. We had to sit outside with the pigeons...not very appetizing.
author: pathic d.

description: Though I've traveled West many a time before, tonight I had my first "In-N-Out Burger." I had the double double with fries and a root beer and couldn't have been more surprised...best fastfood burger I've ever had. Now, that's really not saying much considering the company InNOut has in their genre but it was a quality sandwich down to the fresh tomato. If you ever find your tummy grubbling while insight of an InNOut, stop in, they've got the fastfood thing down pat!
author: A D.

description: The burgers are so good that I get random cravings for it. I usually order the hamburger with grilled onions with extra crispy fries (I still like McDonald's fries though) and strawberry shake (so good).
author: Goldie L.

description: For the east coasters: this place blows away Five Guys.  Animal style = awesome.  Opened until 1:30 the night we went, which was perfect for my late night hunger.  Downside was that it was full of drunk partyers.  Also, prep staff didn't use gloves.  Definitely not used to this.  Skip the fries, they suck.  And I found a hair in mine.  Stick to the burgers and you'll be happy.  Cheap, tasty and friendly staff.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
so damn good i hate that i live in ny 
i'm planning my next vacation right now....
author: Sarah B.

description: You can't mess up In N Out Burger, but the lady messed up my order, but I didn't want to complain cause the line was super long. I ordered a hamburger, not a cheeseburger.   Plus, it's like 1 dollar more here than the one in Daly City.
author: James C.

description: I'm from the east coast and grew up on McDonalds and Burger King.  I had heard good things about this place and the crispy bun, so I thought I would try it out.  I ordered take-out since the place was packed.  It was a nice day so I sat outside at one of the 6-8 tables next to the building.  The crispy bun did not disappoint and the burger/toppings were tasty.  The fries were good, too.  The service was friendly and helpful. Everything was good!
author: Pamela P.

description:
Many a night did I wonder what is all this ranting for Animal Style.  It wasnt until my poopie love pie Jesse ordered it.  It was awesome.  Your freakin burger oozing with cheesy-onion joy.  French fries engulfed in a flame of the same magical goodness.  Enough said.  In N Out Burger + Animal Style Double Double = One Step Closer to Heaven.  

I'll put aside my girly ettiquette anyday for this item of deliciousness.  MmmMMmmmMMmmMmmMm oozing cheese on top of beef patty of the damned... the damned good tasting!
author: Diana T.

description: As good as it gets for fast food. I demand to have this chain replace at least half the McDonald's here in Boston.  The animal style burger with the russian dressing and grilled onions were awesome.  I want more and am sad I won't be able to get anymore until i return to cali.  The pepperocinis you can request are also a great addition to the meal.
author: Jackie C.

description:
as a person who eats too many burgers in new york, I finally came to sf to try the all famed in and out burger where yelpers say its better than shake shack. 

I got a cheese burger (with onion and asked for my buns toasted (thanks cuz!))and fries and was ready to eat the burger thats apparently better than any burger in new york. 

I ate it and felt no difference. and then I wondered if I got the wrong burger. But there were only 3 options on the menu (double, cheeseburger and burger). 

I'm sorry. but personally, the only thing I find special about this place is the price. (3.50 for a cheeseburger). =/ but I feel like its no different from 5 guys burger.
author: Candice A.

description: In and Out Burgers is an excellent place to grab a quick bite to eat while at  Fisherman's Wharf. There milkshakes are under two dollars. and quite tasty. They also stay open late.
author: Kenny T.

description: Vegetarians: try a "fry burger"-- get a veggie burger (no meat, cheese or no cheese) and get it "animal style" (grilled onions & extra veggies & sauce) and see if you can get french fries IN the burger.  otherwise, put them in yourself :)  less than $4 out the door and filling!
author: George K.

description: So I had In-N-Out on my way to San Fran last time.  I was afraid that being in a giant truck for four days made it one of the best burgers I had ever had.  So when within a stone's throw of an In-N-Out with two Lebowski fans who has never experienced them well I didn't really have a choice.  After a few Donnie jokes we settled in with our perfect burgers.  Yum!
author: Megan P.

description: Less than 5 stars?  I dare you to live somewhere where there isnt an in-n-out burger.  No, I wish that on you.
author: Michael H.

description: Oh yeah it's good. The fries. The burgers. The shakes. Wow.
author: Angry A.

description: Thick and juicy burgers, obviously made with prime beef. Fries that don't taste like they were cooked in three-day-old oil and then coated with a pound of salt. And could that actually be real ice cream in the shakes? As for the 'extremely irritating tourists,' they're the backbone of the city's economy and, if you're receptive, you might meet some very interesting people among them. Ironically, those who sneer at tourists forget that whenever they're away from home, they fall into that category themselves. Who's irritating now???
author: Gourmet G.

description: Consistent.  Reliable.  It's as good whether you go to one of it's old locations in SoCal or elsewhere like this one.  Give me a double double with animal style fries and a neapolitan, and I'll be a happy camper.
author: Yahoo S.

description: Checked this place out based on the Yelp reviews and it did not disappoint! The burgers are made fresh and the fries are cut and fried while you are waiting for your order.  The prices are really reasonable and are a better value compared to the prepackaged versions they have at McDonalds.  I can understand why there's always a line.
author: Derek M.

description: I had a friend from the East Coast come to visit, and someone in her family had told her that In-N-Out would basically become her new BFF while in San Francisco.  We made the trek up to the Wharf and she ordered a double double animal style while I got animal style fries.  She basically ravaged the burger.  Like, it was GONE in about 2 minutes.  Before she went home, she made me take her there 3 times in 3 days.  I even broke down and had an animal style burger on our last visit (and I hardly ever touch red meat) but that thing was GOOD.  In-N-Out, I dunno what magical stuff you use to make that burger, but it just might become my addiction.  I feel bad for my East Coast friend, though, who is going to have withdrawal spells worse than a crack addict :(
author: Christy L.

description:
In-N-Out is the bomb! I love getting a burger, fries and a big coke. You can tell the fries are fresh cut and not frozen. 

Just don't go to this location on Saturday or Sunday (although this is the only one in the city, I think), unless you don't mind the mobs of tourist. We waited about 10 to 15 minutes for our food to come. There were no tables available so we ate outside at the tables around the corner. That was fine, but oh so cold!
author: Mel C.

description:
I just don't get it.

My west coast friends, along with a number of my east coast friends that have visited In-N-Out, absolutely love and rave about this place. It is on the top of most of their "best burger" lists. As such, I was super excited to finally try this place out and experience the burger that many claim is the benchmark to pit all other burgers against.

And so I tried it. The fries, well-done, were actually really good, but the burgers were disappointing -- I tried both regular and animal style. And sorry to say, but the sauce pretty much just tastes like thousand island dressing that you can buy in any grocery store. I figured that maybe I wasn't ordering correctly. So the next time I went to an In-N-Out, I ordered even more different variations. Still no dice.

I just don't get it.

In-N-Out simply did not change my universe and did not move to the top spot in my "best burgers" list, or anywhere near it.
author: Elaine M.

description: I will wear a suit made of "fries well", with grilled cheese sandals, and an "animal style" hat. I will be the best damn tasting mascot that ever lived!
author: Katelin H.

description: This is probably one of the few In-N-Out that doesn't look identical than all the other ones.  The food as always is awesome.  Their crispy lettuce with non greasy fried, with the tasty burgers makes sure they don't need to a large menu.  And remember to add the grilled onions.  Makes it taste so much better.  The only down-side about this one is that the parking around this area is hard to found.  Being in the middle of a tourist trap and all.
author: Jim H.

description:
Burgers were pretty good.
Fries were lame.  McDonalds are much better.  I know it is not for lack of trying because I saw them cutting them through the window.  The shakes were good though.  There were next to no seats in the very busy restaurant.
author: chris c.

description: What's there not to like about any In-N-Out Burger??? I like mine protein (wrapped in lettuce)/animal style... crispy fries and load em up with salt....
author: Rachel L.

description:
I love In-N-Out, but I'd rather go to the Daly City one to avoid this area altogether.  

One word:  

Tourists.
author: Emma H.

description:
i don't care where in-n-out is, it's always amazing. 

being from the east coast, it's the one thing that i crave when i'm back in new york. probably one of my greatest discoveries on the west coast. hate to say it but i tend to pity everyone from back home who's never experienced it. 

i don't go to fishermans wharf all that often cause it's pretty touristy but man, for in-n-out animal style, i'd pretty much do anything. (i also don't go too often cause i don't want to spoil myself.) it's the only fast food i'll eat. so cheap too.
author: Georgia W.

description: Being from Houston, we had to try this place because I doubt I would drive to Dallas to try it.  The burger was delicious, but very salty in my opinion.  But I'm no burger connoisseur so perhaps I'm not the best judge.  Personally, the reason why I'm only giving it four stars is because the fries aren't my particular favorite.  They were dry and weird and unlike any fries I've ever had.  My husband says it tastes healthier.  I don't know how they made them but they were interesting.
author: Cindy W.

description: I can ignore the Christian verses on the burger wrappers and drinks cups.  The grub here is just too daymn good when you're craving something juicy and greasy.  Be adventurous and get a 3x3.  Or get a meatless griled cheese monster-style.
author: Joyhan S.

description: Made a point of having lunch here one day on a recent visit, because I remember my daughter and I LOVING In-n-Out on a Cali trip a few years ago.  "Meh" sums it up.  Burger OK, and they do a decent job of "protein style" (lettuce wrap, no bun). Grilled onions always nice but overall this burger was nothing special.  Fries were worse. If I had not seen a cook with an actual peeled potato, I would not believe the fries were real. Bland, and with a styrofoamy texture, like maybe they somehow pumped the potato full of air before slicing. If I want a fast burger next time I will look for Five Guys, or even Carl's Jr rather than going to In-n-Out.
author: Patrice G.

description: I miss my local In-N-Out.  I used to frequent this joint after a day of drunken debauchery or after my bartening shift at a nearby bar.  Nothing compares to In-N-Out, well nothing in Denver.
author: Shiho F.

description: Expected more of a Johnny Rocket's taste. Slightly disappointed. Would definitely go back again. I just would go the Johnny Rockets down the street instead. Kinda like a West Coast 5Guys. Just not as good.
author: Jacob C.

description: Best damn fast food burger joint ever. I miss it soo bad. Puts Mickey D's to SHAME.
author: Chuck F.

description:
Why do I still get excited EVERY time I'm driving out of town and pass an In-N-Out?!?  They're still such a treat for me...even though we have one right in SF.  This particular location added to probably 5 of the 7 lbs I gained late night after pastry school this last year but I'm still in love.
All hail to the fresh cut french fries, animal style double double with cheese and a chocolate shake!
author: Amy C.

description: The only reason to go to Fisherman's Wharf, besides Aquatic Park.  Great service, great food.  Parking can be a pain.
author: Greg R.

description: KEEP THE HOMELESS PEOPLE OUT!!  lots of lettuce on the burger.  if i wanted a salad, i would have gotten one.
author: Hammer Time H.

description: I think this is the only place worth grabbing a cheap meal on the wharf. Out-of-town guests can have their first taste of In-N-Out after a long day of being tourists. As for me, one order of animal-style fries, please!
author: Nathalie L.

description:
True story: the last time I saw an In-n-Out, I almost died, like literally. There we were, hurtling down the freeway at 90 miles per hour, sweltering even with the airconditioning on, about two miles from Las Vegas. We were on our way home to the bay, after two years in Chicago, toting along our dearest worldly possesions (including a cooler of pickles, but that's another story).
That's when it happened: I saw the bright red sign and yellow arrow, and swerved so fast to reach the exit that I nearly killed myself, the husband, and the hapless soul in the car next to me. But aside from some burning rubber, we all lived to tell the tale. 
If I seem a tad overexcited here, please try to understand. I had been deprived of the joy of In-n-Out for two whole years. Go put that in your pipe, smoke it for an hour and think how you'd feel.
So, what does a person like me, a true blue vegetarian, go sniffing around this burger heaven, you might wonder. Well, funny you should ask. I just stand in line with all the other sunny people in striped shirts (or sit in my car, stew at the wait, and bark my order into the little red box when I'm feeling less social) and when it's my turn, order what happens to be the best grilled cheese sandwich, EVER. Animal style too, ironically enough. With some fries, if such is my pleasure. But mostly just with a neapolitan shake. (There may be greater joys than shifting your straw around to slurp down alternating sips of vanilla, strawberry and chocolate, but I don't know many.)
And if the mix of grilled bun, gooey cheese, sauteed onions and crunchy pickle doesn't do it for ya, go ahead and order the meat. I promise not to tell.
author: Purnima M.

description: oh my god! Best fast food burger ever, and for cheap!
author: Shelly S.

description: Best fast food burger hands down. I come here almost every Saturday. My order is a cheeseburger w/ onions, animal style fries, and a chocolate shake or a lemonade depending on my mood and it's probably the best tradition I have developed since moving to SF.
author: David K.

description: Very affordable and fun to be here! I love the neopolitan shake - you can actually taste the different flavors. I wish the burger itself tasted better... think I'll try it without meat next time (pink the middle too, weird!) The fries are really good crispy -- next time I'd get them crispy and animal style. Ohhh... yummmm!
author: lizzie b.

description: I don't know how they do it!  Animal style is a must and also get crazy by doing animal style on your fires too.  Simply divine.
author: Nick M.

description: Being a tourist, from Texas, I wanted to try the In-N-Out.  It was great and reasonably priced (ok, so it was cheaper than McD's and better tasting).  The fries were all right, not what I expected since they were a combination of greaseless, stale, fresh fried potatoes.  Yea, I don't think I would get the fries again.
author: Anmry N.

description:
ok i admit the burgers are pretty good but what the shit with people acting like it is the biggest deal in the hole world? carls j is better and easier to find

and it pisses me off when my bf orders stuff animals or bananas or whatever that code word is. if it aint on the menu where i can order it to he can go to hell. they sure got pretty white uniforms tho
author: Farajaqua S.

description: This place is small and gets SERIOUSLY packed on evenings and weekends. Otherwise,... I love In-&-Out, and the burgers here are always good. Try it  "Animal Style" (it's not on the posted menu), with grilled onions!
author: J K.

description: Just because they advertise themselves as fresh and blah blah blah doesn't mean it's anything special. This is the case with In-N-Out. I was not impressed. The burger was a typical burger and the fries were fries. The end.
author: Annie T.

description: Come on, it's In-N-Out! Man, how I miss thee. On the east coast you often hear Five Guys compared to In-N-Out. Five Guys is good, it really is. They have great fries. But honestly, nothing just compares to the simple deliciousness of a Double Double. Mmmmm. I know it is too much to ask for In-N-Out to make it back east, but can they at least head a bit north and bless Portland with its beefy goodness? Burgerville is good, but I want In-N-Out when I go home!
author: Jake W.

description: Favorite fast food burger, hands down - and I am one true lover of burgers. I do wish there were more than one location in San Francisco so I didn't have to battle the tourons in Fisherman's warf and I do wish their fries were better. But I can't deny their deliciously toasted bun with oozing sauce on my burger!
author: Lindsay A.

description: Arrgh! It's so frustrating that mobs of tourists literally stand between me and my double double.  The lines can be long and the uninitiated people who stare at the unbelievably simple menu and STILL can't make up their minds is maddening!
author: Alice R.

description: Animal style fries.  Try them, and you'll never know what hit you.
author: Sloane R.

description: One of the best deals in town!  For @$5-$6 you can get a full meal.  The burgers rate a 9.5/10 on my personal burger scale although they can tend to be on the messy side.  The fries are fresh cut and you can tell they seem to change the frying oil frequently.  Eating there can mess up your triathlon training diet fast but it's so worth it!! Be prepared for waiting up to 10 minutes for your order which seems to be typical.
author: patrick w j.

description:
Every tme I go to In-N-Out I get a grilled cheese, well-done fries, and a small soda. In-N-Out consistantly has the best-tasting and healthiest french fries of any burger chain in California, never sugared and always prepared fresh in canola oil.

If you don't know about the Secret Menu you're missing out. Some of the stuff on it is pretty weird, but some of it is great. My only complaint is that every In-N-Out I've ever been to is always crowded as hell, and this specific location is right next to a Hooter's.

A Hooter's? In San Francisco? Seriously?
I thought they reserved sexist bullshit like this for Texas and Alabama. 

======SECRET MENU ITEMS======
X by Y = X meat patties and Y slices of cheese (for example, a 3 by 3 or a 2 by 4)
Triple Meat = Three meat patties without cheese.
Animal Style = A mustard cooked beef patty served on a bun with pickles, lettuce, tomatoes, extra spread and grilled onions.
Animal Style Fries = Fries with cheese, spread, and grilled onions.
Double Meat = Two meat patties without cheese.
Extra Everything = Adds extra spread, tomato, lettuce, and onions (regular or grilled).
Flying Dutchman = Two meat patties, two slices of melted cheese and nothing else.
Well-Done Fries = Fries that are cooked longer to be extra crisp.
Fries with cheese= Fries with two slices of melted cheese placed on top.
Grilled Cheese = Two slices of melted cheese, tomato, lettuce and spread on a bun, with no meat. There is also a Grilled Cheese Animal Style (grilled onions are added).
Neopolitan Shake = All three shake flavors (strawberry, vanilla and chocolate) combined in one shake.
Protein Style = Instead of a bun, the burger is wrapped in lettuce.
Veggie Burger = A burger without the meat and cheese.
author: James C.

description: I don't understand the cult following this place has... I find it to be ok for fast food, which I don't eat often, but seriously... what is it? IS there some drug in the patty that I am just immune to? Is there some code I don't know so I am not getting the full experience? I know some of the secret codes, but none of them call to me... I just don't get it.  But I do find the bible references in the bottom of their drink cups!  Interesting!
author: Amelia M.

description: Of course In-N-Out is amazing, that is no secret. Usually the con's are busy crowds or location. I've been here since August and this location is great! It is less busy than most IN-N-OUT's in other cities. For example, I always find a seat! That is unheard of in San Diego. So for now, 5 stars! We will see how it gets in busy summer tourist months! It's nice living in SF and still having access to this great burger joint!
author: Joseph D.

description: There is very little from my time in SoCal that I miss...except In-N-Out. How fortunate for me that they opened a shop in SF, even if it is on the wharf. This one is pretty good, although they don't get the concept of well-done fries (crispy makes them PERFECT tasting), so I've deducted a star. Anyway, my preferred order is a cheeseburger or double double animal style (grilled onions, pickles) with ketchup and mustard instead (of the spread...basic 1,000 island)...sooooo goooood. Vanilla milkshakes so sweet and yummy...and it's one of the cheapest meals in SF. This is a favorite stop after running 6+ miles or I feel the need to go tourist watching...either sport builds up an appetite.
author: Julia C.

description: I don't understand the In-N-Out Burger fan club.  It's a good idea, but the execution is lame.  I've tried it several times now, but whatever.  Dick's in Seattle (on Broadway or in the U District, not so much the one near Seattle Center) nails the concept perfectly:  hand cut "real" fries, root beer floats, a very decent burger, but In-N-Out?  Tidak bagus (no good) (as they say in Bahasa Indonesian).   If I want a burger, I can do it better myself, even in my toaster oven, or go somewhere real like the Slow Club.
author: Laurel B.

description:
whats with the In n Out nut riders out there? its not THAT good. go home and make a burger. its cheaper in the long run and tastes far better.
yes its better than BK or McDees but its still uninspiring. and that animal style ish? gross. they just slop on their sauce and onions all over your fries...what a mess.
and i really do not like how every in n out is designed the exact. same. way. like, to the TEE. it makes me have flashbacks to 50 other locations and i dont know where i am anymore. over dramatic? i dont much care.
this place is allright.
i will say this place is AMAZING when drunk.
but so is dennys. or McDs. or well. anything! 
*applause sign*
author: Spencer P.

description: restauranters in fisherman's wharf must hate in & out. tourists can save monies by eating here instead of the high price fish places.
author: Victor G.

description: The address on this is incorrect since it's actually ON Embarcadero but yeah good food I'd say :D The burgers were HUGE in my double double, I was shocked. More expensive here than any other one I've been to but because of touristas this is why. Still delicious though. It's always crowded so good luck finding a table.
author: Nancy R.

description:
ill take a Double double ANIMAL STYLE!
cheap,bomb,fast....


love it here

even though you gotta fight somebody for a place to sit,its still the business
author: David c.

description:
This place brings to memory an old expression that was once coined by Yogi Berra : "The place is so bad that EVERYBODY goes there!".

I had a client up in the wharf until about a year ago, and I migrated over to In-And-Out every chance I got.  It's without question the best deal going for lunch on the wharf. Hordes of  out-of-towners seem to key in on this, as the medium sized facility is usually deluged with a mob of customers the moment the clock strikes noon.

Every time the lunch bell rang, I'd get the "In and Out urge".  But too many times I'd walk over there, view the teeming mass of humanity crammed into the place, and just decided not to deal with the hassle.  It goes something like this: First off, you order and you're given a number.  They announce what number they're serving over PA system and the number is usually 20 to 30 below the number you've just been given. Worse yet, they usually call the numbers out of sequence.  As a general rule, check with staff to see if you've been lost in the shuffle if the current number-being-served goes 10 over the one on your receipt.  The wait can be awhile, but it gives you time to compete in the guerrilla-warfare-like shell game of staking out a seat.  Pace the floor, stalk out someone about to finish, and grab their seat the second they vacate, as open tables at this location have a half-life shorter than that of snowflakes on a red-hot skillet.  Reserve your  table with a backpack or a jacket when your number comes up, and Lo, dread the process of serve-yourself soft drinks.  Getting to the taps can be like fighting your way to the front of the stage at a stadium concert...on the other hand, never order a soft drink size other than small....I've snarfed refills every time I've been there, and nobody has given me a single iota of flak.

To avoid the crowds, check the place out before 11:30 am, or during the dank winter months where the Wharf is slow. If you're in the hood, stop by, size up the crowd, and decide if it's worth the hassle.  If it looks crazy, try the burger at Fiddlers Green on the other side of Columbus St.  A couple bucks more gets you a half pound burger, the option of a beer with your chow, and a complete lack of hassle finding a seat.  My 2 cents....
author: Mike W.

description:
sucks that it's in such an inconvenient location...
they should open one in the new westfield mall!!! :D
mmmmmmmmmm in n out burger...
i like the number two with grilled onions and fries animal style please! :D
yummmmm
author: charlotte s.

description: Typical In-N-Out. LOL LOL LOL I love staring at the workers making their orders on the window which is located outside on the left.  The workers are probably wondering why the hell am I staring at them but I just like too see people making food, kind of strange but that is me. I love their lemonade, I hope it is made from fresh squeezed lemonades at least that is what I keep on telling myself because I do not and can not or will not choose to believe that it is made out of a mix.  But sometimes I see the pulp of the lemons which is nice too see. It is hard to find seating and it takes forever for the orders to arrive!!
author: Janet Z.

description: gold standard for price and flavor. Seriously nothing changes in any in n out except the t shirts. Food is consistent and always feel satisfied with a double double animal style and well done fries. Shakes are worthy as well.
author: Ryan k.

description: Awsome staff great place to work at and we owe it all to you guys, our faithful customers! I'm so pleased to be reading all these great reviews at our location. I know some have had bad expieriences but please next time your in an In-N-Out don't be afraid to let us know if there's problem if we haven't asked you beforehand. We love to help everyone the best we can and to make our store even better we would like you, the customer to feel as though your will be taken care of 110% of the time. We will go the "extra mile" for you guys and we are very happy to everytime. Thank you once again for your guy's support. This is a great In-N-Out and at a great location!
author: Evan T.

description: I love In-and-Out so much, that when I moved to LA, when I was 17, I became an honorary employee, my last month, before moving away.
author: Cindy H.

description: I think maybe my taste buds are broken. They must be. Everyone I know loves In-N-Out. Don't get me wrong, they make a decent burger, but I don't consider it the be all and end all of burgers. Add to that the subversive christian propaganda they put on their wrappers (no seriously)... well actually I kind of like things that are subversive. The fries are good if they are hot... I mean really hot, but they are made so thin that they rarely stay hot very long. The place is always jam packed and you see people ordering 6 or 8 burgers at a time (where the heck do they put them?). I'll go here once in a while on my way to get a sundae at Ghirardelli.
author: Jordan M.

description: Ditto, double-double animal style. Need I say more? So the tourists and the wait can be annoying, but go eat outside and enjoy the scenery.
author: Julianne M.

description: Why do I need to review this?  You know how In N Out does it already.  Unless you're from some other planet.  And the best thing is, every single one that you go to is the same as the rest.  Nothing's different, except for the crop of customers.  Yeah, I've dealt with my fair share of WTs and overweight degenerates who wanted a 4x4 instead of a triple-triple and made them throw it away (I WOULDUV EATEN IT!). But life is life.  Tip is to only go to the drive-thru.  They are mandated to serve the drive-thru window first.
author: Zo L.

description: I will burn in hell for this one. But what is the big deal about this place. All I heard when I landed is that I had to go to get a double double animal style. R U kidding me with this. There are only 4 things on the menu. I would expect that they are all exeptional. The burger was average at best. What time is the taste suppose to get here? The fries killed me. They looked like something that came out of your kids fuzzy pumper barber shop. They didn't taste like anything. They weren't crunchy or soggy. Just there. Drowning them in Ketcup didn't even help. NO DEAL!
author: Steven M.

description: This place is always busy!!!! but what can you expect its down in fisherman's and with the price of food down there everyone is going to be looking for a good cheap meal. Now the place is a hard one to find tables so if you are in a group split up while one orders and the other hunts a table down!!! FYI if you park in the lot of the same stuchtor you are able to get your ticket validated and save a few bucks!!!
author: Martin G.

description: I wish there was one closer.  The lines are crazy over at the Wharf!
author: Matthew R.

description: When I think of In N Out, I think of a drive through.  Unfortunately this one doesn't provide that.  And when I had the burgers at this particular location, they seem a little salty.  Too salty?  Weird.  Other than those two idiosyncrasies, this is the standard you come to expect from In-N-Out- good greasy food, quick service.  The lack of a drive through and the fact that this is a tourist hot spot means that I will probably never be back unless I am in the area for something else, like showing taking out of towners to Fisherman's Wharf.
author: Denise B.

description: See my review of In N Out Daly City...  I love my In N Out....  And this place opens late so if you need a late night dinner/late night snack/late night bite....  Whatever you want to call it, take a drive out here....
author: Mark W.

description: 5 stars for a fast-food burger, no questions asked.  I've been eating In-N-Out for the past 7 years.  Of those 7 years, I have easily eaten over 500 Double-Doubles.  That's a lot of burgers from the same place the same way.  What was my secret to still savoring and loving every bite, "Changing It Up!"  I used to be a "2 Double-Doubles Animal Style" guy, but, I realized that what makes In-N-Out so good is, in order, the Meat, the Cheese, the Bun and the Raw Onions.  So, now, I order 1 burger Animal Style and 1 with just Meat, Cheese, Bun and Raw Onion.  The "plain" cheeseburger is so good and in it's most simplest and tastiest form.  It is almost dessert-like / palate cleansing after eating a flavor packed Double-Double Animal Style.  It is a perfect ending to an always consistent meal.  Also, ALWAYS order your fries "Well-Done."  Trust me.
author: Terry L.

description: I know.  It's unhealthy but sometimes you're just craving the bad stuff: "I'll have a 3 by 3 with grilled onions animal style, 2 fries, and a large chocolate shake please." Oink, oink...yes I can certainly pigout! Parking can be a pain so I walk a couple of miles to get there -it helps with burning the extra calories and with gas prices going up we should all be doing more walking. Besides, it's fun roaming through the city on a nice day.
author: Sabi M.

description: So fresh! And the burgers look like they're supposed to(all picture perfect like in burger ads) The buns are fresh, the meat is fresh(when they say it's never frozen - it shows) the veggies are crisp, and the fries are...they're pretty good, lol. Ask for the animal style fries if you can(one of the hidden menu items.) I wish they had more than one location in town.
author: Susan K.

description:
its just the best burgers in the city and you cant say otherwise. this place is always packed so they must be doing something right.just got get a burger and walk to the beach and eat there.then when you're done go walk to ghirardelli and get free chocolate.

trust

p.s. a buddy of mine tried another burger place and died.
author: Mike L.

description: An In-n-out burger so close to my home that it's worth braving the throngs of tourists for the oh-so delicous-o double-double "animal style".  Sometimes I have the balls to get the fries animal style too, but hey, that's how I roll sometimes.
author: George K.

description: The best fast food burger joint in the world!!!!! Hands down!!! I have loved this place since I was a girl in So Cal and it is so wonderful there are In n Outs up in the Bay area. Every friend who I have introduced to In n Out from the East coast has fallen as much in love with the place as I have too! I don't know what it is but the cheeseburger animal style is the best tasting burger ever! I LOVE THIS PLACE!
author: Jenny C.

description: The midwest prides itself on its meat-eating traditions. But ther fast food outposts could learn a thing or two from In N Out. (Steak and Shake, I'm looking in your direction.)  Between San Fran and Reno, we probably stopped at In N Out three times (different locations) and each time was reliably good. Fresh, really tasty. Off the secret menu (which I hear is available on their web site) I had both the Animal Style and Protein Style burgers (Protein is served wrapped in lettuce as opposed to a bun, because who needs all those carb calories when you can add another beef patty onto the pile?)  The fries are obviously made from real potatoes, but not fried in peanut oil or whatever it is that gives McDonalds fried their sort of nutty/addictive flavor. This burger was real and seemed more healthy (relatively speaking) than your typical fast food fare.
author: Robyn S.

description: They have burgers, fries, or cheeseburgers here. The fries were not greasy at all but it's just overpriced fast food that we had to wait 20 minutes for because it was packed with tourists due to it's tourist trap location at Fisherman's Wharf.
author: Justin R.

description: This is not the best burger I have ever had. This is a good fast food burger. It is a little on the salty side. This is my order regarding fast food burgers, In n out, Wendy's, McDonalds, Burger king. This my order regarding Fast food fries mcdonalds, Wendy's, In n out, Burger king. Tried a chocolate shake. It was okay. The service was excellent. I made a mistake and did not order my kid burgers plain so they came with the special sauce which is basically big Mac special sauce. I believe the lady at the counter was named jeanette and she could not have been more accomodating. She got new burgers quickly, even though it was my error, during a very busy time. This place is very busy but, extremely efficient. Difficult to get seating inside but outside there was plenty. Bathroom is accessed by the outside seating area and you need to get access code from staff. It sounds like it would be difficult but, it was really no big deal.
author: Ellie S.

description: Best damn one dollar ten cents you could ever spend:  An In-N-Out hamburger.  Anything that will lure me down to the depths of hell, I mean, Fisherman's Wharf (seriously, Paris Hilton in wax?  Surely, a spawn of Satan), deserves five stars.  Wish there were one on every corner.
author: Kate M.

description: Even as a vegetarian, I love this place. Grilled cheese animal style is the way to go. Yes, In-N-Out IS located in the most touristy area of the city, but that's okay if you like to people watch and make the occasional snarky comment to your dining partner. I recommend going with someone else -- one of you to claim a table and one of you to order.
author: Rebecca H.

description: Once you discover the secret menu, In-N-Out becomes a magical vegetarian wonderland.  I love a place where I can order fries "animal style" and call it a meal.  It's not healthy, but it's cheap and tasty, so why the hell not?
author: Squirrel L.

description: talk about tourist. i would never come here unless i'm with a friend who is visiting the city. No place to park and definitely jammed packed. If there's no reason for you to visit fisherman wharf then don't come here.
author: Eric Y.

description: Double Double, with one slice of cheese, animal style, but w/raw onions, add ketchup.  Add fries and a drink . . . . . heaven.
author: Simon N.

description: Rather than opting for the birthday cake BS, we decided to throw an IN-N-OUT birthday party for a co-worker.  Yeah, it could have turned out painful -- it would have been easy to mess up an order for a party of 20, but instead, IN-N-OUT came through like a champ.  They separated each order in its own bag and they did it with a smile.  Since I'm a total cynic, I thought, this is too good to be true...but to everyone's surprise, ALL of the orders, came out exactly the way everyone wanted: some fries well done, some plain burgers, some burgers animal style, some burgers with onions, some without...THANKS, IN-N-OUT FISHERMAN'S WHARF!
author: Pilar P.

description: I've been visiting the Bay Area once a year since 2003 and this was the first time I went to In-N-Out.  Haha.  I finally tried it -- got a Double Double.  My Bay Area friends were mad when I told them that I thought it tasted kind of like a Big Mac.  The fries are also kind of rubbery.  Overall, fast food is fast food.
author: Diana N.

description:
I stopped eating red meat 2 years ago...BUUTTTT....I cheated twice at this location.  In-N-Out has the BEST burgers EVER!!!  The way everything tastes so fresh and the way they make them soooooo sloppy.  Good Lord!  I think I am getting wood right now!

I may have to cheat on my vegetarian bretheren again soon.
author: James B.

description:
So this East Coaster finally got to try the famous In-N-Out.  And I must admit, it was pretty good.  Of course I armed myself with a print out of the secret menu and was figuring out what I wanted on the plane to SF, ha.  Neapolitan shake was deeelicious!  Fries well done tasted almost like potato chips.  I dislike thousand island-style dressings so I wasn't having anything animal style, though I could deal with a little on the burger.  Speaking of which, I asked for it without tomato and lettuce and when the girl repeated the order back to me she included no onions and I said nah onions are fine, and she lit up and said, "Oooh well, I'll get plenty of onions for you!" (not in a sarcastic way, she said it in a friendly/what I thought was joking way) but, well, she wasn't joking and I think she just thought I really liked onions!  There were chopped cooked onions, there were raw onions, there onions on top of the burger, onions under the burger.  I probably offended everyone I opened my mouth to for the rest of the day after eating that.  But wow, I've never seen such happy/perky employees in any fast food place in my life - every single one of them to every single customer! 

Only downside, which I can't completely fault given their location, was the really long wait to get the food.  Also wish they were bigger inside so there could be more seats.
author: Elizabeth G.

description: We went to the In N Out on Fisherman's Wharf. My first In-N-Out burger. I'm from Seattle, where we have Dick's to compare to. They both have a very limited selection.  I truly don't understand the hype about In-N-Out. Compared to Dick's it was..meh. OK so it had some lettuce and a tomato, which Dick's doesn't have, but it could have been any burger from anywhere. I can tell a Dick's burger blindfolded. The fries? Dry and tasteless. Dick's fries? greasy, salty goodness with the skin still on. Shakes? from a soft serve machine, just like any other fast food hellhole. Dick's shakes are had dipped from real ice cream. No comparison at all.
author: Eric M.

description: I'm a big fan of In-N-Out Burger. I order the number 2, which is cheese burger with grilled onions, order of fries and a drink, and I"m good to go. The few In-N-Out burgers I've been too, are all good. All the restaurants have consistency, not one restaurant is different from the other. They taste the same and the food is good no matter which one you go to. It has to be good, becasuse no matter where you go, the drive-thru line is always ten to twenty cars deep long. Now that's a good burger for ya.
author: Baseemah R.

description: Burgers = delicious. One con is that the VEGGIE BURGER (with all the veggies and no cheese) takes a WHOLE lot longer to make than a cheeseburger. =(
author: Katherine C.

description: It's In-N-Out for fucks sakes, you can't go wrong. Tourists pack this place during appropriate meal times so hit it up for an in-between meal, no line. What else..... There is a bad ass magic show out front usually, the magician looks like Moneybags from Monopoly.
author: Carson L.

description:
now, i'm not a vegetarian, what with me being a plumber and all. but this is san francisco, and my l33t friends are vegetarian.

so, we pushed through the crowded touristy warf streets, passing the countless t-shirt shops, the occasional "museum" and the tacky seafood restaurants.

"gimme the double cheeseburger, biatch!" i yelled. i pay and wait in line next to aforementioned veggy friend.

"can i have a vegetarian burger, please?" he asked.

"sorry, we don't sell those." replied the snot-nosed 20-something behind the cash register.

sounds of people waiting in line for their number to be called reminded me of a dmv line during lunch time. who knows why..

"39!", "42!" yelled some other snot-nosed kid behind the counter.

from the corner of my eye, i see the busy bodies peeling and pressing potatoes through the french-fry "machine". in goes a whole peeled potato, out comes strings of potato into a tub to be deep-fried. since i'm here, i might as well say that their fries aren't "all that". in fact, they're less than impressive. you want real fries? go to a real diner. or go the other direction for some real fast-food fries from wendys, mc d's, and the usual suspects.

back to regularly scheduled programming...

we wait a few seconds while the gears turn inside the cash register person's brain tick-tocks away. "we can take the meat out of a hamburger." 

(to self: wtf?)

"fine" said friend. btw, i assumed that they wouldnt' even put the meat patty in there to begin with. 

he pays.

we wait.

"65!" i get my heart attack on a bun.

"78!" he gets his "vegetarian burger". 

we open up his burger to find the two buns with their special "spread" surrounding a sliced onion, sliced tomato, and some lettuce. hey, we knew what we were getting into, but that was just too strange for words.

why only two stars? i like the simplicity of their menu. it is also their downfall. the only time i've ever really liked in-n-out is when i'm on the road and between this stop and the next one 150 miles away is nothing but road, dirt, and nothingness.

it's a decent burger at best with less-than-stellar fries. as for the milkshake... who eats those, anyway? i'll have vomit in a glass, please.

rating: one toilet seat cover and a toilet paper dispenser with the toilet paper removed. hah!
author: dave tastic fantasmo x.

description: Somehow not as tasty as the Auburn In N Out on the drive to Tahoe. And I think I actually go to Tahoe more than this part of town. But you know, I'm glad it's there.
author: Megan W.

description: I want their buger right now.  Love their juicy hamburgers animal style with buns that aren't smashed!  Absolutely delicious.  However, I am not a fan of their fries.  I just dowse them in salt and ketchup to get by.  Also, hate the lines at this place.
author: Vanessa Z.

description: "I don't really understand the hype. Burger is pretty goo, as are the shakes...but seriously?!"
author: Jocelyn L.

description:
Ever since I saw John Favreau sporting an "In 'N Out" t-shirt in the classic flick, "Swingers" it was love at first bite.

Seriously, this place serves absolutely delicious burgers, fresh and crispy fries and great malts. Sure, it's fast food, and this one is the beloved Fisherman's Wharf area (a place I go twice a year when friends/family are in town and I'm playing tour guide) but it's hard not to want to hop on a trolley and inbibe some of this amazing fare every now and then.

I'll take INO over any other filthy chain fast-food joint anyday. 

Name a place that serves food this good, and where the employees sport sexy white (nearly see though) uniforms and paper hats with oversized safety pins, and I'll eat my hat!
author: Alex G.

description: I am from San Diego (duh!) and I remember when I first found out about the "secret" menu everyone speaks of, but no one fully understands, BTW (http://www.in-n-out.com/secretmenu.asp). I could of reviewed any one of the In-N-Out burgers in San Diego, but I liked this one because it was a taste of MY home in another land. Recommendation: 2 Grilled Cheeses Animal Style, and a Vanilla Shake, taste like MAGIC and SEX. I simply thought that this was a weird addition to Fisherman's Wharf, that was the most delightful part of eating at this In-N-Out.
author: Esteban W.

description: I have a secret -ok, not so secret- love affair with In-N-Out. Their food is SO good for fast food. Seriously! I'm not kidding... Their fries are good, their burgers are super yummy, and their shakes are also super yummy. The atmosphere can be a bit hectic and crazy, but what do you expect at Fisherman's Wharf? It can't be helped. All in all, I love this place... And dammit, now I'm hungry!
author: Lindsey S.

description:
am i the only one who's amazed that a cup of joe now costs more than a delicious burger??? for a buck and change, i'm even willing to ignore the bible passage citations. shit, i might even sing "amazing grace" for in-n-out if that's what they want. that's right. i can be had for the right price. oh shit, i didn't mean to say "shit" earlier. isn't saying "shit" here as same as saying "shit" at a church service? so sorry.

yes, i would like mine with grilled onions. animal what? oh, you call it animal style? um, i really don't get the connection here...
author: frisco j.

description: I had a double-double, fries and a coke to go. The place was packed due to tourists, but the burger was well worth the wait. I believe the bun was toasted on the inside which really made a difference. My only complaint is the fries tasted like cardboard. I know they claim they are fresh, but they really tasted like crap...
author: Nicolas H.

description: If this place had a drive-thru, I'd still be sitting in line by the ferry building.
author: Michael A.

description: While in San Francisco I finally got to try in-n-out burger. It was ok, the patties actually tasted like meat unlike Mickey D's. I personally was expecting a better burger but its not bad. Of the California burgers I tried this comes in second behind Carl's Jr and ahead of Jack in the box. If I was in the area again I may go here if it was nearby but I wouldn't go out of my way.
author: Steve M.

description: I like it "animal-style"! In-n-Out is the only fast food I'll eat. A solid burger.
author: Pamela B.

description:
If the most delicious ground beef patty could be topped with chedda cheese and wrapped in fresh lettuce, it would be spelled with four letters. "mmmm".



oh wait, i mean "love".
author: Daniel C.

description:
top three orders from in n out:

double double doggy style - they shape the patty like a hot dog. use plenty of condiments.

fries animal style with a hamburger patty - they will tell you they can't do this, but they can. don't take no for an answer. if you are forced to take no for an answer, just order the fries animal style (fries with cheese, sauce, and onions) and a separate hamburger patty (it'll come in a nice little envelope) and throw it on top yourself. wait five minutes for the ingredients to gel together and you've got yourself a treat.

triple triple talleywacker surprise - three patties mushed up by hand into one big ball which is then deep fried and served on a bed of lettuce. 

i'm going tonight!!!!!!!!!!
author: Dibital N.

description: I dont think theres anything bad you can say about In n Out 154. Great burgers. Great Fries. Great nostalgic atmosphere. Oh, and this guy, Evan, that works there.... HOT! :)
author: John M.

description: I can ignore the biblical quote on the bottom of my cup, but where is your Kremey partner in crime?
author: Skip K.

description:
I wish in n out delivered to NY :/ 

i can literally eat here for lunch everyday x)
author: dragon r.

description: About the best fast food anywhere. The food is healthier than corporate fast food, they pay their employees more, and you need not be embarrassed when seen eating there. Only problem with this one is that you have to trek through Fisherman's Wharf to get there.
author: Galen M.

description: i like their hamburgers.
author: Ann L.

description: My favorite fast food burger! Now I want one.  I avoid Fisherman's wharf in general, but if I want to satisfy my burger craving, my roommies and I will venture here.  It's crowded and there are bums hanging out inside, but it doesn't matter since I just get take out.  Be ready to wait, even late in the evening, there's always a line.
author: Ben D.

description:
double double animal style - big props for this bad boy

not so big on the fries though
author: david s.

description: I'm gonna have to go against the grain on this one, and it's completely for personal reasons.  I do love the animal style fries, and a double double isn't bad.  But ever since I tried to do the Atkins diet and thought I could make due with the protein style burger, man, something just clicked and In-N-Out has never been the same for me.  Everbody's always raving about In-N-Out burger, it's so different, it's pure Cali, it's got Bible verses on the bottom, ok, ok, I hear ya.  But it ain't no Sour Dough Jack, and it definitely isn't a Fat Burger.  I'll take people here to try it out if they've never had one before, but otherwise, I'll take a pass.
author: Tony L.

description: It's good if you're short on moolah and you work in the area. Like me. Unfortunately, this In-N-Out location can be a bit dirty at times with panhandlers collecting scraps and freeloading off the soda fountain.
author: Leroid D.

description:
A trip to California is not complete without a trip to In-N-Out at least once. This place is great, by far the best fast food around. They keep the menu simple and focus only of hamburgers and fries and it shows. This place is a great value and should be visited. The fries are great and it's fun to watch them cut the potatoes right in the store. The never frozen patties are well seasoned and the spread they put on is great. This place puts Burger King and Wendys to shame. 

Bottom line, this place is great and I love it. I am from the East Coast and find myself going through withdrawals from it.
author: Mike V.

description: Among the best of the chain fast food burger places, but you're in San Francisco. Why would you want to go to a fast food burger place when there's infinitely better food in any given direction, and probably within a block or two?
author: Don H.

description: Excellent burgers and fries, but what's the deal with the hidden menu? If you can find the secret message on the fries wrapper, you WILL be awarded cool points.
author: Evelyn B.

description: As with any other In-n-out, this place is constantly packed.  However, they manage to plow through that customer line at a breakneck pace.  In the end you are treated to a simple but delicious burger.  The beauty of in-n-out is that it is nothing fancy.  They do one thing and they do it well.  If you are looking for the world's best hamburger, this might not  be your place, but if you want it fast and cheap, you are in the right place.
author: Robert R.

description: Ew, a chain restaurant - yeah, I've heard it all before!  In-N-Out still makes some of the best burgers around.  My boyfriend has not yet experienced the joy of their food, so I took him their yesterday.  He easily thought that his burger lives up to all the hype.  He was quite surprised to find them cutting potatoes right in the back to make fries, let alone being able to see all the cooking they do.  Freshness is key here and they really have it figured out.  If you plan on going here, do keep in mind that it is popular and you might have to wait 10-15 minutes for your order.
author: Victoria K.

description:
i dream of this place when i'm not here.

and i like to feel like a super spy when i order the secret orders of burgers and shakes.

mmm.  another reason to love the west coast.
author: Kimberly K.

description: They can NEVER do wrong! Grew up in SoCal so this is my fast food joint! Double double animal/protein style is the BEST! My ONLY complaint about this spot is that the ONE in SF is @ The Wharf, why??? PLEASE TELL ME WHY?!?!?!?
author: Rob L.

description: I've been waiting to try In-N-Out for a while, but by the time I got to the Wharf today I just wasn't that hungry so I only got some lemonade and fries. The fries were damn good, but the lemonade was terrible, I ended up dumping it out and refilling with water to rebuild my stomach lining. Good fuckin fries though.
author: Amuse B.

description: I've heard many good things about in-n-out so it was definitely one of the things I wanted to try on my trip to San Francisco and I was not disappointed. It's fast food but still it's very cheap! I haven't eaten a whole lot of fast food in recent years but this food was good. I don't know how they make money selling burgers this big for so little.
author: Kevin K.

description:
in n out.

in n ouuutt! that's what our hamburgers

alllll aboutttt!!!!!!!

:]
author: ingrid H.

description: One of the only fast food place that I can still trust.  No artificial anything like McD or Burger K.  For the healthy conscience, get the protein style and you'll save yourself about 150 calories!!!  3 stars because no drive through and there's no parking!
author: Jason A.

description: It sucks that the only In-N-Out in San Francisco is at the Wharf. And they jack up their prices here as well, I assume to compensate for the high-rent tourist area. It's still In-N-Out though, and it still fucking rules.
author: Brandon B.

description: Can't go wrong with the best fast-food burger in the country.  There's plenty of seating outside (sometimes they have a band playing), so there's no need to fight those burmuda-short, flip-flops-with-socks wearing tourists!
author: Mark D.

description: I know I just gave a fast food joint (haha) four stars, but this place is like no other.  Somehow I don't feel a food coma after I eat a delicious cheeseburger and fries from In-N-Out like I do after a meal from Mickey D's.  The fries are fresh and not greasy and the burgers are just quality, with the perfect amount of toppings.  The secret menu is just the icing on the cake for this place.  I mean, this place is not overplayed, if anything it is underplayed and deserves more recognition for the fine food, fine service.  My only complaint is that it doesn't have a drive thru, but that keeps me from eating here too often.
author: Michelle N.

description: For all that the FW area has to offer, this really isn't a typical fast-food place. Everything is cooked fresh. You really don't have a long wait, even on busy days, and the food is good. Fries taste like what we all would attempt to make at home and not the so-called fries from some of these places...although sorry folks Wendy's has the best FFs IMHO. Reasonably priced.
author: Anthony F.

description: Aside from the explosion of ketchup that adorned the floor about our table, it was about as good as a fast-food burger can get. My inaugural visit to In-N-Out was a success, and our bellies were full. I didn't order anything special though.
author: Dan P.

description: In n out burger, you food is five star for the money but how can something soo good make me feel soo bad five minutes later. In n out is like crack or cheap booze, you always regret it and yet can't help but want more. Everytime I think I'm out, they drag me back in!!!
author: M L.

description: ehh i wish i could give half rating if so i would give it a 3.5 but since not its a 4. Its always a good place to go to if u are at fishermans wharf and need a quick bite that is also good everywhere else the wait is too long. Evven though at times the line is long the wait is never that long they serve a long line of people really fast which is great the the burgers are great the fries are so-so after a bunch of ketchup and eaten at the same time as the burger
author: Maurice H.

description: double double animal style in vegas was only $5.35, here it was $6 something. only reason it gets 4 stars instead of 5.  Still the best "fast food" burger you can get.
author: Kyle N.

description: I went to this one over the weekend, roughly around 1pm. Oh so good!!!! I was already in town, and am glad this place opened up for my consumption! I agree with Dan, In-and-Out should not be the only fast-food chain that is mentioned in a good light.
author: Michael C.
