description: 3 by 3.  I repeat 3 by 3 L,T only, fries well (this is critical for a firmer fry).  I can't count how many times that  order has passed my lips.  The B.E.S.T. fast food burger on the planet, hands down.  Fresh ingredients, well-paid (relatively), competent servers, real ice cream shakes.... don't give a damn about the tourists, as long as they don't steal my order.  Jordan M. - I think the phrase you are looking for is "subliminal christian propaganda".  I don't think Christianity has been "subversive" for 1,500 years or so ....well at least in the "west"
author: Max C.

description: When I first moved to California, I lived in the southern end of the state, and quickly discovered In-n-Out.  Decent cheap fresh fast food. -- good shakes -- family owned (it is not a franchise).  And then I moved to SF -- and anytime I was heading north or south, and was hungry, I'd "In-n-Out" -- it wasn't that often but it was a treat (of sorts) because I didn't get to do it that often. Now that there is one in the City, well, I'm kinda disappointed.  It's taken away the novelty.  Though it is (now that the Wharf Coffee Shop was forced out of business due to high the rent increase) the best cheap meal in that part of town.
author: Ranger A.

description:
protein style! iceberg lettuce instead of the bun, so refreshing and crunchy.

take apart the the fry basket and look under the drink cup for a hidden message, how strange. 

Clean, fresh and yummy.
author: Helen J.

description: Double Double Animal Style and a Neapolitan Shake FTW!!!!!  They must put crack in their burgers cuz I can't get enough.  I love road trips in Cali cuz that means I'm getting In-n-Out.  this past Winter I made it a point to hit all the different In-n-Outs on the way to Tahoe.
author: Chard M.

description: The only reason I give this In-N-Out 4 stars is because it is in Fisherman's Wharf.  In-N-Out was put on this earth for one simple purpose: to feed you on roadtrips.  Make sure you order a double-double, animal style.  In-N-Out has the best fast-food cheeseburgers you can find, just get them while you are cruisin' on the 80, 5, or 101.
author: Dave L.

description: Not the complete In & Out experience, as it's in the midst of the trinket store strip, so it lacks the endless drive-thru line and parking lot where everyone eats and people-watches, but it's the only In & Out in SF, so I'm grateful for this oasis.
author: Chris R.

description: Sometimes there is just nothing like a good In-N-Out burger. I am not a huge fast food lover, but sometimes, I just crave these things. The only bad thing about this place is that it's smack in the middle of Fisherman's Wharf. Luckily it is close to home, but that's to the madness that is FW, it is always packed with people. It's worth it though.
author: Anita B.

description: I never knew thousand island dressing & onions could taste so good. Very good deal. About $5 and some change for a cheeseburger, fries (ask for em animal style!) and a medium drink. It was yummy in my tummy. It's always crowded in here but there's always outside seats! I've never experienced bad customer service here either :) YUM.
author: M J.

description: This is delicious fast food! The burger that I got actually looked like a burger from the commercials that you see on TV for fast food places. You see these delicious burgers on TV, decide to go get one, and instead you end up getting a squished and mangled burger, but at In N Out Burger you really do get a good looking and appetizing burger. It was one of the best, the fries are tasty and not salted, so you can salt them yourself. The prices are cheap and the milkshakes are great. I was happy!
author: Carly W.

description: Maybe it's the McDonalds, Burger Kings and the "typical" fast food burger restaurants I am used to in the Southeast but In N Out Burger, although fast food, tastes really good for what it is.  If you are in a diet, don't go but if you are looking for a good fast food burger, go and get your fill.  I was told there is a secret menu you can order from but I have never tried it and maybe it's just an urban legend : )
author: Robert L.

description: I'm a fan. I get the small chocolate shake and cheeseburger. It's just the kind of thing to do after swimming in the ocean.
author: Anna B.

description: Wow!! I love In-N-Out burger because the burgers are not greasy as compared to other burgers joints.  They have big sizes and a simple menu.  It's probably in my opinion the best burger chain in the US!!!!
author: Rob P.

description:
so this location may not be the best of all innouts, but lets be honest, you're here for the food.

refer to my "last meal on earth".  if i'm not in the mood for that much food, then i just stick with the double double animal style, which usually fills me up enough.  but when i'm in the mood for something awesome, then i do the trio.  

if you haven't been to innout . . . where have you been?  i mean seriously, where have you been?
author: Jason J.

description: Solid food and service for a fast food place on the warf...LOL I actually like this fast food joint!
author: David G.

description: One of the, if not, best burgers in the city in my opinion.  I always get a double double and fries both animal style.  Seeing how my arteries are already a bit clogged I usually stick with a glass of water.  Only thing that deters me from this place a bit is the wannabe thugs that just love crowding around this place every Friday and Saturday night.
author: Doogie H.

description: I have only eaten here once, but got the added entertainment of watching the Tin Man do his show while having the best fast food burger available.  I won't go on about In-N-Out burger as I am sure plenty of people have talked about it already.
author: Pele N.

description: I love this place!  Great burgers, great prices!  We come to this place when we stay in Fisherman's Wharf.  We also go to the one in Stockton.  They're always packed.    I hear it's Tom Hank's favorite burger.  I wish they'd open up in Washington.  I seriously think they'd give Dick's serious competition.
author: Meg T.

description: It's not the best burger in the world....but man, sometimes I just crave me some In-N-Out. There is something about that immaculate white interior and those milkshakes that makes a girl wanna holla. I'll even brave the Fisherman's Wharf tourists for that.
author: Jackie I.

description: Double double: meat+cheese+ bun, side of fries and amazing customer service (and the fact there is no mayo in and around the restaurant)=awesome!
author: Cameron R.

description: Tasty fresh burgers and fries but I've had better. I like their tarter sauce which I usually ask for to dip my fries in . The food is pretty affordable . You can get a meal .. consisting of a burger , fries , and a drink for about 5$ . Where else can you find deals like these ? This place is usually always crowded and busy so there's no place to sit and enjoy your food. However , I like how you can watch the workers make the burgers on the outside of this place .
author: Eileen L.

description: If you come to California, you MUST go to In-N-Out Burger.  When I used to live in so-cal, and there was a drive thru at the one by my house, I ate here like once a week, seriously.  Um, yeah and I gained like 5 pounds.  Anyhow, this is what I love about In-N-Out:  although the menu seems small, there are so many variations on the hamburger that's not even on the menu.  For example, when I was a vegetarian, I would order a "grilled cheese."  This is a cheeseburger minus the burger.  This location has messed up my order countless times, but like an idiot I go back for more.  And more... and more.
author: Sarah F.

description: One of the reasons why I moved to California...'nuff said.
author: Guava C.

description: Really crowded on a Sunday afternoon. Who knew? I came here after not having In-N-Out for over 7 years and had fond memories. Too bad I didn't make any fond memories this trip. The food was just average (had a double burger and a shake...trying the new I-DON'T-CARE diet) and we had to sit outside in the shade and wind because there was no where else to go. The rest of the lunch consisted of trying to not let our food blow away and disappoint the food beggars. Then the wind blew a napkin off the table, into a pile of ketchup and onto my friend's shoe. Overall, not a fun trip.
author: Matt H.

description: I do like a good In-N-Out burger! This particular location is ALWAYS packed, I can never get in and out in just 5 minutes. I do really hate the wait. However, even as my Irish temper is flaring at being made to stand in a room so packed with people, that I don't know how anyone eats IN the building, the customer service is so great that I can't stay mad long. When I get my burger & well done fries, I can't remember why I was so irritated. So all in all, I wouldn't suggest eating in, but it is worth the wait, and the staff is usually very helpful & friendly.
author: Krista H.

description: Don't be fooled by all the 'fan-boys' this is still fast food.  However, keeping that in mind this is restaurant is better than the rest.
author: Daniel H.

description: Like the way they make their burgers. Closer to the way a hamburger tasted in the 1950's. Only drawback to this location is when the London Double Deck styled buses 'dump' about 65 ravenous tourists out in front of this Fisherman's Wharf location. It's hard trying 'to time it' in order to avoid this unfortunate phenomenon. I took my daughter here when she visited from Brooklyn , last year. She loves In 'n Out.
author: Randy F.

description: The Petaluma In and Out is great too! The Mill Valley one lacks a drive through to make it great! Otherwise if you want a fast food burger this is the best chain I have found for taste!
author: Andrew W.

description:
A
Like most American's I kept hearing about In-N-Out burgers from my friends who travel by car in the western states and they always raved about these great burgers, their fries, the secret sauce, the cleanliness of their operations and the friendliness of the staff at all their locations. After a long time dishing all the hoopla, they finally opened in San Francisco and the hype was all true. I can't say its any one thing, but man it speaks volumes about the way they do everything.   After hearing applause for the burgers at this small and independent chain, family owned since beginning, I was thrilled when they decided to open a location in San Francisco, and then dismayed that they chose Fisherman's Wharf where so few locals want to go because of traffic, congestion and the effort getting to and from that no man's land within our 49 square miles.

The meat is good and cooked just right, the bun is great and also lightly toasted. The sauce is tasty and applied in the perfect amount, the produce is fresh, the staff so pleasant and helpful it's almost sinful. And the place is clean and civilized although over run by hungry throngs of tourists who flock to Fisherman's Wharf where this chain that is so much better than any chain I've ever supported in the past. Consistency is an art form, and they have it married to style and functionality and produce great burgers that put almost every chain burger to shame.  The menu is really just a couple versions of their outstanding burger and fries, but damn those burgers are good.  Each burger is cooked to order and all in front of the customer so there are no secrets.  They use top notch ingredients and supplies and it shows in taste and quality and the huge number of devoted, repeat customers.  Their mystery sauce is almost as good as the unique version of 1000 Island dressing prepared fresh every day at our own Swan's Oyster Depot which is a story in itself you can find elsewhere.  This chain is great.
author: Stu S.

description: Typical In & Out, you know what to expect. Solid burgers and solid fries. Parking around here is tough. I took the chance of parking without paying a meter, walked away, looked back and saw the po-po heading to my car. I ran back, got in and drove off. Went around the block once and ended up with a spot right in front of the In & Out that still had time left...karma baby. Not sure what that has to do with the review of the place, but hey.
author: Mike C.

description: Good tasty hamburgers as usual.  I'm not a big fan of the fries, so I spend the money on two cheeseburgers and a small soda rather than the combo.  The bathrooms operate on tokens, so I suppose you could take a couple of tokens in case you're ever in the area and need to use the facilities there as it's rather hard to find a public toilet.
author: Thomas C.

description: i love In & Out but i drive to Marin because this one just is a lil nasty. Probably because of it tourist trap location i wish they'll put one in the city maybe pac height????
author: willie l.

description:
I need to find a table.  Wait, there's a table!  Argh, that tourist family of 5 just took it.  Wait wait, there's another, quick like a bunny, go get it!  Oh, come on, what do you mean that kid got there first?  I just want to sit down for 8.5 minutes and devour my burger (animal style), crispy-salty fries, and itsthisthick strawberry shake.  Sigh.  

Oh wait, I think I see another table, use your elbows this time!!!

So good.  I wish I was on the "right" coast right now.
author: Lisa B.

description: For those who are homesick for L.A., this is a little oasis on Fisherman's Wharf.  Sure, you'll have to elbow your way through a lot of tourists to get here, but bring a magazine in the early evening, enjoy an iconic In-N-Out combo meal, people watch out the window, and then walk along the shore toward Fort Mason as the sun sets behind the GG Bridge ahead of you and the Ghirardelli sign lights up to your left.  And what the heck, now that it's dark, why not hop on the trolley and let the blinking light of the Alcatraz lighthouse guide you up over the hill to Union Square?  Sometimes it's good to be a tourist.
author: Ryan G.

description: This burger was so bland! I ordered a double double, expecting it to taste super meaty and cheesy, and boy, was I wrong. The meat has no taste, and the pink sauce (thousand island dressing) and tomatoes overpower the taste of anything else. It looks wayyy better than it tastes, that's for sure. I do not recommend this at all!  5 Guys wins. And so do Mcdonalds and Burger King... yikes!
author: carla s.

description: As good as it gets when it comes to fast food in the Bay Area, scratch that, the United States.  Bummer that there is only one in SF. Would like to see a couple more throughout the city.  Make sure to try a strawberry/vanilla shake while there. And animal style fries of course.
author: Ben L.

description: In-N-Out is defiantly the best berger joint in the world. While this location is always busy with tourist, service is always very quick here. The staff her is very good for a fast food place. The food is of course excellent. I recommend a double-double meal. If you want to be a little more adventurous google In-N-Out's secret menu.
author: Tom A.

description: *seriously considers walking to car, driving halfway across town, ordering double double, fries well, medium drink, eating while driving back, curling up into bed stuffed*
author: dave w.

description: Very good place...fresh, never frozen food too. They even have something called the secret menu.........
author: Henry P.

description: MmMmMmMmM. In-N-Out! Probably the best fast food restaurant around. Everything is fresh and good! Only problem is they're always full of people so there may be a long line. If you're in Fisherman's Warf area and you're craving some burgers come here!
author: Josh E.

description: My Boss bought us all dinner here once ... kind of like a business meeting slash dinner . The burgers are inexpensive ! --- a buck something for a juicy burger with grilled onions ...  Nice location --- after dinner --- you can walk two blocks and see the Golden Gate Bridge ...
author: Roy L.

description: I've only been here once. & I must say, I FELL IN LOVE. I'm not a big burger/fast food person but I loved In & out Burger. There was a lot of people, yeah, I wasn't surprised. So yeah the food didn't come THAT FAST but once it came, IT WAS DELISSSSSSSH! loved the fries and the milkshake. The fries are fresh made in front of you. And the Burger doesn't taste like it has some kind of artificial crap in it.
author: Hailee P.

description: Juicy burgers and the onions were delicious. Strawberry shake was good too.
author: hugh k.

description:
i think in-and-out is wayyyyy better than mcdonlads and burger king.it's vene fresh there too and when i mean fresh i mean
-they  make their own french fries
-their burgers are very nice
and stuff 

also i recoomed the vanilla milkshake i just love it^^
author: teri c.

description: grilled cheese... animal style. so delicious and worth the wait. animal style is truly the secret
author: Kelly F.

description: This is the place to be when you ever gonna go and visit SF!! Animal style....
author: Angel L.

description: The burgers here are the best chain-restaurant burgers anywhere. I don't care what the other critics on Yelp say, In-N Out is awesome. Their fries are not just fries, they are not greasy or frozen like every other chain. I've seen them peel the potatoes themselves! The burgers are not just everyday burgers these are some of the best burgers you'll find anywhere. Californians love this place because they don't sell out to anyone. They are privately owned and have been forever. They don't branch out of Cali unless it's Las Vegas and that's what makes them awesome. No matter which In-N-Out you go to they are always full of people so stop complaining about the line. They don't have a large variety and that's awesome. 3 combos is all you need. Whenever I go to California I always eat here as much as possible. You guys are idiots if you think any CHAIN restaurant has better burgers than this. Jack in the Box, Burger King, McDonalds, nothing compares to In-N-Out. Sure you'll find better burgers at sticky burger joints, but this is a CHAIN of restaurants and they represent California so yay for them.
author: Clara M.

description: in n out is still my fav burger joint, I wish it could open up more stores in SF though, this one is located in the bottom of a tourist hole, so it's more like "in n wait for half an hour out".
author: Bo D.

description: Despite what many say, this place has extremely fresh food, they prepare it fairly fast and it's not nearly as greasy as McDonalds or Burger King.  You wouldn't even guess until you got some food here.  Bottom line:  Don't judge a book by it's cover.
author: Michael B.

description: On my most recent trip to SF in 2008, I had an In-N-Out burger and realized that Californians and their admirers make a big deal out of this place when it really isn't.  I appreciate hamburgers but I don't think In-N- Out is what it's cracked up to be.  I would opt for Jack-in-the-Box any day.
author: R C.

description: the MOST delicious burgers, but alas...the most disgusting fries, ever.  the fries make me want to cry.  in fact, tears are streaming down my face as i remember the bummer the fucking fries from in-n-out put in my otherwise untainted summer.
author: Claudia B.

description: cheeseburgers are decent, and they should add bacon on the menu, but the fries suck!  +1 star for having Del Monte ketchup packets, to cover for the fresh cut fries.
author: Pickle R.

description: i've only come here around 11pm on weeknights, why?  i don't know.  it's ridiculous as to how many people are still there on a week night at 11pm/12am.  it's always difficult to find a table, and the table is always dirty.
author: H. L.

description: This restaurant has bad customer service. After you place your order, you get a receipt with an order number on it. They messed up on the order numbers; they could not get the order numbers accurate. They put the one order number receipt into a different bag. For example, my order number was 11 and they put order number 12's receipt by the bag; they kept announcing order number 12 your food is ready; but order number 12 had their food already; clearly they don't check receipts. This is a place that does not have great customer service. They should be able to get what you order correctly.
author: Linda F.

description: I was soooooo damn excited to try In-N-Out Burger for my first time ever. Was super hungover, so it as even gonna taste THAT much better. Boy was I wrong. The fries tasted like they'd been in the freezer for years, and I'd take a 6 pack mcnuggets over that burger any day. And don't even get me started on the grilled cheese - it was just a burger sans patty. WTF?!
author: Katie G.

description: mmm just thinking about that animal style burger and crispy fries make my mouth waterly...
author: Mai K.

description: looks like a mcdonalds tastes like a..... damn this place is good. no line and the service was fast too!! booya.
author: Drew M.

description: Now I have even heard Chef Thomas Keller of French Laundry in Yountville say go for Animal...What is that?  I guess they have a secret menu you can order things.  I've been in California 20 years and this is the first.  I want my fries well-done!   You can Google secret menu.  They don't have a name for foie gras or Périgord Truffle. I am Sure chef Hubert Keller of Fleur de Lys will come up with it.
author: Antony E.

description: fresh and tasty burgers, fries and shakes.  this one is a little more expensive since it's in a touristy area but the same food.  can't go wrong with in-n-out.
author: Curtis L.

description: french fries animal style.  you'll need a fork and several napkins.  i don't eat beef and i love this place.  i know that's so lame, there's something in the sauce.
author: jen b.

description: The fst food here is the best i've ever gotten in a fast food resturant! it's better than stinky old Mcdonalds=( I recommend this place to enery one!
author: edwin q.

description: burgers always come out perfect. this location is mostly tailored to tourists though so it can get really crowded. still, its the only in and out within a reasonable distance from work or downtown.
author: John G.

description: four words.  double double animal style.  that's right bitch!  four little words, but those four words certainly warrant four stars!  Minus one star for only having one location in the city, way up at the wharf....why no tl love....why....whyyyyyyyyyyyyyy!
author: Francis K.

description: I want to say in n out was started in southern california, where I am from....that said, it gets 5 stars for the sole fact that it's a so cal eatery. But also for the fact that everything is super fresh, your hamburger is never frozen so much like what you get at home and the french fries are cut from real potatoes right there in the store. So, all around good quality, semi-fast food. Nothing beats a $6 cheeseburger meal from In n Out!
author: Sarah I.

description: best quality food since i came to thee states, makes me love california that much more
author: nima r.

description: Love it!  I've been to In-N-Out in LA and Las Vegas and thought it was good...  But my cousin introduced me to the special "hidden" menu, which includes "Animal Style," grilled onions, and well done fries.  Try it!!!  Delish...
author: D. L.

description: i like the fact that there's an in & out in the city ... sometimes you have a craving, and you just don't want to travel that far for a fresh, fast, cheap, to-go burger with fries.
author: Jan W.

description: If you count calories, deduct some stars and keep on truck-in. But if you want to get down with a burger, fries and a shake to-go, then do a little jig (yes, like in river dance...no I am not gay) cause you found your spot.  Shakes come in vanilla, chocolate or strawberry, but if you wink at the counter person and ask for a "Neapolitan" you will get a crazy shake. Can't guarantee your safety if you really wink at them, as the wink really is not necessary, I was just throwing that in!
author: Niko P.

description: animal style flying dutchman -- excellent. eat it with a spoon and wash it down with milk.
author: R E.

description: Out of all the fast food, this one is the cheapest and greatest burger. I still prefer my gourmet burgers but this place is inexpensive.
author: bob k.

description: fried beef, melted cheese and fries. who cares about cholesterol when it tastes this good.
author: steve s.

description: A fantastic cheeseburger at a really good price.  If there was an In N' Out on every corner I would go more often than I do but then again I would also get really fat and have to start hating them so it's a comprimise for the two of us.
author: Ian L.

description: this place is good, very much from my LDS backround, its a toursit trap plus a monk secne was filmed here
author: Leigh McInnis Lee G.

description: how could you not LOVE this place??? the burgers are to die for. animal style. french fries could be a little better but the burgers. man the burgers are hands down the best.
author: Miss O.

description:
this is hands down the best fast food chain burger joint in the world.  after recently discovering the "secret menu" i did the only thing a true nerd would do.  i go there and order it.  today i had the double double "animal style" and the fries animal style.  i found the burger not as good as the way i usually order it.  however the animal fries hmmmm forget about it.  delicious.  melted cheese, spread, and grilled onions.  that was good.  i am still full and i ate at 5.  it was unusally packed this afternoon.  i wish this was in a different location.  i hate the people that flock to the wharf.  i dont mind the tourists per se that much.  what i do hate are the steady stream of wannabe gangsters that make there way over here from hayward or brentwood or whatever.  they irk me.  
in n out should open up a joint right here in my neighborhood next door to Cala.  that would rule.  the building there is vacant in n out people. just so you know.
author: Anthony Y.

description: i love in n out.  what separates in n out fast food, from other place is simply their stuff is fresh, the tomatos, the lettuce, the onions. all of it goes towards making a good burger.  I can tell you what i had, but then again their menu is pretty limited, i had the same thing the other thousands of people have had, chessburgers, fries, milkshake. good. good. good. The minus one star is simply because we seem to have the only in n out that doesnt have a freaking drive through.  call me fat and lazy, i wont argue with ya, but damn, i had standing in an all too crowded in n outs.
author: Mike S.
